Title: Red Kite Tree Tent - Ynys Affalon
Description: "Escape to one of these two fabulous Tree Tents. Suspended high above the canopyit‚Äôs time to appreciate life from a new perspective. Featured on George Clarke‚Äôs Amazing Spacesthese Tree Tents are a feat of aviation technology. Tree Tent comes complete with fire pitoutdoor kitchen and shower with hot water. You‚Äôll discover a comfortable bed and cosy wood burning stove. Part of the Red Kite Estatealong with our barn and its sister tree tentthe first ever built in the UKDragons Egg."The spaceThe space.The true joy of this place is how wonderfully simple it is (aviation technology aside). Days are filled with fireside discussionswildlife watching and stunningly beautiful walks. With the nearest mobile signal a ten minute walk awayit‚Äôs a great place to ditch the digital and truly escape. Head over the bridge to your own private deck that happily houses a clever outdoor-kitchen and shower (complete with hot water). It‚Äôs the perfect spot to fry up breakfast whilst basking in peace and tranquility. There is also a flushing toilet situated just up the hill.And don‚Äôt worryyou‚Äôre not totally left to your own deviceson arrival you can expect bed linentowels and a load of dry wood and kindling. If you feel the need to leave your new found homestead in the trees then the local area has lots of suitably chilled things to do. Head out on a moorland walk to take in some magical views - and perhaps even grab a pint at the local pub en route. Further afieldthe stunning Elan Valleya landscape bursting with impressive dams and reservoirsis well worthy of an explore. And for those needing supplies - and perhaps a flat white - then the friendly market town of Builth Wells is just down the road.Other things to note.You are entering a remote woodland hideaway for a digital detox: there is very patchy mobile signal and limited internet connectivity.

Title: Az Alom Cabin - Treehouse Tree to Nature Cabin
Description: "Come and spend a romantic stay with a couple or familyon the Domaine de l'Arbre in CabaneA very pretty forest of 5 hectares shelters 8 beautiful huts they all have the dream namesunique and unprecedented.They are housed in centuries-old trees out of sightin osmosis with nature.The site is preservedyour peace is assured. Nature is everywhereA treehouse to indulgerelax and go where no one will be looking for you!"The spaceThe space.Cabin perched in trees 8 meters high.This cabin is beautiful. Its access via a board walkway and its platform adjoining 3 individual beds seduce them to the highest degree. It has a capacity of 3 people.Guest access.You will have access to the entire cabinforest and park.Sanitary facilities (showers and toilets) are at the receptiona 3-minute walk.Other things to note.Are you ready for an unusual stay?

Title:
Cabane Entre Les Pins
üå≤üèïÔ∏èüå≤
Description: Rustic cabin between the pines3 meters high and 28 square meters on the banks of the Austreberth River üå≤üèïÔ∏èüå≤The space"The space.Our cabin between the pines is a great alternative for those looking for contact with nature and want to restenjoy together or have fun with family or friends. With 3 meters high and 28 square metersit accommodates 4 people. Located on a 1.2 hectare property by the river Austrebertheour rustic treehouse shares the space with our garden rabbits and dumplingsas well as wild dumplings and our beloved khenty marewho loves apples and carrots. A tranquil retreatwith efficient thermal insulation and heaters for the colder days. Equipped with a double bedsofa bedkitchen duvet and toilet.We provide:.Towels.Bed linens and pillows.Kitchen detergent and bathroom soap.Paper towels & toilet paper.Cooking utensils.Coffeeteasalt and pepperherbs of provence.What to do in the areas guideIll follow us on Instagram @entreespins"Guest access.Guests can use the space around the cabin."Other things to note.*When its windythe cabin squeaksbut theres nothing to worry about.*Do not use candles or objects containing a fire inside and outside the cabin as the polyester is flammable.*Smoking outside only please.*Our dear pets are allowed but with the commitment of their guardian not to leave them on the bed and furnishing fabricsas well as being responsible for their waste.*Pine needles often fall on the balconywhich doesnt mean the space hasnt been cleaned.*As this is literally a house between the treesit is common that there are insects and cobwebs outside but with the door closed it will prevent them from entering the cabin.*With the arrival of the cold seasonwe see that the internal temperature is between 15 and 18 degrees.*Check-out time must be respected so as not to change the arrival time of the next guest."

Title: Tree Top Cabin with log burner & private hot tub
Description: The Tree top cabin is situated in our peaceful woodland in the heart of Snowdonia. It has a shower (hot water included)and w.c and washbasin (no hot water in the washbasin).Lighting is provided from a 12v solar panel system.A log burner is provided with free wood.There is a double bed.The private wood fired hot tub is situated on a balcony overlooking the woodland area.Pet friendly.Outside seating is provided.The spaceThe space.This unique glamping experience has everything you need for a restful and idyllic break from everyday life. Wake up to bird song and the sound of the stream. Enjoy your own exclusive hot tub whilst sipping a glass of bubbly. Our Cabin is fully insulated and has everything you need for that perfect "rustic" getaway without compromising on quality and convenience.ALL bedding and towels are included in your stay. You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.A small log burner inside to keep you nice and cosy.There is limited telephone signal.

Title: Treehouse near Paris Disney
Description: Charming cabin nestled in the leavesreal unusual and cozy house in the trees with all the modern comfortsjust 45 minutes from Paris28 km from Disneyland or Provins and 5 minutes from the Parc des F√©lins. This cozy nest awaits you year-round for an unusual romantic or family experience. A parenthesis of relaxation and relaxationideal to offer yourself or yourself. See you soon :)The space"The space.La Cabane Perch√©e de Chambonni√®re awaits you over the seasons and offers a comfortable and cozy setting amidst the treesthe opportunity to escape from everyday life during a romantic stay with two or familyfor one or more nights.You will be seduced by this treehouse full of charm with neat decoration.- Access by gentle slopeideal for welcoming you easily.- Charming living room with bioethanol fireplace (only in cold weather and exclusively for couples or families with children over 7 years old).- Fully equipped kitchen.- Double bedroom + 1 bedroom with 2 single beds upstairs.- Shower room with shower and real toilet.- Magnificent private terrace of 36m¬≤ with garden furniture and deckchair.This cozy nest in the trees offers all the modern comforts (electricityheatingbathroom with toilet and standard showerflat screen TVand a kitchenette with multifunction ovenrefrigeratorhobwifi internet access..). For your arrivalall beds are made.The shack perched in chambonni√®re is ideally located to allow you to discover the charms of the Seine and Marne and the Champagne region:.> the Parc des F√©lins,.> the medieval city of Provins with magnificent equestrian and falconry shows in season,.> Disneyland Paris & La Vall√©e Village 25mn,.> the castles of Vaux le VicomteBlandy les Tours and Fontainebleau.> and for the most sporty (depending on the season):.- tree climbing,.- paintball,.- karting and other motor sports.> Youll also have a chance to go for nice walks around on foot or by mountain bike and tennis in the village.A parenthesis of relaxation and relaxationideal to offer yourself or yourself .Looking forward to welcoming you‚Ä¶.The rates shown in the calendar are for 2 people. Rates for 4 people are calculated automatically when bookingA surcharge may be charged if the general condition rendered is indecent.""Other things to note.The owners reserve the right to cancel your stay at the hut if the weather conditions are very badwhether they are known a few days beforeor even on the day of arrivalwhether you are already on the road or already arrived on siteor during your stay (weather alertsevere weather eventsstrong windstormthunderstorm). If this happenswell try to relocate you to other types of accommodation nearbysubject to availability and at no extra charge. If we do not have a relocation solution availableand in this case onlyyou will be offered a date extension at the choice of the owners or you will receive a 50% discount on a next equivalent stay in a cabin in the current 12 months. In any caseno compensation or reimbursement can be claimed."

Title: CABANE DES GIROLLES - IN THE TREES
Description: Above allthis is a breathtaking setting that we invite you to discover during your stay at Les H√©bergements de Qu√©necan. We invite you to escape to this natural and unique horizon in the heart of nature.In the heart of the immense forest of Qu√©n√©cannear the water points or overlooking the former iron and steel village of Les Forgesenjoy the peace and quiet to take a moment to recharge your batteriesaway from everyday life.The spaceThe space.Located at a height of 10 meters in an oak of nearly 200 yearsthe Cabane des Girolles takes its name from the good girolles harvests that are made regularly for the happiness of all.It is equipped with:A bed in 90.A bed in 140 above.A toilet corner with water reservedry toiletwipes.A spacioussunny terrace overlooking the listed village of Les Forges des Salles. Title: RENARDI√àRE HUT - IN THE TREES
Description: It is above all a breathtaking setting that we offer you to discover during your stay at Accommodations in Qu√©n√©can. We invite you to escape to this natural and unique landscape surrounded by nature.In the heart of the immense forest of Qu√©n√©cannear the water points or overlooking the old steel village of Les Forgestake advantage of the peace and quiet to take a moment to recharge your batteriesaway from everyday life.The spaceThe space.In the foreston the edge of the private furnace pond (12 hectares)the Renardi√®re cabin is built at a height of 5 meters while Douglas-fir and larchnaturally impenetrable wood. This cabin for 6 people is ideal for an exceptional moment with friends or family. Located in an oak tree and supported by 5 pillarsthis largevery spacious and clear cabin will seduce you with its originality.A spiral staircase will take you to the southwesterly facing terrace overlooking the furnace pond.The occupants of the cabin will be able to settle in for dinner at sunset. The cabin is composed of a living room with coffee table and benchesa bed in 140 retractable2 beds in 90 including a 90/140a mezzanine with a bed in 160a small toilet with dry toilets. This hut will please aspiring piratesindeedour builders have planned a drawbridge to maneuver to drop the moorings and start the adventure!Guest access.Access indicated during booking. Private parking at the foot of the cabin.Other things to note.On the estateenjoy the steel village of Les Forges des Salles (free visit). This former well-preserved steel industrial site brings you back to the daily life of a 19th century blacksmith!.AroundLake Guerl√©danthe Abbey of Bon Reposthe Museum of Electricitythe Valley of Saints are all sites that open their doors to you

Title: La Cabane Les Faines
Description: The Les Faines cabinperched in a 150-year-old beech treewill make you live an unusual nature experience in Normandy year-round.We are located 12 km from Dieppe (Seine-Maritime)2 h from Paris and 3 h from Brussels.The spaceThe space.Nestled in a 150-year-old beech tree8 m highthis hut is oriented northwest : sunset ensured on the terrace (10 m¬≤)between the branches overlooking the horse meadow and you can watch for the passage of animalsamong othersdeerwho like to sleep nearby.This hut (10 m¬≤)built with total respect for the tree and its environmentaccommodates 2 people (adult or 12 years minimum accompanied by an adult).Access is via a beautiful spiral staircasethen via a 15 m long walkway.It is undoubtedly the easiest access deckhousecombining height and ease.This hut also gives you exclusive access to another large terracecommon to the 3 bridge hutsperched 20 m from a 190-year-old beech tree: it is the tallest terrace in Franceaccessible by a magnificent crinoline ladderfully secured ! Change of scenery and relaxation guaranteed !Without running water or electricitybut rustic comfort for a unique adventure in the wild. Water supply (4 l)dry toilet and heating. Bathroom at the reception.

Title: Heavenly Treehouse w/ Wrap Around Deck & Farm Views
Description: ‚òÜ Welcome to the Treehouse at Bluebird Farm Connecticut ‚òÜThis 40-acre farm sanctuary is suitable for anyone looking to visit a Farmstay.The town of Willington offers:.‚úî Hiking Trails.‚úî Antiquing.‚úî Local Diners.‚úî Vineyards & Breweries.‚úî Drive-In Movie TheaterWe are close drive from:.‚óè UCONN (10 Mins).‚óè Hartford (25 Mins).‚óè Boston (1.5 Hours).‚óè NYC (2.5 Hours)"The space.The Treehouse is custom built for your comfort!You will have all the essentials in your kitchenettebathroomand shower. You also have shared access to the gardens gazebo.Are you sleeping among the clouds? Almost! The main bed has a memory foam mattress and is encircled by what seems like endless windows. Rest easy among the surrounding trees.NOTE #1: The Treehouses fire place is propane-based and does not use fire wood. Temperature regulation of the unit is easily regulated via a simple thermostat and ceiling fan.NOTE #2: It might get rustic! There is no guarantee of running water from November 15 to April 15 due to seasonal freezing of the Treehouses water line. This means running sink water and shower will most likely NOT be in use during this period. The toilet is eco-friendly and in use year round.Amenities:.‚úî Free Coffee and Tea.‚úî Outdoor Gas Grill.‚úî Indoor Gas Stovetop.‚úî Bathroom Gear (TowelsSoapsShampooConditioner).‚úî Back-up Toothpaste/Brush.‚úî Classic Board Games (ClueBattle ShipMonopoly & Sorry).‚úî Free Parking On Premise.‚úî Fire Pit for Bonfires.‚úî Interaction w/ Farm Animals.‚úî Close Proximity to Trails and State Parks"Guest access.‚úî Guest will have access to property groundsgazeboand Treehouse.‚úî Guests have access to the animal pasture only when guided by Host.‚úî Guest may use of the gas grill on the patio of the Treehouse.‚úî Guest can use the bonfire.. and we supply the wood!Other things to note.Please note this is a functioning farm - livestocktractors and work is conducted daily. As a Guestyou and your party understand and are aware you may encounter potential sound and smells accustomed to a farm experience. You understand that you may be exposed to polleninsectsand other environmental factors accustomed to being in nature and a farm.You understand that you MUST CLIMB STAIRS AND STEP-LADDERS ‚Äî There are two flights of stairs to get to the Treehouse. There is a step-ladder to the main bedroom. You understand you can NOT sit on the patio rails.‚úî NO PETS ALLOWED.‚úî SHOWER AND KITCHEN SINK ARE MOST LIKELY NOT IN USE FROM NOVEMBER 15 TO APRIL 15 DUE TO FROZEN WATER LINES.‚úî TOILET IS ECO-FRIENDLY AND IN USE YEAR ROUNDAdditional Fees and Instant Booking Requirements:.‚òÜ After more than: 1 guesta extra charge of $29 per personper night will be issued ‚òÜ

Title: Lovely Treehouse in the Woods next to Stream
Description: "Note: Please read the covid travel restriction information below before you book.You will feel the stresses of life wash away as you sway in the trees and listen to the sounds of the beautiful stream just feet from the treehouse deck. Youll never want to leave! Enjoy a bit of solitude or some special alone time with a loved one. Its hard to beat Stone City Treehouse to make your time away special!"The spaceThe space.COVID INFO - 10/17/21I had not been updating Covid infoso here\s the most recent info:Vermont does not currently have any travel restrictions or behavior restrictions around Covid. I do not have any such requirements for the treehouse either. HoweverI am vaccinated and wear a mask in public indoor space.Let‚Äôs all be respectful and kind!---------------------------------------------------------------------------------After your day of hikingskiingor touring local breweries and distilleriescome home to this beautifulprivate tiny house in the trees! Orjust spend the day lazily relaxing by the fire and readingwhile the sound of the stream soothes you.Walk through the woodsup the stairsand enter into another dimension - one that you won\t want to leave! Much thought was put into the design and localnaturaland recycled materials were a priority in its construction.Soak in the curated interior design while you relax in the living room space and gaze out the largerecycled windows (from an oldlocal schoolhouse).Enjoy the deck that overlooks the year-round stream (that may be frozen over in the winter) and let the sound of the water wash through you. You may even see some critters if you\re still enough!There is a sweet sitting areahammockand campfire space just below the treehouse right on the streamwith a dramatic view of the treehouse. And a hanging bed underneath!You can cook simple meals on the propane campstove (with a griddle option) or use the small charcoal grill in the space under the treehouse. There is a mini-fridge with a separate freezer to keep your fresh produce from the farmers\ market and your yummy local beer nice and cool. There\s a very primitive (and limited) water system you can use for washing dishes.We also provide some basic condiments and cooking basicslike olive oil and salt and pepper. We also offer coffeehot chocolateand lemonade. Most of the products we offer for your useand our cleaning supplies and paper products are from Public Goods and you can get a 25% discount on your first purchase with the coupon code TREEHOUSEPGAThere is a basic composting toilet in the treehouse for your conveniencebut you also have access to a fullmodern bathroom at the housewith a beautiful shower.When it\s time for bedclimb up the loft ladder to "the nest" and sink into the comfy bed. Open up the windows to hear the nighttime sounds of the forest!We prioritize our earth and take environmental considerations into every decision: we generate solar electricity; we compost and recycle; we use environmentally friendly cleaning products; we avoid disposable items as much as possible; and we used many local and recycled materials in the construction of the treehouse.The interior structure is 10\x16\ with a loft and the deck is 4\x16\."Guest access.Although official check-in is at 5pmif youd like to check in before this timeplease inquire and we may be able to accommodate.You have exclusive access to the entire treehouse.The treehouse is about 200 feet from the driveway and houseyet its very private in the woods.I have a garden cart you can use to transport your belongings to the treehouse.If you arrive early and the treehouse is not ready yetyou are welcome to leave your things on the porch at the house.""Other things to note.You must be physically able to climb stairs and ladders to stay here. The sleeping space is in a somewhat-tight loftbut the limited space has not been an issue for even our taller guests. We do not allow dogs (or any other pets) in the sleeping loft.This area of Vermont (the Northeast Kingdom) has snow all winterand sometimes mudespecially in the spring. The treehouse is located on a dirt/gravel road that can sometimes be challenging if its muddy or even snowy or icy. We can get a lot of snow sometimes and you could possibly get stuck on your way here or in the driveway. I do my best to keep the driveway clean and sandedbut its not always possible all of the time. We live in a rural area and services are not always immediately available.All of that being saidmost of the time there are no issues but if you have access to a 4WD vehicleideally with higher clearance and snow tiresthat is the best case scenario. Keep an eye on the weather and plan ahead: the Northeast Kingdom of Vermont is probably not like where youre from and being prepared for weather and challenging driving conditions is absolutely the best policy.There is a primitive composting toilet in the treehousewith regular bathroom access (toiletsinkwasherdryershower) in the main housewhich is about 200 feet away.Wifi is not (barely?) available at the treehousebut it is at the house. There is a phone (landline) at the treehouse and minimal/intermittent cell reception.I provide at least two gallons of water that can be used for either drinking and/or washing. I encourage you to fill the water up at the house if you need more than this (there is a faucet option in the shower) rather than bringing in bottles. Our water is great!There is a camping cookstove available (with a griddle)a charcoal grilltoaster oven and a mini-fridge. You should be able to find all you need for basic cooking there.Please understand that you are likely to come across various critters - anything from fairly large spiders (most likely - they love the water) to bears and moose (less likely). Walking down to the treehouse you may come across our resident chipmunkand will often hear owls and loons at night. Soif you want to stay here you must be comfortable with insects and wildlife! We are in the woods and nature and spiders and insects are part of the package."

Title: Tullihas in the Trees
Description: Tullihas in the Trees is an off-grid treehouse adventure. The treehouse has no electricityno running waterno central heatingand limited cell service. There is a composting outhouse on site and potable water is available a short distance away. The treehouse is a great place to hammocksit around the campfireexplore trailsand unwind while glamping on a lovely wooded farm.Sleeping bags are highly recommended during the cool months. The small propane heater will only take off the chill.The spaceThe space.The treehouse has one double beda single bed and two cots. We provide sheets for the double bed and single bedhowever it is highly recommended that you bring a sleeping bag and pillows. If you plan to use the cotsyou will need to bring your own bedding.There is a single burner propane stovea coffee pot and French press. There is also a small propane heater for the cold months to take off the chill.The treehouse is situated on a 230+ acre farm which is available for exploring and hiking all spring and summer long. Restrictions apply October and November.Guest access.To access the treehousewe give you the address for the mailbox directly across from the treehouse. When you put that address in your GPS it takes you right there! You park right out front of the treehouse.This is the countrywhich means dirt roads and no streetlights.Other things to note.Remember: this is a treehouse with no electricity and no running water. This meanswe do not have a showerno air conditioningno central heatand no refrigerator. The potable water is available on the farm. Guests are welcome to build campfires in the ring. We provide you with one double memory foam mattressone single memory foam mattressand a two cots. Hammocking is strongly encouraged. Think of it as Glamping. :)- In the cooler monthsbring warm bedding/sleeping bags. The propane heater is intended to take off the chill - but it will still be cool. We supply you with extra propane tankslocated in the cedar chest. They last for about 8 hours on low.- We do spray for bugs - but it is a treehousetherefore be prepared to meet an occasional flyspiderladybug or waspas they think the treehouse is super cool too!- Guests are free to hike the trailsexplore the woodscreeksand farmland from December to October. Some restrictions apply October and November.EXPECT:.‚Äì Ladybugs on your pillowand the occasional cricket if you‚Äôre lucky. Please watch out for wasps‚Äîthey seem to like the treehouse too.‚Äì The noisy Amish cows and goats that will work better than an alarm clock.‚Äì A million starsand even more birds.‚Äì The opportunity to walk out your door to the stream and watch wildlife. (Literally a few steps away).‚Äì To be treated like a houseguestnot a renter.‚Äì No cell phone service. (You can always walk up the hill to make a call).‚Äì Campfireshiking trailsnearby fishingswimmingetc.‚Äì The best hammocking (yesthis is a verb) in all of Ohio.‚Äì A sunset view that will take your breath away.

Title: Cherry Treesort "Big Nick"
Description: This tree house is very unique. It features two separate sleeping quarters to give renters the ability to accommodate more friends and enjoy time together but also have private time at night. Its 25 feet up in the trees and has plenty of nature coming through and around the decks. Its also has all the amenities one would want for comfort in the main house with heat/ ACTVShowerand Toilet. The bunk house also has TV/DVDheat and AC. Come enjoy nature at its best.Other things to note.The shower is very unique in that it is an outdoor shower. Its located high up in the trees with the main house and is very private. It has very good water pressure and very hot water. Just thought we should let everyone know. Alsowe do not offer WIFI.

Title: Romantic Treehouse Getaway with Breathtaking Views
Description: "Discover the ultimate romance in trees 30 feet off the ground! This luxurious treehouse offers the perfect treehouse lodging in Ohio for a romantic escape. Private setting in the woods on a 38-acre property in the heart of Ohio‚Äôs Amish Country. Enjoy a king bed and a living room with a sofa and sitting chair. A covered porch will help you enjoy the breathtaking treetop views. Come see why these incredible one-of-a-kind Treehouses were featured on HGTV! Were sure youll have an incredible stay!"The spaceThe space.Living Room:.Roughhewn beams and split pine planking surround you as you relax in the comfy sofa and matching chair in front of a live edge coffee table. Flip the switch to ignite the fireplace encased in hand-cut stone and curl up with a good book or take a much-deserved nap. You can also catch up on your favorite shows on the large screen TV with cable channels that are mounted above the mantle. Windows on each wall allow plenty of natural light and outdoor beauty to enter your hideaway.But make sure you spend lots of time outside on the wrap-around balcony. Allow the peacefulness of your wooded retreat to soothe your mind and soul as you rock gently in the rockers and absorb the serenity that surrounds you.King Bed:.Before snuggling into the King size bed featuring an Amish-made pillow-top mattress resting on an elevated pinewood basemake sure you unwind in your private two-person jetted tub. The ceiling-high waterfall fill supplies the hot water that will be jetted over tired muscles creating just the right mood for the perfect night.Kitchen:.Your kitchen is home to a collegiate-sized refrigerator with a freezer and a 2-burner stovetop. There are ample pots and pans if you feel like making your favorite vacation mealor a microwave oven for heating up the leftovers from one of our amazing restaurants in town. A toaster and drip coffee maker round out the appliances which are at your disposal. The Amish-made wood table and chairs are the perfect spots for breakfast for two.Bathroom:.A sliding barn door opens to reveal your tiled floor bathroom. An artisanal counter rests on legs made from logs and supports an above counter stone basin. The expertly tiled shower is large enough for two and can start your day or end your night on just the right note.

Title: Baumhaushotel Krautsand Haus JOJO
Description: The tree house Jojo is the 3 tree house on our paddock. It rests on stilts at an altitude of about 6m above the pastures. The tree house stands between old pastures and you have a magnificent view of the meadows. Here you can go back a gear.The spaceThe space.there is a hotpot on our premises that you can use at any time. There is also a groundseminar or meditation house for max. 12 people. We live practically next doorbut are also far away that we do not disturb you. If you need any help or tipsjust come over.Other things to note.You will deliberately not find a TV in our treehouses. For this there is music or free access to Wi-Fi. An iPad is also available for surfing the Internet. If you want to see which ship is passing by or when the next flood is.

Title: Moose Meadow Lodge - Treehouse
Description: "Waking up to the splashing of rainbow trout and the music of the hermit thrush as you gaze out on the pristine pond at Moose Meadow. The Treehouse is where nature and luxury come together in tranquil harmonyand where your imagination can soar. Its a perfect location to isolate yourself with your loved oneaway from others."The spaceThe space.This New England Treehouse features a living & dining area on the first floor with an expansive wrap-around deck. Enjoy the view of the woods as you climb up the circular staircase wrapped around a maple tree. The second-story bedroom with its custom made queen size bed provides comfort and warmthwhile the balcony provides a high perch to take in the surrounding natural beauty."Guest access.The Treehouse is part of the Moose Meadow Lodge Bed & Breakfast. Treehouse guests will be given a full breakfast each morning and will also have access to the lodges kitchen for storing foodand for preparing snacks or meals. A variety of restaurants are nearby for lunch or dinner.""Other things to note.We are a lodging facility that is licensedinspected and registered with the VT Department of Health. We are also members of the Vermont Chamber of CommerceMad River Valley Chamber of Commerce and Revitalizing Waterbury.COVID-19: Due to the rise in COVID-19 infectionswe require proof of vaccination for those age 5 or older or proof of a negative COVID test (antigen or PCR) within 24 hours prior to arrival. Masks are required in public spaces in the presence of people outside your household. If youre feeling any COVID-19 symptomsstay home. You will not be allowed to enter. We appreciate your help in mitigating the pandemic and look forward to welcoming you.If you or anyone in your party has had any symptoms within the last 24 hoursstay home. You will not be allowed to enter. Symptoms include:.‚Ä¢ Cough;.‚Ä¢ Difficulty breathing;.‚Ä¢ Fever (feeling feverish or have a measured temperature at or above 100.4¬∞F/38¬∞C);.‚Ä¢ Chills;.‚Ä¢ Repeated shaking with chills;.‚Ä¢ Muscle or body aches;.‚Ä¢ Headache;.‚Ä¢ Sore throat;.‚Ä¢ New loss of taste or smell;.‚Ä¢ Congestion or runny nose;.‚Ä¢ Nausea or vomitingdiarrhea."

Title: Chulavista Dome
Description: The Chulavista Dome is a geodesic dome high up in the trees. Our two-storey treehouse is built around 3 Fresnos (European Ash)a tree native to Cantabria. The huge windows and large terrace offer panoramic views of the valleymountains and forests.The space"The space.Fantastic for romantic getawaysthe cozy bedroom sleeps two and features a seating areanespresso coffee maker and heating.The garden under the dome is very secludedand offers a gas barbecuepicnic table and a jacuzzi just for the two of you. The only sounds youll hear are birds chirping and cow bells ringing.Enjoy this unique experience of sleeping under the starssurrounded by nothing but naturewith all modern comfort such as a full bathroomwifi and a microwave."

Title: Nature‚Äôs Nook- A Modern Treehouse
Description: Set in the heart of wine countrythis treehouse is where nature meets globally inspiredmodern design. The compact interior sleeps up to 4 people in layered bunkslofts and nooks while the exterior space sprawls overlooking the fern filled valley below. This property is the perfect getaway for adventurerelaxationwine tasting or hiking. Built around a living oak tree this treehouse embraces the beauty nature offers and still has creature comforts such as HeatAC and a full bathroom.The spaceThe space.Nature‚Äôs Nook is the culmination of the fine work of a number of craftsmen. The overall design was crafted by Susan Scranton. There are so many unique features that set it apart. Below are a few.Hand scribed live edge poplar floors.Large deck for outdoor enjoyment whose shape mirrors the treehouse itself.Back deck perched high above the fern forest with two custom whiskey barrel Adirondack chairs.Main bed is a queen tucked into its own nook with views out the massive window.Custom cabinets in kitchen and bath built by the Treehouse Squad.A Living roof covered in moss (will be planted this fall in the cooler weather).Built around a massive oak tree that runs through middle of the treehouse.Huge glass window overlooking the Fern Forest.Concrete site poured countertops.Shou Sugi Ban cypress siding- an ancient technique where the wood is charred using a torch. This makes the wood rot and insect resistant.Glass tiled shower with rainfall shower head.Whiskey barrel Adirondack chairs custom made by the Treehouse Squad.All rainfall is channeled to the back of the roof and directed at the base of the tree ensuring the tree has plenty of water.Deck boasts a grill and a built in YETI cooler for extra cold storage.

Title: Luxurious Secluded Romantic Treehouse with Hot Tub
Description: ***2020 #1 Airbnb Most Wish-listed property in North Carolina***Take a short walk on well lit path to an oasis in the woods. A swinging bridge welcomes you to a quietcozy home in the treessurrounded by native Laurel and abundant hardwoods. Listen to the birds while having your morning coffee on the deck or relax in the hot tub below. The home is located on 14 acres. Old Fort is 10 minutes to Black Mountain and 20 minutes to Asheville.The spaceThe space.The treehouse has luxury beddingLED fireplacefull internet connectioncable tvheat/airmicrowavecook topand refrigerator. We have an outdoor shower with hot water and composting toiletall located on the deck overlooking the forest. Our driveway is approximately 1/3 of a mile long through the woods. The gravel driveway does have some hills and curves. It DOES NOT require 4wd but if you have a very low profile car you may scrape in some sections. If you drive a Priusyou may have trouble getting up the hill. If you have a rear wheel drive car or truckyou may spin slightly in the gravel on the hills. If you are uncomfortable driving on a gravel roaddrive a low profile vehicleor if we have a heavy snowwe offer ‚Äúdrive in‚Äù and ‚Äúdrive out‚Äù service on our UTV. We‚Äôre always available to help!

Title: Bed+Bough, an enchanting Treehouse Retreat
Description: "This is the stuff dreams are made of! Nestled in the North Georgia treetops an hour north of AtlantaBed+Bough is the Luxury Treehouse youve been waiting for! Enjoy your own private nature retreat with the luxurious accommodations youve come to expect. Built by our team of craftsman with artisanal details and a whimsical flairthe Treehouse sits on 5 acres just outside of Dahlonegas award winning winerieswaterfalls and historic Square. For travelers seeking restromance or adventure."The spaceThe space.Bed+Bough has so many unique featuresincluding a king size bed in the lofta fold out couch with a queen size beda full bathrooma living rooma kitchenettewith a microwavea toaster ovena sinkand a French Press for that morning coffee. Nestled among 5 acres of beautiful treesyou will feel as if you are in the middle of nowhere and yet you are just minutes from restaurants and shopping. The grounds of Bed+Bough offer a firepit with Adirondack chairsa picnic tablea pizza ovena protected sitting area and a grill as well as Wifi speed of 40 mgbs.Debra Stipeas your super hostwith over 800 reviews and a 4.9 overall ratinginvites you to come and experience this unique treehouse in North Georgia.Guest access.Access to the whole treehousegrounds around the treehouse as well as the Firepit & picnic table area.Other things to note.This is a treehouse and as suchis high among the trees and this height must be respected for safety reasons. Therefore the Treehouse is not suitable for young children but kids 7 years and up are considered on a case by case basis. There is a kitchenette with a microwavea toaster ovena electric hot water kettleFrench press and Keurig for coffeea mini fridge and freezerand a sink. Additionally it has running waterhot and colda full bathroom with showersink and toilet. Heat and air conditioning is also provided. The treehouse is set on 5 acres of forest with a covered outdoor seating areaa front porchand a built in Yeti cooler for additional food and beverage storage. The outdoor area has a built in grilla picnic tablea fire pit and a built in pizza oven. We recommend you pick up some firewood at a grocery store or convenience store on your way as ours gets wet outside. If using the pizza oven we recommend picking up pizza dough at the Publix located off of 400 in Dawsonville.Follow us @staydahlonega

Title: Raven Rock Treehouse
Description: Radical off grid therapy. If you want a walk on the wild side this is your spot. Perched on the apex of the Eastern Continental DivideRaven Rock Treehouse is nestled in the trees near Raven Rock Cabin in a 40 acre wilderness wild life preserve. In spite of our remote setting everything is close by. Hikingartisan shopswineriesand unique dining abound. From complete seclusion you are just 10 miles from the Asheville airport and 5 miles away from the quaint town of Hendersonville.The spaceThe space.Access is ALL WHEEL DRIVE ONLY! Gravel road is well maintained but too steep for 2 wheel drive.The bathroom is a clean Porta Potty 50 ft from the venue (also 50 feet to the ground!). There is a pee bucket with a toilet seat for night time convenance that guests empty in the porta potty and rinse at the outdoor kitchen.Spring water dispenser with 6 gallons is on the deck along with a propane cooktop. A 500 watt Goal Zero solar generator will charge your cell phones and laptops although service is sometimes spotty depending on your carrier.We supply a crate of kindling and precut wood (10") for the Dwarf mini wood stove. Additional crates are available next to the port potty for $10. (cash or Venmo)BRING YOUR OWN SHEETS AND BEDDING. (Queen). our mattress and box spring are hermetically sealed and disinfected for your protection.This site is off gridno electric. There is a gravity fed spigot with COLD water if you want to wash or rinse off.Bears are extremely shy but hungryplease store all food.If you are an early riser and quiet you may see bobcatfoxdeerturkeyhawksfalconsgrouseowls and of course ravens. It

Title: The Majestic Treehouse romantic, luxury retreat
Description: At this time we are fully booked until March 2022Check out our other listings!.COVID-19 safety measures: 150+ point cleaning & disinfecting checklist performed for every guesthealth-screening for all guests. We recommend bringing food with you so you can stay put and enjoy nature and quality time in the safety of the woods and our farm.LIVE LIKE KINGS & PLAY LIKE KIDS in this extraordinaryaward-winning treehouse.We are 25x Superhosts! Named the Most Popular Airbnb in SC!The space"The space.Why do people travel thousands of miles from around the world to stay in our treehouse? Come and see for yourself!! Transport your spiritand feel a thrill that can only be discovered in the treetops! Experience the one-of-a-kind blend of youthful bliss and grown-up luxury for yourself. The faster you get herethe sooner you change your pace and unwind in our wooden paradise.This luxury treehouse was designed by Seth Bolt (from the band NEEDTOBREATHE)who grew up on Bolt Farm. Larry Bolt (Seths dad)proprietorEagle Scout and licensed custom home builder has been building & remodeling homes for over 40 years in upstate SC.Larry and Seth both love creating masterpieces (they built our home from timber they harvested from our land) and this romanticluxury treehouse is one of their finest works of art.Seth & Tori Bolt were married at Bolt Farm and honeymooned in the treehouse suite. Tori manages brandingpressand runs the social media pages.Regina Bolt (Seths mom)the queen & caretakeris one of the top producing real-estate agents in South Carolina because of how much she genuinely cares for others and helping their dreams become reality. She will make sure your stay is comfortable and unforgettable!WE HAVE HEATING & AIR CONDITIONING! This is a year-round destination. We do have a bathroom with a toilet and washbasin in the treehouse and an amazing outdoor shower with a hot water supply for you to use just a short walk away!"Other things to note.*Due to high demand (and to make booking fair to everyone)we release more treehouse dates at 12 noon EST on the 15th of every month. For more information go to our boltfarmtreehouse website. Dates are first comefirst reservedand sell out fast! Set your reminders for next month\s Treehouse Release Day & follow us on social media to stay updated on last-minute openings!NEW OFFERING: THE VIP TREEHOUSE EXPERIENCE! Our goal as Airbnb Superhosts is to ensure every guests\ treehouse experience is truly unforgettable! Going VIP adds a wonderful variety of fun activitiessweet treatskeepsakes - enjoy our "luxury s\mores" around your own private campfireand even get a coupon for $100 off your next stay! Be sure to ask us about how you can access our VIP Treehouse Experience.Please let us know what you will be celebrating during your stay. Alsoat this timeplease make us aware of any special needs you may have.In order to ensure all of our treehouse guests have an unforgettable and safe stay at Bolt Farmwe require our guests to sign a simple liability waiver prior to check-in. Professional photoshoots are welcomed with advanced notice and approval. For media inquiriesplease contact us on our boltfarmtreehouse website. Thank you for celebrating our treehouse and the joy it brings!

Title: √Ö Auge - River Eye - Treehouse
Description: Experience being in the treesfalling asleep under the stars and waking up to the sound of birdsong in this spectacular treehouse. If you are looking for an intimatesimple and restful retreatlook no further.The space"The space.Towering six meters above the Tessung√•e river that runs down from the great plateau of NorwayHardangerviddayou will feel truly immersed in nature from your unique vantage point. Take in unparalleled views over the rushing river and into the forest beyond through full-length windows spanning the entire living area.The cleverly designed space has a surprisingly generous capacityso not only is it ideal for a couple on a romantic getawayit can also accommodate families and large groups. On the lower levelyou will find two sleeping alcovescomplete with premium double mattresses and leafy views. Upstairs in the mezzaninethere is a cosy sleeping loft with queen sized bedpanoramic windows and a huge skylightso you can enjoy a magical moment drifting off to sleep with a view of the constellations above. Youll surely sleep soundly here at the treehouse!Light candles in the evening and cook up a storm in the fully functioning kitchenwhich features a powerful gas stove and all the necessary equipment.Dine on the covered terrace with the river flowing below youwhile being enveloped in thick greenery from the trees that support the treehouse. It‚Äôs an enchanting place to drink a coffee watch the sun set or the snow fallwhile staying warm curled up in a soft woollen blanket. The terrace also includes a full sized bedso those who want a real outdoors experience can sleep here in summer.You will never feel cold in this well-insulated treetop cabin thanks to double glazed windows and an efficient wood fired stove taking pride of place in the center. You can enjoy long evenings in golden lightfeeding the fire with firewood felled sustainably from the surrounding forest.Heat up some crystal-clear river water and wash yourself with an Indian-style bucket bath in the custom designed wet room. Orif you want more of an ‚Äòoutdoor spa‚Äô experiencetake a bath in your private riverside tub and soak in the steamy water while taking in the spectacular view.You also have access to your own heatedwell maintained outdoor composting toiletdesigned to adhere to our eco-friendly principles.Instead of electricitywe provide candlessolar lamps and a solar phone charger. If you need to connect to the outside worldfree WiFi is available in the nearby cabin (50 meters walk)along with plenty of power-points for charging.In this secluded off-grid retreatyou will have a memorable experience made up of the simple pleasures that come from slowing down and disconnecting from technologyall while savoring the comforts of top quality modern architecture."Guest access.The entire treehouse and its surroundings are available for you during your stay.Other things to note.It is also possible to rent the whole locationcalled √Ö Campfor gatherings or parties. Please get in touch here!

Title: PRIVATE romantic TREEHOUSE ‚òÖ The Lions Lair
Description: "Take in the rusticfairy tale vibe of this custom-made treehouse in the midst of towering trees! Star gaze on the top deck or swing on the bottom deck while listening to the nightly sounds of the forest. The fire pit is also an amazing area to fellowshipunwind and make smores. In the morningwalk to the trailhead and explore the stunning forest of the Red River Gorge.If your travel dates are not available on this calendarvisit one of our sister properties by visiting our profile!"The spaceThe space.At nightlisten to gentle owls and enjoy the twinkling stars as you disconnect from your normal busy! Warm up near a fire while enjoying the solitude that the forest has to offer.In the morningwalk to the national trailhead location while the sun breaks through the trees as you hear the gentle stream of a nearby creek! When you returnswing underneath Lion\s Lair with a designated covered outdoor patio surrounded by ambient lighting.We are a RARE find in the area located on PRIVATE landand one of the few rentals in the Red River Gorge that is located so conveniently INSIDE the National Park just walking distance to great nearby hiking trails!If your dates are unavailablebe sure to check out our other listings as well such as "The Eagles Nest" and "KENTUCKY BREEZE" each providing their own unique accommodations.This treehouse provides both heatelectricity and a full bathroom! We guarantee you this combination of outdoors & amenities provides a truly uniqueadventurousmagicaland relaxing getaway experience with your friends or and loved ones! Perfectly designed for small families and romantic couples looking for a weekend getaway.We look forward to having you stay with usand be sure to book soon before it fills up fast!!

Title: Treasure Hunt Tree House in Metro Atlanta
Description: Welcome to Treasure Hunt Tree Houselocated in Kennesaw GA (about 20 min drive from Atlanta).This is a truly unique three floor tree house complete with many fun features as well as this cool activity: This backyard tree house has an adventurous twist in the form of a treasure hunt for any guest who stays in this fun little bungalow. Againthis is a backyard treehouse..The spaceThe space.This unique two structure tree house connected by a rope bridge sits high among the bamboo leaves in our backyard. Down below you will hear the sounds of a trickling stream that runs underneath the treehousea bridge and the hammocks. This simple intimate setting provides quiet spaces to rest and relaxwith an added bonus of an escape room style treasure hunt hidden amongst the tree houses.The first structure consists of a 144 square foot bedroom with 3 sets of French doors and a vaulted ceiling supported by pine beams. There is a wrap-around porch on 3 sides surrounded by bamboo railing. The tin roof provides a calming sound when it rains. All six doors open fully to allow maximum airflowbut the treehouse bedroom is also equipped with a ceiling fanand heating and air conditioning. The bed is a comfortable memory foam/ coil hybrid mattress with high quality sheets. Trees run through the deck and the interior of this room. Most of the d√©cor was handmade by the owner.As you walk across the rope bridge you‚Äôll enter the 2nd structure which is screened in with a table and chairs to sit in. Along the center tree is a ladder that leads through a trap door to a crow‚Äôs nest observatory above with bamboo railing. This floor has a bucket that is raised via a rope and pulley system that is turned by a boat helm. (Just for fun). All three levels are lit up at night via stringed lights magical feeling ambiance.A full bathroom consisting of a sinktoilet and marble shower is reserved on the ground level exclusively for tree house guests. Guests are provided with towelshandmade soapswatersand snacks. There is a small mini fridgea microwaveand a coffee maker in the treehouse as well. Guests are encouraged to look at the online guidebook we have created which highlights the many great restaurants and activities available in the Kennesaw area.For those adventurous types looking for more fun than just a simple quiet retreatthese bungalows hold a secret: many complex cluespuzzles and riddles are hidden throughout the structures and promise to surprise and delight the inner child of all who plays the game. No assistance is given to find the treasureso work together. Those who win the game will have the eternal honor of signing their name amongst the past legends who have overcome this challenge. (And you will get a prize too :).We try our very best to exceed your expectations in our little backyard bungalow and aim to make it a truly memorable and relaxing time to escape and unwind in a fun and unique setting. This treehouseas most treehouses areis in the backyard. The bathroom is about 30 steps from the treehouse on the ground level and is attached to my house (but is exclusively for treehouse guests). The electronic key code for the tree house is the same code as for the bathroom.Guest access.all three treehouse levels and the bathroom on the ground level

Title: Luxury Stone and Timber Treehouse on 40-Acre Farm
Description: Stay in the gorgeous Treehouse for a luxury "glamping" experience! Perfect for anyone looking for a peaceful getaway. Surrounded by towering pines on a 40-acre farm estate in Concordyou feel like you are in the mountains of Asheville. Enjoy the hot tubfire pitwalk our trails or visit the animals- all within minutes of historic Concord and Kannapolis. Book a 60 or 90 minute individual massage or coffee tasting during your stay at the farm (please contact them directly for availability)!The space"The space.The Treehouse is a largeone-room space featuring a Queen bed with hand-crafted furnishings and a small table with chairs. There is also a private deck for enjoying your morning coffee looking out over the trees. Outside of your space is a propane grill as well as an outdoor table with chairs for dining under the stars.The space includes A/C and heatall linens - including bath and swim towelsrobes and extra blankets - a mini fridgeand a coffee bar with a Keurig coffee machineground coffeeassorted teas and hot cocoa as well as assorted sweeteners and half&half. We also provide you with a selection of eco-friendly compostable platesbowlsnapkinssilverware and cups.A short walk from your space is the Main Barnwhere you will find the shared Farm Kitchen. It includes a full-size Fridgemicrowave and sink as well as all necessary cooking supplies (toolsoilseasoningsand more) and grill-friendly pots and pans. You can also find an iron and ironing boardpicnic blankets and nest hammocks in this space.Also located in the Main Barn is Cairn Coffee RoastersHarmony & Balance Massage Studio and our Farm Store! You can contact them directly after booking to check availability for a 60 or 90 minute individual massage or a tour of the roasting facilities.The Eco Bathrooms are located within a short walking distance from your space. They contain separate mens and womens eco-toilets with a shared exterior sink. The main Eco Bathroom also includes an amazing attached outdoor rainforest shower with organic shampooconditioner and bodywash. No worries- our tankless hot water heaters provide unlimited hot water for you during your stay!Whether youre visiting the Eco Shower or relaxing in the hot tubwe provide you with robesrainboots and cozy socks to keep you comfortable and warm going to and from your spaces.You will also have shared access to our beautiful above-ground pool and deck (open seasonally) and a 7-person hot tub and a fire pit (open year round)."Other things to note.We do not allow pets in this rental space. Howeverpets are allowed at the Barn Loft and Greenhouse with advanced approval.The set up of our spaces are for adult occupany only and therefore we do not allow children to stay with you at the farm regardless of age.You may not invite anyone to visit you at the farm during your staythe property is only available for the use of our registered guests.If the Treehouse is not available for your trip or you would like to see our other spacesplease check out our Airbnb Profile.Professional photoshoots are not allowed with Airbnb bookings.

Title: Epic Luxury Treehouse - next to Dog Mountain !
Description: The Outpost Treehouse is a beautifully handcrafted retreatnestled amongst the evergreens atop Spaulding Mtn and adjacent to the nationally renowned Alerin Barn event venue. Located .5 mile from Stephen Huneck Gallery/Dog Mountain3 miles from the historic Town of St. Johnsburyin the heart of Vermont‚Äôs North East Kingdom. Mountain Bikers are just over 10 miles to The Hub at Kingdom trails15 miles to Burke Mtn ski and bike parkand we are 2 exits north I 93 from Littleton & White Mtn‚Äôs NH!The spaceThe space.The Outpost Luxury Treehouse has been a lifelong dream and labor of lovehandcrafted with reclaimed Timber and vintage salvaged finds by Husband and wife design team Alexa and Aaron Airoldi. Designer finishessoft linensPendleton blanketsand a eclectic mix of antique rustic alpine lodge decorin a magnificent setting among the treetopslooking out over Alerin Farm Cattle pasturesPrivate ski trails and Green Mountain View‚Äôs. Cathedral great room with GAS FIREPLACE ( we turn it on from October -May) main heat: Renai gas heaterfull kitchen :full size gas stoveunder mount Mini wine/ fridgesmall Ice Maker( no freezer/but we provide outdoor beverage station for iced beverages) Antique Farmhouse sinkBathroom1 king on main floor2 queens in the sleeping loft tucked under the Eve 2 story deck with exterior dining tableexterior bar with barstools and covered porchwith private parking and use of fire pits. There is a exterior cooler for beer on the porch. The Treehouse is a natural retreat space located in the woods ... you may see bugs outside you will feel Pine needles drop on the out side decks .... this is as much about the setting in nature as it is the vintage Aesthetic. There is NO AIR-CONDITIONINGbut there are double French doors that open with screens and create a draft. We have 4 plug in fans for cooling if needed and screens on all French doors. The Treehouse is well insulated and under tree cover and remains cool in summer. This is a TV and WIFI free zonebut cell reception works great and you can use your cell as a hotspot easily to activate laptop or tablet etc.... an orange wireless Bluetooth speaker is included in the rentalfor music. There is a Weber Charcoal grill at the fire pitfor guest use. This place is perfectly equipped to handle a couples getaway for twoa family with children.. or a few friends!Please review our description carefully and decide if this is the right space for you and your guests before booking ..Remember ‚Äú NO TVNO WIFINO AIR CONDITIONING‚Äù.....This is a small unique spacemade with salvaged treasures and eclectic findsit is a cozy escape literally in the treesthat means steps to climb and in the hot summer - Fans and old fashioned open screen doors to cool down... In the winterthat means winter boots and 4x4 drive to get up the mountain...that being said you may see bugshear animals at nightand maybe even rediscover yourself by the fire !Other things to note.NOTE: Please review our description carefully and decide if this is the right space for you and your guests before booking ..Remember ‚Äú NO TVNO WIFINO AIR CONDITIONING‚Äù.....This is a small unique spacemade with salvaged treasures and eclectic findsit is a cozy escape literally in the treesthat means steps to climb and in the hot summer - Fans and old fashioned open screen doors to cool down... In the winterthat means winter boots and 4x4 drive to get up the mountain...that being said you may see bugshear animals at nightand maybe even rediscover yourself by the fire !Winter rentals : Driving to the treehouse in the winter: we are located 1.8 miles at the top of Spaulding Rd on Spaulding Mtnthe road is steepand the drive down into the treehouse is a hill as wellfor driving in snowy conditions a 4x4 or AWD vehicle with snow tires would be preferred to get up the roadin lieu of bad weather road conditions. The road and driveway are fully plowedsalted and maintainedBut sometimes Vermont winter conditionscan make it difficultso plan accordingly.REVIEWS If you loved your stayplease leave us a review online at Airbnband in our guest book at the treehouseand pass the word about this enchanting place ! Lets stay connected..PETS We will consider upon requesta well adjustedmature and well behaved dog. A dog is allowed for a fee of $50.00 per dog and that is to be paid upon booking in special requests and fees . A dog must be crated while unattended in the treehouse. Please provide your own dog clean up supplies. Please scoop poopsand if you see our friendly cat Targhee please leash your dog. If you are attending a Alerin Barn or wedding next door absolutely No Dogs are permitted on Alerin Barn grounds. Dogs must remain at the Outpost. If you walk your dog you can hike down the lower cattle fence below the treehouse down the hill ( if you walk the upper fence DO NOT GO FARTHER THAN THE CATTLE BARN) DOGS are NOT Permitted in the Alerin Barn Compound !!!!!!

Title: Trailside Treehouse - Riverside in Richmond, VA
Description: Fulfill your childhood dream of camping in a treehouse! From this central spot by the rivereasily explore the trails and river. Thenrelax on the deck and enjoy the magic of the trees.‚Ä¢Airbnb ‚ÄúTop 20 Places to Stay in VA‚Äù.‚Ä¢"Best of Richmond" by Style Magazine.‚Ä¢Featured in Airbnb article on hospitality.‚Ä¢One of "8 Great Airbnbs" in the U.S. by Inside Hook‚Ä¢Complementary bikes.‚Ä¢Comes with bathroomkitchenette & lounge apartment in host house.‚Ä¢Dog-friendlySocial media: @trailside_treehouseThe space"The space.When you stay in the treehouseyou‚Äôre not just embarking on an incredible adventure for your family‚Äîyou‚Äôre also helping the Richmond-area community by supporting non-profits that are aligned with our mission of supporting children and the outdoors. We donate a large portion of your payment to local non-profits and thank you for being a positive part of our community.~~Heres your chance to fulfill that childhood dream of running away and camping out in a treehouse. This is not a tiny house wrapped around a tree or a glamorous treehouse complete with running water and a kitchen. Insteadthis is an authentic treehouse that we built for our nephew in 2014complete with reclaimed redwood walls and windows from our old house. Its an authentic kid-like treehouse experience; a space devoted to the stuff of childhood dreams.LOCATION: The Trailside Treehouse is centrally located in RichmondVirginiajust minutes from I-95 and I-64. It is directly across the river from one of Richmonds popular parks called Maymont. The James River Park System and Buttermilk Trail also come through the propertythanks to an easement we have given the city. The treehouse property itself includes five wooded acres with nationally-celebrated single-track trail and is adjacent to the river--just hike down the trail and cross a single train track and youll find some of Richmonds best fishing and swimming!THE SPACE: As we designed the treehouse spacewe asked ourselves one question: what would we have wanted in a treehouse as kids? The Trailside Treehouse is our answer to that question--its a magnum opus to childhood.Please note: There is a zipline on the property. Per our insurance companyguests are not allowed to use it. Please prepare your children ahead of time so theyre not bummed when they arrive!WHAT TO EXPECT: The treehouse isn‚Äôt an inexpensive place to stay. It‚Äôs not simply a comfortable room to call home as you pass through townas are many Airbnb‚Äôs. Insteadit‚Äôs an unparalleled experience that we hope transforms our guests by bringing them back to their childlike centers. It‚Äôs a place to practice juggling or learn new yo-yo tricks. It‚Äôs a place to flip through a book about bowling rules and get curious about things you haven‚Äôt wondered about since you were a kid. There are notes to discover in the nooks and crannies. There are games you may not have played with since you were a child. Theres a bin of junk food and a fridge with sodas. Weve stocked the treehouse with activities that we hope reminds you of the curiosity you had as a child. We want you to feel that your time here is invaluable‚Äîthat it is a priceless trip that sets you up for a transformative week or month or year. Reinvigorates. Rejuvenates. Renews your very sense of self.VALUABLE MEMORIES TO LAST A LIFETIME.We know the treehouse experience is an investment that many families save for. Our goal is to provide you with value beyond your expectations so that you truly feel that your time exploring here with your friends and family was worth every cent. Our guests who get the most value from the experience are those guests who are willing to leave their phones in their bags and truly live in the simplicity and wonder of the moment. We want you to imagine that you are your 10-year old self and have packed a backpack with all of your favorite things and run away to your neighbors treehouse in the woods. Even those guests bringing kids should feel ready to loosen the reigns of responsibility for awhile to just enjoy the space and get optimum value from their time here.‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢DESIGN AND TOUR HISTORY.This two-story treehouse was designed by renowned Richmond architectHenry Tenserand modeled after a western firetower. It was featured (alongside the modern home where the hosts live) on the 2017 Virginia Home and Garden Tour as well as three Westover Hills Neighborhood Association tours and the Modern Richmond Tour.‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢TRAILSIDE LOCATION IN THE CITY.The treehouse sits in our back yard at the top of a wooded gully that leads to the James River Park System and is mere yards from the popular Buttermilk Trail--one of the most celebrated urban single-track trail systems in the entire country. For trail-lovers and adventure-loversyou simply cant find a better spot to stay the night in RichmondVirginia.**please note that we are located within the cityso you can expect to hear city soundswhich may include trainssirenstraffic and other things.‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢BRIDGE TO CHILDHOOD.To access the treehouseyoull cross a wooden bridge and enter onto the main deck. If youre ready to playjump into the twisty tube slide and play on the playground equipment beneath the main floor. If youre ready to relaxtake a seat on the deck and enjoy your wooded surroundings.‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢PORCH LEVEL.Enter the main floor screened porch through the screened doors. The main floor is screened in on all four sides and features two hammock swings--the perfect place to read a book or recount your day on the trail as you rock amongst the trees--mosquito-free (a rare summer treat for Richmond).When more than 4 people wish to stay in the treehousethis first floor can be transformed into an additional sleeping area with a fold-up memory foam mattress or single cots. Just let us know if you need those!.‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢SLEEPING LEVEL.The sleeping area on the second story is located up a knee-hole ladder and through a trap door. The second story is surrounded by windows on all four sidesincluding two fish-eye windows so you can poke your head into the concave plexiglass and get a look at the ground three stories below. The second story also features a balconywhich is accessible through a screen door. Youll sleep soundly under the corrugated corten steel roof. The sleeping quarters features a queen bed with a memory foam mattress and a bunkbed cot.‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢.LOUNGEBATHROOM AND KITCHENETTE.Inside the host houseyoull have fullprivate use of our basementwhich includes a temperature-controlled lounge area with a TVsleeper sofabean bag chairkitchenette with sinkmicrowaveand Keurigand full bathroom. The entrance to the lower level is private and accessible from the exterior of the home.The bike room is also in this basement space. You are welcome to take out a bike as long as you sign a waiver and wear a helmet! There are 4 bikes to use for free.‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢GUEST COUNT AND SLEEPING COMFORTABLY.Please let us know in advance how many guests are in your party so we can set up bedsset out the appropriate number of towelspillowsblankets and make sure there are enough snacks and drinks.Our standard guest limit is 6. If you want to bring a larger partywe have some options. Let us know and we will help you figure out whether the options suit your travel styleincluding the sleeper sofa inside and putting two children per level of the cotand sleeping in any of the hammocks. ~Standard sleeping arrangements are as follows (let us know if youd like something different):.-1-2 guests: queen bed on 2nd floor.-3-4 guests: queen bed + bunkbed cot on 2nd floor.-5-6 guests: queen bed + bunkbed cot on 2nd floor + fold-up memory foam mattress on 1st floor NOTE: when there are families with more than two kidswe recommend fitting two kids per level of the bunkbed cot so everyone can sleep on the same level.~~.‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢DOGS ARE WELCOME!.If you‚Äôre bringing your dog(s)please let us know. Our dog is very friendly.Single night options are available upon request and availability. Contact us for more info.We can‚Äôt wait to host your adventure!!!""Guest access.Youll have fullexclusive access to the treehousefirepitand basement of the host housewhich includes a full bathroomlounge area with a sofa bedmassive bean bag and television.This is also where the bike room iscomplete with adult-sized bikes for you to use.The entrance to the basement is private so you can come and go as you please without feeling self-conscious!Our insurance company does not allow guests to use the zipline.Drink water from the kitchen and sink faucetsbut not the garden spigots. Garden spigot water comes from rainwater collected from the roof."Other things to note.summer guests‚Äî yesit can be hot. Againthink of the treehouse of your childhood dreams. It doesn‚Äôt have ac! Overnight temps are typically in the 70s and we have fans. If you need temperature controlled environmentsplan to spend time and sleep in the basement lounge of the host house. If summer glamping isn‚Äôt appealingbook your stay in the spring or fall when temps are milder. :)Winter guests: see above only opposite.Single night options are sometimes available. Contact us if you\d like to book just one night.Please‚Äîno candles or open flames in the treehouseincluding grills or propane cooktops.RIVER ACCESS‚ÄîThe treehouse property includes five wooded acres with trails for you to explore. A train track borders our property to the north and just on the other side of the track is a popular river swimming and fishing spot. You can hike to the river easily and spend a day enjoying swimmingfloatingfishingwater sports and exploring. Rock hopping is very popular in Richmond.FOOD ODORS‚ÄîPlease no fish or fragrant food/items in the treehouse or lounge. This includes cologneperfumefishfishincensefishand any other odors that may take a few days to air outespeciallybut not limited tofish.ZIPLINE‚ÄîThere is a zipline on the property. Per our insurance companyguests are not allowed to use it. Please prepare your children ahead of time so they\re not bummed when they arrive!TRAIL ACCESS‚ÄîThe trail off of the treehouse property is a single track trail that leads to 40 miles of a nationally recognized trail system. It‚Äôs very technical for riders and should only be attempted by advanced riders. It‚Äôs great for hikers and runners at all levels. If you are borrowing treehouse bikes and want to ride the trailavoid the single track Buttermilk trail..you‚Äôll want to ride the bikes a mile downriver on the road to Reedy Creek to pick up the fire roadwhich is flat and awesome for riders at all levels. From the fire roadride down river two miles to Belle Isle then circle the island or ride all over the cityincluding the canal walk and Capital Trail. Togwatee‚Äîfrom here you can go anywhere!!BONFIRE‚ÄîWe have firewoodlighters and fire starters. Plan to have a bonfire. You may want to bring your own starter log if you‚Äôre unfamiliar with starting a fire. The kind you‚Äôd use in a fireplace works!EGRESS AND LADDER‚ÄîThe sleeping quarters are up a ladder and through a 24"x24" opening. Please be comfortable climbing the ladder and moving through the opening. If you\re pregnantyou may want to measure your belly.WEATHER‚ÄîWe do not refund cancellations for weather reasons. Please be aware when booking that you could get inclement weatherincluding stormssnowwindetc. For that reasonyou need to be comfortable assuming some weather-related risk before you book.RESCHEDULING‚ÄîWe do allow guests to reschedule in some cases as long as they request the rescheduling 10 days prior to the day of stay or more.URBAN NOISES‚ÄîThe treehouse is located on five wooded acres in the center of Richmond City. Our property is only one of about a dozen riverside properties in the entire cityso you will have easy access to the river while enjoying life in the trees. Along with lots of wildlifeyou will hear city soundswhich we refer to in our family as ‚Äúurban waves‚Äù like the sounds of beach waves. These noises may include sirenstrainsand trafficalong with all the sounds of nature and your loved one‚Äôs laughter and cheer.HOST FAMILY INTERACTION AND SPACE USE‚ÄîOur family lives in the property and our home is very close to the treehouse. Our family plays in the front yard when guests are in residence and we leave the back yard for guests to enjoy on their own. Guests should be comfortable and open to seeing our kids in the driveway and front yard. :)ELECTRICITY LIMITATIONS‚ÄîThe treehouse is on a 20 AMP power circuit. If too many devices are plugged in and runningthe breaker may tripcausing power loss. Please let us know right away if you lose power.HEATERS‚ÄîWe provide heaters that are approved by our insurance company. Please do not bring your own.HOT PLATES‚ÄîDue to safety concernsplease do not use hot plates or other heating or cooking devices within the treehouse.GUEST COUNT‚ÄîPlease let us know in advance how many guests are in your party so we can set up the bedsset out the appropriate number of towelsand make sure there are enough snacks and drinks. We want everyone in your group to have an awesome experience. If we don‚Äôt know a guest is comingwe won‚Äôt have set up a comfortable space for him/her and he/she will not have towelsblanketspillowssnacksdrinksand all the fun stuff that makes glamping in the treehouse such a memorable experience. Thank you!.WATER‚ÄîDrink water from the kitchen and sink faucetsbut not the garden spigots. Garden spigot water comes from rainwater collected from the roof.

Title: BREEZE, in a tree The Appleton Retreat
Description: BREEZE Treehouseis located at The Appleton Retreat on 120 acres of private landbordered by 1,300 acres of a protected nature conservancy. To the south is the Pettengill Stream a resource protected area and to the north a large secluded pond. BREEZE guests may reserve the wood fired cedar hot tub and the saunaat an additional chargewhich are close by and private. The Appleton Retreat is less than a 30 minute drive to BelfastRockportCamden and Rocklandcharming downeast seaside towns.The space"The space.Total privacyalone in a treethe ultimate getaway.The 1st floor of BREEZE is over 20 high and the sleeping loft is approximately 40 off the ground. To gain access to BREEZE requires climbing three flights of stairs. Two are very easy and code compliantthe 3rd is a ships ladder - most dogs will need a lot of coaching or need to be carried up. The sleeping loft is also accessed by a steep set of stairs.BREEZE is NOT a great place for young children.You will experience the uniqueness of being in a tree! Windowed walls overlook the treetops and a glimpse of the ridge to the south. There is a large deck for hanging out...(CAUTION: In winds over 25 mph you may experience some movement and noise - not to worry!).Although BREEZE appears to be a rustic structureit has many amenities including: Air Conditioninga full galley kitchen; a shower and traditional toiletas well as good old electricity.... so you will not be roughing it.Although there is not wi-fi at BREEZE you may tap into the wi-fi at Braeburn by getting in that proximity.There is private parking at the treehouse."

Title: Oasis Treehouse Atlanta
Description: When you step into our little forest sanctuary it is easy to forget that you are only 10 min from downtown Atlanta. Nestled in the forestacross a bridge over a little creekis a beautiful little modern treehouse that sleeps 4 people. There is a composting toilet and a small kitchenette with running water. Across the bridge are a private outdoor shower with hot/cold water and a heater for amazing winter showersnext to it is a heated bath house all for your use only.The spaceThe space.A true urban oasisbeautiful nature all around without having to leave the comfort or proximity of the city. Visiteat and enjoy everything Atlanta has to offerthen sit on the treehouse balconyswing in the hammock take in the bird song and the forest.. enjoy the rays of sunshine through the trees and the mesmerizing rain as it comes down..An authentic treehouseheld up by two oaksheated in the winter and cooled in the summerwith a cosy loft beda composting toiletand everything you need for a comfortable stay.A walk down the magnificent suspended bridge leads you to secludedcharming outdoor shower with hot running water.The treehouse is smallbut comfortably sleeps up to four (two in the queen bed in the loft and two on the the pull out sofa (queen).Guest access.Plenty of parking is available on our quiet street

Title: Sugar Creek Treehouse with hot tub
Description: Surely the place you dreamed of as a child! The treehouse sits above a beautiful mountain stream. Close to parksart and culturegreat viewsand restaurants and dining. You‚Äôll love the treehouse because of the romantic coziness. My place is good for couplessolo adventurersand families (with kids).The space"The space.Idyllic 600 sq. ft. artist‚Äôs treehouse deep in the forest35 feet above a mountain stream with gently cascading waterfalls ‚Äì just 45 minutes northeast of AshevilleNC. Just 45 miles west of BooneNC. Perched high in the skythis home offers sleeping for up to six. Follow the floating log staircase to a romantic upstairs loft with Romeo and Juliet balcony. Lounge in the window seat thereenjoying the best view in the house. Or enjoy the cozy sleeping loft tucked away off the living room. Its the perfect place to curl up with a good book. Stroll along the wrap around deck for magnificent views of the stream immediately below. Sit by the crackling wood stove and enjoy its cozy warmth. The modern kitchen was made for a master chef. All the cookwareorganic spicesand oils are provided to whip up an amazing meal. This is the place you surely dreamed of when you were a child!.Designed and built by two imaginative and experienced natural buildersthis tiny treehouse hamlet sits on 6 wooded acres with south ‚Äì facing slopes at a comfortable elevation of 2,150 feet. It is near Mt. Mitchellthe tallest mountain east of the Mississippi and only twenty minutes away from the renowned Penland School of Crafts and the community of Celoin Yancey Countywhere more artists per capita live than anywhere in the U.S. The Blue Ridge Parkway will get you within 20 miles of the home. The newly paved highways take you the rest of the way.With easy access to state-maintained roads and just 7 miles from all the conveniences in BurnsvilleNCthis quiettucked-away eden offers the best of both worlds. An inspiring wildlife and birdwatcher‚Äôs paradiseits‚Äô other features include: a view of the beautiful North Toe River from mountain plateaumagnificent rock outcroppingsa small sounding cavenature trails and many edible wild plants.Simply walk across the street to enjoy the Toe River. It offers refreshing deep waters for swimming and excellent trout or bass fishing. Walk along the pebble shores and simply enjoy the beauty.The Appalachian Trail is within 15 miles of the home running along the NC and TN border. Take a short drive for a worthwhile hike. The home is also within 20 miles of the Roan Mountain State Park for another beautiful hike.*** please note the sleeping loft (not bedroom) is accessed by a fixed ladder. Best for school age children or mobile adults. Not suitable for younger children and older adults."

Title: Porumbacu tree house close to Carpathian mountains
Description: Porumbacu treehouse is the perfect place for a vacationimmersed in a small forest right in the heart of Porumbacua mountain village in Transylvania. Two rivers cross the property and you will wake up very day in a deep green landscape. Escape from the busy weekdays life and find the relaxing and quiet way of living. In additionin the front yard there is our Transylvanian guesthouse where you will find other facilities for a pleasant stay: fully equipped kitchenwifi barbecuekiosketc.The spaceThe space.The treehouse has one bedroom (2 adults + 2 children/adults) with a queen bed and an extendible sofaa kitchenette and one bathroom. The terrace offers beautiful view over the entire are.Other things to note.Porumbacu treehouse is the perfect place for a vacationimmersed in a small forest right in the heart of Porumbacua mountain village in Transylvania. Two rivers cross the property and you will wake up very day in a deep green landscape. Escape from the busy weekdays life and find the relaxing and quiet way of living. Title: Treehouse near Bar Harbor. Luxurious and private!
Description: Rekindle the joy of being a kid as you revel in luxury suitable for grownups! Your treehouse offers an unmatched private setting nestled among maplesprucecedarpine and birch. Spacious at 900 square feetyour treehouse offers such comforts as a whirlpoolsaunakitchenfireplaceseasonal outdoor shower and plenty of deck space. Your treehouse is centrally located near the many attractions along the Downeast Coastline! Pets are welcome!!Guest access.You will have the entire treehouse to yourself!"Other things to note.The kitchen has a refrigeratortoaster ovenmicrowavecook top and dishwasher. There are potspans and most everything youll need. There is a coffee maker in the pantry with plenty of k-cups."
