Title: La Paz at Treehouse Mountain!
Description: Enter this colorful treehouse in the mountains for your next getaway! Perfect for trips with friendsfamilyand couples. Completely dog friendly! Walk across a suspension bridge into this magical treehouse that offers a main floor and a loft as well as a spacious porch and the perfect view of the mountains.There are four treehouses total on this property. Let me know if you have questions about renting more than one together for larger groups!The space"The space.Treehouse La Paz is one of four treehouses located on this 29 acre property backed up against a wooded mountain-side.Treehouse Mountain Retreat is a relaxing getaway for every type of traveler. Guests are welcome to inquire about booking more than one treehouse during their stay in case their party is larger than four. We can accommodate up to 11 guests with all three treehouses.All treehouses are dog friendly and we do not charge an extra fee to bring your pets. All you have to do is let us know if youre bringing any dogs and if theyre friendly with other dogs as well!There is a kitchenette which features a half-size refrigeratora COLD sink (no hot water in treehouse)a microwavea coffee makera water boiler for tea and hot chocolatea mini rice cookerand a toaster. On the connecting platformthere is a flat top griddle that is great for cooking breakfastlunchand dinner!.**We will provide teacoffeecreamersugarand coffee mugsas well as basic cooking items such as ricesaltpepperspicesoilutensilsplatesa pota pan and a cast iron skillet. **This treehouse has access to a half bathroom located on the platform connected to the main treehouse as well as use of the 2 shower2 bathroom climate controlled bathhouse.There is a pond on our property and multiple firepits for guests to use. Each treehouse has their own private firepit with firewood and firestarter included.Here at Treehouse Mountainour goal is to provide everything that we would want if we were to travel to other Airbnbs. During your stayyou can find that we are readily available if theres anything we can help out with or want help planning your trip to the area as well.If you have questions about any of our treehouse rentals (we have four total)send me a message! We also offer discounts* for militaryweekly stayreturn guestsor renting more than one treehouse during a stay.*Guests can use up to two discounts for a reservation*""Our property is 29 acres of mostly forestwith some open fields as well. Guests have full access to our propertyexcept for the other treehouses that may be rented out by other guests.Quiet hours:.To respect all guests vacationing at our propertywe have a quiet time of 9 PM. Youre still welcome to enjoy camp fires or sitting out on the porchetc. We just ask that theres no loud music or anything that may cause a disturbance to other guests.Areas of interest guests may enjoy:.9 hole disc golf course (map can be found on the UDisc App) *we have discs available for guest use.Walking trails throughout the property.A slack line (balancing line)Games/Activities available upon request:.Corn Hole.Giant Jenga.Bocce BallOther things to note:.I have a pottery studio on the property. If this interests youyoure welcome to come check it outjust let me know!.We do our best to maintain the grounds without disturbing guests (leaf blowingcutting grasscutting firewoodetc. We aim to do this when all guests are out and about during the day. If you arrive back and were still workingjust send me a message as we may not have noticed your arrival back. Our goal is to provide a relaxing environment .We are constantly looking for new things to add to this listso this may change over time."Other things to note.The other two treehouses may be booked during your stay and other guests may have dogs off leash on the property because we are fully dog friendly. If this is a concern to you (due to fear of dogs or your dog is not friendly towards other dogs) let me know and I would be glad to request any guests staying to keep their dogs on leash.

Title: Magical Treehouse - winter wonderland getaway!
Description: Sleep up in the trees in our cozy Magical Treehouse. This place is the perfect base camp for your next adventureor a unique spot to curl up with a good book. The perfect place to be in the woodsbut not isolated. Cook your meals in the nearby cookhouse (40‚Äô awayunheated) on a camp stove or over an open campfire. A heated bathroom/shower is 20‚Äô away. We provide you with linenscookwareplus help you plan your trip. Property includes miles of hiking trails and beautiful places to explore!The space"The space.Ruralbut centrally locatedThe Magical Treehouse is seven miles north of Paul Smiths College on Rt. 30. You‚Äôll be in one of the most varied wilderness areas of the park.The Paul Smith‚Äôs College Visitors Interpretive Center is five miles away with wonderful hiking trails and educational programs for the whole family.You‚Äôll be 25 minutes to Saranac Lake or Malone; 35 minutes to Lake Placid and its Olympic venues; 50 minutes to Whiteface Mountain. The Natural History Museum of the Adirondacks (the Wild Center) is 40 minutes away in Tupper Lake.The Magical Treehouse has a single room with a beautifulcomfortable handcrafted queen-size beda tableand cozy chairs. Your bathroom/shower is in a separate building 20 awayand your cookhouse is in a screened in area and is 40 away. (Wintertime- mini fridgemicrowave and snowshoes provided).There is a nice campfire spot for summer marshmallow roasts or quiet fire gazing. A complimentary bundle of campfire wood is provided for your usemore for purchase.You can cook meals in the screened in cookhouse (not heated in winter) and a spigot nearby provides water. The cookhouse has all the potsdishesutensils and tools youll need to make a great meal.There are over 5 miles of hiking/xc ski/snowshoe trails on the property to explore and nearby trails are excellent for mountain biking with both back country roads and single-track. The property is home to a bogan old quarry and a river runs nearby. Designated horseback riding trail heads are less than a mile away. A ‚ÄúWild and Scenic Study River,‚Äù the Osgoodflows nearby with put-in and take-outs within a couple of miles of our driveway. Drop-off and pick-up arrangements can be made. This is a ‚Äúmust paddle‚Äù for those interested in wildlife and scenery. Many have spotted the bald eagle who has a nest at the river‚Äôs edge. We are surrounded by many great fishing spots.Your hostsBob and Sheilaare a former professional wilderness guideand a life-long resident of the Paul Smith‚Äôs area. Between the two of themgood advice‚Äîconnecting you to great experiences and unique destinations is as close to a ‚Äúsure thing‚Äù as you can get. The temporary use of their brains is complimentary!""Youll have 27 acres to exploreincluding purpose-built mountain biking trails!""Other things to note.Everything that youll need is here. All you have to do is bring your food and your adventurous spirit."

Title: Varena Treehouse West
Description: The Treehouse is a perfect place for a vacation in the middle of the old pine trees forest. It offers a retreat from an intensive city life and a short getaway to the wild less than one hour away from Vilnius.The spaceThe space.The place itself is a romantic room suited for an unforgettable moments with a loved one. It contains a lovely terrace with the fantastic view to the landscapehammocksfire-place and many other things that will make your time amazing. Moreoverthe place offers a perfect working place with a free wi-fi and working desk for those who are looking to change their usual office day into peaceful and untraditional work place.Other things to note.For those who enjoy more active leisure timewe offer a bike tour to the nearest village Pamerkiai located on the cost of a river Merkys. There you are going to find not only a beautiful village established in the beginning of XX century but also ‚ÄôGrikucis‚Äô farmstead famous for its traditional kitchen and educational programs.

Title: Treehouse Lika 1
Description: "If youre looking to spend your vacation in unspoiled naturein a luxuriously equipped house among the treeslisten to the birdsto ride a bicycleto walk along the forest trailsto explore Velebits peaks and other particular characteristics of this region of exceptional beautythen youve come to the right place. The sea is only 20 minutes away by car. Plitvice Lakes National Park is within 1 hour drive. 4 more national parks are also within an hour drive."The spaceThe space.The house is situated in Velebit Nature Park. It is unique because you stay between the trees at the height of 4 meters. You experience the nature in a totally different and special way. The location is perfect because in summer timeyou are close to the sea (20 minutes) but you sleep in the freshness.Guest access.The whole house is available for stay with its surrounding area where is the barbecue and big covered terrace with garden furniture.Other things to note.The house is new and fully equipped for maximum comfort.

Title: ER69 - Rachel's Tree House - Great location...close to all the action!
Description: "One of our most unique 1 bedroom 1 bathroom log cabinsyoure sure to remember that # 69 is a real treat. Upon enteringon the bottom levelyoure in for quite a surprise. This cabin was built around a tree!!! Yesa tree goes from the bottom levelin the middle of your dining areaall the way up through the top levelright past the foot of your bed. Ground level consists of an incredibly well thought out style of kitchen and dining areawith mason jars as light coversand an old washtub sink equipped with a hand pump water spout and all! Upstairson one side youll find a cozy loveseat and TV with fireplace in your sitting areaand your bedroom with a queen sized bed and Jacuzzi on the other. There is also a steaming hot tub out on your private deck. Staying in this cabin makes for a splendid vacation youll always remember. Our resort area swimming pool and clubhouse is within walking distance for those hot summer days. Area restaurants and attractions are all just minutes away by car."

Title: Romantic Treehouse Getaway with Treetop Views
Description: Enjoy breathtaking and one-of-a-kind lodging in our Whispering Pines Treehouse. This unique treehouse rental in Ohio towers 22 feet in the air and offers luxuryadventureand comfort. Featuring a stone two-person jetted tub with a ceiling tub fillerking-size rustic Amish Crafted pillow-top mattresscherry hardwood floorsand rustic furnishings. Privately tucked away in a grove of White Pinesrelax and refresh yourself while sitting on your deck.The spaceThe space.Living Room:.Step into luxury with your first step over the threshold and onto the beautiful cherry hardwood floor. Roughhewn beams and split pine planking surround you as you relax in the comfy sofa and matching chair in front of a live edge coffee table. Flip the switch to ignite the fireplace encased in hand-cut stone and curl up with a good book or take a much-deserved nap. You can also catch up on your favorite shows on the large screen TV with cable channels that are mounted above the mantle.Windows on each wall allow plenty of natural light and outdoor beauty to enter your hideaway. But make sure you spend lots of time outside on the wrap-around balcony. Allow the peacefulness of your wooded retreat to soothe your mind and soul as you rock gently in the rockers and absorb the serenity that surrounds you.Before snuggling into the King size bed featuring an Amish-made pillow-top mattress resting on an elevated pinewood basemake sure you unwind in your private two-person jetted tub. The ceiling-high waterfall fill supplies the hot water that will be jetted over tired muscles creating just the right mood for the perfect night.Kitchen:.Your kitchen is home to a collegiate-sized refrigerator with a freezer and a 2-burner stovetop. There are ample pots and pans if you feel like making your favorite vacation mealor a microwave oven for heating up the leftovers from one of our amazing restaurants in town. A toaster and drip coffee maker round out the appliances which are at your disposal. The Amish-made wood table and chairs are the perfect spots for breakfast for two.Bathroom:.A sliding barn door opens to reveal your tiled floor bathroom. An artisanal counter rests on legs made from logs. The expertly tiled shower is large enough for two and can start your day or end your night on just the right note.

Title: The Owl Cabin
Description: Welcome and enjoy your stay in our perched hut.This small wooden hut was built entirely by its owner in 2019. The materials come from nearby trees and recovery.Winter as well as summerit allows you to recharge your batteriesbreathe and spend a night in calm and high..Then enjoy an Ardennes breakfast.If the weather is righta barbecue is available on the terrace.Guest access.There is a large yard so either you can park your car in the yard or if the weather permitsyou can park it in the lawn right next to the cabin.

Title: Mink Cove Treehouse
Description: A unique adult adventure awaits in this cozy hand crafted tree house! Nestled 12 feet off the ground amongst the chirping birdsred oaks & breathtaking views of Mink Cove in Buzzards Bay. The tree house is accessible by a suspension bridge that leads you to a partially covered porch where you can enjoy a cup of coffee or sit back & take in the sunset with a glass of wine. Step inside to the living space & snuggle up on the couch for an intimate evening.The space"The space.To get up to the sleeping area youll have to climb a VERY NARROW spiral staircase. We demonstrate how narrow the stairs are by photos. Upstairs houses a double bed and a loft area with a twin. The tree house is equipped with a compostable toiletbathroom sink and outdoor shower.The 2.5 acre property is adjacent to miles of walking & hiking trails.The treehouse is not handicapped accessible. Our place of residence is right next door to the treehouse and guests will share our stone driveway.On arrival each guest must sign a release of Liability Agreement."Other things to note.The treehouse is at the end of a dirt road. Parking is right in front of our house on stone gravel driveway beside large barn/workshop.IN CASE OF HURRICANE WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO CANCEL

Title: Magpies Nest Treehouse
Description: Treehouse overlooking the Dal√§lvan river on an organic farm. In a secluded setting. Treehouse is fully equipped with microwave two burner hot plate and conventional oven. Inside toilet and showerhot/cold running water. Electric radiators. Electric blanket. The bed is made up readytowels gowns & slippers. Sauna and hot tub included. Car park next to the treehouse. Outside grill. Meals on request. Nearby busses. Transport on request.Pets by arrangement.The spaceThe space.Private Entrance to the treehouse.A treehouse overlooking the Dal√§lvan river with spectacular views. Set in woodland on an organic farm in Sweden. Private and secluded among forests. Bubble pool included and sauna included.Skatboet Treehouse Magpies Nest is 36 square meters and 6 meters high.All modern conveniences in the treehouse. Hot and cold running water. Electric radiators for heating. Shower and toilet.No internet inside the treehouse. Internet within the farmhouse area.King size bed. Room for extra guests. Fully equipped with oven microwave two burner hot plate. The bed is made up ready with bed linen towels slippers and gowns and an electric blanket. Watch the Northern lights aurora borealis during December to March.From December to March the temperature outside is normally minus -25c degrees Celsius. In the winter there is flat skiing. Ski resorts nearby. Roma alpine and others. Visit the copper mines and Silver mines a short drive away. Bison farm 6 kilometres away.Therapy treatments offered Swedish body massagehappy feet at 500 krona for an hours treatment.Cows horses two cats and chickens on the farm. Moose springbok swans and many other wild life. Walks in the forests and around the farm.Mushroomapple and berry picking in season in the forests around.Enjoy the tranquility in your own space and time. Beautiful sunrises and sunsets.Pets by arrangement.Meals by arrangement.

Title: La Pitalaya hut, perched at 7m, romantic night
Description: High perched in two century-old oaksPitalaya will welcome the most romantic of you..A spiral staircase will lead you to the heart of the cabin connected by a bridge suspended from an interlaced terrace in the heart of the branches of a majestic leaning oak.Perched at a height of almost 7mit can accommodate 2 people and its access is reserved for adults.The spaceThe space.3 cabins perched in the treesin the heart of the Pyreneesin the Barousse Valleya magical place to stay with familyfriends or lovers.All our cabins are equipped with lights (solar and battery)dry toiletswater point and washbasin for the extra toiletwith locally made handmade soaptableschairs and deckchairsas well as additional gas heating. Towelslinensduvetsplaids and blankets are provided and beds are made upon arrival.La Pitalaya cabin (7m high2 people): the romantic with a four-poster bed formed by the branches of the treeaccess by a spiral staircase2 terraces including one coveredconnected by a suspension bridge.Cabane du Brame (5m3/4 pers): the "cocooning" with a bed in 140a bed in 90*200 on the mezzanineaccessible by a rope laddera "junior" bed in 70*160 and a large semi-covered terrace.Peyre Hitte cabin (3m2 to 7 pers) : the "fairytale"perched on 3 treeswith a bed in 140*2002 bunk beds and 1 single bed in 90*200Guest access.Site with an exceptional environment very frequented by deer and other animals of the forest located 20min from the motorway exitin the heart of the Pyrenees400m from the village center and 700m above sea level.Car parking on arrival on siteaccess to the cabins on foot (70 to 120m from the car park)reception building with office and sanitary facilities open 24 hours a day. 2 ha landscaped site that promises privacy and moments of relaxation with a Nordic bath (reservation required) and wooden games (free access).Other things to note.Restoration options:.Breakfast is included in the overnight ratewe carry it in a basket that you lift with a pulley to the cabin for an indoor or outdoor tasting.As an optionyou can book a warm and hearty evening meal basket made with local produce.For groups of 4 to 10 people we offer an atypical form of catering in the Kota Grill : all-inclusive meal from aperitif to dessertaround grills in a small hexagonal chaletwith a grill in the center of the tabletopped with a hostfor a memorable and very friendly meal.

Title: Forest Treehouse

Title: TreeHouse in the Cloud, (Close  toTheme Parks
Description: The treehouse is a private getaway for a couple that want to experience the magic.For a video tour type the following link into your browser:.https://tinyurl.com/a72vevp5.There have been several movie and other photo shoots done on property. Please text request and detailsand we can negotiate fees.Our other AirBnB is just next door; meemaws-country -cottage which sleeps six.Guest access.The Treehouse has a full wrap around walkand a deck. Inside is a bedroomtable and chairsa full bathroomand a kitchenette. You have choice of stairs or a fixed ladder.Other things to note.There are 4 horses on the property that you can enjoy. In the refrigerator you will find carrots for you to feed the horses. (They will be your forever friend :)).There is a fire pit in the common area and we will be glad to set one for you.Although we do not have a built in stove and ovenwe do have a large toaster oven with air cook and an electric frying pan. These items along with the microwave can make almost anything you need.

Title: Rainforest Tree House with Hot Springs
Description: No children under 5 years of age for safety reasons. The Tree House is hand-craftedone of 3 casitas and 3 treehouses at the Bio Thermales natural resort organically integrated into our 35 acre rainforest. Guests enjoy free accessfrom 9 am to 10 pm to the 15 natural hot and cool springs pools of various temperatures and rainforest trails.The spaceThe space.Please message us if we will be your first or last destination in Costa Rica. We highly recommend booking on weekdays for more privacy and tranquilityas we have more day visitors from 9 am to 6 pm to our hot springs on the weekendsespecially Sundays. If your reservation includes a Sundaywe highly recommend planning a day outing to the many wonderful nearby activities.We are three hours north of San Jose (airport)45 minutes east of Fortuna and Volcano Arenaland the many activities there and nearby.Guests enjoy 24/day access* to our hot springs and trails in our 35 acre rainforest at no extra charge. The pools are cleaned every morning starting at 6 ambut one hot spring will always be available. Many factors may dictate schedulingincluding weather. We do not charge for children 17 and under -- but we will not accept reservations for the Tree House for families with children under 5 years old for whom a 20 foot fall from the balcony would be very serious.Our hot springs are ancient ‚Äúdeep Earth‚Äù sources that bubble up through the rainforest floorladen with mineral-rich waters that have been in the Earth for at least 10,000 years. Our waters are rich in bicarbonatescalcium and magnesiumlow in sulfurand slightly acidic -- qualities shared by many of the world\s best hot springs.Five of our 9 organic form hot springs pools are located in the rainforestand 4 hot springs pools as well as a small and a large cool spring swimming pool are located in a meadowsurrounded by rainforest (see below for more information). The small and large cool springs pools both have water slidesand there is a small water slide in one of the shallow and moderate temperature pools for small children.The Tree House is built to strict Costa Rican building codesbut as with all tree housesthere is some movement when the wind blowsand this could be uncomfortable for people very sensitive to motion sickness.You may see our other listings on Airbnb at:Tucano Casita (Toucan Casita) is listed as "Rainforest Casita with Hot Springs": airbnb.com/rooms/30358Mariposa Casita (Butterfly Casita) is listed as "Rainforest Casita2 with Hot Springs" airbnb.com/rooms/51518Colibri Casita (Hummingbird Casita) is listed as "Rainforest Casita3 with Hot Springs".airbnb.com/rooms/1896911Tree House: "Rainforest Tree House with Hot Springs" airbnb.com/rooms/50435You can check availability of each accommodation by clicking on the "Calendar" tab above the main photo on each listing.Tree House features: (see floor-plan for all details):.‚Ä¢ Perched high among the rainforest treesthe Tree House has large screened areas for circulation of naturally cooler breezes. It also has fans.‚Ä¢ All onsite hot springs and recreation activities includedincluding 24 hour access to the hot springs and cool spring swimming pools.‚Ä¢ The Master bedroom with a Queen sized bed with orthopedic mattress and hypoallergenic bedding is in a loft.‚Ä¢ One the main floortwo twin-sized beds that can double as settees with hypoallergenic bedding.‚Ä¢ Hand-crafted rustic furniture from naturally harvested trees on the land.‚Ä¢ Main floor kitchen with refrigeratormicro-wavecoffee makerbasic kitchenware.‚Ä¢ Bathroom with flash on-demand hot-water heater.‚Ä¢ Wrap around balcony for relaxing and animal and bird watching.‚Ä¢ Maid service every 3 days included.‚Ä¢ Laundry service at extra charge per load.‚Ä¢ Short walk to rainforest and hot springs pools.‚Ä¢ No telephone or television.‚Ä¢ WiFi internet for your laptop -- if reliable 24 hour internet is essential to youplease message us for suggestions.‚Ä¢ Hosts Kathy and Bernie live onsite.‚Ä¢ Languages: EnglishSpanishGermanlimited FrenchOne time $10 cleaning fee; thereafter housecleaning services every 3 days are free.Bio Thermales Hot Springs features:.‚Ä¢ Our hot springs pools are all-natural mineral water just as it flows from the Earth.‚Ä¢ Rainforest Pools from 90¬∞ - 105¬∞F (31¬∞ - 40¬∞C).‚Ä¢ Grotto Pools in meadow flow from the 112¬∞F/45¬∞C source pool onward into two larger and progressively cooler pools which are handicap-accessible and suitable for small children.‚Ä¢ Cool Pool in meadow is 90¬∞F/31¬∞C mineral water flowing from the thermal creek.‚Ä¢ 2 Swimming pools with continuous flow of natural cold spring water (88 degrees) - one is 1 to 1.5 meters deepand the larger is 3 meters deep.‚Ä¢ Bathhouse in meadow with handicap accessible bathrooms and showers.‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúRanchos‚Äù ‚Äì roofed tables with concrete floors and grills for picnicsOther Activities on our 35 acre rainforest reserve:.‚Ä¢ Bird-watching: many types of toucansoropendulasparrotshummingbirdsand the rare green macaw.‚Ä¢ Rainforest: enjoy it from the casita porch or hot springs poolstake easy walks on paths or more adventurous hikes.‚Ä¢ Fossils ‚Äì enjoy our collection or hunt (gently) for your own.‚Ä¢ Wildlife: two-toed slothsiguanascapuchin and mantled howler monkeystree frogsbirdsbutterfliesand many others.We are a 45 minute drive from the many activities in Fortuna and Volcano Arenal -- such as ziplineshanging bridgeswhite water raftingslow river floats or kayaking through wildlife sanctuaries -- or a 1.5 hour drive to La Paz Waterfall Gardens and Volcano Poas.Bio Thermales Hot Springs is open to the public for day use of the hot springsand most of our day visitors are Costa Ricansso you may also meet new Tico friends. Bio Thermales is generally not crowdedhoweverexcept on major holidays and Sundays.Food/Meals: The Tree House has a kitchen. There are many restaurants and a good supermarket within a 15 minute drive. Traditional Costa Rican meals can be delivered from a local caterer for very reasonable prices (Costa Rican food is tasty but not spicy). Otherwisefor those without carswe can call a taxi or synchronize a food shopping trip when we go to town for errands.Driving from SJO airport: Please message us before booking if we are your first and/or last destination in Costa Rica.We recommend at least a small 4 wheel drive car. The last 3 kilometers are country roads.Three hours of daylight are needed to safely drive here from the SJO airport before sunset at 5:30 pm. The drive through mountainous cloud forests is splendid in daylightbut prone to fog and rainespecially at nightcreating hazardous visibility conditions after dark. Finding our countryside location will also be far easier if you arrive the first time before sunset. If your plane lands in the morning to noonyou can drive here directly from the airport. Otherwiseit is safer to book a room near the airport on your first nightor ask us to book a private driver ($145) and have a rental car delivered at no extra charge.Last night in Costa Rica:.Driving directly to the SJO airport on the same day is possible if you book a flight in the afternoon. Please be aware that you must be at the airport 2.5 hours before departure. If you have an early morning departing flight it is basically necessary to stay near the airport on the night before.Guest access.Five of our 9 organic form hot springs pools are located in the rainforestand 4 hot springs pools as well as a small and a large cool spring swimming pool(with water slides) are located in a meadowsurrounded by rainforest and one cool fresh spring pool in the rainforest (see below for more information). Tree House guests can enjoy the hot springs pools from 9am to 10 pmand 35 acres of rainforest access at no charge. The pools are cleaned daily from 6 am to 9 am but one pool is always available -- there are many factors involvedincluding weatherthat may dictate when the pools are ready. We have a staff operated laundry facility and guests may give clothes for washing/drying/folding for $5/load.Other things to note.Day visitors and groups are permitted entrance to use the hot springs and cool springs pools from 9 am to 6 pm. There are usually more day visitors on weekendsespecially Sundaysand we recommend booking week days for more tranquility and privacy. If guests book a longer reservation that includes a Sundaywe recommend planning a day tour in the many nearby activities on Sundays. Day visitors must leave by 6 pmand only casita and Tree House guests may use the pools after 6 pm and enjoy unlimited access to the poolswith the exception of no nighttime use of the forest poolsand cleaning schedule as noted above.We recommend either ordering a catered dinner in advance for your first evening and/or next morning breakfastor buying and bringing groceries to cook because we are 4 km from the main paved road and driving after dark is highly discouraged until drivers have quite some experience on Costa Rican roads. Alsomost guests prefer to settle in upon arrival and not to have to get back in the car and drive out to dinner. We provide a Catering Menu to each guest once reservedbut the caterer requires advance notice of selected meals and TIMES guests would like meals delivered. We do not have a liquor license and guests must bring their own beer/wine/rum etc. The tap water is safe to drinkand we sell soft drinksfruit juicesand other non-alcohol beveragessnacks and ice cream.

Description: CHECK IN DATES ARE;.Friday- three night minimum.Monday -two night minimum.Wednesday-two night minimum.You can book 2‚Äì3-4 nights or more!.Designed to be the most romantic getaway tucked deep in the woods of Tennessee. Come experience Sulfur RidgeTennessee‚Äôs first luxury treehouse! Perched 15 feet above the forest floorthe treehouse offers a privateintimate space to relax and be immersed in nature.PlEASE NOTE-.WE ARE AN ADULT ONLY PROPERTY.No pets.No smoking.The spaceThe space.-PLEASE NOTE-.THREE NIGHT MINIMUM ON WEEK ENDS.CHECK IN DATES:Monday ,Wednesday or Friday.Our local Amish built treehouse has an eclectic style encompassing a variety of eras all intertwined together.From entering through the front door dated 1848 to the 100 year old stain glass window repurposed in the bathroom you will discover many interesting stories.The treehouse is built with your comfort in mindfrom a luxury mattress to a cast iron claw foot tub large enough for two!.Dance the night away to your favorite songs on the jukebox.Spend your evening underneath the stars sitting at the fire pit.Soaking in the hot tub designed for only two will be the ending of a perfect day!If you are a group of six or less- We also have on our property our retro inspired ‚ÄúShasta Camp‚Äù three 1962 inspired campers are available as a separate Listing to book all three campers. Think of it like a three bedroom house.Look under - Cummins Falls stays.Sulfur Ridge Shasta Camp

Title: Celesterra: Transformation Amidst Heaven and Earth
Description: Celesterra is a spiritual retreat treehouse for people feeling the need to experience deep rest and contemplationhealing from griefa new direction in lifea more powerful connection with nature and/or yourselfa vision you wish to clarifyetc. To spend time in retreat hereyou MUST include two or three paragraphs about why your heart is calling you here. Alsoplease let us know you have read the description and agree to our guidelines. This is a magical place for your retreat!The spaceThe space.Celesterra is a 230 sq. ft. sacred space that floats between earth and sky about 15 feet off of the ground. Built by the television show Treehouse Mastersit is a beautifulserene space that is cozywarm and inviting. PLEASE NOTE: All food and cooking are strictly vegetarian with no garlic or onions (so the next guests might be able to appreciate the space as well). No meat on the land at allplease.Celesterra features a beautiful living area with wood stove and leather club chairsa dining tablefully stocked kitchenette and a bathroom with a composting toilet. IT HAS NO RUNNING WATERbut glorious spring water is supplied for drinkingwashing dishes and cleaning hands. There is a full bathroom available in the main house exclusively for your use (about a three minute walk - try a walking meditation back and forth each day!). It features a beautiful walk-in shower and flushing toilet and sink with hot and cold water. You can restock up on water thereor walk about 1 minute from the treehouse to where the spring overflows into the creek and fill up there. Celesterra also features a large front deck with fabulous views of the mountains.The bedroom is located in a loft above the kitchen area. It features a queen size memory foam mattress (like a cloud)with all natural bedding. It is accessed by a 9-foot ladder. If you have physical limitationsusing the ladder might prove difficult for youplease let us know. See photos included here or we can send photos.This is a wonderfully quiet space that enhances your meditationsreflections and relaxation. Only serious intentions to do deep personal work will be considered. We ask for 7 days notice before bookingbut apply if you feel a deep need to come within the 7 day limit. Alsowe are happy to discuss financial costs for retreats longer than a week. We will try and work with you in any way to help make this a transformational experience.NO DOGSplease. We have a hunting dogWinston (rescue) who is human friendly but not dog friendly. Alsowhile we love the energy of childrenwe do not allow them to come on retreat.Other things to note.The application is simple: Please write a thorough explanation to the question: What is my innermost heart yearning for during my retreat in Celesterra and why? If we feel your application is sincere and earnest and gives us enough information to come to a sense of right alignmentwe will notify you of your acceptance.

Title:
The best in tiny living!
TreehouseTopia
Description: The Barkhouse is the only fully tree supported structure in the Gatlinburg/Pigeon Forge area. Located just minutes from all the major attractions in the area and only 5 miles from the Greenbriar entrance to the GSMNP. Enjoy the seclusion of 25 acres of trees with amazing views of the river and the mountains plus all the comforts of home.The Barkhouse is engineered with a beautiful live White Pine growing through the center of the treehouse. Enjoy stargazing through the skylight.The spaceThe space.The Barkhouse has a kitchen area with a microwaverefrigerator/freezer combotoaster ovensingle electric burnerand coffee maker. Enjoy charcoal grilling outdoors on your private deck or using the fire pit shared with the other treehouse located on the property. Spend time inside resting on yoga mats in the suspended cargo net area.Guest access.A door code will be given prior to arrival to enter the premise. Once inside the treehouse the entire (black circle) locking mechanism will need to be turned clockwise or counterclockwise to unlock or lock the door.Other things to note.No pets!

Title: Tree house safari
Description: Perfect for a wedding nightan engagement requesta big reunion or a moment you will never forget in your life. Come live the experience of being a bird in the trees and let the wind rock you in the leaves in the heart of nature.CITQ number : 304228The spaceThe space.Magic Tingwick is a 15 acre maple forest bordered by a streama nearby forest and two market gardening fields. Title: Suburban Treehouse Getaway - Newly Renovated!
Description: Owl in the Oak Treehouse was renovated in January to give our guests a completely modern experience while maintaining the uniqueness and charm of a real treehouse overlooking a small stream in a quiet valley.The spaceThe space.The treehouse is secluded more than 300 feet from the closest house. In the winterseveral neighborhood homes are visible from the treehousebut summer foliage cloaks the treehouse in almost total privacy.The main floor of the treehouse is 120 square feet and has a sitting areabathroomand kitchenette. There is also a small writing desk that folds out of the way when not in use.The 50-square-foot sleeping loft is accessed via ladder and gives guests some of the best views of the forest and stream.The kitchenette features a sinkminifridgemicrowaveand Keurig coffee maker.The small bathroom has a composting toilet and a shower. Towelsbody washshampooand conditioner are included.Outside the treehouse is a sitting area with stunning views out over the forest and down to a small stream 30 feet below!Guest access.Guests have access to the entire treehouse and platform. There is also a short side path with a bench overlooking the stream.Other things to note.Guest parking is on the streetand the two-minute walk to the treehouse takes you down a stone path through the woodsup and down several flights of uneven stepsand across a small footbridge.Access to the treehouse itself is up a spiral staircaseand it‚Äôs necessary to climb a ladder to get to the sleeping loft.Children under the age of 10 are not allowed to access the sleeping loft for safety reasons.The water heater tank only holds 7 gallons of waterso showers need to be kept short. The toilet in the treehouse is a composting toilet.This property is a real treehouseactually suspended in trees. If it happens to be windy during your stayyou will feel the sway and hear some creaking sounds.

Title: THE BELLA LUNA Romantic Mountain Treehouse
Description: Come Sleep in the Trees - Luxury Romantic Treehouse above WalhallaSC is just minutes from Stumphouse TunnelStumphouse Mountain Bike ParkIssaqueena Falls & white water rafting. Oconee County has many beautiful waterfalls & hiking trails. We are close to ClemsonLake KeoweeLake Hartwell & Lake Jocassee and located just inside Sumter National Forest.An AMAZING ROMANTIC GETAWAY for HONEYMOONSANNIVERSARIES & BIRTHDAYS!See our sister treehouse The Stella Vista.The space"The space.PLEASE READ ENTIRE DESCRIPTION.BEFORE YOU BOOK.This is a romantic retreat for COUPLES ONLY.We are not PET friendly due to guests that may have pet allergies and due to the high decks we are not KID friendly.Our romantic little house in the trees is designed with our guests‚Äô comfort in mind. It sleeps 2 people. There is a beautiful king-size custom built bed with a Rainbow Poplar live edge headboard. We chose to dress our Tuft & Needle mattress with soft comfy cotton linens and soft blankets. The white flowing drapery surrounding the sleeping area makes this a dreamy and romantic space. Hanging over the bed is a stunning vintage crystal chandelier. If you happen to catch the sun streaming in the upper windows just right in the morning or late afternoonyou may see a beautiful show of rainbow prisms cast by the crystals dancing all over the room. The french door from the sleeping area leads out to a west facing deck where you can enjoy your morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evenings in the treetops on a pretty little bistro set.Inside the cozy sitting area has a small dining table for 2 and small loveseat for relaxing and kicking your feet up.The KITCHENETTE has a mini fridgemicrowave and a toaster. The wake up station is stocked with a french presscoffee makerburr coffee grinder and an electric water kettle. We have whole bean coffeeground coffeeflavored teas along with cream and sugar and sugar substitutes. We have platesbowlscoffee cupsglassescool bronze flatware and glass stemware and of course wine & bottle openers. If you prefer to paper plates and plastic utensils we have those too. We leave snacksa few goodiesjuice and water. These are for you and there is no extra charge so please enjoy.For OUTDOOR COOKING there is a Weber electric grill and an electric griddle for cooking on the lower deck. We have grilling utensilsspicesfoiland cooking oil. All cooking must be done outside as there is very limited counter space indoors. After all this is a treehouse so enjoy the ‚ÄúGlamping‚Äù experience! There are two great outdoor dining spaces with bistro tables and chairs. One is on the upper deck off the bedroom and the other is a dedicated covered dining area downstairs that overlooks the fire pit.The bathroom has a huge WALK-IN SHOWER with natural fossil stone tile and a river rock floor. Over the shower are copper fairy wire lights for a fun showering experience. Wrap yourself in the large fluffy bath sheets after showering. There is a petrified teak vessel sink and standard traditional potty just like you have at home. Soapshampoohairdryer and all towels and linens are providedjust bring your toothbrush.If you want a more adventurous showering experiencegrab a robe and head downstairs to our new OUTDOOR SUMMER SHOWER. You will love the cool copper rain head and lighting for showering at night.Off the back deck you can stroll across the laurel branch bridge to a private NAPPING DECK complete with a raised Double-Stack Net custom-made for just two people. Grab a pillow and blanket and snuggle up!On the downstairs deck you can relax in the 2 cedar rocking chairs or hang out on the porch swing.The FIRE PIT is just off the lower deck and we provide firewood and a little basket of goodies to make Smores.You will find utensils and cooking supplies in the utility room off the lower deck.There is NO TV or WiFi but we have a basket of gamesplaying cardsand a vintage style record player and few old records for you to enjoy. On the lower deck there is an addicting hook & ring on a string game.Quiet hours are 10pm to 8am.I only allow 2 guests. There is not a sleeper sofa or any room for a cot or air mattress. The treehouse is a cozy 300 square feet.I have poured my heart into building this treehouse. I want my guests to enjoy all the wonderful and carefully thought out things I have placed here for them.Please respect my propertyfollow the house rules and PLEASE LEAVE EVERYTHING LIKE YOU FOUND IT.I provide a nice clean place for you when you arrive. Fresh clean linenscozy blanketstowelsdish towelsand dishes. All hard surfacesdoor knobs etc. are wiped down with sanitizing wipes between every guest. Please clean up after yourself and leave everything in good order before checking out.I only book out 6 months in advanceso if you look on the calendar and the dates you want are more than 6 months away that doesnt mean they are not availableit just means the dates havent been released yet. Please check back and grab your dates once they become available to book."Guest access.You will have access to the area around the treehouse.Other things to note.My dream when designing and building this little getaway was to provide a comfortable and relaxing space where you can unwind and enjoy some downtime. I carefully thought out all the things I wanted my guests to enjoy. All the fun little details and interesting things mean a lot to me and I want you to enjoy them as well.I know accidents happen and that is okay as long as you let me know about it. If you do happen to break something PLEASE just let me know. Just leave me a note or message me. I need to be able to replace things before I host my next guests.*Failure to report broken/damaged items will result in replacement fees.*We do not have WiFi.Cell service is best with Verizon.

Title: Caba√±a Treehouse Mountain View
Description: The dream when we were childrena treehousesurrounded by trees where the main habitat is birdsyou will get unparalleled peace and tranquilityawakening with the view to the mountain and birdsongis a unique experiencefar from the noise of the city in the middle of the mountain.In the background you will hear the sound of a river of crystal clear water just 70 metres from the cabinideal for relaxing and sharingbeing an extremely quiet and safe place.The spaceThe space.Quanta with kitchen equipped for cookingand all kinds of utensilsadditional sugarcoffeesaltoil.The bed with all its equipmentthe bathroom has a hot tubgel towels.Guest access.We have the Horseback Tour Serviceon the slopes of the Braulio Carrillo National Parkvisiting the riverthe waterfall and a spectacular view of the central valley.We also have guided hikes to Cerros Tib√°sCariciasTur√∫. where you can enjoy mountaineering and its great landscapes."Other things to note.700 metres from the property is part of the Braulio Carrillo National Parka 30-minute driveyou can reach the Braulio Carrillo National Park and the cable caras well as the Barva Volcano within an hours drive.A horseback riding tour is offered on the slopes of Braulio Carrillo.we are 15 minutes from Toucan Rescue Ranch."

Title: Cozy West Virginia Treehouse
Description: Thanks for checking out our treehouse! It‚Äôs 4 minutes from downtown Shepherdstown and 15 minutes from downtown Harpers Ferry. We are excited to share it with other fun-loving folks! The treehouse has heat and ACa tiny kitchen with a mini fridgestove toptoaster ovengravity-fed sink and kitchenware. There‚Äôs a bathhouse built on the back of the host‚Äôs home with a conventional toilet and shower. There‚Äôs also an outhouse with a light and essentials. We provide wood for the fire pit also.The spaceThe space.The treehouse sits between oak and hickory trees 20 feet above a rock outcropping that overlooks our little holler. There is a 12x5 front porch with a good sunset view and lighting for nighttime enjoyment. Inside there is a nook with large windows to relax bya mini kitchen with a gravity fed sinkmini fridgedual cook top and toaster oven along with four stools. We provide kitchenwarepillowsbeddingtowels and firewood for the outdoor fire-pit. The loft is more suited for kids but is fine for able-bodied adults as well. We do not provide bedding for the full mattress in the loftonly pillows. The bathhouse is on the back side of the host‚Äôs house and is about a 30 second walk from the treehouse. The outhouse is 50 feet from the treehouse and has a light and other essentials.When you arriveuse the gravel driveway just beyond our home‚Äôs paved driveway that has two silver gates. You will see a sign that reads ‚ÄúWillbillys‚Äù and a school bus that you can park beside. The path to the treehouse begins along the left side of our large red workshop.I live on a country road and my neighbors are like familyso make yourselves at home and feel free to check out our property. We have one other Airbnb‚ÄúCozy School Bus‚Äùon the other side of our property.

Title: Treehouse at Bliss Ridge Farm - Best View in VT
Description: "Dr. Seuss-inspiredluxury treehouse perched at the top of an 88-acreorganic hill farmfurther surrounded by 1000s of acres of wilderness. Designed by Bfer RothDIY network TV show host of The Treehouse Guysthis is an authentic treehouse built within and around living trees. Enjoy private hiking from your door& panoramic views of VTs Worcester range (Camel‚Äôs HumpMt. Mansfieldetc). You are truly secludedyet only a 15-min drive from the heart of the Mad River Valley & Waterbury."The spaceThe space.The treehouse is nestled in the edge of the woods at the top of the farm‚Äôs hay fields. Enjoy seclusion and incredible viewshikingand quietude. There is a spring-fed pond available for swimming nearer to the farmhouse and farm events and dinners can be arranged.The indoor space:.the queen bedfold-out sofakitchenlivingbathroomand patio with hammockare all part of the main floor. There are two (10ft) lofts above; one with a double bed and one with a twin. The "bedrooms" are not closed off from one-another - see photos. The house is built within the treeswhich move and creak subtly if it is windy. The toilet is the best composting toilet available ‚Äî it looks like a regular toilet and the waste closes behind a doorbut note that it does not have a water flush. The shower is a hot (outdoor) shower on the front porchwith a curtain.*Important Information Regarding The Treehouse at Bliss Ridge Farm*.We would like for you to understand a few important facts before you arrive..Being a tree house guest has its benefits and its limitations.Building and caring for a treehouse in nature was a labor of love and not an easy endeavor. We hope that you will appreciate how special it isenjoy the majesty of mother nature and at the same time will understand its limitations and respect our operating instructions. There is an explicit information sheet when you get here but we want you to be prepared ahead of time.There is no electricity and no plumbing. Howeverthere is a solar panel to provide you with lights and cell phone charging. Please note that cell phone service is limited to texting and sometimes a phone call.There is a composting toilet which is very modern and clean but you need to follow the directions that are clearly posted.There is hot and cold water for a kitchen sinkand an outside shower.Because the treehouse is in the woodsnature will take over when it cani.e. mice may come in in the fall to try and nest in warm places in Vermont. We hope that you do not leave food around to entice them. We monitor mouse traps so you will not have to deal with that.Sometimes some rainwater may come down the large inside tree if it is windy and raining hard. We provide towels to put on the floor around the tree if this happens. (It stays in a small area around the tree).If you have small childrenwe trust that you will take responsibility for them. Please monitor them on the loft stairshelp them to use the toilet properlyand don‚Äôt let them take food away from the dining tables that are inside and on the deck.Being mindful of being in nature will help prevent miceantsand bugs and it will help us to keep the treehouse clean and smelling fresh.We have an organic farm and respect nature and do not want to be wasteful. We hope that you will divide your garbage into recyclingtrashand compost (receptacles are clearly marked on the bridge) and please do not bring plastic water bottles onto the property. We will provide you with two x 2 gallon containers of fresh spring water and refill whenever you would like.No smoking in the treehouse or on the decks please.We wish you a wonderfuladventurous experience. If you have any questions,.please do not hesitate to ask.Other things to note.***we supply freshtested spring water! Please do not bring plastic water bottles! (Please do not buy or use plastic water bottles at all - they are ruining the earth!)**We open the calendar for the following season at the end of the current season (late October). Our season runs between late April and late October.

Title: Magical Treehouse: Secluded Mountain View Off-Grid
Description: You will have a truly unique experience sleeping 30 feet above the forest floor. Rock-a-byebaby!You get to go totally off-grid in this treehouse perched between two beautiful maple trees in a wooded forest in the countrysidewith amazing views over a fields all the way to the stunning Endless Mountains.This is your opportunity to reconnect. This is your chance to be in touch with the environment.We are proud to be rated as Gold Key SuperHosts by Airbnb since 2014.The spaceThe space.Your stay in the treehouse is off‚Äìgridthoroughly insulated and heated by a wood-burning stovealso we do supply you with a Jackery 1000 lithium battery generator to power the showeror to charge your phone or laptop. We also use a composting toilet for the cleanest and most environmentally sensitive relationship to the surroundings.You will learn firsthand what off‚Äìgrid glamping is like‚Ä¶and that includes a hot-water shower.We will supply you with bed linenstowelsbath soapshampooplatescupsutensilsat least 2 1/2 gallons of fresh drinking waterpots and pansgrill utensilssalt and pepperpaper towelsa sink and dish soapdish towelstoilet tissuehand sanitizera camping percolating coffee potcoffee cupsa flashlightand some firewood (for the mini wood stove‚Äîsee amenity limitations).Mobile phone service is definitely adequate for working from a tree. :-)Guest access.Guests have access to the entire treehouse area and surrounding 2 acres of woods. The field (downhill from the treehouse) is not our property. It is the field for our neighbor‚Äôs cows. Please respect his property by not trespassing.This area of Mehoopany is referred to as Mehoopany Mountain. Atop the mountain sit wind turbines which power the local area with green energy.The closest public transportation available is either in Scranton or Wilkes-Barre. Our guests drive their cars or rent one to get to the country.Check in time is from 4 to 7 PM.

Title: Whispering Pines Treehouse
Description: Whispering PinesOne of a kindbeautiful2 storey tree house built on 8 pine treesoverlooking a ravine with an amazing view. Located only minutes from St. Catharines and Jordan Station in the heart of wine country. The tree house can sleep 2 adults and 1 child ( age 3 and up).The spaceThe space.Your private space is located over 1000 feet (300 m) back from the road with easy access to free parking . Sitting 10 feet (3 m) off the groundthe treehouse is a perfect place to relax and unwind and spend time with nature.The treehouse comes with 1 queen size bed on the upper level and the possibility of a fold out mattress for a child. The main floor has an eating area and basic kitchenette equipped with a bar fridgeKeurig coffee makertoaster and microwave. No stove supplied. A bathroom with a shower is located on the main level. Enjoy your morning coffee on a large balcony overlooking the wooded ravine. Along the creek below you may hear or see ravine wildlife. The fully insulated premise has both heating and air conditioning for your comfort. Early luggage drop off available.Children aged 3 and over are welcome.Major grocery stores and restaurants are located 5 mins drive from treehouse.Bring your bikes and enjoy the scenery of the beautiful Jordan area.Guest access.Guest Access: self check-in with keypad,.guest can access the entire spaceOther things to note.Of Note.UNIT IS THOROUGHLY CLEANED AND DISINFECTED AFTER EACH GUEST LEAVES.*must navigate stairs to enter treehouse and bedroom (10 ft).*no smoking or vaping on property.*no pets allowed.*no fires of any type because of treehouse location including candles and incense.*potential of noise - Treehouse is located on a farm propertyadjacent to orchards and vineyards and there may be noises related to agricultural operations.

Title: Mountaintop Luxury Treehouse at Selah Ridge
Description: "Located in RinggoldGeorgiathe treehouse sits in 16 acres of private property. It is minutes from Georgias best wineries and some of the most desirable hikingwhitewaterand scenic activities in Chattanooga and the Tennessee Valley. Escape to our mountaintop retreat for solitude and tranquility.All MilitaryPoliceand Firefighters will receive a 15% discount on all week day stays. Thank you for your sacrifice and service!"The spaceThe space.For a full tour of the treehouseplease visit our Instagram (@SelahRidgeTreesort) and click on the "Tour" bubble below the profile.Though plenty of activities are nearby for adventurethe treehouse provides sanctuary for the weary soul. An arched bridge connects the treehouse to the hot tubcustom-built in Alaska by Zen Bathworks. Made from aromatic cedaryou\ll sooth away your worries as you breathe in the sweet mountain air.Take in the views and sounds of the rustling trees while experiencing our spacious outdoor shower. Top off the night with a nice glass of wineor roast smores on the balcony fire pit. At our treehouse you will not only enjoy the breathtaking views and the melodies of naturebut also unwind to the sound of the waterfall underneath. Bundle up in the warmth of the cozy indoors or bring in nature by sliding open the giant picture window. Our sweet escape makes kicking back in nature easy.The treehouse is the perfect place for a romantic getaway for two. Howeverit can accommodate up to four guests comfortably with a full size trundle bed that pulls out from below the king bed if needed.Our Treehouse is not currently equipped with wifi. It is our hope that this provides a much needed escape from the world and that you will enjoy being off the grid. Howeverif you find that plugging in is a necessity during your staythere is great cell service. Any hotspots you provide should work well.

Title: Modern Tree Dwelling w/Water Views+Cedar Hot Tub
Description: Stay in our custom designed tree dwelling w/ wood-fired cedar hot tub up among the trees! This unique structure is perched atop a 21-acre wooded hill sloping to water views. Enjoy stunning views from the King size bed through a wall of windows. Located in a classic coastal Maine village w/ Reid State Park\s miles of beaches + famed Five Islands Lobster Co. (See 2 other tree dwellings on our 21 acre property listed on AirBnb as "Tree Dwelling w/Water Views." See our reviews!).The spaceThe space.Part modern tree housepart tiny housethis abode is called "Souhegan" (which means "Watching Place") because of the gorgeous views of the river and neighboring conservation land. The dwelling consists of two elevated structures connected by a rope bridge (structures are elevated on posts and trees); a second rope bridge leads to a wood-fired cedar hot tub elevated up among the trees. We\ve used vintage and salvaged materials when possible. STRUCTURE #1: a two-story structure: master bedroom on the second floor (accessed via a SPIRAL STAIRCASE)with a wall of south facing windows affording stunning river views; includes KING SIZE BED (or two twin beds upon request); on the first floor is a small kitchen and dining area (with large windows for water views)a small full bathroomand a screened-in porch with rockers and river views. Kitchen includes: two-burner stovesinksmall fridgepotspansdishestoaster oven (no regular oven) andimportantlycork screw! STRUCTURE #2: is a convertible space with a wall of water-facing windows. UPON REQUEST (for an extra fee of $20 per person/per nightthis fee includes labor of converting the living room space into a bedroom + extra linens and towels for the extra guests)we can set it up as a second bedroom (with either King size bed or two twinsdo let us know at least one day in advance) or we can set it up as a living room space with sofas and coffee table. There is a water-facing veranda off the front of Structure #2.PLEASE NOTE: as much as we love pets we have a strict no-pet policy in our dwellings!There are 2 other tree dwellings on our 21 acre property listed on AirBnb as "Tree Dwelling w/Water Views." See our reviews!AUTUMN VISITS: Come stay in the tree dwelling in Autumn for stunning views of foliage and crisp walks along the marsh back to the tree dwelling to warm up in the cedar hot tub. The dwelling is well insulated and warms up quickly with our top quality wall mounted heating units.WINTER VISITS: The tree dwelling is open all year round. They stay super cozy on cold nightsand there is no better time of year to sit in the hot tubsnow flakes swirling around you. Warm up after a day of cross country skiing or snowshoeing.THE VIEWS: Both structures have views across down the large tidal Back River. In the distance you can see where the Back River meets up with Kennebec River just before both flow into open ocean and past Seguin Island (where a light house was commissioned by George Washington). Across the Back River from the land lie hundreds of acres of pristine conservation land. Part of the yearthis tree dwelling will be used for the Seguin Artist in Residence Program at the Seguinland Institutewhich is under development. Use of KAYAK\s and CANOE\s are included with rental and available at anytime during your stayGuest access.The space and the 21 acre property are yours. There are two other one-bedroom tree dwellings on the propertyeach well spaced out to give plenty of privacy. In additionguests have access to adjoining 40 acre peninsula with dockstrails and cottages. The two other tree dwellings are also listed on AirBnb as "Tree Dwelling w/Water Views." Take note of our reviews.

This privatetiny home and balcony is all yours with no shared spaces.Enjoy the ground level covered patio complete with furniture and a gas grill perfect for cookouts after long hikes at Ricketts Glen. Perfect base for your outdoor adventure to Ricketts Glen State Parkonly 2.5 miles."The spaceThe space.The treehouse has a sleeping loft with two twin mattresses that easily slide together into a king bed (king sheets provided).Alsothe sofa on the main floor converts to a full sized bed. Comfortably sleeps a total of 4 guests.Guest access.The treehouse is accessed by many stairs and may not be suitable for small children or those with disabilities.Other things to note.Yoy will have your own private patio area and firepit. Extendable forks for the firepit can be found in a black bag hanging on the grill. Breakfast is served at the main house and you are welcome to join.

Title: Eagles Nest Treehouse ~ Hike/ Relax / Climb!
Description: Take in the rusticfairy tale vibe of this custom-made treehouse in the midst of towering trees! Recline in a rocking chair and watch the sunset over the mountainsor try your hand at some stargazing on the "NEST" deck overlooking the forest while listening to the nightly sounds of the forest. In the morningstep out on the trailhead and explore the stunning forest. BOOK SOON!If your travel dates are not available on this calendarvisit one of our sister properties by visiting our profile!The spaceThe space.Relax at night while you listen to gentle owls and enjoy the twinkling stars above while you warm up near a home-made stone fireplace area with bulb strung lights encircling the area. In the morningwalk to the national trailhead location while the sun breaks through the trees as you hear the gentle stream of a nearby creek!We are a RARE find in the area located on PRIVATE landand one of the only rentals in the Red River Gorge that is located so conveniently INSIDE the National Park just walking distance to great nearby hiking trails! If your dates are unavailablebe sure to check out our other listings as well such as "The EY Breeze" and "Lions Lair" each providing its own unique accommodations.This treehouse is one of our original builds and receives high reviews due to its unique build and amenities such as a swing underneatha separate bedroom called "the nest" which is 16ft off the groundand a handmade stone fireplace with ambient lighting.We guarantee you this combination of outdoors & amenities provides a truly uniqueadventurousmagicaland relaxing getaway experience with your friends or and loved ones! We look forward to having you stay with usand be sure to book soon before it fills up fast!!We look forward to having you stay with usand be sure to book soon before it fills up fast!!

Title: Little Goldies
Description: Free Whitewater Rafting Tour + CozyCharming Cabin + Glorious ViewThe space"The space.Free Activities Included Every Day! To enhance your vacation experiencefree admissions are included every day of your stay to some of the most popular attractions the area has to offer such as the BiltmoreSmoky Mountain Railroadwhite water raftingjeep excursionsand more! Daily value of $250.Cabin is pet friendly ‚Äì Pet Fees Apply.When you just need to sit back and enjoy the great outdoors on a modest budgetLittle Goldies is the place. This unassuming cabin is perched perfectly on the side of a rocky hill with an expansive view of the Great Smoky Mountains. But dont let the simplicity fool youat Little Goldies cabin you have a steaming hot tub on the ample deckand a comfortable queen bed inside. The basic kitchenette with washer and dryerdishwasherand small cooktopadded to the propane grillare all youll need to survive comfortably in the woodsso to speak. The housekeeping standards and luxury linens are includedand up to the standards of Watershed. What is even betteris that while you may seem hidden away in naturemiles from civilizationyou can be wifi connectedhave satellite TVand are just 15 minutes to Bryson City.All bookings are subject to local restrictions in place at the time of the stay. We may not be allowed to accommodate all bookings that are made if local rules change after you make a booking. We make every effort to communicate currentlocal rules and any changes to them."

Title: Water Forest Retreat- Tree House
Description: Water Forest Retreat Tree House is a 168 sq ft. private heated and electrified tiny home with stained glass windows surrounding an oak tree nestled in 100 acres of forest. Enjoy your favorite drink out on the deck up in the trees while watching the birds. There are 2 1/2 miles of hiking trails with a brookwaterfallmarsh and pond. Come here to hikefish or just relax in this beautiful forest. We also have an OCTAGON and HIKER‚ÄôS HAVEN house. Please click on our profile picture to read more.The space"The space.Regarding the Corona viruswe follow all CDC cleaning protocols. We also supply sanitizer wipesLysol and hand sanitizer.Water Forest RetreatTree House is a great place to rejuvenate and enjoy all that Nature has to offer. Here you can hikemeditaterelaxreadwritemushroom huntfishcreate artmusicphotographybird watchcross country skisnowshoeand star gaze as there is little light pollutionalong with many other activities in a private woodland setting.The spacewhich is 168 ft.¬≤ or 15.6 m¬≤ has electricitybut not running water. Hand sanitizer is provided along with a wash basin or you can use the sink at the main house to wash your hands. Soapwash clothsand towels are stored in a container under the bed. On top of the cabinet there is complimentary hand made glycerin soap. Bottled water is provided or you can fill up a container at the shower as the well water is very good. The composting toilet is conveniently located in the tree house and is vented so there is no odor. Toilet paper is provided. There are directions on the bathroom wall on how to use it. PLEASE READ CAREFULLY so that it will function properly. NEVER urinate with the chute open.The tree house has a locking door and six large windows with screens and shades for privacy. The key is located on top of the cabinet. There are two stained glass transoms above the front windows and two more in the apexes. The space has a queen size bed with a comfy hybrid coil memory foam mattress. There are 400 thread count sheets with plenty of pillows and quilts along with a faux fur throw. Two bed side tables with Tiffany style lamps complement each side along with two tall white birch logs decorated with branchescrystals and fairy lights. Behind the bed side tables are USB ports with cords so you can charge your iPhone. Above the bed hangs a stained glass panel and a ceiling fan for your comfort on warm nights. There is also an electric fireplace for cold nights or you can just enjoy watching the flames without heat. On very cold nights we also supply a propane heaterthough the electric fireplace is usually sufficient.Although there is no traditional kitchenthere is space inside on top of the cabinettable and outdoor tables to prepare your meals. There is no fridge or microwave. We do have a large lobster pot and a tripod pizza grill available upon request.There is a cabinet which stores some camping essentials such as a propane camp stovedinnerwarecutlerycutting boardsugar and sugar substitutesspicesoiltin foilcreamerspotspanslightersscissorswine bottle and can openerextra light bulbsmugsdish drying clothumbrellasfirst aid kitpaper towelsLysol cleanerflashlightspropaneinsect repellent and a battery powered lantern. A Kuerig coffee machine is provided with assorted coffeeschai latteteahot chocolateand hot apple cider. There is also a turquoise inlaid wooden table with two chairs where you can dinewriteor use your computer and a small wall rack for hanging clothes. On top of the rack are two wine glassesbinoculars and a mirror. Under the bed there are an assortment of games. Two pottery mugs are provided which Nancy made. The mugs are for sale at 34.00 each. Atop the cabinet is a bowl of snacks and a book binder with more informationmapsmenusand directions on how to use the coffee machinepropane stovepropane heater and electric fire place.There are 2 1/2 miles of well maintained wood lined hiking trails with some that follow Goldmine brook to a waterfall that once hosted a grist mill back in the 1700s. You can still see the large stone foundations. Along the trails you will see many of the iconic stone walls that are unique to New England. Maps are provided in the book binder and trail markers are posted along the way. There are many benches and chairs along the trail where you can sitrelax and enjoy the scenery. While hiking the trails walking poles or sticks are suggested as the terrain is hilly with some stone steps and steep areas. Two walking sticks hang on the wall in the tree house. Because of the terrain hiking boots are strongly recommended. Due to the nature of the trails no ATVdirt or mountain biking is allowed. These are hiking trails only. We ask that you please respect the private sign as this trail leads to the Octagon where guests may be staying. There is a good distance between the buildings so you will not be able to see each other even in winter. We wanted to make each site secluded and private. While hikingplease stay on our side of the brook as the opposite side is owned by our neighbor.It is a five minute walk to the spring fed pond which is part of Goldmine brook. The brook is rated class A and supports a myriad of wildlife including river ottersmink and great blue herons. If you like to fish bring your gear to try for pickerellarge and small mouth basswhite and yellow perchshiners and native trout. Previous guests have had great luck fly fishing here.If you are looking for a place to swimcanoe or kayak visit Gardner Lake state park in Salem which is only 15 minutes away. ( you will have to supply your own canoe or kayaks) Depending on water flowyou can also take a dip right here in the small pool below the Goldmine brook waterfall which is a 20-25 minute walk down the trail or you can go for a swim in gold mine brook pond which is only a five minute walk away. We supply water floats that you can borrow. Looking for some ocean fun? Bluff Point state park in Groton is another good choice. Here they have a beach along with hiking and biking trails. Bluff Point is about 24 minutes away. Both places are free of charge. Please check out our guide book on Airbnb by clicking our profile picture for more things to do in the area.The outdoor living area is conveniently layered with crushed stone. Enjoy a fire in the fire pit and meals either outdoors or in. On the deck there are two chairs and a mosaic glass table for outdoor dining along with a propane grill and a Mayan style hammock that seats two people. At ground level there is a fire pit with additional tables and chairszero gravity lounge chairs along with tiki torches for extra light and ambiance. Seasoned wood is available for 6 dollars per five gallon bucket and includes fire starter. Pleaseno wood deliveries after dusk. You can bring your own wood or use any of the wood on the forest floor as long as it is not being used to mark the trails.There is a Walmart and Big Y one mile away where you can buy fooddrinksice and other supplies. Looking for a liquor store? Bozrah Wine and Spirits is one mile one the right heading west on route 82. Since there is no refrigerator you will need to bring your own cooler or you can borrow ours. If you do not wish to cook there are many good restaurants close by. We provide a few menus in the book binder for you to look through. Some restaurants even make deliveries or you can use a delivery app. such as door dash.comEnjoy a hot private outdoor shower down at the main house. The distance to the shower is about a one minute walk. The shower is private while you are using it but is shared with other guests. Plush towelswashcloths and soap are stored under the bed in a container. Shampoo and conditioner are at the shower. There is a sink here where you can wash your dishes. Under the bed there is a black plastic container to use for dirty dishes. Dish soap and scrubber are provided at the sink. There is a dish drying cloth in the cabinet back at the tree house. Due to freezing temperaturesthe shower and sink are not available in winter. A wash basin is provided for sponge bathing. The basin is stored under the bed. Simply use the coffee machine or camp stove to make hot water. Guests staying two nights or more during this season are more than welcome to use the inside shower up at the main house. In winter we will take care of washing the dishes.Because of the distanceWifi is not available in the tree housebut is available in the parking area and pottery studio which is a walking distance of about 300 feet. If your device is supported by an Internet provider you will be able to get online.For the nature enthusiasttake part in a guided nature walk where Nancy will discuss the historyplantsanimalsgeology and mushrooms found in the area. The walk costs 15 dollars per person and lasts about an hour and a half to two hours. We usually cover 2 miles and may go off trail. After the hike we will go to the house and sample some Autumn berry syrupShagbark hickory syrupsassafras syrupspice bush pepper and acorn or mushroom cookies when available. We also have shagbark hickory syrup for sale. You might want to bring something to drinka snackand your camera.BEFORE YOU BOOKplease keep in mind that this is a fancy form of camping (glamping!) that is semi off grid ( no running water in the Treehouse) with all that camping entails including insectsanimalssudden weather changesrocky paths and hilly terrain. It is a one minute walk from the parking lot to the tree house and shower. You may get to hear our resident barred owlsred foxeastern coyotes or possibly come across a white tailed deer or mink while hiking the trails.The distance from the parking area to the tree house is about 300 feet with 170 feet of that being in the forest. Since the tree house is small please pack appropriately. We will be more be more than happy to help you with your luggage.Be mindful of check in and check out times. If you tell us you plan to arrive at three and do not show up until 9 o‚Äôclockrealize that we have been waiting many hours for you when we could‚Äôve been doing something else. We have also been running electricity and heat which is wasteful. If you are going to be lateplease have the courtesy to let us know. Unfortunately our tiny homes are not conducive for lockbox entry and we need to show you around. We also need time to clean after check out for the next guest and are on a tight schedule.Please read House rules.Smoking is not allowed inside the tree housebut is allowed outside of it.For people staying two nights or more I will leave you a check in text to see how you‚Äôre doing.We also have a pottery shop-studio that you are more than welcome to visit. There are many items for sale including hand woven scarvesearrings and Shagbark Hickory syrup that I make.Check out is easy! Please leave the key on top of the cabinet and you‚Äôre all set to go! If you would like to stay longer and hike the trails after check out you are more than welcome!Bert and I will do everything we can to make your stay relaxing and enjoyable. Please feel free to contact us at anytime during your stay if you need anything. We look forward to hosting you!"Guest access.Hiking trailsyardshower and parking area. Please respect the private signs as these trails lead to the octagon or Hiker‚Äôs Haven where guests may be staying. You will not be able to see the octagon or Hiker‚Äôs Haven from the tree house nor they you. We wanted to make all places private and secluded. While hiking please stay on our side of the brook as the opposite side belongs to our neighbor. Thanks for your cooperation!Other things to note.Please bring your own personal toiletriesfooddrinks and ice for your cooler. If you do not have a cooleryou can borrow ours. We also have extra ice packs if you need them. Also bring suitable footwear for hikingoutdoor shower or if you want to walk in the brook as the stones can be slippery. We do not do wood deliveries after duskbut if you would like more wood we will get some ready for you and leave it by the basement door outside.

Title: Treehouse for dreaming
Description: Our "Cuckoo\s nest" tree house is close to many destinations. It is hidden above a small village at the edge of the forest and is good for couples and families with children.The spaceThe space.The tree house stands on the edge of an oak forest overlooking the small village of Bottenbach. Through your own access from the roadyou are also independent of the associated farm. At night you can switch on a lighting of the path from the parking lototherwise there is no lighting in the village between approx. 24:00 and 4:00. City-dwellers are always very enthusiastic about the sight of the clear starry sky.In summerthe terrace offers shelter from excessive heat from the canopy and can sit outside for a long time in the evening and enjoy the view. In winterthe sun comes through the bare branches and insidethe marble plate heater creates a cozy atmosphere.For child restraintthere is a fold-down grid on the ladder in the upper sleeping area (see picture) and doors with latches on the two entrances on the outside on the terrace.Guest access.Our guests are welcome to come to the farm to watch the daily workpet the animals and also to stoke and grill a campfire. Unfortunatelythis is not possible near the tree house because of the fire hazard.Other things to note.In the neighbouring village of Rennhofen there is a beautiful beer garden "Baumhaus". :) Just google :).We have 2-3 bikes to rent at the farm.

Title: Treehouse with Jacuzzi bathtub + infrared cabin
Description: Enjoy your holiday amidst vineyards in a unique apartment at 4 meters altitude. From the new living area you can access a terrace where you can spend cozy hoursas well as watch magnificent suns rise and set.The spaceThe space.21 steps at a height of 4 meters with a magnificent view of the Krems Valley.Our apartment has a small kitchendining areatoilet and bathroom with shower and whirlpool as well as a bedroom in the upper area. Ideal for 2 peoplebut possible for four. In the living area there is then an additional sleeping possibility for two people.Guest access.The tree house is only available to you.Other things to note.Starting point is our tree house in a perfect location for many wonderful hikescycling tripsmountain biking and visiting historical sights in our beautiful Wachau and in the forest district.

Title: An Adirondack Tree House Retreat
Description: The treehouse is one of the most sought after places for couples to reconnect with nature.Nestled in the foothills of the Adirondack Mtns. and just 9 miles from Saratoga Springs NYboasting quiet solitude.The winding staircase leads to a sleeping area and covered porch.Alsooutdoor kitchendeckfire pit and full bath just a few steps away are included.Please keep in mind that our treehouse is meant as a quiet retreat for 1-3 people.The spaceThe space.This private wooded setting offers many unique features such as: private parkingoutdoor kitchen and dining with charcoal grill,refrigeratormicrowavefire pithot and cold running water as well as outdoor lighting.The narrow circular stair case leads to a comfortable sleeping area including a double bedplus a loft. Just outside the sleeping quarters is a covered porch for readingwriting or reflecting.Electric heater and fan are included.Provided are sheetsblanketspillows and pillow cases.A full bathroom is just a few steps away. Provided are towelssoapshampoo and paper goods.
