Title: Modern treehouse on working maple syrup farm.
Description: Welcome to Quinn‚Äôs treehouse. We are located on a 500 acre working maple syrup farm at the base of Robbins Mountain. There is endless outdoor opportunities. Hikingbikingboatingswimming and skiing are right outside the door. The treehouse abuts Camels Hump State Foresthowever is close to local shopsdining and the interstate for easy travel.The spaceThe space.This is a unique treehouse experience with modern accommodations yet nestled in the woods. The space works best for couples or a family with 2 children. We are located on a very steep private driveway and in the winter you will need a 4 wheel drive vehicle.The treehouse is on an owner occupied propertybut our house is completely out of sight. The treehouse has heatair conditioningwifiand an incinerating toiletwhich requires some unique procedures to operatebut very easy to use. We have a smart TV available for your use. There is no cablebut have basic streaming options to use with your personal account.We have a small kitchenette with a mini fridgehotplatetoaster oven and Keurig coffee maker. A sink and barbecue occupy the outdoor kitchenand there is an outdoor hot water shower. There is no indoor plumbing including shower or sink. The toilet runs on electricity and cleanly incinerates waste.We supply plenty of drinking water. The outdoor sink and shower water is not suitable for drinking. In winter monthswe have a portable on demand hot water heater that runs on propane. As there is a specific procedure to follow we are going to have to set up times for water delivery and showers. We will supply water from our house and set everything up for you.Guest access.The treehouse is surrounded by miles of hiking trailsmultiple rivers and an abundance of mountain biking and skiing opportunities. Numerous established mountain biking trails are minutes away and there are 2 local ski resorts within 5 miles from us. There are endless opportunities to skibikehikeswimfly fishpaddleOr‚Ä¶ just float down the river with an inner tube to our local brewery in Richmond- (Shuttling can be arranged for an extra fee).As the treehouse is located on a maple syrup farmyou may have an opportunity to witness maple syrup making in action. Sugaring season is typically March through Aprilbut tours of the sugarhouse and sugarbush are year round and can be easily arranged.Visit sweetAbbys.com for more information.

Title: Treehouse Village - The Box
Description: "The Box is a shipping container with a modern design that is set amidst the trees. There is a bedroom with a queen-sized bed and an air mattress to add space for two more guests should you want to make it a family affairor bring a few friends. There is a full batha kitchenetteand then the rest of the space is made into a living area with all youll need to enjoy your stay. At the end of the living areayoull find yourself surrounded by huge windows looking high into the treetops!"The space"The space.The Box is a shipping container with a modern design that is set amidst the trees. There is a bedroom with a queen-sized bed and an air mattress to add space for two more guests should you want to make it a family affairor bring a few friends. There is a full batha kitchenetteand then the rest of the space is made into a living area with all youll need to enjoy your stay. At the end of the living areayoull find yourself surrounded by huge windows looking high into the treetops!"Guest access.You will have the whole treehouse to yourself!Other things to note.Since these are treehousesyou will need to e-sign a liability waiver. We are located in the woods so all animals and insects that come with naturewill be prevalent.Since we are in a rural areawe have limited wifi available. Alsothere is a longhilly driveway. If the weather is roughyou will need to be careful. If you get stuckwe will assist you if we are available. A four-wheel drive vehicles is recommended if there is snow.

Title: Luxurious Two-Story Treehouse | Minutes from Lake Sunapee | Peaceful
Description: A four-season TREEHOUSE packed with all the modern amenities! An experience to remember with exquisite craftsmanship throughoutenjoy the unique features yet simple pleasures of life in the trees! The Treehouse is equipped with radiant heat flooring and a propane fireplace for the winter and air conditioning for the summer! With two bedrooms and one bathroomyou will find romanceprivacyand charmall nestled in the woods near Mount Sunapee and Lake Sunapee.Knock this one off your bucket list: SLEEP IN A TREEHOUSE!The spaceThe space.A four season TREEHOUSE packed with all the modern amenities! An experience to remember with exquisite craftsmanship throughoutenjoy the unique features yet simple pleasures of life in the trees! The Treehouse is equipped with radiant heat flooring and a propane fireplace for the winter and air conditioning for the summer! With two bedrooms and one bathroomyou will find romanceprivacyand charmall nestled in the woods near Mount Sunapee and Lake Sunapee. Knock this one off your bucket list: SLEEP IN A TREEHOUSE!Every inch of this one-of-a-kind treehouse has been crafted with the utmost attention to detail that invites you to discover the many surprises it holds‚Ä¶ including a mouse house!Other features include wrap-around deck raised high above the trees where you can relax and enjoy the solitude surrounding youand a lower deck with bench seating and a Weber Spirit grill that converts to a griddle ‚Äì cook your morning pancakes in the great outdoors! In the eveningsit back and relax around the fire pit with your favorite drink!Walk through the hand-crafted ‚ÄòHobbit Door‚Äô to discover a welcoming main room with radiant heated Travertine stone flooring and walls covered with reclaimed barn board from the 1800‚Äôs. Dine at the table built on a kiln-dried tree stump. The galley kitchen is equipped with a microwave convection oventwo-burner cook stove and under-the-counter refrigerator/freezer.A soapstone propane stove keeps the house cozy on snowy winter dayswhile a central air conditioning cools down the heat of the summer.The treehouse offers two bedrooms to comfortably sleep four. The lower level bedroom has a full size bedand the upstairs bedroom has a queen size bed.The kitchen is fully stocked with utensilsdinnerwarepansa toaster and Keurig coffee maker with coffee and creamer.The tree house is a self-contained private arealocated on a well-lit road with parking for two vehicles.Must be 21 years of age or older to rent.Guests have access to the entire property.

Title: Ash hill treehouse, in the Adirondacks
Description: *Brand New* The Ash Hill Treehouse is suspended between Ash and Maple trees. This is a real treehouse built in the trees and you won‚Äôt want to miss out on an experience like this! Five steps will lead you up a path as you embark on a 100 foot winding bridgeelevating you from ground level into the canopy of the trees where you will start your much needed getaway. Relax by the propane fireplace. The perfect place for couples or solo travelers that want to getawayand enjoy the sounds of nature.The spaceThe space.The Ash Hill Treehouse is the perfect mix between rustic and modern.Guest access.Feel free to walk the 15 acre property and experience nature.

Title: Observatory Tree House
Description: The Observatory tree-house is a vacation experience that quite literally rises above the rest! Built not for the faint of heartthis tree-top adventure offers the best views of the Red River Gorge.The spaceThe space.Once you trek up to your new home in the swaying Eastern White Pineyou may feel exposed to the unforgettable raw nature of the canopy!  This tree house is designed for able-bodied folks and is NOT meant for unsupervised or small children.Ascend the wandering wooden staircases into the canopy to begin your exploration of this pirate ship in the trees.  You`ll discover spectacular views from a glass bedroom with built-in skylightsa screened-in hammock lounge with plenty of storageand a cozy kitchen with a wrap-around porch.  As you navigate from room to room through floating walkways and steep ship laddersyou may be wondering what it must have been like to create such an epic abode..Guest access.Access to Wifi on our red office porch and in the office parking lot.Other things to note.Kitchen: The Observatory kitchen has a gas stovefrench press coffee potcookwaredishwaresoap and kitchen linens . Above the sink you‚Äôll find a 5-gallon water dispenser for your cooking and cleaning needs. We supply two 5-gallon jugs of potable water during your stay. For perishablesa 75 L Yeti cooler is provided. Please bring your own ice.Living/Dining: Screened-in lounge on the lowest level with a futon and two hammocksa porch and bar-style seating for two on the mid-leveland the most spectacular views from the highest level on the Observation deck that leads to the bedroom.Bathroom: Observatory has a private composting outhouse. You are also welcome to use our guest shower and bathroom at the RRG Headquarters at any time during your stay.Bedroom: A full bed above the trees and a full-futon in the lower hammock lounge. Please note that while this tree-house was designed for twothere is room for two additional guests in the hammock lounge.Additional Amenities: Weber charcoal grillwall heater in the bedroomsolar powered kitchen lights and solar charging station for small electronicsbattery-powered lanternsand a private fire pit with camp chairs.**Important** While we allow dogs at our rentalswe do not recommend them for Observatory. Your furry friends will most likely not be fans of the steep ladders/stairs.4WD and high clearance vehicles are recommended but not required.

Title: KY Breeze PRIVATE Treehouse ‚òÖ  Romantic RRG Forest
Description: Take in the rusticfairy tale vibe of this custom-made treehouse in the midst of towering trees! Open the 15 ft glass garage door & watch the sunset over the mountainsor try your hand at some stargazing on the stargazing deck while listening to the nightly sounds of the forest. In the morningstep out on the trailhead and explore the stunning forest of the Red River GorgeIf your travel dates are not available on this calendarvisit one of our sister properties by visiting our profile!The spaceThe space.At nightlisten to gentle owls and enjoy the twinkling stars above on the stargazing deckwarm up near a fire while enjoying the solitude that the forest has to offer. In the morningwalk to the national trailhead location while the sun breaks through the trees as you hear the gentle stream of a nearby creek!We are a RARE find in the area located on PRIVATE landand one of the only rentals in the Red River Gorge that is located so conveniently INSIDE the National Park just walking distance to great nearby hiking trails!If your dates are unavailablebe sure to check out our other listings as well such as "The Eagles Nest" and "Lions Lair" each providing its own unique accommodations. This treehouse is one of our newest additions providing ACHeatand Electricity!We guarantee you this combination of outdoors & amenities provides a truly uniqueadventurousmagicaland relaxing getaway experience with your friends or and loved ones!We look forward to having you stay with usand be sure to book soon before it fills up fast!!

Title: Tree House and Sauna with Beautiful Mountain Views
Description: "Cozy in all seasons.‚òº BEAUTIFUL NATURE AND SURROUNDINGS ‚òº.‚òº MOUNTAIN VIEWS‚òº.‚òº MAGICAL GARDEN‚òº.‚òº JACUZZI AND SAUNA ‚òº.‚òº PEACEFUL AND QUIET SOLITUDE ‚òºMagic existsand youll find it here.This dazzling space in the mountains will take you to a different place where nothing else existsonly it and you. Its a capsule of peacefulnessdisconnection to the outer world and an intrinsic connection to natureleisurepleasure and joy."Other things to note.Extras Prices:Hot tub (wooded heated bath under stars): 1500 CZK for up to 6 people (prepared of fresh quelle water just for you and preparation takes several hours).Sauna (wooded heated): one sauna per stay is freeanother for 800 CZK (you prepare it yourselves).If you come with your dogwe charge 500 CZK per night.The 5th person in the TH is ideal when being a child - so that you can comfortably fit together on the 2 of the double-beds.

Title: The Tree house in Ano Korakiana
Description: Although this lovely and romantic tree house is set in the woodsit is light and airy with a balcony that overlooks the verdant landscape so typical of Corfu.The detail as well as the tasteful fabrics adds to the ambience. Whilst small it has everything you need. It will enchant you.The spaceThe space.The treehouse is part of an estate called "Vradi Estate" which is located in the foothills of the village of Ano Korakiana. As part of the estate there is a guest house with 7 bedroomsthree cottagesan A-frame housea treehouse and a horse trekking center. The cottages were built in such way so that our guests can enjoy the peace and the privacy that the place has to offer. Each property has it‚Äôs own outdoor space and it‚Äôs own unique view of the field where the horses graze every evening. Near the cottages there is a vegetable garden from where guests can help themselves to fresh produce.Anyone that is a nature and animal lover and is looking for a quiet place away from the touristy spots will enjoy it. Friendly cats an dogs roam around the estate freely.The Vradi Estate is quite central located on the island making it a good base for guests to explore both the north and the south of Corfu.The nearest beaches are IpsosDassia and Barbati which are all within 10 minutes distance by car or scooter . Approximately 5- 6 km. Palaiokastrisaone of Corfu‚Äôs most popular attractions is 15 minutes away.Corfu town is 15km away so 20 minutes by car.Corfu airport and Corfu port about the same. 15-16 km away20 minutes by car or scooter.A car of scooter is required as there is no public transportation.The horse trekking center just 20m from the cottages is nicely busy in the summer but not noisy.Breakfast is also available at an extra cost at Luna Inn (the adjacent b&b)

Title: Panorama: Magnificent treehouse,cozy
Description: www . valterria . comThe Totem Houses of Valterria are located in the Valterria Adventure Park located in the privileged environment of the Merindades.Imagine sleeping among treesjumping on zip linestaking a ride on our ebikesenjoying the sunset on your terrace with unique views. You can enjoy the tranquility of the rural world and immerse yourself in countless adventures.The spaceThe space.Treehouselocated in the forest of the Valterr√≠a adventure park.Its hexagonal shape accommodates two peoplewith the possibility of a double bed or two single beds.It has a toilet and a shower.The terrace of this cabin has east orientation.Guest access.An adventure park at your feet:- Climbingzip lines and jumping in a single tower of 24 meters high. Climb up its climbing and climbing tracks or from the stairs inside. An adrenaline monster through which to access the circuits of high rope bridges.- Hanging bridges. It runs 18 extra long bridges at 11 meters high through the canopies of an oak forest.- Giant zip line. Jump and slide along the large double zip line of 300 meters in length.- Enchanted forest of molars. Turn on your imagination thanks to a circuit built between giant rocks joined by bridges and with different challenges.- Cafeteria. Skewersrations or some dishes that come out of our kitchen‚Ä¶ In a family atmosphere and with the best views of the Merindad.- Food Truck. Come and see our Foodtruck mounted on the chassis of an old bus that will delight young and old. In the you can enjoy our pizzas and focattias with a wide variety of ingredientswafflescrepsice cream and much more in our adventure atmosphere.www . valterria . com

Title: Treehouse Canopy Room: Permaculture Farm
Description: Our lovely space is a lush urban oasis and permaculture farm. Enjoy goatspigsemusroostersparrotstortoisescatsand friendly people. Located in "Little Haiti," near art district15 minutes from airport and South Beach. Fresh veggieseggs and honey when available! Late night train horns and early rooster crows also!.Please check in by 7 pm on arrival day.The spaceThe space.Walk up narrow staircase to the 3rd level of the treehousenestled within the pithocilobium tree. Feel like you\re living in the trees! Beautiful view of canopy and animals. There\s a double bed for two. Shared kitchen downstairs. The Bahamas style bathroom is located a few steps away from the Treehouse and the lovely outdoor shower is also close by. Bathroom and shower have hot water.Due to height of treehouseno children are allowed (sorry). From the canopy roomyou will hear animal sounds and possibly midnight train horns.Mosquitos are at their peak during rainy season (June-September) we have a net over the bedcitronella candletwo fans and incense to keep them away from you in the Treehousebut that\s not a guarantee.Miami summer is hot. While our beautiful canopy of trees helps keep the farm a lot cooler than other parts of the citybe mindful that the Treehouse only has fans for cooling. It does not have an air conditioner. Please consider our "Cozy Cabin room" or "Cute Cedar Camper" listings if you are sensitive to mosquitoes or prefer air conditioning. Click on my photoand scroll down to see all our interesting listings on the farm!.Please check-in by 7 pm.

Title: Eagles Nest Tree House
Description: Come stay in your very own Tree House!This rustic luxury treehouse is nestled away 17 feet high in the treetops. Eagles nest will accommodate up to 4 guests. Thrill your inner child staying in a treehousebut with all the luxury you expect as an adult!This beautiful 900 sq ft treehouse is furnished in a rustic luxury style and has all the luxurious amenities you want with the fun of a treehouse! Stairs are necessary to enter the treehouse. Check in is after 4pm. Check out is 11am.The space"The space.***We sanitize the cabins and change the hot tub water before and after every guest***Walk right onto the 1st screened porch where youll find a 4 person hot tub. Then into the treehouseyoull find a kitchenettewasher/dryerwifiin house surround soundgas fireplaceKing bed (upstairs) and two fold-out memory foam twin beds (convertible to a King) downstairs. There is a half bath downstairs and a full bath with a tiled shower upstairs. You can also enjoy the upstairs screened-in porch sitting area right off the bedroom.There is 280 ft of open deck and a lower patio area with a gas grill and picnic table for an additional 160 sq ft. You can also relax outside on the deck in the hanging rope chairsor under the treehouse by the lower patio area in the swinging play forts (weight limit 250 pounds). So much fun to be had and so much relaxing to do!Your payment constitutes your agreement to our rental contractso you do not need to sign and return it to us. Rates are based on DOUBLE OCCUPANCY and do not include taxprocessingadditional guest fees or insurance fees.ADDITIONAL ADULTS ARE $25 PER NIGHT PER ADULTONE CHILD FREE PER PAYING ADULT (IF you have children instant quote will include in the priceplease contact us before instant booking so we can correct the cost.)Minimum stay 2 nights3 night minimum for Holiday dates. Other discounts may be availableplease contact us for more information.We do require payment in full at the time of booking unless other arrangements are agreed to at the time of booking.Non-refundable Pet fee $75 plus tax per dogwe do not allow cats2 dogs max."Rates are based on DOUBLE OCCUPANCY and do not include taxprocessing or insurance fees. Rates may change at any time without notice.ADDITIONAL GUESTS ARE $25 PER NIGHT PER GUEST. We offer weeknight 1-night minimum stays. Weekend Minimum stay is 2 nights3 night minimum for Holiday dates.Please also note that if you plan to bring our fur family member(s) we have 2 do maxand there will be an $82.73 ($75 plus tax) non-refundableper dog fee for the entire trip. Note that this is not a per night fee. This charge will be billed to you through the Airbnb resolution center. Please contact the manager with any questions or concerns. We do not allow cats.We are available 24/7 to answer your questions and are here to make your stay with us unforgettable!

Title: Nomad Jungle Treehouse - surf / yoga (shared bath)
Description: "‚ÄúLa Selva at Nomad Tree Lodge‚Äù is an adventure accommodation offering a Home to surfersyogisand nomads from around the world.We offer daily yogaand foot access to 2 world class surf breaks (intermediate/ advanced).Were not perfectwere not luxurybut life here is really beautiful in its raw simplicity. If you sign up for this adventurecommit to surrendering to the jungle and immersing yourself in this unique experience.NOTE: wifi in communal space onlyno guest kitchen."The space"The space.Our rooms are all uniquely beautiful in their rustic simplicity. Think of the space more as ‚Äúglamping‚Äù than as a hotel.You will get to your cabin by a series of pathways & rope bridges through the trees. Nestled in the jungleyour little a-frame treehouse Cabina is your own little jungle nest to reset & relax.The Treehouse is breezy and open (even though its 100% screened and protected from bugs)and youll often see monkeys right out your front door! Listen to the waves crashing at night and the jungle sounds in the morning. Your little Paradise.You‚Äôll have access to the shared bathhouse with a bathroom and shower shared with 1 other cabin.""Guest access.You will have access to the poolyoga shalaand the main loungewhere we have wifi connection and seating. For an additional chargewe offer breakfast and daily yoga classes.We dont have a shared kitchen! Butthere are plenty of restaurants nearby."

Title: Treehouse Escape on 5 Acres- TreeHausATL
Description: Come sleep in the trees..This is the perfect place to come when you need a break. This beautiful treehouse sits on five acres of wooded property minutes from the 75/285 and less than two miles from the The Battery and Truist Park. After your walk down the sparkling path past the firepityou enter the house by crossing three bridges to the porch. Has a full kitchen and bathroom. The sleeping loft has a ships ladder and a king size bed with soft linen bedding. Truly awesome place to recharge.The space"The space.The large 400 square foot deck sits 23 feet in the air. full in suit bathroomfiber internetkitchen and AC/Heat. Its a great way to recharge your soul when you need a break from the norm."Other things to note.Pets are welcomebut there is a $65 pet fee.

Title: The Sugar Maple Treehouse @ Vermont ReTREEt
Description: "The Sugar Maple Treehouse was hand built by us as a peaceful and serene reTREEt in central Vermont. Surrounded by the wilderness of the Green Mountain National Forest and perched high above the ground in three maples treesthere is no place better to escape to. There are so many things to do in this area between Killington and SugarbushI cant list them all! Between the cozy bed and in-house massage therapist you probably won‚Äôt want to leave anyway. Please read the entire description."The spaceThe space.You can relax in the treehouse and enjoy being surrounded by nature or you can be adventurous and go explore the surrounding forest.Guest access.After you park your caryou will get to walk along the path and across the beaver creek bridge and up the path some more until you come across the treehouse nestled in the forest perched up on three beautiful maple trees.Other things to note.While we tried to make this treehouse as easy to access as possiblethe path to the treehouse is 650‚Äô in length up a slight hill. With the treehouse being located in a forest the walking path can be a bit muddybumpysnow coveredperfectof a combination of everything so please bring appropriate footwear.We expect to clean the treehouse after each guest so there is no additional cleaning feebut if you leave a mess we will contact you and ask for a cleaning fee.We love animals and enjoy when guests gets to bring theirs! We just do not like cleaning up after those furry family members so we are asking for you to bring a bed or blanket for the furry one to sleep on. We do have a fee of $20 per day per pet for normal wear and tear. Airbnb is set up to charge you for the first nightbut any more nights will be added manually. This fee does not include any extra cleaning or damage to the treehouse. If you bring a pet with out telling us a head of timewe will add on $50 since we use different linens when pets are visiting and won‚Äôt be able to change them out on your arrival. (I do apologize if this sounds over the top in anywaya few bad apples are why we had to implement such things).Please let us know your estimated time of arrival on arrival day so I know when to come down from the trees and keep an eye out. Showing up without giving me a heads up could cause up to an hour wait time until I can get you checked in since I could be in the middle of a project in the forest.We try to be as accommodating as possible by having a 4 hour check in windowif you want to check in out side of that time frame we will do so to the best of our abilities at a charge of $30 per hour.The bathroom consists of a composting toilet which is on the same treehouse platform. We have a seasonal heated outdoor shower which is operational in the warmer months. We will provide you with some drinking water in a bottle and hand sanitizer.The treehouse is well insulated and has electric heaters that will keep you plenty warm on the coldest of Vermont nights.For those that want to disconnect while still being able to connect we now have internet and a small smart tv in this treehouse!We will help bring your belongings up to the treehouse upon your arrival but can not guarantee help bringing them back down as we both work in the mornings.We want to make sure everyone who visits our treehouse knows what they are booking by reading the description and not just our glorious reviews because the experience at our treehouse is not for everyone. To indicate that you have read all of this please include your favorite type of tree when you message us!Licence numberLicence number.MRT-10126712

Title: The TreEscape
Description: 1st true treehouse in Gatlinburg/Pigeon Forge built by The Treehouse Guys from the DIY network show. Features a loft brfull bath with rain head-tile showerunlimited high speed internetfully equipped kitchenvery comfortable power reclining leather couch2 live trees growing through the interior2 live trees growing through the enormous deck spacecovered hot tub2 outdoor barssuspension bridge to crows nest deck around a 5th treeand so much more..The spaceThe space.Our space was designed primarily for a unique experience that we would describe as luxury in the trees! The setting is perfect for a quiet writers retreathoneymoon or romantic getawayor an unforgettable family trip to the Smoky Mountains. Our property is the best of both worlds as you can be in Gatlinburg or Pigeon Forge within minutesbut still feel like you have your own private setting in the woods. Below the house is even more to explore including a pub table with hanging/swinging chairs. There is also a nice charcoal grill and fire pit just off to the front and side of our place.Guest access.Our guests will have complete and exclusive access to all amenities at the Treescape.

Title: Gypsy Treehouse Gazebo - Walk to Beach
Description: This beautiful large gazebo is detached from our home but is accessed via the back porch and deck. Plenty of windows overlook the trees and pond. Inside find this eclectic haven for the wandering soul with hanging bed and 2 foot deep tub. Find us on "FB" under "Treehouse Gazebo."The spaceThe space.Eclectic is an understatement. One of a kind indoor modern out-house and cattle trough tub. Enjoy privacy overlooking a large yard and access the deck to cookoutreadrelax or just soak in some sun. It\s a trip back in time but with modern amenities. The suspended bed is super comfortable and all of this is found in one room nestled among the trees just a few blocks from the beach or a short walk to the Nags Head Woods Preserve forest.****Note**** Bed is Full Size (54x75) this may not be comfortable for those fortunate enough to be over 6 foot tall.A mini fridgeoven toastermicrowave ovenand Keurig single brew coffemaker are available for your conveniencethere are also USB charger ports at bedside. Underneath the bed there is a wooden chestinside you will find the blu-ray dvd player12 ft. HDMI cordironironing boardblow dryer and first aid kit (please write down supplies taken from kit so that I can replace them). Underneath the sink there is a small broom and dustpan if you want to clean the sand from the floor. A drying rack is provided for your wet bathing suitsyou may set it up outside or over the tub (located in shower). Light switch for the bathroom lamp is on the lamp itself. Cable for the TV is on the SPECTRUM app as there is no longer a cable box. You may also use NETFLIX under "Treehouse guest" profile and we want you to enjoy this unique experienceso if you have any special requests or recommendationswe would love to know.Other things to note.Bed is Full Size (54x75) this may not be comfortable for those fortunate enough to be over 6 foot tall.

Title: 02 - Treetop Flyer
Description: "NOW WITH ELECTRIC!! The Treetop Flyer is a smallone-room treehouse with a loftwrap-around porchlower deckpropane grilland nearby fire pit. There is NO PLUMBINGbut we provide a jug of spring water and theres an outhouse at the base of the stairs. The farm also has a centrally located Community Kitchen and a Bath House which are shared with other guests on the farm. NO PETS - NO EXCEPTIONS. Please read ALL the house rules and full description. HomeGrown HideAways is also on FB and IG."The space"The space.HomeGrown HideAways is a hundred-acre farmcampgroundand event facility with treehousesyurtscabinscampingetc. The ownersNathan & Jessalive onsite with a parade of dogscatschickensand ducks. For the safety of our own animals (and yours)we cannot allow any additional animals onto the farm. Anyone arriving with an animal of any kind will not be allowed to stay and no refund will be given.INTERIOR: The interior of the Treetop Flyer is complete with 4 double bedspillowssheetsand light blankets (2 futons that fold open on the main floor and 2 mattresses in the loft)barnwood table with 2 benches for eating and playing gamesand a jug of spring water. There is an electric fireplace for heatbut no indoor plumbing. You get the entire treehouse to yourself. A trash can is providedbut we do not have trash service on the farm so you need to take your trash to town with you upon departure. (NOTE: Please let us know if you plan to bring your own linens. We offer a linen discount of $3 per person if we don‚Äôt have to do extra laundry. Beds will still come with a fitted sheet and pillows with pillowcasesjust no blankets or top sheet. You can request the discount as a refund or farm credit to use towards eggsfirewoodor other items).EXTERIOR: The treehouse features a coveredwrap-around porch above and massive deck below with swingpicnic tablepropane grilland firewood bundles (bring cash). The upstairs porch and lower deck have solar lights. Please note that the lights do not come on until dark and they will only stay on for as much time as the battery was able to re-charge during the day. A private outhouse is just a few steps away from the base of the stairs or you can use the shared-use bath house in the main camping field. There is also a nearby firepit that overlooks the gardens. Parking is available at the base of the treehouse is but very limited. If you are bringing a groupsome will need to park in the parking area near the Community Kitchen.CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT: Guests can check in any time after 4pmbut we do recommend arriving before dark. Depending on our cleaning schedulewe may be able to accommodate an earlier arrival time with advance notice. Rentals are unlocked so guests can just follow the instructions sent with the check-in email to find their location and let themselves in. Check-out is at 11am so that we have time to clean the rental before the next guest arrives. If something comes up and you need to leave before your scheduled check-out dateplease do us the courtesy of sending a message once you have cell service so that we know not to expect you.UNPLUG AND RECONNECT: HomeGrown HideAways does not have cell service or wifibut there is a landline in the Community Kitchen for guests to use. We hope that you will take the opportunity to re-connect with natureyourselfyour familyand other guests. In addition to the shared kitchen spacewe also have a pavilion with cornhole set up for rainy daysand a massive bonfire area where we encourage guests to pitch in on firewood to share stories and s‚Äômores. Please note that quiet hours are from 10pm ‚Äì 7am and sound carries far in the holler.SHARED BATH HOUSE: In addition to year-round outhousesthere is a seasonal BATH HOUSE with 4 flush toilets and 2 solar-heated showers. The bath house is rustic with a concrete floor so we recommend shower shoes or flip flops. Towels and toiletries are not providedbut we do have extra for purchase if you forget yours. In the winter monthswhen the bath house is closedwe open the restrooms in the community building for showering (1 full bath and 1 half bath).COMMUNITY KITCHEN: The farm has a brand new (2021)centrally-locatedsolar-poweredchef-inspired COMMUNITY KITCHEN with 4 ovens5-burner gas cooktopmicrowaverefrigerator with farm-fresh eggscoffee-makertoasterdishescutlerybaking sheetsbasic cooking supplies (oilsaltpepperetc)plus HomeGrown farm goodss‚Äômore kitsand other goodies. BRING CASH for the honor system. Please remember that this space is available for ALL visitors of the farm so guests are expected to clean up after themselves and not to loiter when others are waiting. To prevent over-crowdingwe ask that a maximum of TWO people from your group occupy the space at a time and children MUST be accompanied by a guardian at all times. Meals may be eaten at the picnic tables on the porchunder the pavilionor you can take food back to your site. FOOD SCRAPS MUST BE PUT INTO THE COMPOST BIN ‚Äì NOT IN THE TRASH. Please do not discard food on the ground as it can make our animals sick and attract unwanted wildlife.THE FARM: We are a farm in the mountains so we have all the good (beautiful viewsbabbling brookhiking trails) and the bad (insectshowling coyotespoison ivy) that nature has to offer so come prepared. We recommend hiking bootsbug sprayand weather-appropriate clothing. Be prepared to encounter INSECTS (mosquitoestickschiggers)WILDLIFE (deerturkeysnakestoadsand dare we mention the bear track we spotted one spring?)WEATHER (hotcoldrainsnow)TOXIC PLANTS (poison ivystinging nettlewild mushrooms)just to name a few. There is a steep and rugged 1.5-mile hiking loop that takes most folks about an hour (if they can get past the first 10-minute uphill climb). We also have playground swingsdisc golfhula hoopsa croquet setand a creek full of geodes to hunt.CAMPFIRES: Most sites have their own fire pit except for the primitive camping area. There is also a large communal fire pit near the Community Kitchen. Due to the spread of invasive insectswe ask that you DO NOT BRING FIREWOOD unless it is store-bought/kiln dried. We have bundles for sale here for $5/bundle (bring cash) or you can scavenge dead wood from the forest floor for free. DO NOT cut down live trees and DO NOT burn plasticglasstrashgasor anything that isn‚Äôt wood or paper. There is plenty of fire-starting materials under the Pavilion next to the bundles. On your way to the farmyou will pass the local fire department. Please make note of the fire danger sign. If the fire danger is higha campfire may not be advisable ‚Äì please check for local burn bans.SMOKING: Smoking is not permitted within the vicinity of any building on the farm. Please do not discard cigarette butts in the firepits or on the ground. They must be completely extinguished and can be thrown in the trash.TRASH: In case you missed it beforewe do not have trash pick-up on the farm and very much appreciate it if you can take your trash with you when you leave the farm. We do have recycling bins for clean plastic and aluminum cans. Paper and cardboard can be put in the box next to the firewood bundles under the pavilion for others to use for starting fires. We also have a compost bin available for all food scrapspaper napkinsand paper plates. Please do not discard food on the ground as it can make our animals sick and attract unwanted wildlife.MOTORIZED VEHICLES: We do not allow ATVs4-wheelersgolf cartsor any non-medical motorized transportation. Bicycles are welcome and encouraged.GENERATORS: We highly discourage the use of generators as they can be quite noisy and produce toxic fumes. Please talk to us in advance if you require one for a specific purpose.ACCIDENTS: If a child or member of your party has an accident involving bodily fluidsplease take the time to clean up after them. First aid kits are supplied in most rentals and in the Community Kitchen. If bedding is involvedwe have coin-operated laundry facilities in the Community building to begin the washing process. Please notify us of such events.COOLERS & CANDLES: Coolers should be left outside so that the condensation doesnt damage our floors. Candles are not allowed due to too many wax spills.NEARBY: We are just 8 miles from the Berea Pinnacles6 miles from Get Outside Ky (they rent canoeskayaksSUPsand e-bikes)3 miles to Tater Knob Pottery20 minutes to Anglin Fallsand a scenic hour from Red River Gorge. Berea is known for its arts and craftsthe historic Berea Collegeand outdoor recreation. In addition to hiking at the Pinnaclesthere are several other trails throughout town and the newly opened Silver Creek Bike Park.NOMS: Our favorite places to eat in Berea are Noodle NirvanaNative Bagel CompanyHappy Jack‚Äôs World Sandwich BarNightjarApollo PizzaPapaLeno‚Äôsand El Rio Grande. In Richmondwe like Masala IndianPurdy‚Äôs Coffee Co.and Thai Smile. Note: Madison County is DRYBerea is MOISTand Richmond is WET so plan your alcohol accordingly."Guest access.Guests have access to all 100 acres of the farm EXCEPT the private rentalsthe residenceand the chicken/duck houses. DO NOT LET YOUR CHILDREN CHASE THE BIRDS!We HIGHLY recommend arriving before dark. There are very few streetlights on the road coming in and none on the farm. It gets REALLY dark out here and some of our city guests have a bit of trouble with this.Rentals are unlocked for your arrival. Be sure to save/screenshot/download the check-in instructions you receive in your inbox as there‚Äôs no wifi or cell service once you arrive."Other things to note.Items we recommend bringing: CASH for firewoodeggsand farm goods; bug spray; hiking shoes/mudboots; slippers; earplugs (sometimes the coyotes throw big parties); and shower shoes (the bath house is rustic with a concrete floor).We live onsite. If you have any issues during your stayPLEASE come knock on our door so we can assist. Theres nothing worse than finding out in the review that you didnt enjoy your stay and its something we could have easily fixed.We are constantly striving to make the farm better and sometimes we forget to update the listings with the latest changes and improvements. For the most up-to-date informationwe suggest you follow our HomeGrown HideAways social media accounts where we also advertise on-farm workshopsclassesand events."

Title: Treehouse on the Blue Ridge Parkway near Boone
Description: "This hideaway was built on camera for an episode of Animal Planets Treehouse Masters. Perched in trees just off the Blue Ridge Parkwayits ideal for guests who would like to reconnect with natureand its a great home base for exploring the High Country. This property offers many unique featuresso please read the entire listing before booking. We look forward to having you!"The spaceThe space.Located on the Blue Ridge Parkwaythis beautiful cabin is literally nestled in the trees. Built with special touches throughoutyou may not want to leave this unique treasure once you get here. As you drive down the private drive you will feel the stress of daily life melt away. The treehouse is below the main house and has views of the vast forest surrounding you. Enjoy your breakfast on the back deck with total privacy from the outside world. Inside the cabin you will find a fully stocked kitchen and charming sitting area with comfortable futon that pulls out into an additional sleeping space. A comfortable queen-size bed is upstairs in the loft and surrounded by windows so you will wake up in the trees.The treehouse uniquely features an outdoor shower and a composting toilet.Guest access.The treehouse is yours during your stay. Guests can explore surrounding land and hiking trails on the property.Other things to note.**Please note: There is no shower available in the treehouse during the winter months when it is below freezing. The treehouse does have a bathroom with a composting toilet. If you are staying for two nights or moreyou are welcome to request shower access in our private home.**

Title: Mountain Dreams in Big Canoe-Escape the masses!
Description: "Beautiful views of Lake Petit and the mountains all YEAR! This chalet has been completely remodeled and is just beautiful! If your wanting a romantic getaway in the mountainsit would be hard to beat this one. The lake with boat rentals and miles of hiking trails. The cabin is close to Big Canoes core amenities and trails. This cabin has upgraded high speed WIFI and TVs in each room. Many of our guests come and end up buying a home here. If your looking to relaxTHIS IS THE PLACE!"The space"The space.This chalet has one bedroom and one bath. It is approximately 600 square feet. The kitchen is completely stocked with everything you would need to cook a full meal and then some. There are two TVs in the cabinone in the bedroom and one in the living room. Both have smart devices attached to them if you have netflix or some other streaming service. The couch is also a sleeper sofa that turns into a queen bed. This cabin is maintained IMMACULATELY. If your looking to come to the mountainsthis is the place! We occasionally allow guests with a child to stay in the cabin as a fourth person. Butyou must ask. WE DO NOT WANT MORE THAN TWO ADULTS STAYING IN THIS CABIN.**Owner is a licensed real estate agent lic#370513.The owner is a licensed real estate agent with Harry Norman Realtors and is always willing to show properties in Big Canoe and nearby communities with"Guest access.All of chalet. Laundry room is only available if guests are staying over three days or if specifically requested by the guest.Other things to note.NO SMOKING OR PETS INSIDE THE CABIN!

Title: Nights of Cimes - The Cabane du Bois Mauret
Description: Unusual accommodation open all year round: dream cabinsjust for youperched 10 meters in the trees (easy and secure access). Isolated from everythingpeace is guaranteed for an unforgettable night in the heart of the forestfor loversfamilies or friendsideal as a gift for those you love.The spaceThe space.Perched on a magnificent treethe Mauret wood hut is comfortable and rustic. Access is from a wooden staircase and then a footbridge fully secured by a net that leads directly to a small terrace. Inside many windows create a bright atmosphere and allow you to fully enjoy the surroundings.It is equipped with dry toiletsa kitchenette with gas and sinka cozy seating areaadditional heatingtables and chairs inside and on the terracestorage areas and solar electricity (lamps and socket).This cabin does not have a shower. We provide you towels and gloves for a rustic toilet in the kitchen sink.Upstairsthere are two small bedrooms under the rooftops. In allthe cabin is designed to accommodate four people in hotel formulathat is to say clean and prepared beds.. you do not have sheets to bring and breakfast is provided.Guest access.A 10-minute walk in the forest from the parking lot takes you to the foot of a staircase (plan a pair of sneakers). This leads you to the departure of a suspended walkway to the terrace of the cabana.Other things to note.Breakfast included in the price. For mealsyou can cook in the cabin or go to a nearby restaurant.

Title: Treehouse perched in the trees  of Cassis
Description: Text idea for your hut." As long as there are huts in.the woodsnothing will be totally lost. "Whether you are a child in the countryside or in the citythe hut is a part of your childhood.What iffor the time of a getawayyou find the joys of these suspended moments?.Go for an atypical stay by combining well-being and respect for nature in a chic and intimate setting offset from everyday life.All in newly clothed wood.The spaceThe space.Unique.. Cassis cabin. The cabin is installed on a wide platform hanging from the trees and supported by stilts. Accessible on one level thanks to the natural slopeyou will however have the real feeling of being high with 5 m under your feet.the cabin is insulated in sheep\s wool. It ensures natural softness in the middle of the season and freshness in the summer. It includes a 140 cm bed that faces a glazed window. Lying downyou\ll have a bird \s-eye view of nature. a hanging wooden walkwayA "bathroom" is at your disposal : a shower a sink and a private toilet. The bathroom is private to the hut Towels are providedThe hut has electric light but also photophores for a more romantic atmosphere!If you can\t separate from your mobile phone or computeryou will be able to charge it on a socket.A small fridge in the cabin and an espresso coffee machine are provided no breakfast scheduled.You will spend a stay in lazy mode during summerbucolic during springshimmering during fall and in trapper mode during winter !

Description: Treehouse with small kitchen and bedroom in a charming troglodytic listed valley. Extensive land bordering the stream and forest. The kitchenette has a sinkhot platecoffee maker and cooking essentials.Guest access.Dry toilets are present in the cottage. A bathroom as well as a conventional toilet are available in the nearby house if needed.

Title: TreeHouse~Aliyah~Off  grid+hiking+family friendly!
Description: A whimsical magical treehouse! A real tree house with a red oak that resides in the living room. Sleeps total of 2 adults 4 kids. Full bed in loft of main cabin. A swinging bridge connects to the snuggle palace bedroom 50 feet off ground that has bunk bed. A fire pit lights up the entire place. Hike 285 acres with trail head right below treehouseplay games. Cook full meal in stocked kitchenette. Dates taken? Check out our tree houses The Pete NelsonHickory or Tiny home Schoolie-The Love BusThe spaceThe space.We are excited you found us!We are Earthjoy village and have three treehouses on 200 acres of privately owned land strategically placed to give you privacy and close enough that you can rent out all three. One built by Master Pete Nelson.You will have private access to the 285 acres with over ten miles of rolling hiking trails of varying degrees of difficulty. There is a laminated map inside your treehouse with descriptions on the back. There are hammocksand tire swings along the way. There are creeks to exploreplay and hike. Your trail starts right below your treehouseThe listing you are looking at presently is the Aliyah treehouse. What makes it unique is that the snuggle palace is 50 feet high ..this is our tallest treehouse. It‚Äôs great for when you‚Äôre a family that likes to spread out. In the main cabin is a full size bed and across the swinging bridge is a bunk bed with a twin & full size bed.What stands us apart is the quietseclusion and options to add on adventures like our unique guided tree climb.THE ALIYAH. This tree house is for those wanting an"off the grid nature experience." It sleeps 2 adults and 3-4 kids. This is TRULYa one of a kind experience.Inside this particular tree house you are greeted by a tree in the room. As in: a more-than-100-year-oldtwo foot wide trunk right there in the middlelichen and allreaching straight through the roofone of two red oaks that support the tree house.Neighboring limbs hold a second tree-house bedroom accessible by a suspended rope-and-plank bridge to a deck. It‚Äôs an excellent place to sleepwithout light or soundsexcept for the nighttime woods.It‚Äôs trees as far as the eyes can see. The woods hold different marvels all times of yearso there is no off-season.Guests also relax with a swinging cabana tree pod belowa hammock villagea outdoor patio seta stacked-stone fire-pitcafe seating outside the main tree house on the deckand shaded hiking paths (including the popular 3.3 mile Heart Trail) that wind through the 285-acre private propertyeach bend bringing old growth forests full of white and red oakshickoriesblackberry patch for you to pick your ownpondsand creeks. Plus the NEWEST are two of largest tunnel landslides in Ky. to enjoy (over 150 feet)There is a space heater for winter for both spaces and back up propane if needed.Bathrooms.You have a compost toilet 5 second walk outside the treehouse for quick trips and a private bathroom marked Aliyah bath house up the road about a football field away with showerflushing toiletsinktowelswash ragssoapshampoopaper towels and toilet paper. Heated in the winter.Cooking: It has a fully stocked kitchenette inside and everything you need to cook all your meals including propane stove3-gallon tank of waterpots and pansplatesbowlscupsmugsand utensilsFrench coffee pressand cooler. With a portable sink for clean up. A charcoal grill outside. Bring your own preference of charcoalBeds: A full memory foam mattress in the loft above the living room in main cabin.The snuggle palace bedroom has a full size memory foam mattress below and twin bunk above. Snuggle Palace gives you that true treehouse feel so you will have to draw straws.This TreeHouse is recommended for Nature loverspeople who seek time away from technology and love being outside. It is an experience.Because it is truly a off the grid experience we want to alert you to a few things you may have to navigate during your stay. We have lighting for you by makita lightceiling lightand mini lights. We recommend bringing your own head lamps. You have two electrical outlets in this treehouse mainly for space heater. You can charge your cell phones via the USB ports on the Makita battery source.The tree grove is available to you to book a guided tree climb. Hereour professional facilitator will take you step by step to the top for the best views! Challenge by choice and always on rope. You can learn all the tree tricksincluding coming downupside down. Or you can always just hang out in the GIANT green net!A fire-pit is strategically placed to view from the all parts of the tree house. Build a fire and roast marsh mellows. You can buy a bundle of split firewood for $40.00 that will be delivered to your treehouse with a small fire starterabout 20 pieces that equals one night or bring your own firewood( It must have state compliance code)Pets are welcome for 50 a pet per stay. Maximum 2.You can go on scavenger hunt to find the 5 ponds(scavenger bingo is supplied for you and in the tree house.) A favorite of guests is to explore an abandoned 1800s settlers log cabin..proceed with cautionwade and play in several cool creeks! Bring your fishing poles for kids fishing ponds.We now have two large land slides over 150 feet on property for you to explore. Bring wax paper if you want to go super fastMake sure to play the survival card game in the tree house to get everyone engaged and off their phones!Check out our nature invitations in the tree house manual as a tool to enhance your self-awarenessconnect deeper to natureand others.We cannot predict the weather. When it is sunny and warm things can be peachy. The tree house can also be fun when it rains just prepare ahead of time. We will send out a welcome letter once you book with detailed info for a rainy day and other important things to note.In good dry weather you will have much easier time to navigate right up to the tree house! Howeverif snow is in forecastwe recommend four wheel drive or front wheel drive with good tires. If you are afraid you will get stuck during your stay we ask you do not pull down further than the green farm house at entry of property. From there you can use a wagon next to farmhouse to take your things down or pre-arrange someone to assist you.We have a detailed manual inside the tree house for more details about everything in the tree house.You will also receive a detailed welcome letter after you book with what to bringwhat to expect and local information like where to get groceries.We love our guests and love to MEET everyone. However first and foremost we respect your privacy. If you would like to meet us simply give us a text during your stay and if we are on the property we will meet you. We do not live on the property and hour away so you will need to be coached for any problems via phone.Please take note*** This adventure includes Wildlife. The tree house is in the middle of the woods you may encounter micewaspbeesticksdeerturkeyfliesantswater bugshear coyotesand owls especially out on the trails. THIS IS THEIR HOME! We ask that you be a person that loves and respects wildlife. If interaction with bugsinsectsanimals and nature is disheartening to you we do not recommend this tree house experience for you.Local Tips.**A favorite of guests is visiting the Historical town of Augusta Ky. Childhood home to George Clooney. The Irish Pub is a great place to eat (call ahead for open hours) and have a ice cream after at the general store across the street. Visit the small red train with historical info and take a stroll along the beautiful Ohio River just two blocks to the left of the pub. Augusta is also home to underground railroad.Another favorite for more fine dining right on the river is the Beehive. Call ahead to make sure they are open during your stay and to make reservations.From Augusta you can take a magical ferry ride across river and visit small town of Ripley. Find a place to eat along the river. You can take bridge back to Maysville and visit their historical downtown. Eat at Parc Cafe-A Italian cafe replica or at the five star LILJUMBO cafeFor quick bite to eat order a Pizza from the Germantown 1st stop Gas station 4 miles and pick it up. Phone number is in the treehouse or order from Snappy\s in Brooksville and they will now deliver as far as 3 miles from tree house by Palmer funeral home at beginning of 875.Back story. The Tree houses are our dream come true. We both wanted treehouses at a young age. For me being in nature brings me peace. When I was 9 I would play in the woods with my siblings and build my tree house with small branchesusing rocks as our furniture and moss as our carpet. I never let go of having this space and thought about it often.When Bill and I started our dream company EarthJOY Tree adventures in 2007. Whereas we take clients to the top of trees on ropes. As part of this venture we wanted to give them another experience. Why not be able to stay in a treehouse too??We set off to take Pete Nelsons LEARN HOW TO BUILD A TREEHOUSE in 2009 workshop.After the workshop we looked high and low for the perfect property to have this dream come true. We ran into many obstacles one being not able to afford it or not the right trees.When we saw Pete on Animal planet I thought I would just apply for the fun of it. We didn\t even have a place. When they called and accepted our application I called Dad. I asked him if we could build a treehouse on his 200 acre farm. He laughed and then said YES! He said he was tired of running two farms and would now change gears to have a few tree houses.In 2017 we built our second tree house. This one you are reading about!IN 2019 we finished our third tree house built by Bill ~ co-owner and my husband. He put love into every single nail and board. It is unique in that it has play elements like a slide2 swings and double loft. He made 50% of the tree house from the land itself using cedars and re-purposed wood and roof from one of the old farmhouses .*** Important *** No RESCHEDULES or CANCELLATIONS within 30 days of your stay! This is a strict policy! As a small businesswe are no longer able to accept cancels or reschedules unless it is a death in the immediate family! However you are able to transfer it to someone else that is 21+. If it‚Äôs outside 30 days before your stay and you absolutely need to cancel or reschedule your datethere is a $75.00 Change of reservation fee. We DO NOT accept CANCELLATIONS beyond 30 daysRAIN OR SHINE. Please DO NOT call if you are cancelling weather related.Guest access.285 acres of rolling trails. Approximately 7.9 miles to be exact. You can hikewalk or mountain bike if advanced. There are also a kids fishing ponds. A three person hammock on hidden trail and 10 hobbit tree houses to find hidden in the trees on Hobbit trail. Find the tree pod along cabana trail.Play in 2 largest land slides of Ky 150 feet long!Newest trail is Jacobs Ladders Trail in honor of my late nephew killed in a motorcycle accident. Guests from all over the world bring a chime to hang in memory of someoneOther things to note.From your car is 10 second walk to the tree house. Bring your ice we have a cooler. There is charcoal grill outside and inside camp stove.If it is snow you may need to park at top of hill. It is about 200 feet walk down on gravel. We recommend four wheel or front wheel drive or simply park at the top of the hill

Title: Pioneer Cabins + Luxury Treehouse  with Lakeviews
Description: A collection of 2 pioneer built cabins (moved and rebuilt at this location in 2003) and a luxury treehouse on 12 woodedprivate and gated acres. The breathtaking lake views await you at once you step out on to the back porch of the main cabin.The property sleeps up to 14 peopleyet each structure is on the smaller side and brimming with character!The spaceThe space.Perfect for couples or families who want to be together but still need some privacy! The large screened in porch has incredible views of the hilltop across the lakeand don‚Äôt miss the hot tuboutdoor showerhorseshoe pitand extra large fire pit seating area. The porch bed swing is the most popular place to relax with a good book!.I loved the challenge of renovating these structures and bringing.luxury to a rustic setting! The string lights will guide you down the steps to a fabulous view of the water off the back of the property. Kitchens are fully equipped to cook a great mealand the treehouse boasts a Keurig coffee station with a small fridge for leftovers from the main meal!.Wood burning fireplaces and coziness await! Take a soak in the jacuzzi tub,.then head outside to listen to the sounds of the deep woods and see the sky full of stars‚Ä¶.Sligo Marina is 10 minutes away where you can rent a pontoon for the dayand Burgess Falls has the most incredible hiking and waterfalls also 10 minutes away. There are many beautiful nature parks also nearby! Come enjoy the finest of Tennessee treasures‚Ä¶

Title: Treehouse perched in the forest
Description: A treehouse 4 m from the ground where you will sleep in the intoxicating smells of wood. Here nature gives you all its secretswithout electricitywith dry toilets and well watera return to springs away from the world. Village at 1km.NEW !.In winterPhilippe offers extra heating for warm evenings in the hut.The spaceThe space.Philippe and C√©cile built this spruce cabinmade of douglas and insulated with strawit offers rustic comfort. The 25-square-metre platform is accessed via a milled staircase. There is everything you need to sleeprest and have fun for children : a sofa bedgamesreadinga small table and two Chilean girls for the terrace ..When handing over the keysa bottle of water4 cupsa garbage bag and a battery lamp will be provided. All you have to do is plan your picnic and bedding kit.Guest access.In a forest of 10,000 m¬≤a zip linegamesbranches to make huts will delight young and old alike.A picnic tablea dry toileta pump on the well for a toilet in the wild.Other things to note.At an altitude of 940 mnights can be cool !.C√©cile and Philippe recommend that you come equipped with a warm down.For your winter eveningsif you\d likeyou\ll be offered extra heating for ‚Ç¨5 for refuelling.We also rent a lovely "Ecological House Gorges de l'\Ard√®che " in Chauzon.You can find all of our rentals on airbnb.

Title: Stay In tree house or set up tent
Description: Come sleep among the trees and spend your days hunting and/or hiking on more than 130 acres of land!great place to bring your dad to hunt he can keep up fire while you hunt he will see deer guarantee-from glass sliding door great shot he will see more than you jan 20/2020 now making syrup come see tasteThe spaceThe space.Very quite no one around all woods only noise maybe a airplane no roads or house,s within one mile very secluded pets welcome please have crate and pee pads. Do not leave pets unattendedGuest access.For deer hunting price Is 50$ extra per person a day .lots of deerOther things to note.We have two twin beds. There is an out side bath room. If you need shower come to our house! (At this time with the COVID going around,we do not allow taking showers at our house.) We will supply drinking spring water.we have generator for 25$ run time about 7 hr.

Title: Icaco Treehouse:Rustic tiny treehouse by the river
Description: Icaco Treehouse is a tiny gem hidden away in the mountains of Rio Grandejust 25 minutes drive from the SJU airport and below the rainforest. The name comes from the first indigenous living heremeaning "God of the mountain"; who is said to protect us from natural disasters. It is nettled by the side of a peaceful arterial stream of the Esp√≠ritu Santo riveron a 9-acre farm with private entrance. A perfect place to relaxdisconnect from the craziness out there and reconnect with nature.The space"The space.Because of the Covid situationunfortunatelyright now Im not provided sheetsblanketsnor pillows for safety matters. AlsoI dont host pets! I hope that you can understand meand come to my place because youll have the most amazing nature experience in the Caribbean. Youll love the beauty of the surrounds: including a rustic tiny house that comfortably fits 4 and provides basic amenities for a comfortable stay with a view of the Yunque National Rainforest. The first flooris fitted with a small electric stove and water reservoir hand-pumped from the cristal clear stream connected to the sink and the shower below. Alsothere is a basic bathroom with toilet paper.The friendlycalm Esp√≠ritu Santo river lays at the doorstep. With its natural poolsits the perfect place to chill with a beer and enjoy its shallow waters. Alsoyoull be able to walk through a trail where youll see many beautiful trees and birds.Please be gentle with windows and mahogany surfaces. Take good care of this gemso others can enjoy it as much as youand youll return. This is a property with full contact with nature. So insectslizards and non-poisonous snakes bound around. The river is easily hike-ablebut enjoy it at your own risk and be aware of rising water levels."

Title: Tradewinds Treehouse
Description: The Trade Winds Treehouse is simply our most luxurious getaway in the forest. Two twin treehouses perch side by side like owls roosting on a limb. It features full electricityrunning waterheata private bathhousea slideand even a hot tub!The spaceThe space.*Important*.Access to this cabin requires driving up a gravel road with various steep sections. Most vehicles can make itbut we do recommend 4WD and/or high clearance. If your vehicle cannot make itwe can give you and your things a ride up.Full Bathroom: featuring tile showerflush toilethand sinktowel hooksbath exhaust fan and more! Approximately 50 feet away from the two tree houses on a gravel path with night lighting. The bathhouse is a log cabinwhich includes a living room arealoft with a full size bedplus a comfy couch& bar sink(sleeps 3 total)Full Compact Kitchen: featuring 3 burner stovehalf size fridgecookwareeating utensilsdish rackkichten sinkrolling island with integrated cutting boardkitchen exhaust fanand ample lighting. Interior seating in the kitchen is limitedbut can accomodate 6 people with additional outside seating available.Two treehouses: one master quarters with a queen mattress downstairs plus a sleeping loft for 1 additional person (sleeps 3 total)and the other features a kitchen downstairscompact futon downstairs and sleeping loft with a full size mattress upstairs (sleeps 3 total)Full electricityplumbingand flush toiletSPRING-FED HOT TUB! Enjoy in the springsummer and fall! We need to disconnect it when temperatures are below freezing. Amazing all natural location.Ample parking for 3 or more cars.Easy access to exceptional hiking trails and climbing areasincluding several within walking distance.

Title: Hemlock Hill Hideaway - Treehouse Glamping Style!
Description: Welcome to Hemlock Hill Hideaway - a unique glamping experience while being minutes from Boone city limits!!A perfect place to connect with nature!The space"The space.The treehouse is approximately 10x10. There is a loft consisting of a full-size mattress while facing a clear semi-see-through roof. A futon with a full-size memory foam mattress sits below it.DURING THE WINTER MONTHS (NOVEMBER 7 TO TBD)there is a non-water portable toilet in a tent off the treehouse but NO sink or shower amenities. (Please see the picture provided.) We do not have the means to keep water from freezing when temperatures fall below freezing and do not want to risk damaging our bathroom items. You will need to bring water for cleaning and drinking.PLEASE REMEMBER THAT WINTER IN THE MOUNTAINS CAN BE UNPREDICTABLE. We might have snow. We might not. We might have ice. We might not. If you decide to venture out here during the winter monthsplease be prepared to deal with snow and ice. The steps to the treehouse can get treacherous. We work very hard to keep our guests informed of the weather conditions - particularly bad weather. We are also not responsible for any accidents or injuries or damages to your vehicles that might occur as the result of the bad weather.(During the springsummerand fall monthsthe bathroom will consist of a portable toilet and sink in a tent off the treehouse. A shower station sits on the other side of the treehouse. Although there is no plumbingboth have water. You would only need to bring drinking water for yourselves.)There is electricity and WiFi. There is a cooler and an electric kettle available for you to use. Outside of the treehousethere is a fire pita grilla hammockand a slide - plenty to do while relaxing in nature!Please bring blankets/sleeping bags and pillows to sleep. (Both the foam mattress & futon will have freshly laundered sheets.)A space heater is providedbut you will still need to make sure you bring plenty of blankets to keep warm. Also - be aware that plugging in too many devices along with the space heater can trip the breaker.If you plan to use the grillplease bring your own charcoal. Grilling utensils are provided.Firewood is provided for the fire pit.Although smoking is allowed on the premiseswe ask that you do not smoke inside the treehouse. If you decide to smokeplease clean up after yourselves.Checking out is easy! We ask that you throw away your trash & recycles and return the key to the lockbox. We will take care of the rest! There is no need to refill the water or take the sheets off of the mattresses."Guest access.Please park in the designated parking area as shown in the picture.We are located at the end of a quiet street - although we are minutes away from US-421 and all of the amenities the High Country has to offer!1 mile - Pine Run Paddle Access for kayakingcanoeingand tubing.2 miles - Food Lion.~4 miles - Blue Ridge Parkway entrance (we are close to two BR Parkway entrances).4 miles - Rocky Knob Mountain Bike Park.4 miles - Brookshire Park.7 miles - StarbucksOther things to note.The hideaway is behind our backyard so you may see/hear us from time to time. There may be a cat or a dog running around although we find that they do not go out there as much without us.If you have any questions or concernsplease feel free to ask. Thank you!

Title: Yocah√∫ Treehouse: rustic tiny house by the river
Description: Yocah√∫ Treehouse is a tiny gem hidden away in the mountains of Rio Grandejust 25 minutes drive from the SJU airport and below the rainforest. The name comes from the first indigenous living heremeaning "God of the mountain"; who is said to protect us from natural disasters. It is nettled by the side of a peaceful arterial stream of the Esp√≠ritu Santo riveron a 9-acre farm with private entrance. A perfect place to relaxdisconnect from the craziness out there and reconnect with nature.The space"The space.Because of the Covid situationunfortunatelyright now Im not provided sheetsblanketsnor pillows for safety matters. AlsoI dont host pets! I hope that you can understand meand come to my place because youll have the most amazing nature experience in the Caribbean. Youll love the beauty of the surrounds: including a rustic tiny house that comfortably fits 4 and provides basic amenities for a comfortable stay with a view of the Yunque National Rainforest. The first flooris fitted with a small electric stove and water reservoir hand-pumped from the cristal clear stream connected to the sink and the shower below. Alsothere is a basic bathroom with toilet paper.The friendlycalm Esp√≠ritu Santo river lays at the doorstep. With its natural poolsits the perfect place to chill with a beer and enjoy its shallow waters. Alsoyoull be able to walk through a trail where youll see many beautiful trees and birds.Please be gentle with windows and mahogany surfaces. Take good care of this gemso others can enjoy it as much as youand youll return. This is a property with full contact with nature. So insectslizards and non-poisonous snakes bound around. The river is easily hike-ablebut enjoy it at your own risk and be aware of rising water levels."

Title: Cozy Treehouse near Helen, Ga
Description: This treehouse is one of a kind and made out of recycled materials placed 20ft up a tree! It is a cozy place to relax and be completely surrounded by naturethere is no water or electricity. It is located about a 1/2 mile from our check-in office/parking. Cars are not allowed at the camping sitesand parking is available at the main office. They are hike in or we will provide transportation only once at check in and once at check out.The spaceThe space.Made of of recycled materials and placed 20ft up a treethe treehouse is a cozy place with one bedroomthree bedsand back deck with table and chairs for relaxing. Please be aware that there is no water or electricity. Sometimes in summer months it still be very warm at night! The treehouse is in a remote location. Commercial vehicles are not allowed at the site. You must leave your car at our main office and then either hike in or be shuttled in.Guest access.Guests cannot drive their car to the treehouse. Parking is available in a gravel lot at our main office. We will transport guests once upon check-in and once at check-out. Any other time you must walk.There is an outhouse directly across from the treehouse and regular bathrooms and showers are conveniently located at our main office along with wi-fi.Other things to note.The Treehouse is located about a 1/2 mile from our check-in office/parking. We will provide transportation once at check-in and once at check-out. We have maps to get you to downtown Helen from via the Hardman Farm trail located across the street from our main office.Guests need to bring pillows and sleeping bags. They are not provided. All that is provided is the shelter and mattresses.This is just like camping except instead of a tent you are using our shelter. Plan to bring any supplies you would need if you were camping.Tents can be pitched next to the treehouse for an extra $10 per tent.Please let us know if you will be arriving after hours so we can make arrangements for you. You can check in late via no contact check in!

Title: Chasing Fireflies Treehouse- NEW!! Treehouse sits adjacent to the Great Smoky Mountain National Park
Description: Newly constructed in 2021..the Chasing Fireflies treehouse is perched over 15 feet up among the trees! Complete with modern amenities and oversized windowsenjoy the calm peaceful view from this treehouse bordering the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. Let nostalgic memories of your youth come back to life when you stay at the Chasing Fireflies treehouse. This Farmhouse style treehouse has oversized windows that will bring the outdoor beauty in and is full of modern amenitieswhile providing you whimsical and enchanting experience.The Chasing Fireflies treehouse sits adjacent to the Great Smoky Mountains National Park at the base of Cove Mountain in Wears Valley. This open concept 1 bedroom1 bath treehouse sleeps up to 4 people. The treehouse is full of amenities. In addition to a queen bed and sofa bedit offers a full size bathroom & shower and kitchenette. Chasing Fireflies has oversized windows which provide a feeling of having the National Park in your living room. Regardless of the seasonrelax in the air-conditioned or heated treehouse after your day‚Äôs activities. The kitchen has a 2 burner cook-toprefrigeratorand combo convection/microwave oven. Enjoy your favorite show on the 55" big screen smart-TV or use the free WI-FI. When you arrive at the Chasing Fireflies treehouseyou will experience the life-like flashing and flickering lights of fireflies; along with firefly decor in the treehouse. While your treehouse sits in the treesyou access Chasing Fireflies via the set of stairs (30 steps) & catwalks or a service set of 15 stairs. The outsides decks provide ample outdoor seating and viewing areas. Use the decks to sit and relaxor dine outside in the fresh mountain air. At nightChasing Fireflies transforms into a nightly light display with over 150 feet of outdoor lights.

Title: Tree house eco lodge
Description: "If youre looking for an immersive jungle experience while retaining creature comforts and staying close to civilisationthis gorgeous open-plan tree house is just the place!"The spaceThe space.Highlights:.- Open plan bedroom and living area with chairs and table comfortably situated to witness the magnificence of nature.- The space can accomodate 2 to 4 people with 1 double bed and 1 extra double matress.- Proper bathroom with a WC and a shower overlooking the jungle.- Fall asleep and wake up to the sounds of the jungle.- Live among tree tops.- Observe the unique flora and fauna"Guest access.You can easily get here without a 4x4 and park on the property. A quiet gravel road takes you from the main road (costanera) to the tree house (1km drive).Whats nearby:Youre really well connected here - there is a choice of restaurants around here (including the famous farm to table gourmet reservation only dining experience)one of the most beautiful beaches in the area (Playa Hermosa 2km away) with great surfcacao tourmedicinal plants tour and more.Uvita is just 8km away - with Ballena Marine National Park is nearbyknown for its humpback whale migration and the land bridge that appears at low tide to Punta Uvita and its iconic whale-tail rock formation.Domincal surfer town with a good choice of vegan and non-vegan restaurantsbarsgood surf and cool vibe. - 14km"

Title: Hacienda in the branches
Description: Have you ever dreamed of sleeping in the trees? Like a Peter Pan?.As a little child you wanted to have your house high in the branches?.Our "hacienda in the trees" makes your dream come true.But when it blowsthat the hell\s moves. Are you ready for it?The spaceThe space.We offernot just overnight accommodationin a unique building. Nowhere else in the Giant Mountains such a facility to stay open throughout the yearyou will not find.There is NO NETWORKING: NO electricityNO gasNO waterNO stovesNO fireplaces and even NO Wifi. Thats means NO HEATING !!! Just and only pure nature!.It is strictly forbidden to use open fire (candlesstovesetc.)!!!! Only LED lamps please!Guest access.If you settle in our Hacienda in the brancheswe will arrange for freeusing of toilets and showers on Mountain chalet Port√°≈°ky (portasky.cz). You can order breakfastlunch and dinner. You can also subscribe to our specialties delivered almost to your sleeping bag (all for fee).Other things to note.You are not the usually forest. The behavior of visitorssubject to the rules of KRNAP. Our forest is unique in that it will stay overnight and in the morning you will be amazed at how much wildlife around you through. Of course you can not make a noise!

Title: Treehouse Village - The Shack
Description: "The Shack is what dreams are made of! Enter over a 40 foot swinging bridgethen step into a house in the woods! There is a full batha kitchenetteand a day bed/ lounge area on the main floor. A European style ladder takes you up into the loft where youll find your queen-sized bed sleeping area. Outside you can warm by the fire on a deck large enough for the family."The space"The space.The Shack is what dreams are made of! Enter over a 40 foot swinging bridgethen step into a house in the woods! There is a full batha kitchenetteand a day bed/ lounge areathat doubles as another bed to sleep at nighton the main floor. A European style ladder takes you up into the loft where youll find your queen-sized bed sleeping area. Outside you can warm by the fire on a deck large enough for the entire family."Guest access.You will have the whole treehouse to yourself!Other things to note.Since these are treehousesyou will need to e-sign a liability waiver. We are located in the woods so all animals and insects that come with naturewill be prevalent.Since we are in a rural areawe have limited wifi available. Alsothere is a longhilly driveway. If the weather is roughyou will need to be careful. If you get stuckwe will assist you if we are available. A four-wheel drive vehicles is recommended if there is snow.
