Title: The  treehouse of Cerro Verde. ECORREFUGIO
Description: You\ll love my place because it has magic and is special. It is in the middle of a primary tropical wet forest at 3,000 meters above sea level at 33 km from Cll 82 with Kr. 7 of Bogota (+/- 55 min. ) or 25 min. from "La Calera"you will find a very comfortable and well-equipped cabin.Built at 8 m highin the canopy of the treeswith good viewsbirdsmossbromeliads and ravines.On a sidewalk of good and friendly farmerseasy to get to. It\s an unforgettable experience.The spaceThe space.You can arrive by car or there are public buses from La Calera that leaves you about 1 km from the Cabin.It is very cozy and quiet.It is a very beautiful regionvery quiet and safe and very close to Bogot√°.You can go for a walk to the Chingaza National Natural Parkwhere the water is born for Bogot√°.Guest access.The forest is beautiful and 300 m away there is a very clean and very cold water stream."Other things to note.It is recommended to bring boots and good raincoat to walk comfortably and warm clothes to be in the house.Its always nice to wear warm clothes and a raincoat.There are several very nice walks and walks in the region and sometimes very humid and cold.The walk to Chingaza is very closeit is beautiful and unique..!! You need to buy the tickets in advance to enter the Chingaza Natural National Park. I can present them with a foundation that also allows you to enter the park more easily and they have very good guides."

Title: Casa Cascada: a unique cabin with waterfall
Description: Casa Cascada is a unique cabin in the middle of the forest with a stuning waterfall just in front of the balcony. The place is located in a private green comunity with no neighbors. The place is perfect for couples who want to disconnect from the world and connect between them and nature. Get away from the hustle and bustle and enjoy this quiet cabin in the middle of the forest. Follow us on insta! @casa.cascadaThe spaceThe space.Casa Cascada is a wood cabin built right over a serene waterfalland is a perfect private romantic getaway. The studio-sized cabin features a king bedas well as a larger hanging covered patio suited for entertaining or lounging. The lounge chair on the terrace is a perfect place to sit and read while listening to the sounds of the waterfall and creek.

Title: Magical Jungle Tree House with Hot Springs
Description: No children under 5 years of age for safety reasons. The hand-crafted Magical Jungle Tree House is one of 3 casitas and 2 treehouses at the Bio Thermales natural resort organically integrated into our 35 acre rainforest. Guests enjoy free 24 hour access to the 12 natural hot and cool springs pools of various temperatures and rainforest trails.The spaceThe space.The Magical Jungle Tree House is handcrafted with many artistic wood work and furniturea tile bathroom with a flash on-demand water heater for the showerand a nicely laid out and well equipped kitchen. It is set back a bit in the rainforestbut still close to the hot and cool springs. The balcony almost completely surrounds the tree house.Our hot springs are ancient ‚Äúdeep Earth‚Äù sources that bubble up through the rainforest floorladen with mineral-rich waters that have been in the Earth for at least 10,000 years. Our waters are rich in bicarbonatescalcium and magnesiumlow in sulfurand slightly acidic -- qualities shared by many of the world\s best hot springs.Five of our 9 organic form hot springs pools are located in the rainforestand 4 hot springs pools as well as a small and a large cool spring swimming pool are located in a meadowsurrounded by rainforest (see below for more information). The small and large cool springs pools both have water slidesand there is a small water slide in one of the shallow and moderate temperature pools for small children.Note on wifi -- we have a fiber optic cable to the main office that is about 98% reliablebut had to install repeaters to bring wifi signal to the casitas and tree houses. The repeaters are not as reliableespecially in bad weather. Howeverwe can help you send or receive email one way or another via the fiber optic cable.The Treehouse is built to strict Costa Rican building codes.To see all our listingsincluding the Colibri Casita3please go to https://www.airbnb.com/users/show/54000 and on the left side of the page three listings will show. At the bottom of themclick on ‚ÄúView all listings‚Äù to see all 5 listings.You can check availability of each accommodation by clicking on the "Calendar" tab above the main photo on each listing.Treehouse features: (see floor-plan for all details):.‚Ä¢ Perched high among the rainforest treesthe Tree House has large screened areas for circulation of naturally cooler breezes. It also has fans.‚Ä¢ All onsite hot springs and recreation activities includedincluding 24 hour access to the hot springs and cool spring swimming pools.‚Ä¢ The Treehouse2 is all on one floorwith a Queen sized bed with orthopedic mattress and hypoallergenic bedding.‚Ä¢ There is also a twin-sized bed that can double a a settee with hypoallergenic bedding.‚Ä¢ Hand-crafted rustic furniture from naturally harvested trees on the land.‚Ä¢ Main floor kitchen with refrigeratormicro-waverice-cookercoffee makerbasic kitchenware.‚Ä¢ Bathroom with flash on-demand hot-water heater.‚Ä¢ Wrap around balcony for relaxing and animal and bird watching.‚Ä¢ Laundry service at $5 charge per load.‚Ä¢ Short walk to rainforest and hot springs pools.‚Ä¢ No telephone or television.‚Ä¢ WiFi internet for your laptop -- if reliable 24 hour internet is essential to youplease message us for suggestions.‚Ä¢ Hosts Kathy and Bernie live onsite.‚Ä¢ Languages: EnglishSpanishGerman.One time $10 cleaning fee; thereafter housecleaning services every 3 days are free.Bio Thermales Hot Springs features:.‚Ä¢ Our hot springs pools are all-natural mineral water just as it flows from the Earth.‚Ä¢ Rainforest Pools from 90¬∞ - 102¬∞F (31¬∞ - 40¬∞C).‚Ä¢ Grotto Pools in meadow flow from the 104¬∞F/42¬∞C source pool onward into two larger and progressively cooler pools which are handicap-accessible and suitable for small children.‚Ä¢ Cool Pool in meadow is 90¬∞F/31¬∞C mineral water flowing from the thermal creek.‚Ä¢ 2 Swimming pools with continuous flow of natural cold spring water (88 degrees) - one is 1 to 1.5 meters deepand the larger is 1.6 meters deep.‚Ä¢ Bathhouse in meadow with handicap accessible bathrooms and showers.‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúRanchos‚Äù ‚Äì roofed tables with concrete floors and grills for picnics.Other Activities on our 35 acre rainforest reserve:.‚Ä¢ Bird-watching: many types of toucansoropendulasparrotshummingbirdsand the rare green macaw.‚Ä¢ Rainforest: enjoy it from the casita porch or hot springs poolstake easy walks on paths or more adventurous hikes.‚Ä¢ Fossils ‚Äì enjoy our collection or hunt (gently) for your own.‚Ä¢ Wildlife: two-toed slothsiguanascapuchin and mantled howler monkeystree frogsbirdsbutterfliesand many others.We are a 45 minute drive from the many activities in Fortuna and Volcano Arenal -- such as ziplineshanging bridgeswhite water raftingslow river floats or kayaking through wildlife sanctuaries -- or a 1.5 hour drive to La Paz Waterfall Gardens and Volcano Poas.Bio Thermales Hot Springs is open to the public for day use of the hot springsand most of our day visitors are Costa Ricansso you may also meet new Tico friends. Bio Thermales is generally not crowdedhoweverexcept on major holidays and Sundays.Food/Meals: The Tree House has a kitchen. There are many restaurants and a good supermarket within a 15 minute drive. Traditional Costa Rican meals can be delivered from a local caterer for very reasonable prices (Costa Rican food is tasty but not spicy). Otherwisefor those without carswe can call a taxi or try to synchronize a food shopping trip when we go to town for errands.Three hours of daylight are needed to safely drive here from the SJO airport before sunset at 5:30 pm. The drive through mountainous cloud forests is splendid in daylightbut prone to fog and rainespecially at nightcreating hazardous visibility conditions after dark. Finding our countryside location will also be far easier if you arrive the first time before sunset. If your plane lands in the morning to noon at SJO airport ‚Äì or 11:00 am at Liberia airport -- you can drive here directly from the airport. Otherwiseit is safer to book a room near the airport on your first nightor ask us to book a private driver and have a rental car delivered at no extra charge.Last night in Costa Rica:.Driving directly to the airport on the same day is possible if you book a flight in the afternoon. Please be aware that you must be at the airport 2.5 hours before departure. If you have an early morning departing flight it is basically necessary to stay near the airport on the night before.Guest access.Guests enjoy free access to the hot springsswimming pools and rainforest trails from 9 am to 10 pm.Laundry: we have a full laundry facility and we will do laundry for $5 per load (washdry and fold).Other things to note.Day visitors and groups are permitted entrance to use the hot springs and cool springs pools from 9 am to 6 pm. There are usually more day visitors on weekendsespecially Sundaysand we recommend booking week days for more tranquility and privacy. If guests book a longer reservation that includes a Sundaywe recommend planning a day tour in the many nearby activities on Sundays. Day visitors must leave by 6 pmand only casita and Tree House guests may use the pools after 6 pm and enjoy unlimited access to the poolswith the exception of no nighttime use of the forest poolsand cleaning schedule as noted above.We recommend either ordering a catered dinner in advance for your first evening and/or next morning breakfastor buying and bringing groceries to cook because we are 4 km from the main paved road and driving after dark is highly discouraged until drivers have quite some experience on Costa Rican roads. Alsomost guests prefer to settle in upon arrival and not to have to get back in the car and drive out to dinner. We provide a Catering Menu to each guest once reservedbut the caterer requires advance notice of selected meals and TIMES guests would like meals delivered. We do not have a liquor license and guests must bring their own beer/wine/rum etc. The tap water is safe to drinkand we sell soft drinksfruit juicesand other non-alcohol beveragessnacks and ice cream.

Title: Private wooden cabin with power and double bed
Description: In our woods50 meters from the parking lotyou get your own tree house. Input power for charging mobilecomputeretc. We made your bed.You will have access to hot water so that the outdoor shower will be comfortable.The fire pan is ready outside. Electric heater in the cabin.Very good breakfast on the door can be ordered.For other cooking; bring primus or similar. We have plastic storage boxes for food etc. A really nice placeromantic. And completely private.The spaceThe space.A great starting point for RomsdalseggenRampestreken and via ferrata at √Öndalsnes. Ice fjord is a gem!We always respond quickly to messages and are excited to welcome you."Guest access.You have the forest to yourselfromantically and privately.Own electric heater in the cabinso it doesnt get cold.Parking between the garage and the black main house upon arrival.Hot water can be found in the tap in front of the black main house."Other things to note.New this year:.* Sauna! We offer the riverside saunathis one you can easily book yourself via our websites. There is also an outdoor shower with fresh river water included in the bath rental. Good cookdaring to swim in the river?* Breakfast in bed? We offer homemade rollseggs from local farmcoffeebutterjuicehappy salmon and other snacks - high qualitylots organic - delivered in a great picnic basket at the gate of the tree house every morning at 8.30. 290 kr per person. To be ordered no later than 5 pm the day before.

Title: Tahkuna tree-house
Description: A uniquecozy and modern tree houselocated in a picturesque pine forestwill envelope you in peace and quiet and bring unforgettable memories. You will find yourself surrounded by naturewith easy access to secludedendless beaches and crystal-clear sea. The rustling of treessinging of birds and star gazing in the night will be all you need to forget the busy rhythm of city life. You will explore ancient lighthouses and see many other unique and abundant sights of Hiiumaa Island!The space"The space.Sorrythere is no electricity now. You will find comfort and peace in our cozy house. The lower spacious floor contains a kitchen with all the necessitiessuch as a gas grilla washstanda dinner tableas well as a hammock. The upper deck is a relaxation zone with two chaise lounges and a small table. Inside the living room is a fireplace/wood burner which can be used for cooking or boiling water. The room also has a double bed with a pull-out bed extension for two more peoplea table with chairs and a storage chest. Big windows offer majestic views of the forest. The house is insulatedtheres a fireplace insideso you will be warm even in the colder months of spring and autumn. Electricity is supplied by solar panels. A lovely fire pit with benches is set up on a meadow near the house. Close bythere are an outside shower cabin and a toilet. You will find supermarketsbarscafesa banka pharmacyand a hospital in picturesque town of K√§rdla 15 km away. The sea is an easy 800 m walk from the house.In addition to the wonderful forest and the seathe island has a lot of amazing things to see - ancient lighthousesthe old Suuremeyza estatean open-air ethno-museum (an old peasant farm)there are also tennis courtsa golf coursehorsesexcursions to seals and etc. and so on.The cozy town of K√§rdla (15km) with supermarketsbarscafesrental cars and bicycles.All sorts of festivals are held on the island (jazzclassical musicetc.)Cafe DayJan Daycraft fair and many others.Also yacht parkingbeaches for surfers and kiters.We hope you will enjoy staying at our tree house and have a great time on the magic Hiiumaa Island!"

Title: A TREEHOUSE! Adventure! Support Organic Farming!
Description: CozyRusticAuthentic Treehouse for two by a babbling brook. Full Bed w/Linens & Towels. Shared Bathrooms.11 acre Organic Vegetable Farm supplies local restaurantsFrench Broad Food Co-opand Farmers Market.The spaceThe space.RusticCozy Treehouse has a full-size bed. Candlelight adds to the memorable experience. There is no electricity in the Treehouse. Shared Bathroom. Fire Ring. Charcoal grill. Two Bathrooms w/Showers (Outdoor Shower is closed in winter)Guest access.Guests are welcome and encouraged to walk all 11 acres of our organic farmincluding the woodlotthe creekand the vegetable fields. Access to the greenhouses is restricted. Your room completely private. The farm itself is shared with other guests and farm family.Other things to note.Common courtesy please.Do NOT throw cigarette buttsgarbagecansbottle capsetc in the fire pits!.There is a dumpster at the Farm Entrance.PETS must be friendly to other dogs and people.Pets CANNOT be left unattended while you are off the farm - if you leavethey go with you.If you consume alcoholit must be confined to your personal space. All guests and residents must be enjoying themselves. Any excessive noiseobnoxious behavioror general disrespect will not be tolerated. You will be put out for drunkenness. No refund. I am sole judgejuryand Hangman if has to go that far.Smoking allowed on the farm. Stay a reasonable distance away from buildingscropsand other guests. No smoking - of any substance - in the Barn or the Treehouse - or the Bathrooms. No butts on groundever.WARNING.Under North Carolina lawthere is no liability for an injury to or death of a participant in an agritourism activity conducted at this agritourism location if such injury or death results from the inherent risks of the agritourism activity. Inherent risks of agritourism activities includeamong othersrisks of injury inherent to landequipmentand animalsas well as the potential for you to act in a negligent manner that may contribute to your injury or death. You are assuming the risk of participating in this agritourism activity.

Title: Nights of Cimes - La Grande Cabane du Mauret
Description: Unusual accommodation open all year round : dream cabinsjust for youperched 10 meters in the trees (easy and secure access). Isolated from everythingcalm is guaranteed for an unforgettable night in the heart of the forestas a loverfamily or friendsideal as a gift to those we love.The space"The space.Perched between two magnificent treesthe large Mauret hut is both comfortable and rustic. Access is from a wooden staircase and then from two walkways fully secured by a net that leads directly to a large terrace. Inside many windows create a bright atmosphere and allow you to fully enjoy the surroundings. And its great asset is its second terrace perched on a part of the roofto fully live this unique adventure.It is equipped with dry toiletskitchenette with gas and sinkgas heatingtables and chairs inside and on the terracesolar electricity (lamps).This cabin doesnt have a shower. We provide towels and gloves for a rustic toilet at the kitchen sink.The living area has two convertible sofas. Upstairs there is a large room under the roofs. In allthe hut is designed to accommodate up to seven people in a hotel formulathat is to say clean and prepared beds.. you do not have to bring any sheets and breakfast is provided."

Title: Treehouse 10 minutes from Biarritz
Description: Near the sea and the mountaincome and relax in a refuge 10 minutes from Biarritz. Perched on stilts at more than 3 msurrounded by trees in a lush gardenthe hut is fully equipped for you to enjoy a great comfort in the middle of nature. The fully-equipped summer kitchen is under the hut and the toilet is at its foot. You will wake up to bird songoptional organic breakfast at ‚Ç¨5‚Ç¨9 or ‚Ç¨12/pers. except from April 16 to May 2.The spaceThe space.Come and try the unusual and poetic experience of living in a warm and comfortable hut.High quality king size bedding of 180.Linens and towels are of course included in the service.Washable slippers are available for your stay.For the toiletyou have the choice between the cosy of a bathtub inside and the exotic of an outdoor shower (but under shelter) .A bottle of wine from our reserve or local apple juice is offered.Ranked 2 Star furnished tourist accommodation.From April 16 to May 2 without optional breakfast service.Please read the house rules in full .Guest access.You will also enjoy the lush gardenfrom sunny days a ping pong tablea slackline in summera barbecue..A small "grocery store" is available on request with local and/or organic products.Possibility to buy bottle of champagne.Other things to note.A radiator will warm up chilly nightsand a ventilator will cool down hot days.We do not accept credit cards for the payment of breakfasts or possible cleaning fees ( only cashcheck ).Please take a minute to read the rules of procedure .For breakfastyou can choose the French breakfast at ‚Ç¨9 (tea or chocolate coffeetoast with honey jam butterhot croissantmilk specialtyorange juice or local apple) or Canadian breakfast at ‚Ç¨12 (the same as the French with pancakes or eggs to choose from) or the autonomous menu at ‚Ç¨5 (like the French breakfast without the croissant or the milk specialty) arranged the day before in the summer kitchen. All 3 organic except croissants. (EXCEPT for April 16 to May 2when the rental will be autonomous )

Title: Providence area TreeHouse Farm Stay
Description: Uniquecharmingspaciousprivate tree house overlooking working diversified family farm. Enjoy solitude surrounded by only the sounds of nature and our farm animals. Woodstove heats the space for cozy 4 season get-aways. Fire wood and lanterns are provided. This is a popular off-the-grid space. Please look at our Vintage Airstream and Providence Area Camper if you require additional space or electricity.Ask about our special whole weekend or multiple night pricing!The space"The space.This is a spacious though rustic off the grid accommodation in the trees overlooking our farm fields to the south and the forest to the north. Fresh breezes blow through the open windows in the warm weather and the wood stove keeps the space cozy and warm in the cooler seasons. If lightair and views are what you are looking for this is the place. Working sustainable farm: vegetablesdairy goatslivestock guardian dogscatsheritage hogspoultryhorsessheep and a water buffalo! Please leave your pets home so as not to stress our animals.If you need more space please see our other listings; Vintage Airstream and 28 camper."Guest access.The tree house has no electricity (lanterns are provided) or plumbing. The Tree House is marked with a sign on the driveway. There is no lock on the door. There is a composting toilet close bya spacious outdoor shower on the pond side of our house and a "real bathroom" available in the house for cold-weather guests. There is a charcoal grill for use by our guests. You must provide the charcoal and ice.Other things to note.As a Tree House in the woodson a working farmplease anticipate that u might experience some insects and hear various animal sounds. Please bring insect repellent if u think you might want it. Expect that u will hear the sounds of the cricketskatydidstree frogssong birdswood peckersowlscoyotesroosterpeacockscatsdogs or other animals. If u would like to explore the farmfieldswoodsetcyou might want to bring boots depending on the weather..There are several breakfast spots in close proximity. Both Providence and Warren RI are great destination spots and meccas of great restaurants. We are happy to give you recommendations.Our daughter calls the Tree House home when she is on the farm. You will be staying in her personal space with her personal furnishings and possessions. Please be respectful!.If the TH is not available when you want itplease check out our Vintage Airstream and Working Farm Providence Area Campers

Title: Caeiro's Tree by the Beach
Description: Beautiful self-built wooden tree house situated on top of a horizontally-grown pine tree. Only a 5 minute walk from the sea which borders the property. Two skylights allow you to enjoy the treesthe blue sky and the birds above. Plenty of privacy and space around the house and a sunbed for lazing about. The land is part of the natural parkhas stunning views across the ocean & amazing sunsets.The cabin is decorated with handmade detailshas a comfortable double beda fridge & gas stove.The space"The space.Directly- on the sea-front this self-sustained Eco-treehouse is a 20 min walk away to nearby Foz beach and it is the last sea-front accommodation between Lisbon and Cabo Espichel. The rocky sea pools are only 5 min. away.The treehouse is the proud highlight of the Cantinho Alberto Caeiros project celebrating the poetry & philosophy of our famous poet: Fernando Pessoa. The love for nature which he expresses can be found in this lovely space in the middle of a protected nature area. We let nature speak for itself without the need for any fancy adornmentskeeping its wilderness and raw beauty. The shower outside is sun-warmedusing recycled scaffolding material and wood. We try to recycle and up-cycle: we used old wine bottles for lamps and restored an old Oak-tree door. The wooden bed is self-built and the kitchen counter has a grand view of the trees.The tree house is run on solar energy (12v.).Finishing touches are hand made details such as the cushions from local wool.Key points:.-rocky sea pools where you can let the waves crash over you .-Located on top of a rare horizontally grown & typically Portuguese pine tree.-Tablechairs and hammock amongst the trees.-Unforgettable sunsets.-All basic amenities available: 2-pit gas stove for cookinga fridge and your own sunwarmed outdoor shower (cold in winter).-The (dry) compost toilet is shared.-The tree house is situated within 15.5 acres (6.3 hectare) of agricultural land which gives you unparalleled privacy and sense of nature.-All beaches are nearby.-The Village has a small supermarketa bakerya coffee/lunch place and 2 restaurants. We have good contacts and are happy to advice and book you a table.Location and transport:.-Merely 40 minutes from Lisbon. With your own car you have greater autonomy to explore the area.-Otherwise a bus from Sete Rios or an Uber will get you here as well.Please note there is no ATM in the village."Guest access.You have access to all the land.The main entrance is accessed via a good dirt road from the village of Azoia. You can exit the bottom of the land to go down to the rock pools and walk to the beach."Other things to note.Please note that under NO circumstances we will allow BBQs / open fires during the hot & dry summer months.The water on the land is good enough to cook with but we advice not to drink it. Bring enough drinking water."Licence numberLicence number.Exempt

Title: Creek Treehouse near Helen, GA
Description: This treehouse is one of a kind and made out of recycled materials! It is a secluded place to relax and be completely surrounded by nature. There is no water or electricity and it is located about a 1/2 mile from our check-in office/parking. Cars are not allowed at the camping sitesand parking is available at the main office. It is hike in we will provide shuttle when you check in and check out to get you and your gear to and from the site!The spaceThe space.The treehouse is a cozy place with one bedroomtwo bedsand deck for relaxing. On main level is one king size mattressand in the loft is a full size mattress. Please be aware that there is no water or electricity. The treehouse is in a remote location. Commercial vehicles are not allowed at the site. You must leave your car at our main office 1/2mi awayand then hike in.Guest access.Guests cannot drive their car to the treehouse. Parking is available in a gravel lot at our main office 1/2mi away. During normal business hourswe will transport guests one time at check-in and once at check-out. Any other time you must walk.Other things to note.This is just like camping except in the trees! We only provide the space and the beds. Please plan to bring with you anything that you would need on a regular camping trip--i.e. linens/sleeping bags/pillowslights/lanternscooking toolsetc. We do have firewood available to purchase for $5 a bundleor you are more than welcome to bring your own!

Title: ‚òÖTake to the skies in a Lov Nid‚òÖ
Description: "Come spend an unusual night in our treehouse : the LOVNID.A funny wooden sphere for 2close to nature : an unusual bed and breakfastideal for lovers..Our guesthouse is at 55 Beynac Road in the village of Lembras10 minutes from the center of Bergerac.www.bellevue-cottage.com"The space"The space.Less than 3 hours from BordeauxToulouseLa RochelleClermont Ferrand.Near Bergeraccome and spend an unusual night in our cabin perched the LOVNID¬Æ. Nestled in our parkthis wooden bubble awaits you for a stay in harmony with nature.It all starts with a walkway of about ten metersthen a terrace perched 3 meters high and you discover a cozy nest amid birds and treesfor a getaway for two.Its transparent dome and portholes will give you a magical nightwith the starry canopy for bed sky.A dedicated bathroom is available nearby.Back on land in the morningwell have a hearty breakfast.Some practical information:.* In the current contextadditional precautions have been put in placeparticularly regarding disinfection of frequently touched surfaces.* The Lov Nid is a cabin designed for up to 2 people (adult or child).* Inside just a bed : impossible to eat.* The cabin and the entire property are really non-smoking and non-smoking.* No waterelectricityheatingor air conditioning in the cabin.* During the summerthe temperature inside the cabin can exceed 25¬∞.* In winterit can be cool or even cold indoors.* Use a mosquito repellent if you attract them!"

Title: Rocky River Cotton Treehouse
Description: "Come stay for a Weekend getaway in a rustic treehouse on the heart of the Rocky River. We are located south of Cottonville on Plank RdNorwood. Treehouse has Queen size mattress in loft & queen size futon in living area. Comes with heatacdirectvmini frigm/wWeber grillshowertoilet and an outdoor fire pit for your convenience. Enjoy outdoor porch sitting listening to the sounds of water flowing over rocks. Theres a shelter for parking or camping. 4 Kayaks and 1 canoe available"The spaceThe space.Prices include access to canoe and 4 kayaks. During summer monthsweather permitting.You can launch a canoe or one of 4 kayaks just steps away from the treehouse and float the rocky river. 2 landings: one located about 45 minutes away or another thats approx 4 hours away for your convenience.Fire pit outside for small campfire or cooking.Other things to note.I tell everyone that comes to stayplease prepare as if you are going camping.I provide bed linens (no towels) a beda showera microwavea coffee makera sinka toileta charcoal grill and a fire pit. Those are the only things that are included with the rental.

Title: Newport, Maine Lakeside Treehouse Near ATV Trail
Description: "This cozy treehouse is for outdoor lovers. It sits feet from the 4288 acre Sebasticook Lake; great for kayak or canoe tripsswimmingor bass fishing. On the other side were right on the 4 Season Rail Trail; great for hikingbikingor ATV riding. Close (1 +- mile) to stores and restaurants. Were also close enough to almost anywhere in the state for day trips. Travel to the oceanAcadia National ParkMoosehead Lake AreaBaxter State Parkand more. Let your Maine adventure begin."The space"The space.Ever wanted to stay in a treehouse? This space is not very big but it makes up for size with a breathtaking view of the lake. It is not fancy but its comfortable. You can bring your ATV. We have 2 kayaks or a canoe for you to use. There is plenty of space for parking of your vehicle and trailer. Theres a firepit with wood providedpicnic tableand BBQ grill. We book only during the summer months. We start booking in June and end about mid September."

Title: LYON COUNTRY HOUSE , LYON TREEHOUSE & SPA
Description: "Lyon country House is a 3 hectare property by the Sa√¥ne just across from Paul Bocuses. We offer bed and breakfasts and a luxurious detached cottage and very soon a cabin perched 6 meters high among trees . The perched hut at the end of the park will have stunning views of the Sa√¥ne with a sublime sunset.It should come as no surprise that you encounter deer or sheep on the property even 15 minutes from Bellecour !"The spaceThe space.Cabin for 4 people comprising a kitchenettea dry toileta bar for dining with 4a lounge area with two bench beds with 180 degree views of the sa√¥nea mezzanine of 11m2 with queen size bed with plunging views of the sa√¥nea terrace of 12m2 with weber barbecue. As the cabin is an ecological project in total connection with naturewe have provided a water reserve for the kitchen and small evening toilet.For those wishing shower accesswe have a dedicated shack in THE SPA area that is automatically privatized for shacks in the evening from 8pm to 9PM. This private access to THE SPA is included in the price of the cabin as well as the breakfast delivered in the morning in a pannier that you climb up to the terrace thanks to a pulley.

Title: Lake Joseph Waterfront Cottage
Description: Lakeside cottage at the end of a private road. This charming 3 bedroom (sleeps 6) plus bunkie (sleeps 5) with southern exposure right on the water is the ideal location for a summer family getaway. A newly painted and refreshed cottage with a large deck perfect for evening supper or drinks.Outside there is plenty of space to sit and soak up the sun. Along 300 feet of water frontage sits a large boathouse with plenty of furniture to lounge and relax or jump off the docks.The spaceThe space.The kitchen has many amenitiesincluding stainless steel appliancesdishwashertoastercoffee makercappuccino makerand an ample supply of dishware. Outside of the kitchen is a screened in gazebo which is a perfect spot for dinner.*** 7 day minimum Friday to Friday check in and check out required***We will provide a clean set of sheets and towelskitchen towels and beach towels. A cleaning crew will turn over the cottage prior to your arrival. If you require a change of sheets or additional cleaning throughout the week this too can be arranged for an additional $400 cleaning fee.***Please noteyou are responsible to take your garbage and other waste/recycling with you. You will be charged $20 per garbage bag left behind.*** Paper products: the cottage will provide you enough to get started but vacationers must supply their own.*** Life vests are supplied. Vacationers must bring their own children‚Äôs life jackets due to safety and liability concerns.***Security deposit is $2,500 per booking.

Title: A Little Closer to Heaven Primitive Tree house
Description: This little tree house is primitive with no electricity and no water but has a bath house nearby. This is tent camping in a tree house. Located behind the historic R.M. Brooks Storeit is the perfect place to find peace and beauty . Perfect for hikers. Rest in the huge branches of this nearly 100 year old Oak Tree. A Queen bed awaits you for your restful nights sleep. Underneath you can picnic at the table or swing in the swing that hangs below. This is the perfect place to unplug.The spaceThe space.There is a queen size bed and two chairs for sitting and relaxing. A small table with two chairs for playing cards or eating. A dresser for storing clothes with a mirror above it. Two night stands on each side of beds. Very spacious and easy to move around in.

Title: The Willow in Treehouse Grove at Norton Creek
Description: Treehouse Grove is a Treehouse Resort designed and built by the ‚ÄúTreehouse Master‚ÄùPete Nelson. The Willow Treehouse is the most private Treehouse in the lower grove and can hear the constant roar of the local favoriteNorton Creek. This Treehouse features a large swing under the treehouse while upholding the luxury creature comforts you‚Äôve become accustom tosuch as high-speed Wi-Fia showertoiletheating and coolingkitchenette and of courseyour favorite streaming channels.The spaceThe space.The Willow is your perfect Treehouse getaway in Gatlinburg! As you enter the Treehouseyou will find the well-equipped kitchenette with a mini fridgemicrowavecoffee potutensils and murphy table for 4. With a queen bed in the master and a queen bed in the loftthis Treehouse comfortably sleeps 4. If you are fortunate enough to stay during the Great Smoky Mountain fall or winteryou are in for a treat. Snow occasionally turns the forest into a picturesque winter wonderland. Stand beneath the covered view deck and watch the cascading snowfall accumulate around you while enjoying a steaming cup of hot cocoa. Prepare a meal or another drink in the stocked kitchenette and fully enjoy each moment. Book your stay today!Guest access.All Guest at Treehouse Grove will have easy-to-use entry keypads into their Treehouse. Title: Secluded, Romantic Tree House Retreat
Description: Pamoon is a contemporary style treehouse sleeping 2with stunning views of Pigeon Mountain. Nestled within the tranquil hills and valleys of the Appalachian Mountains of North-West Georgiait is surrounded by natural beauty and panoramic backdrops within its very own 15 acres of private woodland and walking trails.The spaceThe space.For a video tour of the Tree House\Pamoon\visit our website:.lifeshouldbe.netPLEASE NOTE: We are unable to accommodate check-in on the following days; Christmas EveChristmas DayNew Years DayMemorial DayJuly 4thLabor DayThanksgiving & Sundays.Pamoon boasts a light and airy open plan living space with modernfully equipped kitchen. The bedroom has its own screened in porch for relaxing and taking in those stunning views. Our beautifully decorated bathroom has a full size shower with luxurious bathrobes for your comfort.You will find the gas bbq on the rear deck along with seating and sun loungers. Our beautifulcalming Japanese Ofuro soaking tubsituated on a separate relaxation area amongst the treesis a big hit with all of our guests.This heated cedar tub has no jetswhich leads to a beautifully calming experiencethe perfect way to cleanse the mind and soul in the natural surroundings. A tin roof covering this space adds to the experience when rain or snow decides to fall.Take time to walk the peaceful wooded trails on your secluded 15 acres that are home to deerturkey and the beautiful Red Cardinals.Life should be..living alongside nature.In the evenings as the sun setsspend time by the fire pitperfect for roasting s\mores and relaxing with a loved onesipping cocktails and enjoying quiet conversation.Whatever you choose to do with your timejust relaxing or hiking and exploringrest assuredyou will make many wonderful memories at Pamoon. Our hidden gem will offer you peaceseclusion and privacy for your well-being and the chance to just sit backtake a moment and re-charge.Our property management team are close by if you have any issues or queries during your stay ‚Äì we are very lucky to have them as our neighbours.For your arrival informationthe tree house is situated at the end of a long driveway. The first part of the drive is shared with our two other vacation homes but then splinters off with sign postingleading to your very own hideaway in the trees.Amenities include:- Covered Japanese Ofuro Soaking Tubheated all year round (the water is replacedand the tub is sanitised ready for each new guest).Please Note: This is not a traditional hot tub/jacuzzi and has no jets.- Bedroomsleeps 2Comfortable mattress and good quality linens. Hairdryer provided.- Open plan living area/kitchen.- Wireless internetWiFi. Due to our rural location the internet speed can be slower than in urban areas.- 43" 4K Ultra HD Resolution Smart TV with \HULU\ streaming service.- Fully-equipped kitchenfull-size stovefridge/freezermicrowavedishespotscutleryGlasswaredishwasherCoffee maker (Keurig & Drip) and toaster.- Dining table for two.- Gas BBQ on Rear Deck (gas & utensils provided).- Fire Pit and Seating (wood provided)- Outdoor Hook and Ring game- Laundry closet with full-size separate washer and dryer.- All Linens/towels and soaking tub towels provided.- Largeenclosed shower unit with detachable shower head. Unisex bathrobes provided.- Fully furnished throughout by a professional interior designer.Note : Pamoons\ interior and exterior has been designed with adults in mind. Our home has no child safety locks on doors/windows and the soaking tub area is not gated.Guest access.Parking on Site"Other things to note.Pamoons interior and exterior has been designed with adults in mind. Our home has no child safety locks on external or internal doors and the soaking tub area is not gated.The Japanese soaking tub is a heatedcalming experience. It does not have jets like a traditional hot tub. It is emptied and sanitized after each departing guest."

Title: The Treehouse of Borgo Stazione Salionze
Description: You can experience the thrill of sleeping at a height of 5 metresamong the leaves of the great linden tree.The suite is built entirely of wood and furnished with natural materialsin line with our eco-friendly philosophy.A very comfortable king size bedan area with an exposed shower and bathtuband a living area with a sofa bedLED TVa corner infusionsand a minibar. The terraceexclusive area for guests of the suiteis an extraordinary observatory of the sky and the river landscape.The spaceThe space.Uniqueness and hospitality in an old stationreturned to life to live a green vacationon two wheelssurrounded by extraordinary nature.You can choose the type that best fits your needsone of the rooms built in the double or family stationa mini apartment or the Tree House Suite 5 meters from the ground.You will find a full service dedicated to cyclistsand discover the territory with a sustainable approach by renting electric bicycles or bringing your own.The outdoor pool in the heart of the village will allow you to relax in the reflecting body of the skyyou can choose to relax your muscles after a day spent cycling in the heated whirlpool (up to 35¬∞ in winter) or simply stay in the sun on our solarium.A SPA area for exclusive use can end your days of relaxation (service included for the Tree Suite).Guest access.An indoor parking lot will welcome your carbeing a little close to the A4 Peschiera exit (Valeggio direction) it will be easy to find us along Via del Garda on the right side.Other things to note.WANT A SURPRISE Or ARE YOU CELEBRATING A SPECIAL DATE?.We can offer support and suggestions: a bottle of bubblya cake or a bouquet of flowersyour favorite photosor a romantic setup.DO YOU WANT TO BOOK YOUR BIKE ON THE DAY OF YOUR ARRIVAL?.E-bikesmusclesmountain bikesor racing bikes?Send us a message! (services for a fee).

Title: Full bath, Seclusion, Mtn View- Kitchen, Fireplace
Description: Woodberry‚Äôs Farm Treehouse! Retreat to total seclusion and privacy at the far side of our 94 acre farm. Tucked away in the trees on a ridge is a fully functional380 sf treehouse with a small kitchenfull bath with double shower heads. Relax on the wrap around decksoak in the distant mountain views. Hang the hammocks from below or fire up the pit for s‚Äômores. Lounge on the sofa in front of the gas fireplaceplay some board games or watch a movie. Cook together or hike to the on-site lake.The spaceThe space.Guests will have the privacy and exclusive use of the entire treehouse. Located at the back end of our 94 acre farm which neighbors several thousand undeveloped acresguests are guaranteed a true getaway. When you step through the Frenchmahogany doors you are faced with a 9‚Äôx20‚Äô span of glass wall looking out over the valley to the distant mountains. The 380 square foot floor plan has a 5x8 full bath with double head shower tiled in antiquereclaimed roofing slate. The jade basin sink sits atop a real tree root retrofitted to accommodate it. The kitchenette is also tiled in the reclaimed roofing slate and has a mini fridgemicrowavetoastergas stove with small oven and coffee service. The dining space is graced with a beautiful Italian marble bar table with a reclaimed wood base. The cozy living area has a relaxing gas fireplace and the sofa is super comfortable. Stretch out in the king size bed with memory foam mattress. The wrap around deck features a longe areaa high top dining set. Grab the hammocks and hang them under the treehouse or go for a hike and find your perfect spot. Guests are also welcome to take the short hike to our private four acre lake. Perfect spot for a picnic and you can use our canoes and paddles. Bring fishing gearif you like. You can catch and release or have a fish fry.

Title: Glamping at Deer Camp
Description: This is a complete glamping experience! Think tiny house. This 12x12 tree house is equipped with an outdoor kitchena table for twolounger and chairwifismart TV with NetflixHulu and showtimeHBO now. air conditioningboard gamesbookscomfy queen bedair conditionsgas logcoffeegreenhouse bathhouseand fire pit.It is located just 16.2 miles from Fall Creek Falls State Park and 9 miles from Savage Gulf Natural Area on the Cumberland Plateau.And now with an outdoor theater!The space"The space.This glamping experience will give you something to talk about for a long while. Close to great hiking trails in both Savage Gulf and Fall Creek Falls State Parksecluded in the woodsyet close (3 miles to dollar general and 12 mikes to Walmart) to a few groceries and gasif you love glampingyoull love it at Deer Camp!.The cabin is 12x12 and every piece of furniture has been specifically chosen for your experience. It is COZY!!! Besides the queen bed and loungertheres a table for twoa chaira gas log fireplacethrows and throw pillows to snuggle up in. Board games and books and a smart TV with Hulu and showtimeNetflixand HBOnow are the various forms of entertainmentor you can sit around the fire pit and make smores or roast hot dogs or just tell ghost stories. Or if you have the talentbring your guitar and play a few songs. Nowweve just added an outdoor theater: This is a nighttime experience with hammock chairscozy blanketspropane fire ringand big screen with projector and a amazon fire stick with all the shows and movies you love. This experience is available rain or moonlight and will be for use from March through December. Please turn off the propane fire ring when not using the theater.Coffee can be made in the 12 cup stainless percolator or the pour over method is available. Or make hot cocoa or hot tea.Showering offers its own experience in the greenhouse bathhouse with the on demandunlimited hot water camp shower. This is its own experience. Have you ever showered in a greenhouse? With a gas log fireplace?.And the entire camp is lit up with string lights. So even if you need a trip to the bathhouse at nightthe rock path is well lit when you turn on the porch light.Its glamping. All the feels of camping without the work. The camp kitchen is stocked with pans and paper plate and cups and utensilsyou have a warm bed to crawl intofirewood is provided for the fire pitcoffee and hot beverages are providedand soft towels in the bath house. All of the camping experience without camp neighbors and without the packing. Just bring your clothes and food and enjoy this unique experience!.And if you sit quietly on the porchyoure almost certain to see many forms of wildlife. If you dont see ityoull certainly hear the coyotes yipping and howling and the owls hooting. A bear sighting is possible as is a bob cat and / or coyote (both sighted in the middle of day running through camp) and seeing deer is almost a certainty. There are mountain lionthough they are the most reclusive of all.""Other things to note.There is cold running water in the outdoor kitchen via a spigot (and because its 8 off the groundonce you turn it onit takes about 5 seconds to get water). There is hot water in the bathhouse.You do have to cook outside.Camp platescupscooking pans and utensils are provided.There is a complete hot beverage station with coffeeteaand cocoa.A cooler and ice are provided.Its just almost an oxymoron: its a 12x12 but you have lots of space. Between the various stations inside the cabin to the fire pit to the outdoor kitchen and bathhousetheres plenty of living space.Yespets are allowed at Deer Camp. We do love and welcome fur babies! Howeverdue to the allergens of future guests and the extra cleaning that must donethere is a pet fee of $60 - $100 based on weight that is separate from the cleaning fee. Pets must remain on a leash per TN state law when outside. Pets are not be left alone inside the cabin. Please either take them with you or if you need to leave them behindtravel with a crate. We have very strict time constraints between guests and we do not have time to make these types of repairs in this time frame. Even the most well behaved fur babies experience anxiety when left alone in a strange place.Check in is 4pm Central Standard Time. Check out is at 11am Central Standard Time. This is not optional unless prior arrangements have been made as we have to have time to prepare for the next guests. And we do ask to please be respectful of these."

Title: Massanutten Rustic Cabin with Views
Description: COVID-19 UPDATE: We\re still open for guests. Place has been cleaned and disinfected with commercial-grade cleaning products.#############################A simpleyet comfortable small shaker cabin placed in the middle of the Massanutten Mountain with views to die for of the Shenandoah River and National Park. Wake up to the sight of the magnificent "Blue Ridge Mountains" and the town of LurayVA from 1,500 feet.The spaceThe space.We debated long and hard whether to list this place on airbnb. After allthis is our hideawaywith a view that regretfully only a few will ever get to enjoy. But because we love it so muchand in the spirit of the sharing economywe felt compelled to open its doors to others and allow you to experience the wonderful warmth that this small and rustic cabin will bring to your soulyour heart and your sight. While hereevery sense is liftedevery smell improvedevery sound a symphony.If you\re looking for modern comfort and the latest gadgetsthis is not your place. Insteadif you want to warm yourself upyou\ll need to place wood in the stove. If you want to check the latest stock pricesyou\ll need to call your broker because Internet is NOT available. If you want to watch TV in your roomplease look elsewhere.Howeverif you prefer to wake up to the most extraordinary sunrise in your lifesimply sleep on the futon couch and open up your eyes in the early morning. If you find delight while hearing the buzz of a hummingbirdjust place a few seeds in the balcony. If you want to reconnect with your inner selfseat in one of the shaker rocking chairspull up your legs and open that book you always wanted to complete. If you\re luckyyou may even see a black bear or two roaming around (no worriesthey are not dangerous).The Cabin is located at about 1,500 feet overlooking the Shenandoah Riverthe town of Lurayand the "Blue Ridge Mountains." The view is a feast to the eyesight. But don\t stop there. Visit the Luray Caverns6 minutes at the bottom of the hills. Hike to your heart\s content on the Massanutten (Stephen) Trail a mile above or in one of the dozens other nearby paths. Bring a road bike and challenge yourself to the top of the mountain. Go horse back riding. Explore the Virginia wine country. Or just..relax.Welcome to a place where time has finally slowed down!Other things to note.Q & A:Q: Why do you rent this place?.A: We use it one month per year at most. Why keep this jewel to ourselves? Please enjoy it as if it\s your place as well.Q: Why is there no Internet?.A: I work in the high-tech sector. I am connected 24/7. I wanted a place where time stands stillbe close to natureand could truly get away from it all. We want to share not only the placebut the experience as well.Q: What if I need something from you?.A: Just send me a text message or give me a ring. You\ll get my number after your booking is confirmed.Q: The fridge is very smallwill we starve to death?.A: Heyno drama here. Yesthe fridge is smallbut there is also an ice cooler you may use. Simply bring your own ice and please drain it before leaving. That should keep you alive for a bit longer :-)Q: Should I bring sheets and towels?.A: No worries. We will provide bedding and towelsblanketssoapshampoo and toilet paper. If you need anything elseplease let me know and I will do anything in my power to have it ready before your arrival.Q. Nice wood stovedo I can have to purchase firewood?.A. No need to do so. I usually provide plenty of firewood for my guests. You may find it in the back deck. Please cover the wood with the tarp after you\re done to protect it from the rain and allow other guests to warm themselves too :-)Q: I love this placecan I extend my stay?.A: If availablesureknock yourself out. Simply get to an internet cafe or use your smart phone and book again. But please contact me beforehand out of courtesy.Q: Great decorationwhat style is it?.A: Shaker style. From wikipedia"Shaker furniture is a distinctive style of furniture developed by the United Society of Believers in Christ\s Second Appearingcommonly known as Shakersa religious sect that had guiding principles of simplicityutility and honesty. Their beliefs were reflected in the well-made furniture of minimalist designs." We are not shakersbut we are guided by the same principles.Q. What\s the sleeping situation?.A. Wellyou\re welcome to sleep any way you\d like :-) But to be more specificthere are two bedroomsboth with full-size beds. One bedroom has a platform bed with a memory foam mattressand the other one a Murphy bed with a memory foam topper. There are also two full-size futons located next to the stove in the living room. If you\re not into futonsthere is also a comfy inflatable full-size bed found in the closet where the Murphy bed is. Please take your pick.Q. There are no bathroom faucets!.A. Mmmthat wasn\t a questionbut yes they\re there. These faucets and vanity were a DIY project of my own design using copper piping and shut-off valves and reclaimed wood. Just turn the valves one quarter of the way counterclockwise to open the water supply. Pretty coolhugh?Q. Is the Cabin self-sustainable?.A. Not yetbut I\m working on it. With your booking contributionI created a system to capture rain water to the cistern below (the mountain is dry and water is a precious commodity here)and eventually I will install solar panels on the roof. Currentlyall waste water goes into a septic tankso as soon as I implement the above stepsthe Cabin will technically be able to be off-grid.Q. What other environmental measures have you implemented?.A. In addition to capturing water from rain and eventually energy from the sunI have renovated the bathroom and kitchen using reclaimed woodsome of it from a nearby old farm. The dish and body soaps and most house-cleaning products are environmentally-friendly to help natural decomposition of waste water in the septic system. The floor is made up of natural cork and woodand the entire place was recently re-insulated to improve energy efficiency. If you\d like to know more about our eco-effortsplease contact me.Q. Why are there so many water jugs in the kitchen?.A. Drinking water in colorful jugsas well as the 5-gal dispenser just outside the kitchencomes from a nearby natural water spring (best tasting water I ever had). I leave plenty of it for you because TAP water is NOT potable. In factI ask my guests to be mindful of tap water usage because there is no well or city-piped water source. Insteadwater is collected to a cistern below from rain or trucked in (by me) if need be. It is therefore a precious commodity. Simply shut off faucets when not in usebe careful not to leave the toilet runningand take shorter showers if possible. That\s it! :-)Q. How is the house heated?.A. The main source of heat is the wood stove. You\ll be surprise how efficient this rustic appliance is. Depending on the tempit may take a couple of hours to bring the thermometer up to your standardso exercise a little patience. There is a heat-infused fan and a tea pot on top of the stove. The fan will propagate the heat efficiently and the tea pot (with water) will act as a natural humidifiermaking you more comfortable. In additionthere is a wall heater in the kitchen (dial) and another one in the bathroom (switch) that you can control. Finallya baseboard heater in the entrance hallway will keep the bedrooms (and water pipes) warm. In shortyou\ll be cozy!Q. OKso I will be warm in winter. What about the height of the summer heat?.A. Ohyou\ll will be warm in summer alright :-) But seriouslythere is an old and fairly inefficient AC wall unit in the dining room. There is also a ceiling fan in the living room and another one in one of the bedrooms. I\ve found that opening the windows creates a nice airflow that cools the place down. But if you\re looking for a in-house refrigeratorthis small cabin may not be for you.Q. What\s the deal with you being a Superhost?.A. Well thensince you ask..I\m a Superhost because we\re relaxed about our guests despite us having full-time jobs of our own. HoweverI\ve come to be rather fond of that "title," and I don\t appreciate when a guest leaves a review saying that the place was too isolatedor that the place was not what they expected (there\s only about 40 pictures). If a guest does not read the detailed description where I specify the exact distance to placesor the meticulous portrayal of the houseor whateverthen their reviews should be kinder. I truly enjoy 5-star reviews. If there\s something you do not like while hereI beg you to let me know and I promise to do what I can to revert your perspective. Remembercommunication is king.

Title: Silent Paradise in a Tree House - Monte Huam Hu
Description: In the south Portugalin the middle of the Alentejolies a powerful gem. In the midst of a forest that has been untouched for decades lies the tree house. Ancient cork oaksolive trees and birds surround you. You sleep in the the pure nature and experience the powersilence and coolness of the forest.Up on the hill you have a wonderful view. There is an outdoor kitchen with a fireplaceand a shower.There is the possibility to rent a caravan and to put up your own tent or van.The space"The space.The area around the tree platform with its seating area is completely privateas well as the toilet there.The ruin with its open outdoor kitchen and fireplace can be shared. So the composting toilet and the outdoor shower.Natural places in the forest with hammocks and stumps invite you to linger.The entire area is freely accessible.If its rainingit is possible to put a tarp over the platform. You can also sleep in the ruin.CATERING ON THE MONTE HUAM HUBreakfast and Dinner for 15 ‚Ç¨/personA delicious breakfast with a fantastic view.between 5‚Ç¨ and 7,50‚Ç¨Vegetarian dinner (often from my own garden): 9,50‚Ç¨On request there is a midnight snack for 5‚Ç¨/ person under a gigantic starry sky.Own catering in the common outdoor kitchen is also possible (small note: next Minimercado: 11km & supermarket: 35km away)"Exempt

Title: The Dreamweaver at Treehouse Mountain!
Description: "Come relax in the mountains at Treehouse Mountain! Our treehouse has everything you need to enjoy a few days of relaxation. Bring your pupwe are dog friendly too!This is our first treehouse that is great for a romantic getaway for couples! It comfortably sleeps two with studio style floor plan featuring a queen size bedbut there is a twin sized futon if theres a group of three."The space"The space.Our treehouse features heating and air conditioningas well as a Smart TV for NetflixHuluand others with your account. There is also a Bose Bluetooth speaker available for your use.There is a kitchenette which features a half-size refrigeratora COLD sink (no hot water in treehouse)a microwavea coffee makera water boiler for tea and hot chocolatea mini rice cookerand a toaster. On our wrap-around porchthere is a grill with a side burner for additional cooking needs. **We will provide teacoffeecreamersugarand coffee mugsas well as basic cooking items such as ricesaltpepperspicesoilutensilsplatesa pota pan and a cast iron skillet.Located on various parts of the property there are fire pits for your use. We provide fire-starter and firewood for you.There is a bathhouse 40 yards away from the treehouse which has two hot showers and two bathrooms with hot waterall climate controlled for year-around comfort.Here at Treehouse Mountainour goal is to provide everything that we would want if we were to travel to other Airbnbs. During your stayyou can find that we are readily available if theres anything we can help out with or want help planning your trip to the area as well.If you have questions about any of our treehouse rentals (we have four total)send me a message! We also offer discounts* for militaryweekly stayreturn guestsor renting more than one treehouse during a stay.*Guests can use up to two discounts for a reservation*"Other things to note.There is a climate controlled bathhouse just 40 yards from the treehouse that features two bathrooms and two showers. We clean this facility daily. We provide all linens and towels needed as well as soap and shampoo.The other three treehouses may be booked during your stay and other guests may have dogs off leash on the property because we are fully dog friendly. If this is a concern to you (due to fear of dogs or your dog is not friendly towards other dogs) let me know and I would be glad to request any guests staying to keep their dogs on leash.Each treehouse has a private fire pit with firewood and starter provided.

Title: White Mountains Heated Treehouse PLUS Campsites!
Description: "Sleep high or sleep low! Bring your own sleeping pad and a sleeping bag and other creature comforts. This treehouse plus tent sites sits alone on a nearly private acre 100 from the Baker River shore. This is a carry-in/carry-outfull sized sleeping main area for two adults and a loft for two small adults..And a tiny area for kids that a really cool view.Even though it is up highit is stout. Note that the insulation is a work in progressso come prepared for cool nights."The spaceThe space.The down stairs area sleeps two adultsthe loft sleeps two small adults and a tiny area sleep a kid with adventures soul.Guest access.The White Mountains are every where!Other things to note.Potable water is located in a spring down the road. Turn right out of my driveway. After about 1/2 milethere is a pullout on the right. If you go over the bridge just make a u-turn and look a little closer into the woods for the pullout!

Title: Phelps Pharm, I Was Almost A Treehouse
Description: The treehouse you always wanted as child but can enjoy as an adult. I started out next to three trees that had to be removed but you still may feel a treehouse sway if the wind blows the right way. We are a working farm raising beef cattle and offer horseback riding lessonsarena rides and trail rides along with kayaking down our local river in McMinnville. Our guests have the opportunity to experience farm life and assist us in gathering eggsfeeding the cows or helping with the horses.The spaceThe space.The treehouse has a studio style main floor with a kitchenette that includes a refrigeratormicrowavetoaster ovensmall electric skillet and Keurig coffee pot; Full Bathroom and queen size bedthere is also a loft with a queen size bed. Guests have the option of a family style country breakfast typically served at 8am or can be provided with country eggs and homemade sourdough bread to cook their own breakfast included with your stay. Your choice will be requested at the time of your reservation.Guest access.Guests have full access to our farm which encompasses 70 acres for hiking and trail rides. A gas grill is available for guests to use along with an outdoor wood fire pit or a gas for pit on our cover patio. We are centrally located 1 hour from Nashville and Chattanooga in Viola Valley TN. Area attractions include Cumberland CavernsThe Cavernsfive plus State Parks and recreational areas for hikingkayakingfishingswimming etc within 30 minutes. We offer horseback riding lessonsarena ridespasture rides and guided or self guided trail rides for experienced riders. Kayaks are also available for rent during your stay with us.

Title: White Mountains Treehouse
Description: Three room treehouse with huge windows in a reading room area set at the end of a field looking towards Mt Moosilauke. Walking trail to the river is outside your door.Like camping but better! Surrounded by forest and fields. w/ your own Firepit and new for 2022 .outdoor shower (with heated water!).We are a 10 min drive from many trailheadstwo access points to the AT and Rumney Rocks (trails and world famous rock climbing). Relax and enjoy your solitude.The spaceThe space.Have a White Mountains farm experience and a tree house stay all at once. Currier Brook farm is a 250+ yr old22 acre working farm located along the Baker River. The tree house is located along the forest line in the back pasture. It has three small rooms plus a sleeping nook. One of the rooms has large picture windows for walls and makes for a comfortable space to read while enjoying the outdoors inside. The tree house is equipped with a camping propane stovecast iron skilletsutensilsplatesbowlsdrinking vessels and potable water containers. **We provide an ample supply of potable water at the treehouse. There is an indoor composting toilet and a solar shower bag. Fire ring and charcoal grill are also at the tree house area. Enjoy walkingrunning or mountain biking along the extensive old railroad trail that cuts through the farm and goes from Montreal to Central NH. Like hiking or climbing? We are 10 mins from Rumney RocksMt Moosilaukeand sections of the AT. Planning to hike the AT and need a ride to the farm? We may be able to provide transport with advance notice. The treehouse is far enough away from the workings of the farm and the farm house that you can expect privacy unless you initiate a visit to the farm area. You will need to walk in all of your belongings unless we are available to use the lawn tractor and trailer to take it back. It is a 5 minute walk from where you will park. NO ELECTRICITY. Bring your headlampslanternsetc ***NEW*** Propane heater buddy available (safe to use inside). Propane provided. If you decide to use there will be a $10 charge for propane.Note: You may or may not be able to drive to the treehouse (it depends on time of year and how wet the drive is. There is a cart at the parking area about a 5 minute walk from treehouse. New for 2022! Private outdoor shower house. Solar charging station for your devices. Wood for the firepit provided (additional charge per bundle). Propane provided for indoor cook stove and an indoor propane heater for those cool mornings and evenings.

Title: Innatural Land
Description: "The Gaia association organizes an experience in the woodsa stones throw from the Franciscan routebetween Gubbio and Assisifor people who want to regain contact with nature.Sleep close to the communal kitchen and bathroombut surrounded by the wild nature of the central Apennineswith a maximum of 10-15 other guests.Trails and routes with online mapson footon horseback or by bicycleright on CAIs path n2 and within walking distance of the San Francesco trail"The spaceThe space.The farmhouse where we liveis in a completely isolated valleywith a beautiful view of Gubbio and the largest Christmas tree in the worldbut only a 10 minute drive from the village30 minutes from Perugia40 from Assisi and 20 minutes from the E45.The silencethe night darkness and the completely uncontaminated vegetation make this place perfect for those who love relaxing in naturewalking in the woods and rediscovering a lifestyle that connects us to the times of nature.Near the house there is a kitchen areaa space covered by a large vineyarda common area with a stovefridgesink and worktopto spread out the pizza to be cooked in the wood-burning oven or to be cooked on the grill with the large barbecue.At 7 km there is one of the best restaurants in the areaquality food and reasonable pricesin agreement with the property.In front of the kitchen areathere is a large lawn in the shade of large cherries and hazelnutswith hammockssofas chairs and tables for every need of relaxation or workwifi is on request and is not recommended for use :).There are several pitches available for tents or tent trolleysboth near the shared kitchen and the serviceswhich are about fifty meters away from each other.The curtains present with mattressare an extra 10‚Ç¨ per nightfor sheets and blanketsit takes an additional 10‚Ç¨.If you want to book the treehousewrite a message and we will give you the availability.There are then in the vicinity of the parking lotsome pitches for campers and caravansclose to the serviceswithout the possibility of discharging the black water for nownor connect to the electricity networkexcept for emergencies.

Title: Women's Spring Cottage in the House
Description: It is a very warm wooden cabina double bed and two auxiliary bedswith artistic wooden furniture and its private bathroom with hot water.The spaceThe space.The cabin is within the confines of the House in the form of a woman an artistic and sculptural construction; as a guest of the cabin you will be able to know this wonderful house.Her handmade furniture is a tribute to the woman.Guest access.Countryside areawith mist forest and mossto enjoy nature with ecological walks through trails that lead to the canyon climb to the viewpoint; if you go as a family the children have a playgroundmeadowsgardens and swings in the thickness of pines in the forest.A refuge has been built in the southern canyon so that guests can enjoy nature.Enjoy the warmth of the fire and fireplace (extra value)Other things to note.The Villa offers food service at very convenient prices and of excellent qualityyou can request prices once you have made your reservation.

Title: Stylish barn with pool near Horsham, West Sussex
Description: The Granary is a self-containedcosy and private bolt-hole. There is plenty of parking and access to a walled garden and swimming pool (June to September). All amenities are provided including a breakfast hamper. There is a small kitchen with cooking facilitiesfridgekettletoaster and coffee maker. Slinfold village has a friendly pubshop and post office within walking distance. Westerns Farm shop is a local icon and is just around the corner.The spaceThe space.The Granary was converted in 2019it retains all the charm and character of the original building but with the modern features and facilities expected of luxury accommodation. There is underfloor heating throughout the ground floorfast wifi and a large smart TV. The 2 sofas in the seating area fold out into beds suitable for adults or children (please message to pre-approve extra guests. This will incur an additional charge.). The shower room on the ground floor is sleek and modern containing a deluge shower. Shower gel and shampoo/conditioner are provided. Upstairs is a large vaulted room (with some low beams)a very comfortable king size bedchest of drawers and hanging rail. A hairdryer is provided for your convenience. Washing machine and tumble dryer are available for guests on request.Other things to note.Please be aware that we aim to heat the pool between June and September. The pool temperature will vary according to the weather.

Title: Cosy Barn with a Vineyard View
Description: "Nestled in open countryside next to our vineyard on the outskirts of Bishops Stortfordan ideal base to explore East Herts & North Essex or visit London & Cambridge. The Cowshed is a recently converted barn sleeping 5complete with fully equipped kitchendining area and comfy seating around a woodburner. Egyptian cotton linen and black out blinds in all bedrooms. Outdoors enjoy the wood burning hot tubfeed the chickenstake a stroll round our lake or discover the zip wire in the wood!"The space"The space.Fresh eggs are available from the kitchen garden located at the end of the 2 acre orchard that backs onto the property. Nestled in the woods youll discover the zip wire and play area with plenty of trees for den building!"Guest access.Entire space. There are 3 bedrooms1 single bedroom downstairsalong with a twin room (2 single beds) and master room with king-size bed upstairs."Other things to note.We have a minuimum 4 night stay during the weekwith a check-in on Monday. Weekend check-in is on Friday with a minimum 3 night stay.Please note that the hot tub is a wood burning hot tub it is chemical free and filled with fresh water each use. You will need to light the fire and tend to it (adding logs regularly) it will take upwards of 3.5 hours to get hot. We provide logs for your stayinstructions and will be on hand to offer guidance. The hot tub will comfortably fit 5 adults.Whilst we dont have an EV charger there are several outdoor plug sockets to charge your car at."

Title: The Buzzardry, Luxury Woodland Treehouse Retreat
Description: Come away to beautiful East Sussex to experience a unique stay in The Buzzardry. This stunning structure will not disappoint ‚Äì from the luxurious copper bathtub with exquisite views over woodland grounds to the extravagant beamed ceilings that protrude through the buildingthis magnificent treehouse offers unparalleled style and luxury. With full facilities availableincluding two en-suite bathrooms with showersa fully equipped kitchena barbecue and drinks deck at the front.The space"The space.This fantastic 2-bedroom treehouse is generously spaced for you to fully enjoy the lofty environs. Climb up the spiral staircase and across the walkway to find a delightful decked terrace; a perfect place for balmy evenings in the treetops.The Buzzardry sleeps 4 people in 2 bedrooms (which can either be used as 2 doubles or 1 double and 1 twin)each room has its own ensuite shower room. The master bedroom also has a luxurious copper bath with views over the woodland.The open plan living area and kitchen has all mod cons; oveninduction hobfridgedishwashermicrowavekettle and sink. There is a dining area for fourand a comfortable seating area which includes a TV and woodburner (wood provided) to make things extra cosy in the winter months. There is also underfloor heating throughout the treehouse. We are plumbed in and on grid with broadband available.Double glass doors give you access to the open plan circular living areawith gorgeous views over the woodlands from each angled window. The lounge includes comfortable seatinga TV and a cosy wood-burning stovewhich despite the propertys mod consprovides heating with the old-fashioned way for this well-insulated spaceas well as underfloor heating to keep your toes toasty. There is also a dining area for fourwith views through large windows and glass doors for the feeling of al fresco dininga small kitchen complete with ovenhobmicrowavekettle and sink.To the right is a super king-sized bedroom which can also be used as a twin room and is so spacious it comes with wardrobe space and a beautiful morning view of leafy light. The jewel in this cedar crown is the master bedroomwhich fans out into its own spherical spacecontaining a king-sized bedwardrobe spaceand an opulent copper bath tub. This room is not just metres above the groundits miles above other self-catering accommodation - this is treehouse chic. Both bedrooms are beautifully appointed with their own en-suite bathrooms.Outside is a spacious deckwhere you can look over the lakes into the gardens and fields beyond. It has a table and chairs for outdoor diningand a gas BBQ. The lake gardens are available for you to enjoyas is the tennis court in the grounds of Marklye."Other things to note.Please note that although this property welcomes childrenwe advise parents that the treehouse is high in the air and advise vigilance when staying here with youngsters.

Title: Countryside location with hot tub and sauna
Description: We are offering our pool house which consists of saunahot tubkitchendouble shower roombedroom/living room with separate wc. Beautiful countryside views. This building is located in our garden which is an acre in total. From the garden you have the added bonus of seeing Llamas and wild deer in the adjoining field. We are situated close to the cuckoo line and there are beautiful walks nearby.The spaceThe space.sole access to hot tubsaunadouble showerseparate wckitchen and dining area."Other things to note.if you download the app what3word under our check in instructions there is a photo of the exact location of the building so you shouldnt struggle to find us."

Title: ‚ÄúThe Stable - self contained modern conversion‚Äù
Description: The Stable is a unique one bedroom self catering apartment for adults onlyset in the grounds of a small independent working farm that rears cattlesheepdogs & chickens. The original oak & wrought iron railings divide the double bedroom with en-suite showersink & WC from the open plan kitchenette with two ring halogen hobmicrowavefridge with freezer compartmentkettletoastersmart TVsofa & breakfast table with 2 chairs.The spaceThe space.The Stable is all ground floor levelwith vaulted ceilings & modern fittings. Private parking with secure electric gate. Your own Garden seating area & fire pit (bring your mashmallows to toast) sticks & wood available to buy.OTHER THINGS TO NOTE.Guests have use of a private wood fired eco hot tub which typically takes 3 hours to heat up in winter. We provide stick & wood to buy.Our hot tub can be pre-lit & maintained until your arrival if pre arranged at a cost of ¬£20. Once checked-in it‚Äôs the guests responsibility to heat the hot tub.If using hot tub addition days ¬£10 for wood only.

Title: Trinity: luxury lodge in a stunning, lake location
Description: At Cambridgeshire Lakeswe believe that your holiday should start from the moment you drive down our ruraltree-lined track and into the serenity of our stunning lakeside location. The lodge provides a stylish and comfortable accommodation for couples or groups of four people. The vaulted living area includes a large dining tabletwo comfy sofas surrounding the wood burner and a large flat screen Smart TV. We currently have four lodges available on the site (sleeping 16 in total).The spaceThe space.The modern kitchen is equipped with all your kitchen essentials including ovendishwasherwine fridge and a large breakfast bar.The spacious bedrooms have individual lakeside viewsfeaturing super-king sized beds (which can also be split into singles on request for a ¬£25 charge per room) and flat screen TV‚Äôs. Each bedroom has a large en-suite bathroom with a free standing bathdouble vanity basins and separate walk-in showers. If you wish to add an additional children to your bookingthere are 2 additional underbeds available for children under 10 years old (for a charge of ¬£100 per bed) in each lodge. All associated beddingtowels and bathrobe will be provided. Please notethe underbed is low to the floor.  The open plan living area has French doors leading on to the decking area which includes garden furniture and private hot tub.

Title: CABIN X GPF
Description: Nestled amongst the treesour little wooden cabin transports you to the great outdoors. Its simple and honest interior comfortably sleeps two with wide views overlooking woodland where nature abounds. It provides the perfect base for those looking to get out amongst itor those that would rather stay in and enjoy a relaxing retreat.The spaceThe space.The comfortable double bed is positioned so you can enjoy a morning coffee whilst watching the wildlife through the window.The bathroom with its huge walk in shower has amazing views of its secludedtranquil surroundings so you can shower with nature for a uniquely memorable experience.During the warmer times of year the cabin opens up to its serene setting offering the perfect escape from a busy life and the chance to explore the country side. On those coolerrainy days (or for those that would just rather stay tucked up in bed) you can watch the wildlife outside the window through our binoculars whilst staying firmly under the blanket.We provide you with a delicious breakfast and there is tea and coffee making facilities in the cabin as well as a small kitchen.The nearby farm shop and cafe (2 min walk) sells delicious local produce as well as some very tasty cake!
