Title: The Retreat Sauna + Hot Tub Boutique Rooms
Description: Secludedcozy and charmingly rusticthe Retreat is perfect for a romantic rendezvous or for smallintimate gatherings with family and friends.Set against the beautiful Cambridgeshire countrysideThe Retreat is in a secluded area with its own garden and amenitieshoweverdespite its seclusionthe hideaway is only a 30-minute drive to the bustling historic city of Cambridge.The space"The space.The Retreat is a beautiful barn conversion and an idyllic space to relax and unwindset in the quiet village of Great PaxtonCambridgeshire. The secluded hideaway is situated in a perfect locationbeing only a 5-minute drive from St Neots and only a 30-minute drive to the historic city of Cambridge.The cabin itself is within walking distance to various amenities including a sweet little village shop as well as a local pub serving delicious foodgazing out onto the fields of the surrounding Cambridgeshire countryside.Our stunning accommodation is also within close proximity to the mainline railway stationallowing you to reach the city of Peterborough in 20 minutes as well as the phenomenal capital city of London in just under an hour.The Retreat is a beautifully-private spacesuitable for a romantic getaway or a get together with a small number of family and friends. In addition to possessing a fully-fitted kitchencomplete with all the necessary amenitiesit features an exclusive Sauna Cabin to help you unwind and let all your stress melt away.Relax with friends in the Jacuzzi between 10am-10pm or dare to take a dive under the cold water bucket! Take in the last few rays of sunshine in our private gardengazing at our enchanting Koi pondor wrap up with your loved one with a glass of wine and enjoy the smokey warmth coming from the stone fireplace. It is up to you how you choose to spend your time here with us at Boutique Roomsand we will do our very best to make your trip a memorable experience with moments to cherish.** If you would like to use the facilities during your stay please let us know in advance the date and time and we will get everything ready for when you are wanting to unwind! **Further amenities and features include:‚òÖ Modernstylish space perfect for recharging and relaxation.‚òÖ A large back garden with slide and swingperfect for children.‚òÖ Exclusiveprivate use of the Sauna Cabin and Jacuzzi for you and your treasured guests.‚òÖ An enchanting Koi pond to sit near and ponder the beautiful world that surrounds you.‚òÖ A laptop-friendly workspace.‚òÖ Pristine shower rooms.‚òÖ Free complimentary WiFi.‚òÖ Free parking for 3+ vehicles.‚òÖ Fully-fitted and equipped kitchen to create delicious meals for everyone to enjoy.‚òÖ Two large bedrooms with 6 bedsspacious enough for up to 6 guests.‚òÖ Pet-Friendly - Additional Fees apply - ¬£25 per pet per stay (up to 4 pets)Our goal is to offer you high qualitybeautifully furnished accommodation for a truly relaxing stay. We want you to feel right at home when you stay at Boutique Rooms.With usyou can expect sublime comforttasteful decorand superb customer service in order to give you an unforgettable experience.We are happy for our guests to use the space for the following:- Christenings.- Mothers/Fathers Day.- Family gatherings.- Work gatherings.- Business retreats.- Birthday celebrations.- Valentines Day.- Christmas.- Boxing Day.- New Years.- Easter.- Bank holidays.- Weekends awayPlease contact us beforehand if you are looking to use our space for an occasion.** Kindly note this area is not suitable for loud partieswe respect our neighbours :) .**"Guest access.You will have access to The Barn (sleeping accommodation)exclusive use of the traditional Sauna Cabin (housing the saunajacuzzi & cold water bucket)as well as private use of the garden.The entire accommodation is for you and your guests to enjoyso please feel free to make the most out of the idyllicrelaxing space and create moments with family and friends to cherish for a lifetime!Other things to note.We love our small furry friends and we welcome up to four pets. Additional fees apply ¬£25 per pet.Facilities are available from 10am-10pm (expect the day of check out) If you wish to use the facilities longer there is a ¬£25 charge per hour up till midnight.

Title: Forest Den
Description: "Welcome to The Forest Den set in almost 1 and a half acres which has just been beautifully renovated offering a chic rural retreat. Forest Den is probably the closest accommodation to Pooh sticks bridge and set in the Heart of the Ashdown Forest with direct access into the famous 100 Acre Wood from AA Milnes Winnie the Pooh!.Forest Den is a super cosy rural retreat offering a get away from it all lodge at the same time as offering all the creature comforts for a holiday or weekend break."The spaceThe space.Thank you for interest in The Forest Den!.Due to recent circumstances.. I want to assure all our guests that the Den is thoroughly deep cleaned after every guest with antibacterial wipes and sprays. The sheetsbeddingtowels and tea cloths are also washed on 60 degrees with dettol antibacterial too. The safety of our guests is paramount!Forest Den has been totally refurbished for July 2019 and offers a cosy studio cottage. It has luxury lounge and sleeping space with a high end brand new sofa bed with memory foam mattressfeather plume beddingand cotton sheetswith a fully equipped brand new studio kitchen with twin hobmicrowavefridge/freezersink (cold water) brand new and spacious separate outdoor bathroom (cold water sinkhot showertoilet)flat screen HD TV (DVD player) on the wall and a dinning space. Outside guests can enjoy exclusive access of the apple orchard for relaxing. In addition guests will have gated parking and free tours of the forest on request.So if you like walkingthis is the place to be! We are set in the heart of the Ashdown forest! üå≥Guest access.Guests can access our garden orchard and field. We would like you to feel like you are at home !Other things to note.We have 2 dogs and 3 cats that have free roam of the garden. They don‚Äôt have access to the den as there is a fence surrounding the den.When you come out of the gate of the den you will probably meet them. They are very friendly though and love people!

Title: Standlake Glamping - No2 The Owl Shepherd Hut
Description: Welcome to Standlake Glamping - your unique get away with access to many amazing places to visit locally. Hot Tubs on its own decking - If you fancy a more chilled weekend why not explore the picturesque village of Standlake? Its within walking distance of local pubs and even boating on the Thames. No dogs.The spaceThe space.You have access to your own Hot tub on its own deckingDecking outside of the Shepherd hut with table and chairs and sun lounger. Title: Little Cowdray Glamping - The Log Cabin
Description: "The space.Our Log cabin is a beautiful self contained home from homewith all the necessities needed for a relaxing break away. Lots of love and attention has been poured into Little Cowdray Glampings Log cabinwith special touches such as the hand madehand carved king size bed and bunk bedsto the personalised kitchen companion Paddy pig who greedily oogles your kitchen delights. The Log cabin has its own private areawith a hot tub for 4 peoplea garden and patio overlooking the animalsoutdoor seatingBBQparking and a private shed with a heater to store bikesor dry your wet weather gear..it is still in England after all! Designed for 4 peoplewith a King size and 2 Bunks but on request and a *small additional fee can hold up to 6 with the bonus of a double sofa bed. The bunk beds are generous singlesso suitable for adults too.*¬£15pp per night for an extra guest"The space"Guest access.The Log Cabin comes with its own gardenpatioand private hot tub suitable for 4 peopleall of which overlook our fields and animals and best of all the beautiful sunsets.For a small additional cost at ¬£15 per person per night (after 4 guests) we can host 6 peopleand will set up the double sofa bed in the living area.""Other things to note.For a small additional cost we welcome a well behaved dogbut they must remain on a lead at all times outside of the private gardenthis is not only due to our livestockbut because of large machinery operating in and around the farmand wed like your four legged friend to stay safe during your stay. We usually just allow one but in certain circumstances this maybe flexible. We request that no pets are to be left alone in the Cabin."

Title: Gorgeous cosy winter getaway in rural Kent
Description: The Snuggery is a converted outbuilding that has been set up for a cosy stay with a wood burning stove and lots of snuggly wraps to cuddle up in. The open plan interiorhigh vaulted ceilings and natural oak flooring create an interior which is funlight and airy. Walking enthusiasts will enjoy walks from the back door straight on to the North Downs Way and there is a bench by the front door fitted with a heated elementperfect for warming up your walking boots. The spaceThe space.A self-contained one bedroom outbuilding perfect for a romantic break awayGuest access.The Snuggery is separate to the main house and entry is with a key that‚Äôs kept in a key-box by the front door. I will send you the code a couple of days before arrival. When you are hereguests will have access to the immediate garden surrounding the Snuggery which includes a small patio with a table and 4 chairsOther things to note.We provide teacoffeesugarmueslimilksaltpepper and oil. There‚Äôs also a nespresso coffee machine and we provide capsules.The kitchen is well equipped with all the basics you will need to cater for yourselves including washing up liquiddishwasher tabletskitchen rollcling film and silver foil.For bathing we provide hand soaphand cream and shower wash.If you run out of any of the above during your stay please just let me know and I can restock for you!

Title: The Place for Ewe - rural Shepherd's Hut
Description: "Shepherds Hut in delightful rural setting yet within minutes of all that Oxford has to offer. The Perch Pub (where Morse regularly visited) is a five minute walk and serves excellent food. There is a Golf Driving Range five minutes in the other direction. Waitrose is a ten minute walk."The space"The space.Our self-contained Shepherds Hut offers the unique opportunity to enjoy a base in the countryside but only a 25 minute walk to the centre of Oxford. A kitchenette (a small fridge and a hob but no oven)shower room and wood burner provide all home comforts. Towels provided. Microwave can be provided on request (in advance).""Guest access.We are happy to accommodate dogs but they must live in an outside pen next to the Shepherds Hut. Due to the wooden floor dogs should not go into the hut."Other things to note.Dogs welcome but only with prior notice and should be housed in outside kennel.

Title: Milestone House
Description: "A cosy and spacious self catering home nestled in the heart of rural Cambridgeshire . Ideal for Family GetawaysShort breaks or Long Term rental. With tranquil surroundingsfive Bird Reserves within a 3 to 20 mils radius perfect for Dog walkers Hikers Birdwatchers ...30 min drive to Cambridge City Centre 30 min to Ely Cathedral 20 min drive to Huntington station 15 min to Historical St Ives built on the banks of the River Great Ouse 1 mile from Somersham and its amenities ."The spaceThe space.Milestone House comprises an airy Modern Cottage with beautiful surrounding views . Double bedroom with en/suite bathroom is located on the first floor and is accessed from outside of the house. The second bedroom is located on the ground floor with two single beds and en/suit .Spacious living area together with fully equipped kitchen TV and WiFi .We are very happy to host your well behaved pets as we are animal lovers. In the interest of hygiene we would just ask not to leave them alone in the house and keep them off the furniture (beds and sofas). Pleasefeel free to bring your own linen if you wish your pet to sleep on the bed. Dogs are also restricted to the downstairs part of the cottage only.We place these rules in order that all our guests may enjoy the cottage - non pet owners and pet owners alike.Guest access.Use of private driveway and car port . Access to our private paddock and front garden .Other things to note.We are very happy to host your well behaved pets as we are animal lovers. In the interest of hygiene we would just ask not to leave them alone in the house and keep them off the furniture (beds and sofas). Pleasefeel free to bring your own linen if you wish your pet to sleep on the bed. Dogs are also restricted to the downstairs part of the cottage only.We place these rules in order that all our guests may enjoy the cottage - non pet owners and pet owners alike.

Title: The Pigsty
Description: "The Pigsty is Winchesters first luxury woodland hideawaywith beautiful views of Vale Farm. Less than 2.5 miles from the historic centre of Winchesterthis peaceful retreat is perfect for those looking to visit the cityor escape for some peace.The Pigsty‚Äôs domed design with wooden interior has a roll top bathcosy open plan living space and decking area to enjoy dinner with sunset views.Just a few minutes walk from the famous Clarendon Wayand a 30 minute walk to the city centre."The spaceThe space.The Pigsty is situated on a working farmhowever in a secluded corner with minimal disturbance. Access is via a well maintained private farm track suitable for vehiclesbikes or by foot!The Pigsty offers a king-sized bedsimple kitchenTValong with a luxurious roll top bath and separate shower and toilet. Towelssheetsbath robes and special toiletries are provided. There is a gas BBQ for guests to usealong with other surprise perks. Adjacent parking available.Breakfast is provided for the first morning of your stayhowever teamilk and fresh coffee beans (that have been roasted on the farm) are available throughout your stay.Other things to note.The Pigsty is designed for those looking to escape the ways of normal lifethis is why we do not allow children or pets of any size.There are a number of factors as to why but mostly because as parents we felt it was somewhere to enjoy a couple of nights off from the home life.

Title: NEW Luxury Remote Kabin + Outdoor Bath!
Description: "Surrounded by stunning countrysideour beautiful cabin is the perfect place to relax and switch off. The location is totally secludedwith stunning views over the Meon Valley. Come for a few nights and we promise youll leave feeling rested and reenergised.During these unprecedented timeswe wanted to offer a place where people can take a moment away from it all. Where you can get back to basics and enjoy the benefits of being surrounded by nature and nothing else."The space"The space.Everything has been carefully considered and beautifully designed to help our guests slow downswitch off and leave feeling revitalised. Think tiny hotel room in the wildas opposed to your normal shepherds hut. Our cabin has electricand made entirely using wood from the surrounding trees (all of which were felled due to dieback).There are beautiful walkssome to cosy pubs. In the cabin youll find some maps and our personal recommendations.If you have any questions please just ask. Here is some more information of what to expect: The cabin has everything you need. Nothing you dont:.A large king sized bedwith luxury linen bedding.A woodburner inside.A firepit and picnic bench outside.A bathroomwith flushing toilet and hot shower.A kitchenwith two gas hobs and a fridge/freezer.A table and dining area.We offer a generous amount of bespoke cut woodburner logs within our rates. More of these smaller logs are available for purchase during your stay to keep you toasty warm!We also provide a secured bin of seasoned cut logs to be used on the fire-pit ¬£10 per bin which can be purchased on arrival and can be topped up during your stay."

Title: Romantic Oak Cabin Berkhamsted
Description: This cosy luxurious self contained oak frame cabin offers the perfect peaceful setting for a relaxing getaway. Listen out and you may hear the owls at night.Backing onto the National Trust Ashridge Forestthis is perfect for outdoor lovers but equally suitable for a romantic night in. 1.5 miles down the roadthe popular market town of Berkhamsted is offering atmospheric pubs and bars for a special treat out.The cabin offers comfortablespacious living with King size bed.The spaceThe space.Although the cabin is within the grounds of the main propertyit is completely separated off by thick hedge rows to offer complete privacy to our guests. A path alongside the house leads the guests to their own entrance of the cabin.This cabin features all you need for a comfortable stay- a small bathroom with shower facilitya spacious open plan living rooman open plan kitchen with a hob and convection microwave oven grill and a comfortable King Size bed on the Mezzanine levelaccessed by a ladder. It is furnished with cosy lightingtwo comfortable sofas and a dining table. The cabin features a TV as well as a large DVD selection and Hi-Fi system.Kitchen: We also provide utensils so that our guests can choose to stay in and prepare their own meal if they wish.The back gate allows you to walk straight into the woods to explore 5000 acres of deer filled forest and its other wildlife. A 20 minute walk away you may wish to refresh yourself in the upmarket and cosy pubthe Alford Armsin the idyllic Frithsden Valley where they even have their own vineyard.The cabin is only 1.5 miles away from the popular and trendy town centre of Berkhamstedfeaturing a range of lively pubs and restaurants.

Title: Luxurious, picture-perfect, stunning treehouse
Description: "Hoots Treehouse (www.hootstreehouse.co.uk) is a picture-perfectromanticluxurious treehouse with all mod cons in an area of outstanding natural beauty - only 45 minutes south of M25. Clad in aromatic cedar woodbeautifully furnished - ideal privatewoodland retreat for couples. Can also comfortably sleep 2 children (from 6 years) on single mattresses in loft area accessed by a ladder and hatch. A wonderful place to chill-out and lose yourself - you wont want to leave! Sheer bliss!"The spaceThe space.Minimum 2 night stay - check-in any day of the week.Guest access.Hoots has its own dedicated parking area. From here there is a boardwalk with steps that lead directly into the treehouse (about 50m).There are loads of beautiful walks from your doorstep - access through a stunning deer park is a 5 minute walk from the treehouse.There is a tennis court that can be used (however please bring your own racquets and balls!)

Title: Cosy country cottage with chalk stream charm
Description: "A beautifully renovated and charming lodge on the river Deverten minutes drive north of the historic city of Winchester.The Fishermans Lodge is a beautiful self contained country escape with the added benefits of its own little island and brilliant views of the charming river Dever and the wildlife that lives along its banks."The space"The space.The Fishermans Lodge offers a unique and beautiful outdoor space with all the creature comforts that you would expect to find in a cosy home.Although there is now no fishing on sitethe lodge was traditionally part of a small trout fishery. It now stands aloneadjacent to its own small island alongside the sparkling clear waters of the river Devera tributary of the world famous river Test.Right outside the front door is a large covered veranda which offers a perfect spot for a breakfast coffee and croissant. A little rustic bridge provides access to the small island. The island offers lovely riverside space with both the opportunity to relax in the sunshine with a glass of cool wine or to sit beneath the trailing branches of the weeping willow that grows at its heart and watch the river life float by. Duckskingfishersmoorhenscoots and herons are all common visitorswhilst beneath its sparkling surface minnowsbrown trout and the occasional grayling can be seen..and if you are very lucky you may glimpse the otter drift past at dusk.Indoors the kitchen is fully equipped with a large modern cookermicrowavefridgefreezer and breakfast bar. The kitchen retains some of its original character with a natural stone tile floor and bespoke wooden units.The main living area is spacious and contains a dining tablesofabean bag and TV. Additionally there is a small downstairs cloakroom.Upstairs is reached by a stunning oak and wrought iron staircase and leads straight into the bedroom. The large bedroom contains a double beddressing tabletwo hanging cupboardsa long mirrora TV and two wonderful Velux windows that offer stunning views over an adjacent private lake and pond.The bathroom is large and modernwith a huge walk-in shower and a deep free-standing bath.The whole lodge has its own WiFi and both televisions have smart TV options.The lodge is a short walk from the village of Sutton Scotney and its facilities including a parkthe well stocked village shopDever Storesa great village pubThe Coach and Horses and a handy garage with post office facilities.""The whole of the Fishermans Lodge and the adjacent outdoor space as described is for our guests use."Other things to note.You will be parking your car inside a secure gated property just off the main road (A30). Please be aware of some road noise during busy periods.

Title: Secluded Oak Barn Retreat with Hot Tub & Pool!
Description: Relaxation at The Oak Barn Danbury is inevitable. Surrounded by oak treesthe secluded fenced patio with comfy seatinghot tub and BBQ will allow quiet relaxation after a day exploring the Essex countryside on your doorstep. Insideenjoy a beautiful open plan oak beamed kitchen / living area with all the amenities you could need to enjoy your stay3 luxurious beds and a large bathroom. Being child friendlyfree parking and fast Wifi are a given. A seasonal pool is just an added luxury!The spaceThe space.Welcome to the beautiful Oak Barn in Danbury. 1000 sq ft of lightquietsecluded space for a relaxing get away.Bedroom 1 has a luxurious king size bed with memory foam mattressquality linen and is double aspect looking out over the tree lined garden and horses (when they arn\t on their holidays!).Bedroom 2 has an equally luxurious sprung double mattressquality linen and enjoys views of the horses and National Trust Forest behind.The large bathroom comprises of an overized bath for relaxing after a day exploring picturesque Essexa seperate showertoilet and basin. All amenities such as shampoosoap and toilet paper are provided as would be expected.The open planoak beamed Living/Dining/Kitchen area is light and spacious even for 6 people. The double sofa bed can be made up or left folded for your arrival.The 42" TV in the living area is linked up to a Firestick for App access and live TV.A seperate nook is available for reading or if you need to check the laptop and Wifi signal is strong so you can keep connected!The dining table can be set for 6 and the kitchen is equipped with ovenhobmicrowavefridge (with small freezer)dishwashertoastercoffee machinekettle and all equiptment you need for self catering. A selection of tea and coffee is also provided to get you started.Washing is available at a small fee.Outsidethe barn becomes even more delightful as you can choose to see in the evening on your private patio either from your 6 person hot tub or outside seating area whilst someone BBQ\s for dinner.During the summer months (weather dependent) a private heated outdoor pool is available daily between 9am and 12.30pm unless otherwise agreed.Parking for 2 cars on the shared drive is available.The Oak Barn Danbury is family friendly (2 little boys live on site!)so if there are any specific child requirements please just message me before you come and I will try and accomodate.We hope to see you soon x

Title: The Barn @ North Lodge -Soho Farmhouse-esque Cabin
Description: Inspired by Soho Farmhouse. A stylish converted barn set in the grounds of a Georgian Lodge within the South Downs National Park. Conveniently located close to the picturesque market towns of AlresfordPetersfieldAlton and historic Winchesterit is an ideal base to both explore Hampshire and kick back and relax in luxury.The spaceThe space.Rustic luxury is the barn‚Äôs style; whitewashed timber wallsheated oak floorsindustrial iron Nkuku lighting and furniture sit comfortably alongside crisp White Company linenfeather duvets and generous sized pillows. Relax and restore after an action packed day with Neal‚Äôs Yard toiletries and fluffy towels. Comfort is key. Ideal for couplesfriends and solo travellers alike with the option of a super king or twin beds.A Nespresso coffee machinetoasterkettlefridge freezerovenhob microwave and egg cooker are all on handplus a gas BBQ & Chiminea log burner on the private Terrace. Breakfast provisions of granolayogurtfruitsourdough bread and jam are provided along with eggs from our own hens for delicious boiled eggs.The Barn is equipped with the usual mod cons with TVChrome CastWIFI and Sonos Music System.There are Sweeping views from the bedroom french doors up the field where the majestic Redwood Tree and often PheasantsHare and Roe deer can be seen. You are free to explore North Lodge‚Äôs paddock to visit North Lodge‚Äôs chickens and there are several footpaths off the propertyone which leads to the famous ‚ÄúPub with no Name‚Äù in just under an hour."Guest access.Private terrace with seating & coffee tablebbq and wood fired Chimineaadditional larger table with parasol to the side of the Barn. Guests are welcome to wander around the paddock to see the chickens & meet the owners friendly Border Terriers."Other things to note.Breakfast & Dogs!Please note: We provide a complimentary breakfast of granolayogurtfruitfresh sourdough breadbutterfresh eggs and jam.Dogs: We love dogswe have two! we accept small to medium well behaved ones. We ask that they please keep their paws on the floorsnot the bed!

Title: Luxury Garden Studio Apartment
Description: Woodland View is a modern Cedar built apartment set apart from the main house. Located within a 10 minute walk to the near by Silverstone Circuit. It comes complete with off road parking and it‚Äôs own seated decking area with hot tub.The self contained apartment comprises of a bathroomkitchenlounge area and bedroom with double bed.We also can cater for private events such as birthdayanniversaries and special events as seen in some of the later photos for an additional cost.The spaceThe space.Modern Cedar clad structureUnderfloor heatingMechanical vent heat recovery and triple glazingwith green roof and zinc features. Woodland View is set apart from the main house and offers a private setting located within 1/4 of an acre gardenadjoining farm land and wooded area. The property also benefits from a 5 person heated hot tub which is perfect for those cozy evenings under the stars.Guest access.Woodland View allows private gated access and parking. This allows safe parking for your vehicle within a secure electric gated driveway.We currently have two different sets of optional staysStandard and Premium (all prices are standard unless otherwise stated):Standard inclusions:.Access to the hot tublimited to 2 hours per nights stay.Complimentary tea and coffee.A full range of streaming TV packages.Toiletries (shampooconditionershower gel).Use of BBQ/Wood-burner (Guests to provide their own coal).Parking for one vehiclePremium inclusions (in addition to the standard):.Breakfast hamperincluding a selection of fresh fruitscerealcroissantsbreadjuicechocolate and cookies.Access to the hot tublimited to 4 hours per nights stay (opposed to 2 hours).Premium Optional cost: ¬£30Please feel free to message us in relation to the additional Gold and Platinum event packages.

Title: Sparrowhawk Luxury Lodge with Sauna & Hot Tub
Description: COVID-19 Restrictions for England.Guests can book with confidence that we will refund any reservations that needs to be cancelled due to government COVID restrictions.Upper Farm is a 30 acre farm located in the rural hamlet of Henton in the beautiful South Oxfordshire countryside and is around 1 hour from London and less than 5 miles from Junction 6 of the M40 motorway.The space"The space.COVID-19 Restrictions for England.Guests can book with confidence that we will refund any reservations that needs to be cancelled due to government COVID restrictions.Upper Farm is a 30 acre farm located in the rural hamlet of Henton in the beautiful South Oxfordshire countryside and is around 1 hour from London and less thanDue to the additional cleaning and sanitisation required to keep our guests safewe are unable to offer any form of early check-in or late check-out.Sparrowhawk Lodge is tucked away at the edge of the farm.With a sauna in the luxurious bathroom and with its own private year round outdoor hot tubyou are surrounded by acres of green paddocks and views over our 1 acre fishing lake. Its the perfect setting for guests who want to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.Sparrowhawk Lodge is ideal for couples looking for a romantic getawaywalkerscyclistsanglers and business travellers.Kitchen / Dining.- Dining table & chairs.- Fully fitted kitchen (Ovenhobmicrowavekettletoasterslimline dishwasher).- All potspans and cookware provided.- Fridge with integrated freezer compartment.- Teacoffeemilksugar & cafetiere.- French doors leading to veranda and hot tubLiving.- L shaped sofa.- Flame effect electric fire.- LG 43 inch Smart UHD 4K Television with Netflix subscription.- Sky+ HD Satellite receiver with EntertainmentMovies and Sports channels.- Catchup TV (BBC iPlayerITV HubALL 4Demand5).- French doors leading to veranda and hot tubOutside.- Large veranda with stunning views over the lake & Chiltern Hills.- Al Fresco outdoor dining.- Year round outdoor hot tub with Bluetooth sound system.- Weber Charcoal BBQBedroom.- King size bed with award winning Simba Sleep Experience (hybrid mattresshybrid pillowduvet).- Egyptian cotton bedding.- Bedside tableslamps and USB charging.- LG 43 inch Smart UHD 4K TV with FreeviewNetflix & Catchup.- Hairdryer.- Iron and ironing boardEnsuite.- Large free standing bath.- Sauna.- Walk in showerLinenstowelsbathrobes and toiletries providedIMPORTANT EXTRA INFORMATION.We have a zero tolerance policy on drugs. Anyone found smoking or taking drugs or any other illegal substance will be reported to the police and evicted from the property immediately. There will be no refund for any unused nights and you will forfeit the full security deposit.There is no smoking permitted inside the accommodation. Smoking is permitted outside only. Please use the ashtray provided.No excessive outdoor noise after 11pm.Absolutely No parties or events.Maximum of 2 well behaved dogs per property. ¬£15 per dogper stay charge (payable on arrival)."

Title: The Nest: A Unique Retreat on the South Downs Way
Description: On the South Downs Waynestled in a beautiful spot amongst treeswith countryside views across farmlandThe Nest is a hand-built wooden cabin positioned at the top of Springfieldson a family-run working farmSprings PYO. In an area of natural beautyyet a short walk to the PYO areasfarm shop and wonderful cafe at The Gooseberry Houseit has immediate access to footpaths and is ideal for walkers and cyclists.Private parking space and occasional distant road noise across fields.The spaceThe space.The Nest has been lovingly hand built by our family during lockdown using reclaimed woodspalletsdisused gym wall-bars and many other items we could find for the interioryet is fully insulated and equipped with modern comforts. We want guests to feel the fun and excitement of staying in something a little differentyet privacy away from daily life. There is a small kitchen area with cooking facilitiesa fridge and microwave. A Feather & Black double bed2 comfy chairs to sit on and enjoy the view across fields with the doors open. There are several outside seating areas to enjoy the sun all aroundwith outside lighting amidst the treesand a fire-pit for cosy nights outdoors sitting and enjoying the stunning sunsets. Some logs and kindling is provided but all extra is available to purchase at the farm shop.Good 4G signal only in the cabin(so use your break as a rest from the world!)but there is full wifi available at the farm shop cafe should you require. Guests can also bring portable dongles if require.We would ask guests to bring some soft indoor shoes or slippers for their own comfortas muddy shoes and boots stay outdoors!.PLEASE NOTE: There is now access to use of a private gym in a nearby farm building on Tuesday and Thursday morningsfrom 6.30a.m -7.30a.m. This may also mean some distant noise at this time. Guests are welcome to join by prior arrangement when booking their stay. Please enquire.

Title: The Old School House Liphook - hot tub & tennis ct
Description: The Old School House is a traditional and cosy one bedroom detached cottage in the grounds of our home on the western edge of Liphook village in Hampshire. Easy car accessjust off the A3 and south of the Hindhead tunnel. The village has a train station.Situated in the South Downs National Park and ideally located for the market towns of HaslemereFarnhamPetersfield and Altonit is only 25 minutes from Goodwood. Great countryside and lots on offer locally for holiday or break.The spaceThe space.The cottage is within a secure and gated property with parking and extensive grounds. Features include: central heatinglog burning stoveTV (including sky movies/sports)wifiKing sized bed with luxury beddinga fully equipped kitchen with oven and washing machinea shower roomprivate patio and lovely decked area off the bedroom and small secure garden with table and chairs. We offer use of our tennis court and you can enjoy a hot tub.Guest access.hot tub.large garden.tennis courtOther things to note.No Smoking on site.No parties.Check in after 2pm.Check out by 11am.Minimum stay 1 night.Continental breakfast provided.some traffic noise/ noise from army training.

Title: White Deer Lodge - Breakfast hamper included
Description: "White Deer Lodge is situated in the village of Barkway. Surrounded by open fields and beautiful countryside. It is a new build in our gardennext to our home. There is a huge driveway with private parking for the lodge. The main accommodation upstairs is open plan with an ensuite bathroom. There is a kitchen downstairs. Breakfast hamper includescerealseggsbreadbaconmushroomstomatoesjamsteacoffee.See the deer outside your window and hear the owls at night.Sorry no pets."The spaceThe space.A beautiful oak interior with a cosy rustic feel. The setting is very peaceful and quietsurrounded by countryside. There is a seating area outside the front of the lodge and a small area out the back of the lodge overlooking the fields. Extras available to book in advance: Movie hamper ¬£10bouquet of flowers ¬£30cheese and cracker selection ¬£20Proseccostrawberries and truffles ¬£25homemade birthday cake ¬£25. Please message for more info or to book. Check in 3pm. Check out 10.30amGuest access.Key code entry. Private parking right outside the lodge.

Title: The Cabin Retreat
Description: Lovely self catering log cabin with its own private hot tublocated in peaceful residential area next to the historic Crouch Hill. Located only 1 mile from Broughton Castle6 miles from Soho Farmhouse15 miles from Bicester Village and 19 miles from Oxford & Stratford. Close to local amenities and countryside walks near by. We have mobile beauty therapist that will also come to the cabin if you would like a massage or facialthis must be booked in advance so please do let us know.The spaceThe space.Studio log cabin with Kingsize bed and sofa bed suitable for children or 1 adult. Open plan snugkitchen and dining area with separate bathroom. Lovely decking area with hot tub. The Space is suitable for either 2 Adults and 1 child or 3 Adults.We advise that people with Heart condition who are pregnanthave high blood pressure or skin diseases or disorders to not use the hot as we cannot be held responsible for any illness or accidents that may occur.I also make beautiful candles that can be gift wrapped and left in the room for your loved one.Please see photos on the main page.These can be made in range of colours and fragrances.Please message me if intrestedTreatment lists.Full Facial ¬£50.00.Full Body Massage ¬£50.00.Back massage and Indian head massage ¬£50.00.Back massage ¬£30.00.Indian Head Massage ¬£30.00.Afternoon tea is also available at a cost of ¬£22.00 for Two.If you would like to book any treatments or Afternoon tea then please let us know in advance.

Title: Luxury 3 Bedroom, Scandinavian Lodge with HOT TUB
Description: Award winning5 star 3 bedroom2 bathroom log cabin with private HOT TUB (sleeps 6). Located in the centre of a 18 hole Championship Golf Course just 3 miles from the historic city centre of Winchester. Vaulted ceilings and exposed wood provides a tranquil setting. Fully equipped kitchenopen plan living-dinning area with cosy firesmart TV with streaming services. Living room opens onto a private deck with HOT TUB and views over the guest putting greenancient woodland and nature trails.The space"The space.The Lodge in detail:.Living area- The vaulted ceiling and exposed log walls of the open plan living dining area provide a relaxing and stylish room for relaxing and entertaining. An electric log burner effect stove provides a cozy and warm environment to kick back and unwind. The lodges are heated throughout and are lovely and warm even when its chilly outside. The living area leads out onto a large private decked balcony with luxurious HOT TUB overlooking the ancient woodlandnature trails and guest putting green.Multi media- Large smart TV with streaming services and bluetooth speaker in the Lounge area and another located in the master bedroom. Free WiFi access is available in every lodge. Free WiFi access is available in every lodge.Kitchen- Kitchen- The lodge offers a fully equipped kitchen with dishwashermicrowavefridgefreezeroven and washing machine. A complimentary welcome tray is provided with locally sourced produceground coffeea selection of teas and other yummy goodies to ensure the perfect start to your stay with us.Bedrooms- The three bedrooms are light and airy and with beautiful soft furnishings and luxury bed linen and towels. The EnSite master bedroom is presented as a kingsize bed but can also be arranged as two singles beds on requestthe second and third bedroom are arranged as twin rooms. The master bedroom has the added benefit of a flat screen TV. Hairdryers are also provided in each bedroom.Bathrooms- All our lodges offer two bathroomsa family bathroom with bath and over head shower as well as an ensuite shower room. Soft fluffy towels are provided as well as luxurylocally produced toiletries from Lavender Log Barn.Outside and access.All our lodges have a private decked balcony opening out from the living area with views of the ancient woodland or guest putting green. The luxurious HOT TUB is fully serviced during your stay an ready for you to jump in and enjoy! Outdoor furnitureputters and golf balls are provided for guests to enjoy our putting green during their stay. Each lodge has its own BBQ stand suitable for use with a disposable BBQ pack. BBQ utensils and lighters are provided.All our lodges are accessed via a ramp from the private parking area. Once inside the accommodation is arranged over one level.Parking.Private parking for two cars is by the front door of each lodge. Some overflow parking is also available on site on request.Self Catering.To make your arrival as easy as possible all major supermarkets deliver to our lodges. We are also just 2 miles from a Sainsburys supermarket and local butcher and bakery (Olivers Battery). If you would rather take a break from cooking why not book one of our delicious meals offer on our dinners to your door menu. Or book a beautiful English afternoon tea on arrivalserved on bone china and three tiered cake stand. (menus available on request).Winchester is fast becoming a foddies meccaRick SteinsRiver cottage CanteenRaymond Blanc- Brasserie BlancBlack Rat (1 Michelin star)Chesil Rectory (voted 3rd most romantic restaurant in UK)Wykeham Arms (voted best town pub in UK)The PloughSparsholt (multi award winning country pub) to name but just a few. Winchester offers a fantastic range of restaurants to suit all tastesbudgets and occasionsFamilies.Children are very welcome to stay and our lodges are the perfect safe environment for children and parents to enjoy a stay with us. For our little gueststravel cotsbed guards and highchairs can be provided free of charge on request. The open area around lodges and our putting green as well as the beautiful ancient woodland provide a fantastic location for kids to play and explore in the safety of our family friendly site. Our nature trail offers a great opportunity for Wigwam building and woodland exploring.Should you book one of our Plus lodges with hot tubsa cover is fitted to the tub for when its not being used so your little ones will be safe.Should you want to get out and explore the Winchester and surrounding areas there are a wealth of attractions on our door step. From Pepper Pig World (15 mins)Marwell Zooactivity centre and play barn(15 mins)Winchester Intec Science Centre (10 mins)Beaulieu Motor Museum (25 mins) and much much more!Golf.Set in the middle of South Winchester Golf Club we have the privilege to be able to offer guests access to the Championship Golf Course and fantastic bar and restaurant facilities within just a short stroll down the 18th fairway from your front door. Discounted guest green fees can be booked directly with usall guests have access to the lovely lake side restaurant and family friendly bar area and sun terrace. The club also offers a short game practice area and driving range for the keen golfer. Dont forget if you just fancy trying your hand at a bit of golf our guest putting green located at the heart of our site is for all to enjoy old and younggolfer or novice!Dogs.We have a number of dog friendly lodges so you are welcome to bring your furry friends along for a holiday too. Located on the edge of the South Downs National Park and set in woodland there are some fantastic walks on the doorstep of your lodge. Please note maximum of 2 dogs per propertysupplement applies. Unfortunatelywe are unable to accept any other pets.Groups and Celebrations.If you are planning a group break our lodges offer flexible and affordable accommodation and the Golf Club House (just a 5 minute walk away) offers a great venue for a drinks receptiona group meal or function. We are also just 3 miles from the city center of Winchester with all its restaurants and barsif you would like more information regarding a suitable venue for your group please contact a member of our staff for recommendations and further information. Our lodges are suitable for a maximum of four or six peoplefor insurance reasons our lodges are not suitable to host a larger group meal or get-together under one roof.Please note that we charge a fully refundable damage deposit of ¬£250 on bookings of 2 lodges or moreproviding there is no damage to the lodge on check out. With regret we are unable to accommodate Hen and Stag parties or larger single sex groups of 6 or more people.Book With Confidence!.At your time of check inshould the UK government advise not to travel overnight within the UK (Full National Lock Down) due to the Corona virus pandemicor that we as a business are unable to remain openwe will issue a full creditrefund or the option to move your break to a future date with no amendment fee. Please note that as a small business we are unable to cover for every situation and the responsibility is with you the guest to be fully aware of the cancellation policy that you have agreed to at the time of booking with Airbnb."Guest access.Our luxury Self-contained lodges offer the perfect location to relax and unwind. Each lodge provides independent accommodationmaintained to the highest hygiene standards and offers a beautiful tranquil setting to get away from it all!Other things to note.We understand that the last year has created a lot of uncertainty for travellersso we wanted to proactively share the steps we‚Äôve taken to ensure your health and safety. While we‚Äôve always gone to great lengths to best maintain and prepare our lodges for your arrivalwe‚Äôve since updated our operating protocols and are allocating extra cleaning time between guests to disinfect and sanitise all high-touch surfaces. We have also implemented a contactless self-check- in procedure and all hot tubs are fully operational and maintained to strict water hygiene standards set out by The British and Irish Spa Hot Tub Association (BISHTA).

Title: Gorgeous Shepherds Hut, Hot Tub & Firepit
Description: "An absolutely stunning little escapewith boutique decor and a stylishsuper comfy interior. Set in a a beautiful corner of the village just a stones throw from the village pubthis is a truly relaxing escape. The gorgeous decorsuper comfy bed along with little touches such as the Neom essential oils podSt Kitts Herbery productsmake this an extra special place to stay.Relax in the evenings with a glass of wine in the wood fired hot tub and snuggle around the Indian Fire Bowl."The spaceThe space.The shepherds hut is in the centre of a pretty villagejust moments from the village pub. Title: Self contained country cottage for 2 in Sarratt
Description: Crestyl Cottage is a delightful self contained home providing the perfect place to relaxwalkcyclebirdwatch and fish for carp in our small private lake. We provide high end accommodation for 2 people in an area which has plenty to offer in the heart of the stunning Chess Valley.Crestyl Cottage is a conversion of a redundant barnoriginally used for watercress seed drying which has been converted into self catering holiday accommodation with wood fired hot tub.The spaceThe space.Crestyl Cottage boasts a fabulous super king bed with luxury beddingtowelsdressing gowns and slippers. A 50 inch smart tvbroadbanda comfortable sofaa fully fitted kitchen with washing machine and dish washer and a shower room.The beautiful village of Sarratt has everything you need..gastro pubsvillage shop providing all your essentialspost officegarageand stunning walks and views. We are conveniently located to LeavesdenElstree and Pinewood studiosa 10 min drive to the M25 and the nearest train station with direct lines into London.Weekend check in on Friday.Guest access.Guests have plenty of space for free on site parking for 2 cars.There is a step up to the main private entrance.Other things to note.*WEEKEND CHECK IN ON FRIDAY.*THIS COTTAGE IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN DUE TO THE DEEP WATERS SURROUNDING THE COTTAGE.*

Title: The Little Cabin by the Lake
Description: "Sit backrelax and enjoy the ambiance of our beautiful holiday cabin and fishing lake. Set in the heart of the glorious East Sussex country sidesituated in semi ancient woodlandyet only a minute or two drive from the pretty village of East Hoathly.Our rustic cabin is fully equipped to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. Whether youre escaping for a relaxing staya romantic weekendtaking a ramble through the country side and Weald Ways or a spot of fishing."The spaceThe space.Inside our Little Cabin you will find a beautifully rustic style living arealightairy and comfortable. The handmade log bed adds a lovely feature to the room. The breakfast bar and fitted kitchen gives all you foodies everything you need to make any stay just perfect. The lovely large walk in showerWC and sink all add to the comfort of your stay (we provide the towels). In the winter you can snuggle by the log burnerwhilst in the summer you can sit outside on the lovely large deck that over looks the lake. The lovely view of the lake through the windows and double doors allows you to see the wildlife that is forever bustling about. Our lovely Canadian Geese return every year to have their babies are always a pleasure to watch. The bluebells appear in Spring and bursts into life! What ever the time of year the cabins always a pleasure to be in.Guest access.There is private parking for guests at our cabin and your own entrance. The main house is some way away so you can enjoy privacy for all your stay. You can stroll around the lake and you have your own outdoor area. If you would like to walk to the villageyou canacross the fields where you will find a small cafevillage shopand pub."Other things to note.We would like our guests to be aware that we do get some road noise throughout the day. We are close to the A22 which is great for excess but can get busy at times. Although our location is very tranquil and pretty you can hear the road in the background. Please read our reviews to see what our guests have thought so far."

Title: The Good Shepherd Hut with wood-fired hot tub
Description: "A beautiful brand new Shepherds Hut nestled in its own little paddockin rural Hampshire within the South Downs National Park. The huts bespoke design ensures a luxurious stay with a comfy double bedfree WiFiunderfloor heatingwood-burning stovesofakitchenette and ensuite. Outside there‚Äôs a fire pit/BBQpicnic table and wood-fired hot tub offering glorious views across fields. Its the perfect place to relax and unwind and soak-in the hot tub surrounded by nature."The space"The space.The Good Shepherd Hut has been built by master craftsmen to a high specification with every requirement catered for. Each little detail has been chosen to create a homely atmosphere. Here you will finda fridge/mini freezerbutlers sinkdual hobmicrowavekettletoasterbluetooth radiocrockery and cutlery. Theres a sofa and fold down table and chairs from which to dinewatch natureor stream movies! For added luxurytowelling robes and slippers are provided with an ensuite rainforest shower offering instant hot water and a flushing loo. Outsideyoull find your own small private paddock complete with picnic tablefire pit/BBQbench seat and wood-fired hot tub. The paddock offers privacy and plenty of space to take in the glorious views over fields. Sunbathe and watch stunning sunsetsor stargaze from the Scandinavian style wood-fired hot tub. Often you will see deer playing in the fieldswith barn owlsrabbitspheasantsgrouse and birds of prey.We provide a welcome bundle of logs and kindling wood and a complimentary tea tray and continental breakfast. There are hundreds of walks and bike rides connecting us to the South Downs National Park and Ashford Hangers and a variety of pubs serving great food and quintessential English villages to discover locally. If you like watersportsthe coast is easily accessed within 30 minutesor simply relax and unwind soaking in the hot-tubgazing at the stars and enjoying the peace and comfort you will find here.""Guest access.We offer private parking on the driveway of our thatched cottagewith a 70 metre walk to access the little paddock where the hut enjoys its own secluded and private space. We are on hand to answer questionsbut will leave you to enjoy the peace and quiet of the surrounds. This is an ideal location for walkerscyclists and nature lovers and those just simply wishing to get away from the hassles of everyday life!"

Title: Delightful small converted barn
Description: Unique newly converted small barnbrightlight and self contained. Sleeps 3 adults or 2 adults and 2 children (or 2 small adults) due to restricted height space in loft. Large gravel drive behind bigwooden gates for safe and easy parking. Teascoffee and biscuits provided.Situated down a country lanewithin the garden of the housewalking distance to pubs and restaurants. A few miles from Ascot and Royal WindsorTrain stations to London and Reading.The spaceThe space.Delightful newly converted small barn offering high quality self contained accomodation. Brightlight and unique. Large gravel drive behind wooden gates for easy safe parking.Sleeps 3 adultsor 2 adults and 2 children (2 small adults upstairs)due to restricted height space in loft. Steep staircase so not suitable for very young children to sleep upstairs. Well equipped galley kitchen combination microwave/oven and single hobfridge and shower bathroom.Teascoffee and biscuits provided.Situated down a country lanewithin the garden of the houseeasy walking distance to pubs and restaurants.Animals and chickens ( summer time with chicks ) live at the house within garden.A few miles drive to Ascot and Royal Windsorso great location for Ascot races and Legoland. Easy access to M4M3train stationsLondonReadingMarlowHenley.Other things to note.House Rules.No Smoking on the premises.No candles.No curriescooked or takeaway ( due to stains and strong smell )

Title: Beautiful log cabin set in a stunning meadow
Description: White Hill Lodge is a lovingly-converted log cabin situated a short walk from beautiful Shoreham village with its cosy pubs and award-winning Mount Vineyard.The space"The space.The Lodge is set within a stunning meadow with views over hills and fields. It sleeps four comfortably in a double bed and two single beds and we can add a fold-out mattress or travel cot if needed. There is a fully equipped kitchen with ovenhobmicrowave and dishwasherand a TV with FreeSat and DVD player. You will have your own outdoor seating area. The meadow (shared with guests of White Hill Hut) has a swingtrampoline and childrens playhouseand guests can use our outdoor heated swimming pool for 1.5 hours a dayall year round.White Hill Lodge can be booked alongside White Hill Hut - a beautiful shepherds hut sleeping 2also listed on Airbnb.* Please notethe upstairs bedroom with two single beds is a mezzanine level so may not be suitable for toddlers who like to climb!"Guest access.The meadow and all its amenities is exclusively for guests of White Hill Lodge and White Hill Hut. The pool can be used by the Lodge and the Hut separately for 1.5 hours a day - the family use this pool also at other times.Please be aware that the property has an outdoor gated swimming pool and two pondsso if you have young childrenthey will need to be supervised at all times."Other things to note.We have two friendly dogs on the property but they dont have access to the meadow area. Please keep your dog on a lead at all points and clean up after theplacing the bags in the bin provided.The upstairs bedroom with two single beds is a mezzanine level so may not be suitable for young children who like to climb."

Title: Self contained Ecopod with parking near the Downs
Description: Our unique Ecopod was handcrafted in Walesit is beautifully insulated with sheep wool and has a lovely smell of wood. The large double glazing doors allow you to make the most of sunlightyou are in the sunniest spot of the garden! The village has everything you needfour independent coffee shopsone bakery and two supermarkets. Further down you have the beautiful HurstpierpointDitchiling and Lewesif you fancy more actionBrighton is 10 minutes away. FULLY HEATED for colder days.The spaceThe space.IF YOU CAN\T FIND THE DATES YOU WANT PLEASE MESSAGE ME AS I MAY HAVE A LAST MINUTE CANCELLATION OR THE DATES ARE BLOCKED AND NOT YET AVAILABLE.We are close to the Downs National Parkas well as having Brighton 20 minutes away. So if you want to walk and visit the villagethen it\s easy. But it\s equally easy to pop into Brighton for sea air or shopping.We are located close to the A23. The nearest station is Hassockswhich is 10 minutes walk from us. This is the Brighton line to London Bridge/ Victoria. Gatwick airport is 30 minutes by car.There\s also cycle hire at the station in Hassockswhich is a 10 minute walk from our house.Hurstpierpoint is a nearby village with lots of shops and some great pubs5 minutes by car or 40 minutes walking.You also have LewesPlumptonDitchling to visit.Cyclists and hikers are also welcome. There are two "cycling cafes" nearby Proper Cycling here in Hassocks and Velusso in Ditchling.Pubs include The BullThe Thatched InnJack and Jill InnThe Hassocks and more. We have a curry and chinese restaurant on the High Street as well as Fish and chips and Kebab Take away.Finally a local lady called Carly delivers amazing afternoon teasshe organizes everything and even takes the dirty plates away so you don\t have to worry about the washing up check Carly\s Afternoon Teas on Facebook.THE PODSELF CHECK IN AVAILABLE AND OWN ACCESS INDEPENDENT FROM MAIN HOUSE.The PODis tucked away on a corner of our family garden. It is NOT secluded and I think is not ideal for romantic weekends. If not sure please message me BEFORE booking.You will have your own independent access to the Pod.Own indoor kitchen area: microwavesmall fridgekettletea/ coffee facilities and crockery. There is no cooker so you cannot make your meals from scratch. You can buy lovely meals from COOK at our local Budgens or eat out at one of the local pubs restaurants (BOOKING HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)You have WI FI and TV (with Amazon Fire stick)internet can be slow at times but it is normally good.You can also have a hammock on the veranda of the Podwe have one should you wish to relax in the Sun.There will also be a selection of coffeeteahot chocolate and biscuits for you.Guest access.you will have your own access to the POD. using the side gate of the main houseOther things to note.We speak PortugueseFrenchSpanish and some Italian tooFree off street parking. We also have space for 1 small car on our driveIroning board available on requestSome toiletries providedClean towels providedExtra blankets provided too

Title: Nettlebed Farm Holiday Lets, Barn1
Description: Beautiful oak barn set in traditional english countryside. Placed with own access within 15 acres of private woodland and grazing landaway from the main road for peace and tranquility. Guests are able to have privacy for relaxation and enjoy views of horses grazing and the comings and goings of the British wildlife. Just 4 minute drive to the market town of Bishops Waltham or you can join and follow the infamous Pilgrims Trail and walk there in just 30 minutes.The space"The space.Stunning new build accommodation set away from the road with private access. Three cabins built with privacy in mind whilst still making the most of the beautiful views and countryside Durley has to offer. Large apex windows create a warmlight and airy space to relax in with an open plan living area with dining.With beautifully thought out living spacekitchen and double bedroom with wet room ensuite - youll find everything you need for your stay. Finished to a high spec our barns have been built to provide home comforts whilst limiting our impact on the surrounding countryside and natural wildlife. Driving down the private road and walking across to your barn to mark the start of your stay will feel like a complete step away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.There is ample parking for carshorse boxes and motorhomes if required,( 240 v and water available)."Other things to note.Due to Covid 19 we will no longer be leaving our welcome pack which also includes teacoffee and milk.Barn 1 has 2 bedrooms but also has a sofabed in the main living area so can accommodate 6 people if required.We welcome dogs but please keep them off the furniture and bringing your 4 legged friends bed would be a good idea to help them settle.Also we have stables and horses on the farm .If the horses are out side the stables please pass trough this area slowly you may need to open and close the gate.

Title: Les Charmettes  , Haslemere
Description: "Only two miles from beautiful Haslemere yet nestled in the heart of South DownsLes Charmettes is the perfect getaway for all the family. Only ten minutes from Black Down; the highest point in South Downs National Park you have walks into the most fantastic countryside quite literally on your doorstep. The beauty of this location is that you are away from it all yet have excellent travel links only moments away. Haslemere station has a line running direct to London Central with a travel time of 49 minutes as well as direct line to Guildford getting you there in only 15 minutes. Excellent Sussex & Surrey pubs are within an easy taxi distance. The White Horse & Apple Tree pub are local and are particularly good. A little to the East towards Petworth Noahs Ark Inn is another local favourite with excellent food and service. Make sure to book if you are going on a weekend evening! For those attended Goodwood Festival of Speed or Revival this couldnt be a more perfect base. You are only 30 minutes from the events and travelling via the north side of Sussex offers a less traffic filled journey getting you there smoothly across the Downs and cutting in-between West Dean & Charlton. Get in touch for more information on local routes.Les Charmettes has a wonderful alpine feel about it tucked away into the rolling hills of South Downs National Park. On arrival you quite literally look up to the wonderful chalet like building through green vegetation and trees. Following a winding wooden stairway up to the front door you feel as if you have stepped into another world leaving the hustle and bustle of day to day far behind you. Les Charmettes has a fantastically quirky garden going uphill to the fields beyond. As you make your way up to the top you find patches of secret gardenflat decked areas with hammocksdining tables and chairs and perfect BBQ spots.Les Charmettes is warm and welcoming from the moment you step through the door. The kitchen dining area is the heart of the building making the perfect spot to entertain and convene with all the family over a home cooked meal or local takeaway ordered in. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need to effectively self-cater during your stay. A separate utility area with washer and dryer can be found by the front door.The living room with open fire is the ideal spot to unwind and relax. Cosy down with a roaring fire on the chilly evenings or open up the bi-fold doors on a summers day and let country air and bright sunshine in. Stepping out of the living room you find yourself on a gorgeous decked area with plenty of room for dining outdoors. Surrounded by foliage and trees you can enjoy the peace that this holiday home brings.On the first floor Les Charmettes has one ground floor bedroom with shower room next door. This lovely space includes desk and chair for a laptop area as well a single day bed which can be converted into a double upon request. Here is also access to the garden via a French window leading out to a space with bistro table and chairs.On the first floor is large master bedroom with balcony. This room has a full sized cot and sofa bed which can be used for small children. Please note your own linen is required for cot and extra sofa beds. The master bedroom has a large walk through wardrobe leading to a good sized en suite.Further along the book lined landing you will find a double bedroom and twin bedroom. A shower room with WC is also on the first floor. The landing has space to become a play area (stair gates are at the top and bottom of the stairwell) a futon is also here which can be used as a sleeping space should guests not want to share a room.Free wifi included. Parking available for four cars."

Title: Magical Treehouse/Cabin hidden in Ancient Woodland
Description: "Welcome to Treetop Lodgeits a specialmagical place to stay. Situated in 10 acres of private ancient woodland on the edge of the Surrey Hills.Escape into nature and stay warmed by a roaring fire and watch the wildlife stroll past your windows; looking out into woodland in all directions.The hill was part of Winston Churchills GHQ line from Bristol to London and pillboxes can be found in the groundsincluding one that provides the foundation for this unique structure."The spaceThe space.The space provides a cosyretreat whilst allowing you to watch nature from the comfort of your bed! The main room provides a woodburner for heatinga clothes railtwo bedside drawerslightsa 42" flatscreen TV connected to a blu-ray/DVD player (note there is no access to standard TV channelswe have a wide range of DVD\s available at the main house if you would like to watch something)a small fridgemicrowave/oven and oven compartment in the wood burner provide basic cooking/food capability. Fairy-lights are threaded throughout the beams and roof space.Guest access.The treehouse/lodge is located in 10 acres of private grounds and woodland that you are welcome to explore. Around the treehouse are woodland trails and a bench to sit and enjoy the location. Access is via a steep grass covered hillsideso good movement is needed and care should be taken. The car park is situated approx 150m awaytherefore you might want to minimise trips/have luggage that can be transported easily across grassland.Other things to note.The treehouse has mains electricity and water. Due to the isolation of the treehouse and the length of electricity cable to supply the property you will need to be careful not to utilise many high voltage items at the same time e.g. oven/microwavehobbathroom heater or bathroom hot water. There will be woodkindlingpaper and lighter supplied for the use of the Woodburner and the top part of this can be used as a small oven for heating food. There is a cold water tap on the right hand side of the outside as you go up the stairs. There is excellent 4G coverage for the Vodafone networkI do not know for others. WiFi access is available via an external WiFI hotspot near the main house/car park.October to March - We provide a basket of logs and half a bag of kindling per day.April to September - We provide 1/2 a basket of logs and half a bag of kindling per day.Additional wood and kindling can be purchased at a cost of ¬£15 per basket of wood and ¬£8 per bag of kindling.

Title: Charming and Characterful Barn with Stunning Views
Description: Charmingspacious and characterful barn conversion with stunning countryside viewsin an idyllic village setting. The barn is open-plan with oak beamsspiral staircasewood burner and a large outdoor patio with seating. This home has been fitted with brand-new conduction hobovenmicrowaveand modern bathroom. It sits in a highly sought after and beautiful village dating back to the 1100s. There are two quality gastropubsa village shop and several gorgeous walks and trails close by.The spaceThe space.Fully furnished and thoughtfully decorated to make this space very special and homely. The barn has a mezzanine master bedroom and looks out across a pretty garden and rolling fields beyond. There is also a large TV with free view television. Secure private parking also available.Other things to note.Woodkindling and matches will be provided for the wood burner!

Title: Private Woodland Cabin with own wood-fired Hot-Tub
Description: "A cosyprivateself contained cabin with its own wood-fired Hot-tuboverlooking our woods. The cabin is well equipped with everything youll need for your staywe supply a breakfast starter pack and tea & coffeeand a few treats. We are happy to help set up birthday/anniversary celebration. A gas BBQ is available on the deck of the cabin and youre welcome to bring your bikeswe have a cycle rack to use. There is only one unit on propertyyou‚Äôll be comfortably secluded and private."The spaceThe space.This is an ideal space to relaxunwind and reconnect. Walking or cycling from the back gate can take you on river walksto Frensham Ponds and to various beautiful places to enjoy. We are happy for you to bring a well behaved dog with you. We will get the hot tub ready for your arrivalkeep you supplied with wood and happy to maintain fire each pmif you prefer not to do it. It‚Äôs perfect to relax in after a day outwe often hear owls and see wildlifeit‚Äôs a special place.Guest access.The guests have sole use of the privately situated cabin with its own deckhot-tub and gas BBQ. There is a grassed area to the side which they can use for lawn games or enjoy the sunloungers are provided. They may see horses passing to the bridlepath but this is in no way invasive. We welcome the LGBTQIA+ community.Other things to note.We are within easy walking distance of the Duke of Cambridge pub which is great for mealsI suggest booking as they are very popular.We are right on the walking paths which lead to Frensham PondsTilfordHankley CommonPierre point farm and the Craft Rooms brewery. It‚Äôs a great area for cycling too and a bike rack is available for useas is a hose and tap to wash down muddy dogs and bikes!.Please consider covering your booking by taking travel insurance with Covid cover which will cost less than ¬£10 for a weekend in case of a positive LFT after the free cancellation window.

Title: Ivy shepherds hut with hot tub
Description: Set in a clearing in the woodsour holiday lets offer the perfect place to relax in a socially-distanced environment. We have also increased our cleaning programme so you can be sure that your stay will be as safe as possible.Check-in on Fridays and Mondays only. Minimum 3-night stay.The spaceThe space.Set in beautiful surroundingsIvy offers guests the chance to relax and soak up the beautiful natural surroundings or visit one of the many local attractions. Ivy comes complete with beddingtowelslogburner and wood-fired hot tub!Ivy itself is a beautiful shepherds hutequipped with everything you should need.Ivy includes:.A comfy double bed.Bedding and towels.Fridge.Electric kettle.Single ring camping stove.Logburner.TV over the bed.Flushing Toilet (with an ingenious lifting trap door to convert it from toilet to shower).Shower.Electric sockets.Fully equipped kitchen.Household essentials (toilet rollwashing up liquidcooking oilsalt and pepperand a pint of milk).Outdoor seating.BBQ.Chimnea.Wood-fired hot tub (no bubbles).1 bag of logs for each night of your stay (additional bags of logs charged at ¬£5 per bagkindling ¬£2 per tub. Also available: instant light BBQ coal ¬£3 per bagfirelogs ¬£2).Golf packages and fishing also available - enquire for details.See also our other listings: Bluebell the shepherds hut with hot tub and Oak Lodge with wood-fired hot tubperfect for 2!.

Title: The Blewbury Studio: country walks, pubs & piano.
Description: Listed in The Sunday Telegraph as one of ‚Äò10 coolest BnB‚Äôs in Britain‚Äô The Studio is situated in a cosy Oxfordshire villageon the edge of AONB North Wessex Downs (thatched cottagesorchardspubs & walks). Stunningdetached timber~framed barn: large living area with sofa & 2 armchairsmezzanine & king size bed {via ladder}kitchenetteshower room. Also parkinggood Wifihandmade crockerymicrowave/grillfridge/freezerorganic vegetable gardenGrand Piano (extra charge)The space"The space.(Currently set up for minimum 2 night weekend break. For stays longer than 3 nights please message us üôè).For over 150 years the village of Blewbury has been a destination for artistsandas suchThe Blewbury Studio is flooded with light and colour. Beautiful paintings and objectsalong with well-crafted fixturesdecorate the timber framed spacewhich we hope is inspiring and reflective. In keeping with the buildings ECO credentialsmany elements of the decor (coffee tablekitchen units etc) have been handmade on sitefrom upcycled pieces of timberor found in charity shops and given a new lease of life. ‚ÄòThe Blewbury Studio‚Äô was listed both in The Sunday Telegraph and The Sunday Times as one of ‚ÄòThe 10 coolest BnB‚Äôs in Britain‚Äô (November 2020]Parking outside our houseyou are invited to walk through the garden at the back of which sits the Studiooverlooking the organic vegetable garden. Outside the back door a small private table is provided which catches the morning sun..perfect for alfresco breakfastsor an evening drink. You are welcome to wander around our organic vegetable garden or while away the hours by the pond in our vintage deckchairs. There is a small fire pit available for when the evenings draw in (logs charged extra)Insidethe Kitchenette comes with a decent sized fridge/freezerand a microwave/grill for light meals. Its important to point out there is no plumbed sink in the Kitchenette; you are welcome to use the plastic wash tub/liquid and cloths provided. Breakfast (Luxury Mueslimilka locally baked Sourdough or Seeded LoafFrench butterRaspberry Jamfresh Coffee and Tea) is provided..or stroll along to the village Cafe for a Full English. For those who wish to stay in after a long day exploringwe offer a delivery service of delicious Asian inspired meals by local chefs Monsoon. Using fresh local ingredientsthis service is very popular with our guests.details will be emailed after booking.The Mezzanine is a stunning feature of the accommodationgiving a unique aspect of the space. It is 2.2m from ground leveland whilst the ladder is steep it is comfortable/easy to use (10 flat treadswith brushed steel handrails on the side and at the top.see the photos). For safety reasons The Blewbury Studio is not suitable for young children. The bed is a comfortablebrand newKing Size futon made of sustainable hardwoodwith luxury Egyptian cotton bed linen. There is storage on the mezzanine for clothesbut we would recommend leaving suitcases/bags on ground level.As professional musicians we take pride in our Boston Steinway grand piano. Its a stunning instrument which is available to hire by professional musicians or those engaged in serious study (payable in advance- variable rates-please message me). Otherwise the piano will be locked. There are extra music stands available to borrow. There is a large CD collection to peruseand music systemas well as vocal scores and piano music.There is a selection of books on the local areaplus OS walking maps to borrow. The bird life is diverse in the areawith as many as 30 different species visiting our own gardenincluding HeronsWoodpeckersSparrowhawksa Tawny OwlRed Kites and a Mandarin Duck! There is also a guide to garden birds and binoculars to borrow. There is Scrabble and playing cards.. but no telly! Before your arrival well email you a file detailing information on local restaurantsshopsbeauty spot recommendationslocal businessesand fun excursions like hiking routeswild swimming or hiring canoes on The Thames.White Company towels and Egyptian Cotton bed linen are all providedalong with Faith in Nature Body WashShampoo and Conditionerand a hair dryer."Guest access.The Studio is available in its entirety for your private usealong with an outside area. You are welcome to sit under the Hazel tree by the pond.a great place for a coffeeand wander about the vegetable garden."Other things to note.There will be a Welcome Pack on arrival:.-Fresh local sourdoughbutter and raspberry jam.-Milkfreshly ground coffee and tea.-Muesli.-Iced water.-Small bottle of Prosecco-After booking we will email a local info packalong with details of how to order delicious ready meals from local company Monsoon..Asian inspired mealsmade with fresh local ingredients. If youre planning a night in after a long days walkingthis is a popular option for our guests (please give at least 24 hrs notice)"

Title: The Cowshed, Tunbridge Wells
Description: "New for 2018a totally renovated and extended 1920s cowshed. This cosy retreat is 1 mile from the historic Pantiles of Tunbridge Wells and mainline station where London can be reached in around 50 minutes. It sits on the Kent and East Sussex border in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.With its wide range of eating places and shopsTunbridge Wells is a great base from which to explore the beautiful Garden of England.The owners live alongside the Cowshed but respect your privacy."The spaceThe space.There is external CCTV protecting the property and we have electric gatesGuest access.The Cow Shedthe grass in front and the patio at the back. One parking space. The driveway in front of our house is private.Other things to note.Parking is for one car only as this is shared parking with our home. It may be possible to accommodate an additional carbut this is by prior agreement.Sorry no children under 12 apart from non walking babies.Also strictly no pets.There is a combination microwave and induction hob but no conventional oven.Wedding parties incur an additional cleaning charge of ¬£30.

Title: Garden Guest Suite
Description: Private Garden room with en-suite bathroom in the pretty village of Freeland. Self check in available. Private parking and WiFi. Freeland is a small village with a lovely village pub which is located a stones throw away. Close to Oxford 10.1 milesWoodstock (Blenheim Place) 5.2 miles and nearest train station is just 2.6 miles away.The spaceThe space.The property is located opposite the quiet Village Pub and church. It is also a few doors away from Freeland Village Hallwe back onto a lovely playing field which has a park at the far end. You have your own private outside area in front of the accommodation with seating. Please note that it is a family house and although you have your own area you may still hear my children playing in the garden when the weather permits! We also now have a black Labradorhe‚Äôs very young and likes to greet guests with a bark when he‚Äôs in the gardenplease note he is very friendly and can‚Äôt get to youjust please don‚Äôt be alarmed if you see him!Guest access.We offer self check inplease go straight through the gate on the left hand side of the house. There on your right you will find the key safe (combination will be sent to you before arrival) containing the key to your room. The garden room is located at the end of the propertyjust follow the path and lights and you can‚Äôt go wrong! If you‚Äôd prefer to be shown to the suite then please message and I‚Äôll make sure I‚Äôm around at your check in time.Other things to note.The space doesn‚Äôt have a fully fitted kitchen but there is a microwavemini fridge and tea and coffee making facilities. A welcome pack will also be provided.

Description: Beautiful one bedroom log cabin with separate shower room and comfortable living space.Set in 2 acres surrounded by woodland.Located in wonderful village of Chelsfield with 2 local pubs both serving excellent food.Orpington Town is just a short drive away with shopsrestaurantspubs and cinema.Orpington station provides fast train service in to London Victoria and London Charing Cross both within 25 minutes or less .The spaceThe space.Just comerelaxenjoy the view and the tranquility.
