Title: Private Annex with Hot Tub
Description: Located within the gardens of a quaint cottagethis private annex is moderncosy and relaxed. The perfect place to explore the beautiful surrounding countryside or use as a base for the areas multitude of sporting and cultural events.The space"The space.The annex is split in to 4 rooms:A cosy living roomcomplete with wood burning fire and 70 TV DVD player and free view channels . The large L-shaped sofais perfect to come back to after a long days out in the local countryside.Generously sized bedroom with queen bed and stylish wood furnishing.A modern bathroom with shower/bath and WC.A small pantry with refrigerationa microwavetoaster and tea / coffee . Please note this is not a proper kitchen and therefore doesnt have proper cooking facilities . However the area is full of fantastic pubsrestaurants and delis wed be happy to recommend. And the local shop in Kirdford does a great cooked breakfast !!Outside is connected by a series of double doors and theres a small terrace with table and chairsperfect for a sunny morning coffee. Here youll also find the hot tub overlooking paddocks."

Title: River Rose Retreat Shepherds Hut, view and hot tub
Description: "River Rose Retreat is a luxurious and cosy shepherds hutlocated along side the stunning river Hamblein the quaint village of Botley.The Shepherds Hutwhich is within walking distance from Botley village and train stationhas its own garden with hot tubseating area and fire pitsurrounded by trees whilst gazing out on to the river.Although we adore dogs ourselvesunfortunately no dogs are allowed.Due to the current climate please re-book if you or anyone in your house is unwell"The space"The space.The Shepherds hut is situated at the bottom of a field behind a working equestrian centre and farmso you will have the delight of having horses as your neighbours! This luxury glamping shepherds hut consists of a double bedbathroomand a kitchen area with seating and a log burner.Please note we are completely off grid so the property is solar powered therefore NO TViron or hair dryer! The hut has basic facilities including a kettlehob and camping cool box as a fridge.Our gorgeous seating area outside has a firepit and log burning hot tub.The hot tub.The hot tub generally takes around 2-3 hours to heat up from cold. Logs and kindling are kept underneath the hut and you pay for what you use (¬£5/ bag of logs; ¬£5/ bag of kindling)."Other things to note.Everything you need in a cosy and compact traditional shepherds hut with a modern twist. Do as much or as little as you like depending on your mood. A place to digitally disconnect (no wifi!) and appreciate the beautiful naturesounds of birds and view of the river around you.

Title: Stunning barn conversion with panoramic views
Description: Wake up and enjoy uninterrupted views to the beautiful rolling hills of the South Downs. Our lovingly converted barn creates a warm and comfortable homeperfect for a quiet escape or a base to explore. Upstairs is a stunning double bedroom with king bedbathroom and separate area for study or additional sleeping on a sofa bed. Downstairs is a well equipped open plan kitchen and living room with a private garden perfect for alfresco dining or a sundowner drink. Come and enjoy our working farm.The spaceThe space.We are so luckily to be able to welcome guests to our barn in the beautiful Milland Valley. We have decked out the barn with everything you need for a relaxing stay so just pack your clothes and come and unwind. Not only does the house have amazing views across the countryside but there is also a skylight above the king bed so that you can lie in bed and stare at the stars above.

Title: Bluebell Shepherds Hut with hot tub
Description: Set in a clearing in the woodsour holiday lets offer the perfect place to relax in a socially-distanced environment. We have also increased our cleaning programme so you can be sure that your stay will be as safe as possible.Check-in on Fridays and Mondays only. Minimum 3-night stay.The spaceThe space.Bluebell is a beautiful shepherds hut furnished in soft blue fabricsand equipped with everything you should need.Bluebell includes:.A comfy double bed.Bedding and towels.Fridge (18x16x16 inches).Twin gas hob.Logburner.Flushing Toilet.Electric shower.Electric sockets and USB charging points.Fully equipped kitchen.Household essentials (toilet rollwashing up liquidcooking oilsalt and pepper and a pint of milk).Outdoor seating.BBQ.Wood-fired hot tub.1 bag of logs for each night of your stay (additional bags of logs charged at ¬£5 per bagkindling ¬£2 per tub. Title: The Hayloft, Downley Common
Description: The Hayloft is situated at Downley Farmhouse in DownleyBuckinghamshire - half way between London and Oxfordclose to Marlow and Henley-on-Thames.Downley is a small village set around a common with a friendly local pubThe Le De Spencer Armswhich serves good food.The village has all the necessary local amenities and is within easy reach of all major communication networks and local attractions.The spaceThe space.The Hayloft is first floor self-contained accommodation accessed by a private external staircase. It has recently been redecorated and furnished to provide a comfortable and cosy environment. The open plan accommodation offers a kitchen area with breakfast bar and bar stools. The kitchen is fitted with a combination microwavefridgekettletoaster and coffee machine. Teacoffee and sugar are provided.The open plan living area has a two seater sofa complete with comfy cushions and throw. There is a smart HD 40" TV with Netflix and BBC iplayer available. Radio and CD player.King size bed with duvet and plenty of pillows.Shower room with pedestal basin and w.c. White fluffy towels and toiletries provided.Cot and High chair available on request.The owner\s horses are stabled a short distance from the staircase and there are free range chickens and ducks roaming in the gardens. Fresh eggs always available!

Title: Charming cabin in South Downs
Description: "Charming isolated space overlooking garden and open farmland within South Down National Park. Double bed with space for travelling cot if have young family. En-suite toilet and shower with luxury products. Own lockable door with parking. Ideal for Goodwoodweddings at the Tythe Barn and Southdowns Manorvisits to Petersfield and Chichesteras well as walking the South Downs Way. We dont accept dogs but guests may come into contact with Nora our friendly dog so must be OK with dogs."The spaceThe space.The garden is isolated and because the garden and house is on open farmland there is a feeling of space and calm. Country roads abound for walks and escape from city life.Guest access.The garden area is shared with the owners but guests have exclusive use of the table and chairs directly outside their cabin. Please contact hosts for use of the pizza oven or BBQ facilities.Other things to note.Please note that we have a Tibetan TerrierNora so guests must like dogs as she is free to roam in the garden.There are no cooking facilities in the cabin bar a toaster and kettle.

Title: Self Catering shepherds hut with the deer.
Description: Self catering shepherds hut with deer in the surrounding paddock where the hut is situated. Hut is built to the highest standards and has parking. Constant hot and cold watera showerloocookerhobfridgekettletoaster and small double bed. Towels and bed linen provided.Close to Petworth30 minutes from the coasttwenty minutes from Goodwood and Arundel. Title: The Look Out @ Stable Yard
Description: "The Look Out @ Stable Yard is set in an elevated position amongst the trees overlooking the valley. Its a self contained one bedroom boutique house set within our pretty English country garden. The fridge will be stocked with continental breakfast goodies on the first day of arrival. The property has its own access and outdoor space. Ideal for those looking for a place to stay within walking distance to the award winning village. The property does have low ceilings throughout."The spaceThe space.We apologise but due to the elevated position of The Look Out @ Stable Yard the property is not suitable for disabled access or clients with walking difficulties.Unfortunately the property is not suitable for children .Guest access.The Look Out @ Stable Yard is a self contained property.Outside:.* One parking space.* Balcony with small seating area over looking the valley.* Wood burning stove.* Wood store.* To access the property you need to walk up a ramp and make your way down 6 steps to the front door.Inside:.*Kitchen with 2 burner induction hobmicrowave ovenfridge / freezersinktoaster and kettle (tea and coffee supplied).* Bathroom with walk in shower.* Living room with wood burning stoveseating areasmart TVgames.* Wifi throughout the property.* Flight of stairs to carpeted bedroom with double bedluxury mattressseating area & wardrobe.* Balcony usefar reaching views.* Small garden area with patio and BBQ.* Washing line

Title: Stylish, airy Scandinavian-style summerhouse
Description: "Our stylish Scandi-inspired summer house in the bucolic village of Long CrendonBucks is unique to the area. We were thrilled when it recently featured in an interiors magazine.Its perfect for a grown-up getawaybusiness travellers - or if youre attending a wedding in Bucks/Oxon and need a chic bolthole to sleep off the champagne!"The space"The space.The one-bedroom property is located at the end of our garden but is entirely self-contained and private.Please note: we cant accommodate children unfortunately.Basic breakfast provisions are provided but we recommend you swing by our award-winning caf√© and lifestyle store NORSKin the neighbouring village of Haddenham. Its less than 10 minutes by car and open seven days a week from 8am on weekdays and 9am on weekends."

Title: Orchard Garden Cabin
Description: Our cabin is set in the garden of our home which is in an area of outstanding natural beauty. There is a decking area around the cabin with a fire pit plus table and chairs for dining alfresco or just enjoy the fresh air. We are surrounded by fields located about 1 mile from the village and pubs. You can head out for a county walk right from the door step. Several National trust properties in the area. Whether your stay is long or shortthere is plenty do to or just take time to relax.The space"The space.Our cabin is set in the garden of our home which is in an area of outstanding natural beauty. There is a kitchenette in the main studio room and a shower room with toilet. The kitchenette has a breakfast bar and stools. Appliances include a toasterkettletwo ring ceramic hobmicrowaveslow cooker and a fridge.The lounge/bedroom area has a double bed and bedside tablestwo seater sofa and television with sky TV including Sky cinema and Sky Sports.We have a travel cot and highchair available for families with babies/toddlers.On the decking area to the front of the cabinyou will find a table and chairs for dining alfresco or just enjoy the fresh air. We have a fire pit area at the back of the cabin which can be used to cook on. We charge ¬£12.50 per night for coal and wood. (or coal only for ¬£5). We can only allow the use of the fire pit with the coal and logs we provide due to health and safety risk assessment.The cabin is very well insulated to keep the warmth in and has two electric oil filled radiators. One of these radiators on a fairly low setting is more than enough to keep the cabin nice and cosy. We also have a wood burner look alike electric heater which has a mist flame effect that can be used without using the heater.We are surrounded by fields located about 1 mile from the village and pubs. You can head out for a county walk right from the door step.Check in is from 16:00 onwards as this is when it will definitely be cleaned and reset for check ins on Tuesdays and Fridays. The clean is often completed before this on other days and if the cabin can be made available to you earlierwe will let you know.Please note: Our drive way is directly off the main road through the village and you will hear the sound of cars driving pastespecially during rush hour."

Title: Oakside - Luxury Cabin - Tiny House
Description: "A luxury detached & secluded cabin set in a private & secure garden overlooking playing fields & farmland. 6 min walk to the local pub with some great walks nearby. 5 min walk across the village green opposite the main house to NIRVANA SPA10 min walk to Winnersh Train station & Sainsburys. Close to Bearwood golf clubcricket& tennis clubs. Close to J10 M4ReadingTwyfordSonning & Henley-On-Thames.Free parking for 1 carfast WIFI & laptop workspace + cooking facilities."The space"The space.As filmed by the BBC for Escape to The CountryWe are family-friendly and welcome everyone from all walks of life:-)Due to COVIDwe have instigated a thorough cleansing protocol in both our cabin & studio.Oakside cabin is detached from the main house & has been designed to use the maximum amount of space.The decor is in an industrial type scheme with steel pipes used for shelvesmirrorsand towel rails along with handrailssupport railsand lighting.The heating system is controlled by the latest technology in underfloor water heating systems.Inside the interior is finished in English oak (Windsor Great Park) which is used around the doors and window and there is a large solid oak beam that dominates the room. There is a sliding oak door that separates the bathroom from the main space and there is a small hanging space (with hangers) in the airing cupboard should you require it.We have flooded the space with LED lighting to allow you to control the mood. The main space overlooks a playing field & farmland via floor-to-ceiling double glazed patio doors and in the morning as the sun is coming up its possible to see deer roaming in the fields. Outside of the french doorsyou have your private patio with a table and two chairs.Inside there is a kitchenette with everything you need to cook your meals ( a 2-ring electric hob is provided) and a Nespresso coffee machine to have your first cup of coffee to start the day (pods provided). Should you prefer tea there is instant hot water delivered via a Perrin & Rowe filtered water tap for hot drinks via the sink unit.- KitchenAid Nespresso Coffee Machine.- Fridge with Ice Compartment.- Combination Microwave Oven.- 2 Ring Electric Hob.- PlatesCupsGlasses & Cutlery.- Large Philips flat-screen Smart TV and POLK sound system.- Alexa Show.- USB charging ports on the mezzanine level and in the kitchenette.- Shampooshower gel & handwash.- Hand-Sanitiser.- 1 per person complimentary face masks (More available at ¬£2.50 each).- Hairdryer & straighteners.- Table & chairs.- Sofa (small sofabed).- Active Era Luxury Single Size Air Mattress - Elevated Inflatable Air.Bedwith an Electric Built-in PumpRaised Pillow & Structured I-Beam Technology.- Towels.- Luxury memory foam mattress & bed linen.- USB sockets.- WiFiWe also provide teacoffeeshower gelshampoo & conditioner.To access the mezzanine level a solid beech ladder with handrails has been provided. There are solid steel pipe rails that have been installed across the top of the mezzanine to provide safety and comfort. Once you have gained access you will find a very comfortable Japanese-style double bed with a memory foam mattress and a Velux window (with a black-out blind) to look up and watch the stars. As this is a tiny house there is no standing room available on the mezzanine but you can sit very comfortably either against the wall or under the eaves and look through the round window across the fields.PLEASE NOTE - THIS SPACE IS NOT FOR EVERYONE. The cabin is ideal for two but can sleep three as there is a small sofa bed (sleeps one) on the ground floor and/or an Active Era Luxury Single Size Air Mattress - Elevated Inflatable Air Bedwith an Electric Built-in PumpRaised Pillow & Structured I-Beam Technology.We have provided a Philips Ambilight SMART TV with internet access and an Alexa along with free wifi. There is a small fridge with an ice compartmenta two-ring hoband a combination microwave ovenalong with a coffee machine and an instant hot water tap for drinking.In front of the patio doorsthere is a small private patio and we have provided two chairs and a table for your use where you can simply enjoy the view. Or you can simply lie back on the sofa and enjoy the view from there!Storage is supplied by a cupboard and drawers and a small hanging rail in the airing cupboard situated in the bathroom.FREE parking for one car only.Check out our other listing via my profile :-)"Guest access.Guests will access the side gate of the main property and enter through the garden to the cabin on the right. There is a small patio with two chairs and a table for guest use.Please note: CCTV is in operation on the entrances to the house and the driveway/garden.Other things to note.You can expect to see your hosts and dogs in and around the garden.

Separate WC and separate shower.ideal getaway from it all for 2.Secure Parking short distance from well known restaurant ‚Äòthe sir Charles Napier‚Äô.Within an area of outstanding beauty.Min 2 nightsOther things to note.Departure time 11am unless by prior arrangement.This is a non smoking environment

Title: Evesham Lodge
Description: In the heart of the Kent countryside Evesham Lodge offers a perfect getaway. Perfectly situated to visit local attractions including Leeds CastleSissinghurst and Bedgebury Pinetum to name but a few. In the village you can catch a direct train to London which takes under an hour.Evesham Lodge is self-contained and situated in our large 1 acre garden. It has a private entrance and plenty of off road parking. A car is essential for your visit.The spaceThe space.Evesham Lodge has 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. One has a shower cubicle and the other has a bath with shower. The kitchen is fully equipped with cookerdishwashermicrowavefull sized fridge freezer and washing machine with dryer. There is an outside seating area and you have shared use of the garden with a pond. We have ducks living on the pond and chickens.Guest access.You will have sole use of Evesham Lodge and shared use of the garden.Other things to note.You may bring up to 2 well behaved dogs. They must not be left unattended in the property.

Title: Water Lane Barn, Little Tew
Description: "A unique and beautifully designed barn with a largeopen plan living area and a mezzanine sleeping deck. A recently built and timber cladgiving it a rustic and original feel. The barn comes with its own private landscaped terraceproviding excellent views over the fields beyond. Situated in the idyllic Cotswold village of Little Tewa stones throw from Soho Farmhouse."The spaceThe space.There is a mezzanine sleeping deck with lovely round window looking over the orchard and fields beyond. This is accessible by ladder onlyso please do not book this if this is at all challenging for you.The barn was designed to mimic a traditional barn with double crittal windows on opposite sidesallowing wonderful views and lots of natural light. The space downstairs has a long central table with a well-equipped kitchen area (comprising all the usual appliances) and a wetroom with a colourful encaustic tiled floor.The other end has a large comfy L-shaped sofa to relax on. There is a sound system which you can plug in any device and SkyNetflixSpotify etc are all accessible through the TV.Guest access.Behind the barn is a private area with beautifully planted beds around a seating area with pergola above and lovely views beyond over the orchard and fields. The parking space is immediately in front of the barn which is shared for the house and cottage beyond.

Title: Luxury log cabin
Description: "300+ 5* Airbnb reviews300+ 5* for hospitality and ‚Äòthe best breakfast ever!‚Äô I am so pleased that Briar Lodge has successfully hosted so many people from so many parts of the world. In gated grounds offering secure parking and rural tranquility with easy access to DorkingHorshamGatwick and the M25with excellent rail links into London.A perfect base to explore Surreys stunning National Trust siteswith golfingfishingcycling,rambling and country pubs all within easy reach."The spaceThe space.Purpose builtBriar Lodge offers complete privacy and secure parking. Outsidethere is a patio area with charcoal bbq and views across the fields and woodland with access to the garden and terrace to the main house in the summer.Inside we have provided everything we would like to find on a short stay ourselves. There is an en-suite shower room with plenty of towels and toiletriestowelling dressing gownsa flat screen tv with free view and wificomplimentary chilled bottled water and soft drinksfresh fruit as well as a hair dryeriron and ironing board.A fridgetoasterkettle and Nespresso coffee machine with a selection of coffees are provided along with a variety of ‚ÄòTea Pig‚Äô and Pukka teas.If you wish to have breakfast a substantial freshly prepared breakfast of your choiceusing the finest local produceis served to your room between 7am to 11am to enjoy at the breakfast bar or (weather permitting) on the patio or terrace. There is an additional charge of ¬£9.00 per person for this payable during your stay. Veganvegetarian and gluten free options are catered for and guests are requested to advise in advance of any special dietary requirements. A travel cot is available on request. The cabin is a comfortable size for two and will accommodate a travel cot. If travelling with a totaccess to the garden will help tire them out!AlsoRoom One at Briarwood is available. A spacious under-floor heated ground floor ensuitewith super-king size beddouble walk-in power showerplenty of towelstowelling dressing gowns and complimentary toiletries. There is a fridge with complimentary chilled soft drinksa selection of ‚Äò Tea Pig‚Äò and Pukka teasalong with a Nespresso coffee machine and a selection of coffees. Fully loaded smart tv with Netflix and Sky movies and wifi available. Private sitting room. Underfloor heating throughout..and fab White Company bedding. Click to see full details.https://www.airbnb.co.uk/manage-your-space/14898067/detailsOther things to note.To get the most out of your visita car is a must! Box HillLeith HillDenbies Wine Estate and the amazing National Trust properties within the area are all well worth a trip.Although only a ten minute drive away from Dorkingwe are not on a bus route and as a rural area have no street lamps or pavements. You can however access many of the lovely bridle paths and footpaths around - one will take you to Holmwood train station with trains into London and Horsham and another will lead you into the village of Newdigate with a small local shop and post office and a great pub to enjoy lunch or dinner.

Title: Grayswood Cowshed in stunning Grounds
Description: A beautifully converted Cow Shed in a rustic style with luxurious Super King bed in a studio suite with added double bunk room for up to four extra guests.Studio has a galley kitchen with hob and oven for basic cooking.Well fitted bathroom facilities including powerful shower and roll top bath and underfloor heating.Relaxing Sofa in main space with Flatscreen TV and wifi throughout.Underfloor heating throughout. Large french windows overlooking an orchard.The spaceThe space.Set in the grounds of a Georgian manor house there are beautiful gardens and woodland to explore. Horsessheep and Chickens give a farm like feel.Guest access.There is a tennis court that guests that guests can use and possible access to pool when open in the summer months.Other things to note.Pretty village with Cricket in the summer and Local Pub within walking distance.Suitable for those with dogs.

Title: A cabin retreat in Kingston upon Thames - London
Description: "This is an urban stay with an original twist! Youll be staying in a bespoke cabin (with private entrance) in a landscaped & beautifully lit garden. Youll have a double bedroom with an en-suite shower room. This little sanctuary is situated in Kingston upon Thames within walking distance to Richmond parkKingston shopping centre & the riverside. Its 4 minutes walk to Norbiton train station with regular trains to Waterloo (25 mins journey). Plenty of lovely shops & restaurants on the doorstep."The space"The space.This space was lovingly designed and carefully built for visiting family and friends. Howeverwe decided following several recommendations to open it up to paying guestswhich suits us just fine as we love meeting people. Its situated at the end of our gardenwhich is approx 180 ft/50 meters longso you‚Äôll have plenty of privacy & a lovely view of mature trees & a green garden to enjoy. We like to think of it as the ultimate eco retreat. Its brand new (built in summer 2017). The space is nestled under an ancient oak treewhich makes it even cosier and more tranquil. It bathes in afternoon/evening sun. The cabin benefits from its own entrance and the security of CCTV cameras around the main house. The cabin is independentprivatetranquilflooded with light and warm all year round. You will have coffee and tea making facilities (Nespresso machine & a kettle inc coffee capsules & tea bags)smart TV with Netflixmini fridge & free wi-fi""Guest access.Youre welcome to enjoy a lovely lawn area outside the cabin as well as an outdoor seating area with table and chairs under a pergola."Other things to note.- Bed linenbath towelshand soaphand towel& toilet paper are provided but please do bring your own toiletries.- Only those people on the booking are permitted to stay.- Laundry service can be made available at a cost.- Bike hire available from hosts.- Self check-in is available for late arrivals (past 10 p.m.)

Title: Woodland Lodge
Description: Relax and unwind at our woodland lodge. In a peaceful and secluded positionspacious cottage is set within the ancient woodland of Burrswoodwith direct access to beautiful woodland walks. If the weather is ever against you during your staywe have a table tennis tableplus a selection of DVDs and games to keep you occupiedand a large wood-burning stove to keep you cosy.The spaceThe space.The lodge has been recently refurbished and is an open plan layout. The bathroom has a large corner showerand there is a fitted kitchenlounge area with surround sound and a large mezzanine bedroom area with elevated views over the forest canopy.Facilities include:The Kitchen.Within our kitchen facilitieswe must point out that the oven is a combination microwave oven and grill(NO LARGE OVEN). There is also a two-ring electric hob installedand a toasterkettleespresso machinefridge/freezerFrench press coffee makerplus plenty of glassescutlerycrockery etc.Living area: Wood-burning stovetable & chairs for 6 people (plus 2 extra fold-up chairs)high chair available upon requestBathroom: Mira electric showerlarge basinWC.Lounge: Seating comfortably for at least 6 peopleDVD playerDVD collectionCD PlayerWi-FiAux with iPhone 6 connectionsofa bedtable tennis table.Bedroom: Super King sized bedtwo single beds (optional)double futontravel cot.Outside: The Garden.The Lodge benefits from its own garden areawhich is for guests‚Äô private use. Our main garden is separate from thishowever this is a family home with children often in the main gardenwhich we ask you to be mindful of.There is a fire pit setup at the lower level of the Lodge garden. Please feel free to use this - there is fire lighting material by the wood burner and you can either forage for firewood in the woodsor there is a lot of dry wood in the wood store at the side of the building.Optional extras: BBQ & Pizza Oven.If you have pre-booked the pizza oven this will be set up prior to your arrival. We supply enough pizza doughs for two per person and keep them in the fridge of the lodge for you to use whenever you want. We also supply basic ingredients for pizzas (passata and mozzarella cheese)wood and also instructions on how to light and cook the pizzas. Please give us 24 hours‚Äô notice if you would like pizzas.The charcoal BBQ is free for you to useyou just need to supply your own charcoal.Guest access.The track to the left-hand side of the drive as you come in will take you down to Woodland Lodge.There is enough space for a car to 3-point-turn down by the Lodgehoweverif you have more than one vehicle feel free to park them all down there.When facing the front door of the Lodge there is a key lockbox to the right-hand side on the gable end (around the cornerjust above the wood store) about 4ft up. You will have received the code prior to your arrival.Other things to note.The lodge is in a secluded location tucked away from the main house. It is an incredibly peaceful location with no neighbours other than the local wildlife yet within easy reach of Royal Tunbridge Wells.You are within the grounds of a family homebecause of this we request any music or noise to be taken inside the lodge from 10 pm.Please note - *This is not a party venue where additional people can arrive unannounced.*Rubbish & Recycling.There are three recycling boxes beside the right-hand side of the Lodge - one is for paper & cardone is for (rinsed) plasticglass & metalplus one extra. There is also a small food waste caddy under the kitchen sink. We ask our guests to recycle when they can.Please put the non-recyclable bin bags in the green dustbin at the top of the drive (please do not leave then outside the Lodge because animals will go through them and scatter rubbish everywhere!).Table Tennis.The table is free for you to use and enjoyand the balls and bats are kept in the cupboard underneath the kitchen sink.Our family.We have a large family that love the outdoorsand we also have a large garden that needs constant maintenance - especially on weekends children will be playing and mowers mowing. If the odd child wanders down and says helloI apologise in advancebut we will try to prevent this! We will try our best to prevent any disturbance at antisocial hours to our guests& ask that you avoid outdoor noise after 10pm please.

Title: The Hay Loft - luxury converted barn nr Haslemere
Description: "The Hay Loft is a beautiful one bedroom converted barn in private gated grounds situated in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Located next to the village cricket groundpub and church and a five minute drive to Haslemere with its mainline train stationsupermarketindependent shops and coffee shops. Ten minute drive to Petworth Parkwith its stately home and deer park and to Cowdray Parkwith regular polo during the summer monthsfarm shop and stunning walks."The space"The space.The Hay Loft has a fully fitted kitchenwashing machineovenhobmicrowavekettletoaster and the all important coffee machine! The living room with cathedral ceiling and exposed beams and full central heating provides a warmcosy place to relax. There is a double sofa bed which can accommodate 2 children or 1 adult and an additional rollaway bed can be provided upon request. A flatscreen TVbooks and board games are available to help you relax after enjoying the numerous walks in the vicinity. The barn has WiFi throughout. The bedroom is upstairs on the mezzanine level and has a king size bedluxury bed linensrobes and towels. Please notethe bedroom is not suitable for those with mobility issuesas access is up a ladder style staircase. The bathroomhas a heated towel rail and a walk in shower. Externallyautomated gates lead onto a landscaped driveway where parking is available and there is a decked area with outdoor seating to enjoy the sunshine and a tipple of your choice! The Hay Loft shares its courtyard with The Hay Barn(which when booked together sleeps a total of 8 people)."

Title: Entire Garden Annex with Breathtaking Views
Description: Lovely self-contained annex with breath-taking views over the open fields. Open plan spacious living room and kitchen on the ground floor with a double bedroom with en-suite on the first floor. Short walk to Hanborough train station with great links into LondonOxford and the Cotswolds. Plenty of country walkspubs and within walking distance to Blenheim Palace.The spaceThe space.Appletree Cottage is located in an idyllic village in the Cotswoldsit is perfectly situated for visiting Oxford CityBlenheim Palace and the Cotswolds.The self-contained annex is brand newmodern & brightsurrounded by a beautiful garden. It offers a spacious open plan livingdining and kitchen area with a sofaa 55" TV and under floor heating.The bedroom is located on the first floor and has amazing views of the Oxfordshire countryside. It has sloped ceilings and it features a king size bedside cabinetschest of drawers and a generous open wardrobe. The shower room is located just off of the landing next to the bedroom and offers a showersink and a cabinet.***Please note that access to the upper floor is via an external staircase.***Guest access.- We offer our guests complementary Wi-Fi.- You will have sole use of the annexe.- We endeavour to be around to greet our guests - whenever that is not possible a lockbox key code will be provide it to self check-in.- There is space to park 1 guest car (arrangements can be made for more cars but please let us know in advance).- You are welcome to use our garden but please note on some occasions we might be using it too!

Title: A Cosy Cottage With A Fabulous View Close To TW.
Description: This listing is categorically not suitable for groups of singles. Our new cottage has recently been completed. It has stunning views across Kentsituated down a quiet farm lane with no other houses in sight. We are 10 mins from the centre of Tunbridge WellsTonbridge and Paddock Wood.It is incredibly cosy with underfloor heating throughoutit is also totally eco friendly. There is an electric car charger for those arriving inelectric cars (¬£15/night or ¬£25/day charge)payable before charging.The spaceThe space.The cottage is suitable for couples or a family not groups of singles. Dogs are welcome with prior consent. The floor mattress is a single fold up. The cottage has its own terrace with table. There is a utility room next door with washing machine and tumble dryer and space for boots and coats. It is located on a footpath so great for walking with 2 woods encircling us. The garden has open access on to a farm road so dogs need to be attended at all times. There are also lots of cycling paths for cycling.Guest access.There is one dedicated parking space for the cottage but room beside it for further cars. Guests can use the garden which includes a unique fruit garden with peachesapricotspearsfigs and many other fruits. Please note there is a private covered swimming pool in the garden for family use onlythis is not available for guests to useso children would need to be supervised at all times in the garden.Other things to note.The nearest supermarkets are about 10 minutes drive away.The nearest station is 10 minutes awayPaddock Wood with frequent trains to London. Tonbridge station is about 15 minutes drive with even more frequent trains to London.We are on a public footpath so multiple walks from the house.There is a covered private swimming pool for family use only in the garden this is not available for guests to useso children will need supervision in the garden at all times.Those bringing dogs should be aware there is open access to a farm road so you need to supervise dogs at all times.We have 2 very friendly dogs but if you are afraid of dogs please let us know in advance so we can keep them away from you.

Title: Lakeside Retreat- The Boat House
Description: The Lakeside Retreat is a self-contained lodge on the edge of a lake boasting complete privacyin the heart of a working farm in the picturesque county of Sussex. The cabin benefits from an open plan living and kitchen area with floor to ceiling glass doors that open out onto decking. Relish an escape from modern-day life surrounded by uninterrupted farmland.Find us on social media @thelakesideretreatsussex or online by searching for lakeside retreat.The space"The space.The ground floor hosts an open plan layout with;.A living area with a contemporary double sofa bed.A dining area with a table and four chairs.A kitchen equipped with a;.- Four ring hob and oven.- Fridge.- Dishwasher.- Washing machine.- Expected utensils.A separate contemporary toilet and shower.Upstairs;.Offers a large bedroom with a double and single bedwhich are always made upwith an abundance of storage.Externally;.The decking area can be used to your full benefit. Perhaps enjoy an early morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evening on the sun-soaked pontoon. Outdoor furniture is included to complement those summer BBQs.The lake is well stocked with carp and full access is offered to use it for responsible fishing activities. Entering the water or use of any boat is strictly prohibited. Should groups of families wish to use this fantastically unique space then further discussions can be held regarding more than four visitors and the inclusion of tents."

Title: French Gypsy Caravan
Description: Bohemian and full of characterLe Grande Roulotte does not compromise on comfort.Family bathroom with a showersink and toilet. Kitchenette with induction hobfridge and microwave. Full sized double bed and two single day beds. Outdoor area.All bedding and towels are included in the cost of your stay.The space"The space.Le Grande Roulotte is bohemian and full of character.We have included a well equipped family bathroom (with a showersink and toilet)a kitchenette (with small refrigeratorinduction hob and microwave)a full sized double bed and two single day beds making this a real family holiday home.An Oak table with stools pulls out to provide an eating space for 4 people. There is storage under the beds for clothes and suitcases and a hanging clothes rail is in the cupboard under the TV.Built from sustainable timber with energy efficient materials such as sheeps wool insulation (floorwallsroof) and A rated windowsthe Roulotte is warm even in the winter months. A heated towel rail and an electric wood burner provide the main source of heating."Guest access.Access is through a shared electric gate. A shared gravel driveway leads up to the caravan where you will find parking for several cars and an outdoor area next to the caravan. The wider grounds can also be used but are shared with others.Other things to note.There is an outdoor storeroom and wood store about 10m away from the caravan which is accessed by others.There is a road 30m away.The shower is typical of those found in many caravans and boats - it is limited in size and not at the level of a power shower that you would find inside your own home.As detailed in the description abovethe wood burner is electric and not a real wood burner.The caravan shares a site with 5 holiday lodges - on Mondays and Fridaysthe cleaning team are on site and will use the shared parking area. On Mondays OR Fridays from Spring to late Autumnthe gardening team are on site and may be mowingstrimming and/or hedge cutting. There will be some associated noise but it does keep the grounds looking lovely.

Title: Old Fox Inn Annexe,Grade 2 listed, near Cambridge.
Description: "Old Fox Inn Annexe is an independent ground floor wing of The Old Fox Inna Grade 2 listed former pub dating from the mid 1700s.Set 9 miles from the historic city of Cambridge with good transport links. The property benefits from the use of a large garden with free range chickens and overlooking horse paddocks."The space"The space.The Annexe has its own entrance and plenty of off road parking. It has been renovated with modern fixtures and fittings and is warm and cosy with central heating. There is a kitchen with a table and four chairshobovenmicrowavefridge with freezer compartmentcooking utensilsdinnerwareand coffee/tea making facilities. A welcome pack with a range of fresh breakfast produce; milkcerealsbreadjambuttereggsteacoffeesugar is included on arrival.Towels and fresh linen are provided. (Washed at 60 degrees). The bedroom as a very comfortable king size bed with plenty of pillows and a fluffy duvet. This room also has a very comfortable single chair bed. The living room has a sofalovely to snuggle and reador watch TV. This also converts into a full size comfortable double bed for extra guests and you will have fresh linenplump pillows and a cosy duvet.The centre of the picturesque village of Bourn(famous for its pioneering work in the field of IVF) is five minutes away and offers the Willow Tree Puba very good Indian restauranta coffee shopa butchersa convenience store and a golf club. There are numerous local walks through the beautiful surrounding countryside. We are happy to help you with any recommendations.The historic Wimpole Hall Estatea lovely National Trust property is 5-10 minutes away.The historic city of Cambridge is 15 minutes away by car.For trips into LondonRoyston station is only 15 minutes away and is much easier for parking. The fast train is under 40 minutes journey time."

Title: Country estate lodge/cabin on the River Thames
Description: This is a beautiful Scandinavian 2 story3 bedroom log cabin situated on a secure country sitebetween the popular towns of Marlow and Henley on Thamesalso on the River Thames. The luxurious lodge is ideally positioned within the estatewith just one neighbouroverlooking a beautiful lake where spectacular sunsets and a wonderful array of wildlife can be seen. The lodge has been refurbished with modern but cosy decor and along with its lakeside views boasts a large gated veranda.The spaceThe space.There is Sky TVNetflixWiFicentral heatingdishwasherwashing machine/dryer. The lodge has 3 bedrooms (one with ensuite bath)further family bathrooma large open plan dining/lounge area with balcony also overlooking the lakea large comfortable sofa doubling as a sofa bed and a generous dining table for seating up to 8 guests. The master bedroom has a TV that rises up from the foot of the bedthis also has Netflix etc (Freeviewbut not Sky at this time). In addition to a water softenergas central heatingdishwasherwashing machinetumble dryercoffee machine and all the usual essentials. The estate has an 18 hole golf courselarge marinarestaurant in the golf clubample free parkinghelicopter landing pad and can provide moorings for guests arriving by boat. Beautiful walks can be enjoyed in and around the estate or if you fancy venturing off to MarlowHenley or further afield to Oxford or LondonHarleyford provides the perfect location for you.Our country estate lodge will sleep 6 guests comfortably in 3 bedrooms.Additional sleeping arrangement is available to accommodate a further 2 guests (sofa bed in the loungethere is a supplement fee per personper night for this).

Title: Snug & Secluded Lakeside shepherds hut
Description: Perfect rural getaway! Peaceful & secluded lakeside setting for a relaxing adults break in our cosy hut. Pets welcome (xtra). Private bathroom facilities. Fishing available. Countryside walks nearby lead to local villages e.g. Buxted & Hadlow Down or wander round our lakesancient woodland and shaws where wildlife and wild flowers abound. Cattle and sheep in our fields nearby. Tunbridge Wells/Brighton 1/2hr drive. Main line trains to/from Buxted/ Crowborough and London (1 hr). Discs for 4 nts+The space"The space.Our 2 huts have been neatly fitted out to provide a comfortable space to unwind and relax in private. They may be small but have all mod cons albeit in small sizes!! Either stay local for a total chill outor use it as a base for exploring the East Sussex area.Kitchen area has kettlesmall fridge/freezermini oven/toasterdouble ring gas hobmicrowavecafetiereironing board and ironbug zapperfanlog burner with initial supply of kindling and logs (top up available for extra charge)TV. Wifi. USB pointBluetooth speaker. BBQ on balcony. Firepit outside on slabs to sit round of an evening. Use of full size fridge/freezer and wash up area with washing machine and line in separate hut. Own private comfortable heated toilet/shower hut a short walk away.Hand towels providedbut please bring own bath/face towels.Several walks nearby to BuxtedHadlow DownRotherfield. Pubs nearby - The New Inn (a really old fashioned drinkers pub)The Buxted InnThe White HartThe BlackboysThe Hurstwood plus several in CrowboroughUckfield and Heathfield. Takaways menus in the hut for collection or delivery.Coarse Fishing (carp to 20lbsplus many varieties of other silver fish). available for ¬£10 per day (2 rods pp Must have a current angling licence). Full details sent on booking.MAX 2 PETS ¬£5 per pet per night (payable on arrival please). Must be kept on leadsexcept for our empty fields that we will show youand the swimming lake. Not allowed on bed. And please pick up after them.Small safe for your valuables inside plus Keysafe outside.We fill the bird feeders hanging on your balcony and youll have a good view of our local birdlife from the warmth and privacy of your hut!.Extra logs and charcoal available to buy."Other things to note.Welcome pack on arrival consists of breadcroissantsbuttermilkjuicedrinking waterteacoffeesugar. Also suppliedcondiments such as peppersaltcooking oil.Nearest supermarkets in Crowborough (WaitroseLidlMorrisonsSainsbury LocalTesco). Small supermarket in Buxted.Petrol stationsMorrisonsBP and Esso in Crowborough. Esso + 2 others in Uckfield.

Title: Laura‚Äôs Little Sanctuary. Gourmet Food Options.
Description: Cosy serene AnnexGourmet food and Homegrown ingredientsThis tempting retreat is situated in beautiful gardens in the heart of the High Weald area of East Sussex. Recently renovated to a high standard with the aim of providing a luxurious and nourishing place to relax and escape from the demands of everyday life.To this end this immaculate studio has been carefully thought out with attention to detail to provide a comfortable space to completely unwind.A homemade welcome pack is includedThe spaceThe space.The annex has been lovingly restored and offers comfortable cosy accommodation.Inside the annex is a sleeping area with a double bed with a memory foam mattress. There is an adjacent shower room with marble tiles throughout. The bed has Egyptian cotton sheetswith soft warm throws. The shower room has thick soft towels and palm oil free vegan toiletries.In the sitting area is a fully fitted kitchen comprising a Smeg Oven and Induction hobfridgedish washergranite work surface and an eating area. A Nespresso coffee machinetoaster and kettle are also supplied.There are two comfortable armchairs next to a wood burning stove. A Smart TV is attached to the wall.The welcome pack includes a selection of delicious home made pastries and cakes.Outside is an eating area and barbecue. The views from the annex look out across the beautiful gardens and are close to the kitchen garden.We have recently installed a tennis court which is available for guests to use.Stroll through the gardens to the River Uck which borders the property and to the lake where you can relax in a small rowing boat. There is abundant wildlife everywhere and sometimes late at night there are deer to be seen wandering through the garden.Dining-in is provided at an additional cost cooked by a Cordon Bleu cook using locally sourced and home grown ingredients. Please enquire about dining in experience when booking. Mid-week and some weekends not currently available.For stays of a minimum of a week I am currently offering a 15% discount.There is WiFi set up exclusively for the annex.Guest access.There is private parking for guests in our driveway and your own entrance. The main house is a grade II listed historical building with a thatched barn.Other things to note.Located very close to The Little Dairy for groups of friends to holiday close by.Glyndebourne is only 20 minutes drive. Picnics available on request at an additional cost.

Title: Woodland cabin in Stoke Newington, Central London.
Description: The Woodland Cabin is unique - a delightful cozy cabinwith wi-fikitchenettein Central Londonset within its own pretty woodland and featuring a private terrace. INDEPENDENT 24/7 ACCESS. Secure and safe. As you will see from our guest reviewsthe cabin is an oasis of tranquilitybut with easy access to the bright lights of Soho theatre-land and funky Dalston & Shoreditch. You will adore it!The space"The space.The cabin sleeps 2 people. The large double bed is exceptionally comfortable. For guests that prefer 2 single bedswe can arrange this without difficulty. We can also provide a child‚Äôs bed for a baby or toddler. The cabin is safesecure and independently accessedso youre free to come and go as you please. With its own private terrace and woodlandit combines tranquillity with urban access. Bustling Stoke Newington Church Streetrenowned for its great restaurantscafes & barsis a short walk awayas is the wedding venue at Stoke Newington Town Hall. Clissold Park and Woodbury Wetlands nature reserve are nearbytoo. Good transport links; off street parkinga beautiful modern kitchenette with fridge and combi microwave/oven/steamer; charcoal BBQ; underfloor heating if needed: the cabin has everything you could need for a perfect stay in central London. And if youre a musician (which I am!) theres even a guitar in the cabin which youre free to use."Guest access.A fully equipped cabin with its own terrace. Outdoor seatingoverlooking a picturesque pondset within private woodland.Other things to note.Laundry - for longer stay visitorsuse of our washing machine and dryer can be arranged. We also have a very good relationship with our local dry cleanerwho is very accommodating and efficient and can also do emergency alterations and button sewing.COVID-19 secure. The cabin is deep cleaned between guest visits. Hand sanitiser is provided and masks and cotton gloves available for for pandemic related purposesincluding travel on public transport.

Title: Luxurious converted stable.
Description: The Old Stables is a completely self-contained detached building with its own parking spacein the centre of Buxted. There are two pubsa shop and train station within a 5 minute walk.Set within the boundaries of Ashdown Forest there are numerous lovely walks on the doorstep and the town of Uckfield is a short drive away.The spaceThe space.The Old Stables has under-floor heating through-outan open plan living area with sofa bedlog burnersmart TVkitchen with breakfast bar.The kitchen is fully equipped and includes ovenhobmicrowavekettle toaster and Nespresso coffee machine.The bedroom has a double bed and a small hanging space and an en-suite with showertoilet and heated towel rail.Guest access.The Old Stables benefits from self-check in with a key lock by the doorthe code will be sent to guests kn the morning of their arrival.The property accessed direct from the High Street and shares a private driveway with the main house.The building is completely separate from the house and there is a seating area to the front.

Title: 'Stable Cottage' - Beautiful family accommodation
Description: Our holiday homes are a wonderful base for families and large groups wishing to explore the beautiful South Downs National Park.The space"The space.Our holiday homesStable CottageEdwards CottageRose Cottage and Louisas Cottageare set in the heart of the beautiful Hampshire countryside with wonderful views across a peaceful valley. They are a rural haven for visitors but only 10 minutes from Petersfieldwith fantastic road and rail connections for London and Portsmouth. This description is for Stable Cottage. Please see our other adverts for photos and description of Rose CottageEdwards Cottage and Louisas Cottage.The four holiday homes would suit large groups and families looking to holiday together. Please ask your hostVenetiafor more information.Our small working farmDownlands Farmon which the self-catering cottages are setis just off a green-lane which leads to miles of footpathsbridleways and on and off-road cycling.Pets are welcome at Stable Cottageplease enquire upon booking.There are three excellent pubs surrounding the farmall within a half hour stroll or a 3 minute car journey. The quaint and bustling market town of Petersfield is a 10 minute drive from the farm and alongside the two local village shopsthese all provide a perfect base for stocking up on essential items. The largercathedral cities of ChichesterGuildfordPortsmouth and Winchester are all equally 45 minutes awayoffering great shopping and entertainment.We are so lucky to be within an hour‚Äôs drive from one of the premier Blue Flag beaches in the countryWest Wittering. West Wittering is a beautiful place to visitwhatever the seasonand can be enjoyed by all ages. During the low season (October to April)horse riding is permitted at any time during the day on West Wittering and the summer months offer horseriding before 9am and after 6pm. Hayling Islanda shingle beach (with funfair for the children!) is half an hour from Downlands Farm.Stable Cottage offers light and airy accommodation with two ground floor bedrooms and a huge playroom/bedroom upstairs.After stowing muddy wellies in the under-cover porchyou will walk into our brightwell equipped kitchen / dining / sitting room. Stretching the entire width of the barnthis large room opens out through French windows onto your own private terrace and garden complete with garden tables and chairs.A television with BT Vision and Netflix will keep you entertained on those horrible rainy days. It goes without saying that guests have use of free Wifi.A utility room with washing machine and tumble dryer leads off from the kitchen which in turn leads to a well ventilated shower room.Two double bedrooms also lead off from the kitchenthe master bedroom having an ensuite bathroom with a large bathtub perfect for soaking after a long walk. Both bedrooms have televisions.Children will absolutely love their playroom at the top of the property. Accessed by stairs from the sitting roomchildren will have their own space to create chaos and noise. There is ample space up here to accommodate up to four additional people - two single beds and one double bed.There is no extra charge for use of a travel cotstair gate and high chair as required. Please contact us for information and to discuss your requirements.We welcome guests who wish to stay for a minimum of two nights up to a maximum of one month.Please noteStable CottageRose CottageEdwards Cottage and Louisas Cottage are situated on a working farm and next door to horse stables. Whilst the interior of the properties is beautifulwe would like to make it clear thatat presentthe exterior is still a work in progress. This does not detract from the overall glorious setting.The property particulars may change without prior notice and the owners are not liable for any inaccuracies in the propertys description on our website or through media/advertising sources. Any photographs are for illustrative purposes only.COVID NOTES 2021:We are delighted that we are able to open our doors again from Monday 12th April 2021.Please see below key dates in our re-opening (with extracts taken from the gov.uk website):Monday 12th April ‚Äì We are open for business again but each property must only be used by members of the same household. ‚ÄòOvernight stays away from home in this country will be permitted and self-contained accommodation - those that do not require shared use of bathingentry/exitcatering or sleeping facilities - can also reopenthough must only be used by members of the same household.‚ÄôMonday 17th May ‚Äì We will be welcoming groups who wish to stay as two families or as a group of no more than six from different households. ‚ÄòIndoorspeople will be able to meet socially in a group of 6or with 1 other householdthough it may be possible to go further than this at Step 3 depending on the data.‚ÄôMonday 21st June ‚Äì Our holiday houses will be open as usual with no limits on guest numbers/groups mixing etc (depending on government announcements). ‚ÄòNo legal limits on social contact (subject to review).‚Äô.Cleaning: We ensure that the cottage that you have booked will be cleaned and sanitised to the Covid Ready Guidelines from PASC UKthe AA and Visit England. We have produced a Risk Assessment that covers all aspects of our business. This can be seen upon request.Check-out times: Strictly 4pm arrival10am departure.Entertainment: We unfortunately have had to remove all toysboard gamesbooksmagazines and tourist leaflets as we cannot disinfect every item. There is a ping pong table and pool table in the ‚Äògames room‚Äô within the barn. This room is cleaned regularly but it would be great if you could help us by using the disposable paper towel and spray provided to wipe down any equipment after use.If one of your party develops symptoms: while staying with usGovernment advice is to get tested immediately and for the group to self isolate in situ. Should the test come back positive before the scheduled end of the stay then the group is required to immediately return to their primary residence(s) and continue to self isolate for the required time. Please let us know as our cleaning protocols are different in this scenario. The symptoms to look out for are a high temperaturea newcontinuous coughor a loss or change to your sense of smell or taste. Regardless of the test resultif you are too unwell to return home and decide to self isolate in your cottage beyond your scheduled staythen you will be liable for all fees for all bookings affected by this self isolation.Needless to sayif one of your party develops symptoms in the days prior to your scheduled stay with usplease follow Government guidance ‚Äì self isolateget testedand do not travel.Thank you for your help and understanding. We very much hope that all our guests will continue to have wonderful holidays with usand can once again look forward to getting away from homeenjoying the fresh air and open spaces and the beautiful surrounding countryside."Guest access.All areas"Other things to note.The Cottages are set on a working small-holding therefore visitors can expect to see cowsdogs and horses during their stay with us.Please note that all four holiday properties are adjacent/joined to one-another. Each house has its own private patio and garden but the parking is shared. Due to the proximity to one-another and also to our farmhouseyou will be staying next door to children and animals (and sometimes noisy adults!). We are a laid-back farm which very much caters for families so if it is absolute peace and quiet youre afteryou may want to look elsewhere!!.Edwards Cottage and Louisas Cottage are at the ends and Rose Cottage and Stable Cottage are in the middle.A car is absolutely essential if you wish to stay at Downlands Farm.Due to our rural locationmobile phone signal and the WIFI connection can sometimes be weak."

Title: The perfect rural village escape in Sussex
Description: Welcome to The Greenhouse ‚Äì the perfect rural village escape in Sussex. Based in Plumpton Green; close to the historic town of Lewesthe bright lights of Brighton & just minutes away from the glorious South Downs. Perfect for Plumpton RacesGlyndebourne (10 miles) & the Brighton Festival. Pubs aplentyall offering fantastic food. Mainline station with direct access from Gatwick and London.The space"The space.The Greenhouse is situated at the rear of our main house and has its own private parking. It is entered via a large sun deckperfect for lazy breakfastsafternoon tea and sundowners.The main bedroom features a super comfy double bedclothes storage and some hanging space. The double sofa in the main living space can also be pulled out to accommodate two further guests. A well-appointed galley kitchen includes a microwave oventwo hob rings and all the usual gadgetry to make cooking a cinch. If thats not your thing then visit one of the four pubs in the local area or treat yourselves to the fish and chips van (Tuesday evenings only). The village shop also stocks freshly made meals from Chaulas (Indian)Tiny Thai and Cook.Breakfast (breadbutterjameggs and juicetea/fresh coffee) will be left for guests to make themselves. (Please note that we provide enough for two days. If youre staying any longerconsider it a sort of starter kit.)Guests will also have use of a padlocked shed to store bikes.Ideal for couples but families with babies welcome. Due to its size we recommend short stays only for parties of more than two."

Title: A unique property in a beautiful location
Description: Orchard Barn is a brand new property located in Radwinter End 7 miles from the market town of Saffron Walden and 15 miles from the city of Cambridge. Downstairs there is an entrance halltoilet with walk in showerfully equipped kitchen and large living room. Upstairs there is a small toilet and 2 bedrooms with king size beds. Outside there is plenty of parking and private garden with decking area. A peaceful stunning location with panoramic views across fields to Bendysh Woods.The spaceThe space.Orchard Barn is a new property recently completed by the owners to a high specification. With its own entrance and garden it is situated up a quite rural single track lane offering a peaceful escape with many attractions nearby.Other things to note.Orchard Barn is a strictly Non-Smoking property.

Title: The Cabin, a Gorgeous Hideaway in Henley on Thames
Description: The CabinHenley on Thames is a gorgeous space for you to enjoy your holiday. Surrounded by natureguests have the pleasure of deers walking past the window in the morningsand Red Kites flying overhead. Located in the back garden of our house you can walk straight into fields and the beautiful Chiltern hills and are only a 5 minute drive/ 15 minute walk from the centre of the historic town of Henley on Thames.Built in 2018 it features underfloor heatingand brand new designer fittings.The spaceThe space.The Cabin was newly built in 2018it features underfloor heating with Oak Herringbone flooring. The Shower room has designer Philippe StarckHans Grohe fittings. The kitchen is brand new with an Induction hoboven and microwave. The bedroom features 2 new divan beds which can be used as twins or pushed together to make a Super kingsized double should you prefer. It has a designer Danish clothing rack to hang your clothing and shelf space in the hallway. In the living area there is a new desk and table and chairs to enjoy your meals upon. There is a comfortable sofa bed to accommodate 2 guests and a TV connected to wifi with Amazon Prime Video.Outside there are decked areas to the front and back which are lovely sun trapsperfect to enjoy breakfastlunch or an evening drink on in the summer time!Guest access.The Cabin and it‚Äôs front patio and back garden are solely for the guests use only. The Cabin can be accessed via a woodland path so there is no need to enter the main house."Other things to note.We are truly thankful for the nature around us and are firm believers in limiting the impact on our amazing planetwe are therefore striving to make the Cabin as sustainable as possible. Rome wasnt built in a daybut we have changed to using refillable soap and sustainably sourced toilet roll. Any suggestions on how we can further our quest would be greatly appreciated :)"

Title: Beautiful Winterberry Barn ,Romsey
Description: WinterBerry Barn is a gorgeous 1 bedroom cottage with everything you could possibly need for a cosy country getaway. Every aspect of the property is finished to the highest standard. Oak finish throughout with raw natural beams flowing through the property to really give it that warm country feel. Bed setee Close to all the wonderful local amenities such as the beautiful market town of romsey only a 5 minute drive! Also the beautiful historic city of Winchester is only situated 15 mins away.The space"The space.Beautiful cosy cottage with an open plan kitchen living room area.Everything throughout is finished in english oakthe natural oak beams seamlessly add that rustic country feel to the property. The natural wooden floors run throughout the bottom level of the property.Being situated right in the heart of the countryside we wanted the property to reflect its surroundings. The cottage has a warm country feelas soon as you step in the property and hang up your wellies you really do feel like youre stepping into your own country retreat.Set in 15 acres of the countryside.Entertainment: At the cottage we want you to have every home comforton the 55 inch Flat screen you will have access to NetflixAmazon Prime.The Village of Braishfield is in itself beautiful and very quiet whilst being very close to all the wonderful local attractions and history of Southern England.The oak french doors open up and outside is a comfy seating area with firepit. Sometimes its nice to stay in have a glass of wine by the fire and stare at the stars!There is a rustic oak barn door that separates the Lounge/Kitchen area.The lounge has a brand new corner sofa which also doubles up as a sofa bed allowing two more guests to sleep .Slide the door open and there is a wardrobe area and utilities room with a state of the art washing machine & tumble dryer for those wet walks in the countryside!The bathroom is brand new finished with luxurious ceramics and a walk in shower with LED light function!As you come to the glass and oak staircase and are ready to retreat for the night you hit the brand new soft carpets of the upstairs. The bedroom is the entire size of the downstairsthere is a makeup table which can also double up as a suitable study desk. Perfect for those who want to relax and still get a little bit of work done too!The bed itself is a luxury Super King with a state of the art memory foam mattress. Finished with cosy yet stylistic vibesthink cosy with a element of fun! A 32 inch tv is hidden away in a window alcove and can be brought out on its bracket for perfect TV viewing in bed and hidden away when not in use. The upstairs also features a stunning electric fireplace to really make you feel at home.Just to note we love the seasonal festivities e.g Halloween and Christmas especially. So please do expect extravagant decorations around the property during these seasons!"Other things to note.Travel cot and High chair are available on request.Golf clubs can be borrowed free of charge.Free bike use

Title: The Dairy   A Beautiful Cosy Country Retreat
Description: Escape to the country in this stylishimmaculately cleanbarn conversion filled with light and surrounded by unspoiled countrysideAs part of a collection of Medieval farm buildings The Dairy sits at the edge of a Sussex water meadow and boasts its own private south facing terraceGreat for anniversaries and quiet celebrationsholidays or just time away enjoying the secluded and self contained accommodation.Keypad access can allow you the opportunity for complete independenceThe spaceThe space.The Dairy has been beautifully renovated from a C19th brick built barn into a boutique holiday home.Part of a medieval farmstead which dates back to the 14th century it features ;A bright open plan living/kitchen space with large bifold doors opening onto a secluded south facing terrace with beautiful rural views..A lovely separate bedroom and large en-suite shower room.The addition of old mirrorsdecorative accent pieces and attention to detail make this property a dream location for a quiet getaway or special occasion.The Dairy has a fully equipped kitchen complete with large fridge/freezermicrowavetoasterdishwasherrange-style oven with ceramic hob and a Nespresso coffee machine.There is also a washer/dryer should you need it.Unlimited free WiFi throughout.The lounge area benefits from a 55 inch smart TV with Netflix and an award winning Samsung soundbar which will also stream your own music via Bluetooth.A traditional Clearview wood burning stove will ensure that your stay is always warmcosy and relaxing.We supply you with plenty of logs at no extra cost.In the separate bedroom you will find a wonderfully comfortable King size bed from Heals of London draped in sumptuous linens and Egyptian cotton bed sheets.The handcrafted solid oak dressing table can also be used as a convenient work space.We have provided a state of the art Dyson fanthe perfect companion for warm summer nights and a cosy hot water bottle for those frosty evenings.The light and spacious en-suite boasts a large walk in showerbeautiful limestone flooring with under-floor heating and ambient lighting. Egyptian cotton bath sheets and hand towels are provided along with hand wash and shower gel.Outside there is a large and private south facing terrace with seating and views over the water meadows where you can stroll down to the River Uck boundary.It is not uncommon to see herds of passing deer along with the neighbouring sheep and keep an eye out for the beautiful buzzards who have made their home in the surrounding trees.For those of you who like to bring a bike away with you we have installed a sturdy outdoor bike rack that will accommodate three bicycles.A BBQ can be available upon request.Guest access.The Dairy is detached and set away from the Farmhouseyour parking is adjacent to the building.Other things to note.Please note that mobile phone reception is limited with some operators better than others.Unfortunately not safe or suitable for children or infants.No smoking within the property.No dogs or pets.Limited access and steps.Please be aware that we are part of a small Sussex farm and as such there may occasionally be the chance of farm related noise for example from a tractorchainsawgrass cuttingsheep a dog and grandchildren.No partiesfilming or extra guests please.

Title: The Barn at The Grove
Description: The Barn is a self-contained recently converted space in the heart of the Chilterns. It is close to the riverside towns of Henley-on-Thames and Marlow and the surrounding Chiltern countryside. It is located on the edge of the village of Frieth with nearby farm shops and local gastro-pubs within a 5 min drive.The Barn is in a private and peaceful location with off-street parking. It is perfect for couplessolo travellers and small families.The spaceThe space.The space is divided into bedroombathroom and kitchen/living space.The bedroom has a double bed and ample storage.Bathroom has bath and shower facilities plus heated towel rail.Kitchen has an electric hobmicrowavegrilltoasterand fridge.Sitting area has a two-seater sofaarmchairtelevisionaudio equipment and radio.There is underfloor heating throughout and a wood-burner for colder evenings.Outside is a private patio with seating.There is a key safe so guests are able to come and go as they please.Ample parking space on a shared drive.Guest access.The Barn is a detached building in a corner of the garden: guests have exclusive access to the whole building.

Title: Rural retreat in the sticks.
Description: "A quiet location the annex is hidden away overlooking farmers fields in the South Downs National Park.Great if you love being close to naturewalking,bridlepaths and local friendly country pubs,we are also 2 mins away from the RSPB and Parham House.Dont forget your walking boots!"The spaceThe space.Purpose built timber framed annex separate from the main house with open plan kitchen dining,separate bathroom with wet room/walk in shower.Bedroom with king size bed vaulted ceilings living.Freeview Tv and usual kitchen amenities free wifi.Next to a national trail bridle path.Guest access.You will have access to the whole annex and there is parking opposite.Other things to note.Travel cot is available at request.

Title: Beautiful barn in the hills and woods nr Brighton
Description: "Idyllically situated down a quietmagical laneour oak-framed barn is surrounded by hills and woodlandwith stunning views on all sides. There is instant access to beautiful countryside footpaths and bridleways. We are walking distance from a pub with a garden and good home-cooked food. Just an hour from London by train and 10 minutes drive from buzzycosmopolitan Brightonwere also close to lots of pretty villageslovely beachesbeautiful historic houses and gardens."The spaceThe space.The barn is in the garden of our rambling old Tudor cottagewhich is neighbouring (perpendicular to) the barn.Barn lay-out.There are two bedrooms upstairs - one with two singles and one with a king-sized bed. Downstairsin the open-plan living spacethere is a sofa bed which can be used if there are six people staying. We also have a single z-bed which can be added to the room with two singles - ideal for families with three children sharing.

Title: Enchanted Glade Tiny house
Description: Return to nature with comfort and ease.The perfect eco retreat in our off grid wooden cabin or luxury bell tents. Nestled within the enormous magical gardens of a private estate.Relax and unwind in the serenity of our wild spa with only pheasants and deer as neighbours!.We are located in the heart of Sussex -Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB).Excellently locatedonly 30 miles from central London and 45 mins Brighton The perfect getaway to return to a sense of Peace and Tranquility.The space"The space.The perfect staycation so close to London and Brighton yet feels like a million miles away.Social distancing and bubble friendly holidays.It IS possible to hire the entire glade to yourselves and have it as a private party/family gathering. Please message me for details.Our Enchanted glade is set in a magical garden in the middle of a working farm on a plateau in the High Wealdintersected by deep wooded valleys with sandstone outcrops. We are an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and a Site of Special Scientific Interestyet within 10 miles of Gatwick and 35 miles of Central London.Our gardens comprise some rare and exotic Himalayan speciesfirst laid out in 1865. The avenue of Californian Redwoods includes some of the tallest trees in England. And our woods contain bluebellsmosseslichens and briophytes amongst spectacular sandstone outcropsWE OFFER:-1 Wooden CabinSleeps 4 (2 adults,2 children) - There is a sofa that can be used as a bed and one Inflatable mattress. -The cabin has its own private Basic kitchen plus Barbecue outside.Please note that this IS a Tiny house and for larger familiesthe tents are a better option. See our alternative listing for the tents.* 3x Luxury Bell tents with furniture and decordecking and wood burners. Very comfortable and cosy.. Sleeps 2 adults and 2 children (single mattresses for the kidsplease bring sleeping bags!)-WOOD FIRED HOT TUB under the Stars [seats 6] available for TWO HOUR SLOTS for an extra ¬£45Booking in advance required.-Missing link brewery and cafe are onsite and open every weekend with different food vans and events. Check their website for specific details.-Our WILD SPA - Massage-Full body oil or Thai Yoga massageNature connectionLife coachingCreative arts workshopsBooking in advance.-FORAGING/WILD Banquet experience with our fully insured and very experienced local forager- Fergus Drennon who writes regularly on wild food and foraging for BBC Countryfile MagazineThe EcologistCountry KitchenBushcraft and Survival Skills Magazineas well as contributing and/or featuring in many other magazines including most national newspapers. He has also appeared on TV.-Shared Compost toilet with Hot shower in the Redwood forest.-Shared fire pit for all to enjoy.-There is an undercover basic kitchen with sinkrunning watergas cookerBasic utensils and BBQ for the campers.-There are so many beautiful walks to explore locally. (within our boundaries and on public pathways)- Boulders and caves to explore.- Paintball and clay pigeon shooting is available onsite and there are so many local attractions (see our FB page for regular updates)- Excellently located in the middle of so many wonderful local attractions including two reservoirs and Ashdown Forest. See my guestbook.Please note: Although bedding is providedTOWELS ARE NOT-please bring your own. Tea and coffee is provided but not breakfast.Enough wood to heat the cabin for both evenings is providedadditional wood costs ¬£10 a sack.There is currently no fridge availableplease bring a cool box if required.There is lighting and a USB port in the cabinbut other than that there is no electricity."Guest access.PLEASE NOTE it is a 10 min walk from the parking spot to the site. We will meet you with our 4x4 on arrival and help you with bags to and from the siteplus offer wheelbarrows. Bring suitable comfortable walking shoes and clothing for all weathers. There are many private and public pathways that you will be able to access from our glade.Alsoas we are on a private estatethere is a security gate this will be locked after 11pm."Other things to note.-It is possible to book a veg or breakfast hamper in advance (¬£25 from the local farm) or to have meals deliveredplease let us know if you are interested in this.-There is a local co op shop in Shaprthorne village which is 5 mins drive. There is also a village shop with localorganic produce.-Plawhatch Biodynamic farm shop is open 6 days a week and is 10 mins drive.- Forest Bathing- Our compost toilet and HOT shower is a 1 min walk from the cabin.*WILD SPA*.-Private Wood fired hot tub under the stars -.¬£45 per 2 hr session [can seat 6 people]-Full Body MASSAGEDeep tissue or Thai yoga massage available onsite for ¬£55 pp.This can include a cupping therapy session.*Wood fired sauna - ¬£45 per session *-Wild food foraging and fireside cooking experience=Includes nature awareness exercisessome basic bushcraft skills 1.5 hr walk exploring the area and learning about edible and medicinal plantsPLUS A delicious meal cooked on the fire including all the foraged items. ¬£200 for up to 6 people.-Please note that we welcome acoustic music by the firebut drumsspeakers and sound systems are not allowed.We must ensure peace and tranquillity for ALL our guests and the people who live on site.*There is an 11pm curfew in terms of music in the glade and also returning back onsite. The security gate will be locked after this. ** After some bad experienceswe have sadly decided to be a NO DOG sitewe are truly sorry for those we cannot accommodate as a result of this."
