Title: Gamekeeper's Cottage, near Sissinghurst Castle
Description: Sissinghurst Castle and its famous gardens are only a 15 minute woodland walk away from this peaceful and tranquil one bedroom cottage which is set in private grounds of 18 acres and surrounded by woods and wildlife. Gamekeeper Cottage is the perfect retreat for getting away from it allat all times of yearbut is only one hour from London by train. The cottage dates from 1798 and sits directly opposite the main house. The wood burner makes it a cosy and romantic getaway. Sleeps 2-4The spaceThe space.This charming one bedroom cottage is over 200 years old and has been beautifully restoredretaining many of its original featuresincluding the wooden beams. A very large window provides great views to the gardenslarge pond and impressive eucalyptus trees beyond.The double bedroomThe cottage has recently been extended and now includes a large double bedroom which is light and airy and has wonderful views to the pond and beyond. The French doors open onto a large patio area where guests can relax and enjoy the pondthe wildlife and extensive garden area. A barbecue is available. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE EXTENSION HAS NOT YET BEEN COMPLETED SO THERE ARE NO PHOTOS YET. IT WILL BE COMPLETED AT THE END OF MARCH 2022The open plan living room and mezzanine sleeping areaThe living room has a large window providing fantastic views to the pond and gardensThere is a very comfortable sofadining table and chairsas well as the woodburner. The bathroom has a showertoilet and sink. The kitchen area has an electric oven/hob and fridge freezer. The comfortable double bed is on a mezzanine level accessed by a steepish staircase.Please note that although the cottage can sleep up to 4 guestsit is quite small for 4.The Woodburner.The wood burner is a favourite feature of our guestsproviding warmth and a cosy atmosphere. All wood and kindling is provided. The wood is sustainably sourced from trees coppiced on the property. There are also electric heaters for those who don\t want to light a fire.The outside area.Outside the cottagethere is a large patio area where guests can relax and enjoy the pond and wildlife. There is a table and chairs and a barbecue. Guest also have exclusive access to the extensivebeautiful garden area around the pond.There is also a "magical circle of oak " BBQ/sitting area in the woodland which is completely secluded and is a great favourite of our guests. Located in the middle of a circle of ancient oak treesit is a wonderful spot to light a fire and listen to the bird life.We have excellent WIFI - "superfast" fibre to the property with a download speed of 900 megabytes per secondSissinghurst Castle and its world renowned gardens is only a short walk away by public footpaththrough enchanting woods. The property adjoins the Sissinghust Castle Estate so all you need to do is walk to the top of the drivecross the road and you are immediately in the grounds of Sissinghurst Castle - the Castle itself is about 15 minutes walk awaythrough an enchanting wood.Gamekeeper\s Cottage provides a great retreat at all times of year. In autumn and winter it is cosy and atmosphericwith the roaring fire and wonderful crisp walks on your doorstep. Spring and summer are spectacularwith the "Garden of England"as Kent is knownblossoming and coming to life. Bluebell seasonwhich is usually in Mayis a particular favouritewith carpets of bluebells in the woods.The local wildlife is plentiful. As well as the resident ducks and chickensthere are many badgersfoxes and deer in the woodlands surrounding the cottage. In the dead of night you will hear the owls hooting and the dawn chorus of the numerous birds will greet you at day break.The area has many excellent pubssome of which are over 500 years old. They all serve very good food and first class local beer. The Milkhouse in Sissinghurst and the Three Chimneys in Biddenden are both one mile away.There are many other National Trust properties nearbyincluding Castlesstately homes and gardens. The charming village of Cranbrook is 3 miles away and the Cinque port of Ryewith the golden sands of Camber30 minutes by car. London is one hour away by train and Canterbury one hour. There are many beautiful walks in the immediate vicinitymany of which can be started from the cottage itself.VineyardsThe area is also known for some of the finest vineyards in England. Biddenden VineyardsHush Heath and Chapel Down are a short drive away.YogaHenrietta is a fully qualified British School of Yoga instructor and teaches from beginner level to advanced. Classes can be arranged directly with hereither in the main house or outside in spring and summer.Guest access.Parking is immediately outside the cottageOther things to note.We have excellent WIFI - "superfast" fibre broadband with a download speed of 900 megabytes per second . Howeverwe have a limited mobile phone signal due to a poor signal from the main exchange. If you switch on wi-fi calling on your phone then calls work well in the apartment. If this does not work and you do need to make a call there is a good signal at the top of the drive and you are welcome to use the landline in the main house.Please note that the main beam in the cottage is 6 feet 2 inches high and the double bed at the mezzanine level can only be accessed from one side. Public transport is limited and the country roads are not pedestrian friendly so ideally it is better to come with your own transport. Alternativelytaxis can be booked through the local firmMTC taxis.

Title: The Acorn - Deep cleaned and FLEXIBLE C-19 changes
Description: Brand new detached house in an elevated position above a quiet rural lane. Great night skies and horses in the field next door. Outside sitting area and private parking. Lovely king sized double bed with views and high quality bedding. Local eggs provided for breakfast. The Acorn is in the heart of the village so it‚Äôs very easy to walk anywhere and find 3 great pubs. There is also a Co-op store in the village. Fully refundable booking settings.The spaceThe space.We have stayed in many places and tried to take the good parts from each to make The Acorn comfortable and relaxing for you. There is a stereo and an ekornes stressless relaxing leather chair in the main bedroom. Downstairs is a leather sofa and an extendable dining table to seat 4 and an electric shower in the bathroom.In the fridge will be milk and local free range eggsthere are cereals and various teas and a new frying pan!.We have 2 travel cots and a high chair should you need them.We can put another mattress upstairs if needed so it would be possible to sleep 5.There is a lady in the village who can make chocolate brownies or Victoria sponge cake at 3 days notice. ¬£10 each so let us know if you might like to try one.Guest access.You will have the whole house along with an outside sitting area and space to park 2 cars.We also have a large children‚Äôs trampoline in our garden which any children can use at their own riskplease just walk round any time. The post code is MK45 4BG.Other things to note.The house is up a short but a little steep drive which some people may find difficult to walk up/down. However there is parking available at both the top and bottom so no need to walk it.

Title: Stansted Airport - Luxury Annexe with Parking
Description: The accommodation is separate from our house and has its own entrance.We provide a basic breakfast essentials i.e. BreadFresh milkTea & Coffee etc.Free off road parking for duration of your stay.Airport transfers available.You will require a car as we are in a rural location.IMPORTANT NOTE: If there is any anti-sociable behaviour or taking of any illegal substances by any member of your groupyou will all be immediately dismissed from the property and there will be no refunds given.The space"The space.The spaceThe Annexe in a quiet rural location near Stansted Airport and wedding venues. It has 2 bedrooms with the main bedroom having a double bed and the 2nd bedroom having 2 single beds. In the living area there is a double sofa bed and a corner sofa suitetable and chairs and a 40 TV. The living room and main bedroomhave views of the peaceful garden which you have access to. The courtyard has a seating area which you can sit outside and enjoy a cup of coffee or something stronger.There is shower room with toilet and wash basin and we provide shampooconditioner and body wash.In the Kitchen you will have access to KettleToasterMicrowave and Washing Machine. We provide a basic breakfast - teacoffeecerealfresh milkspreads.There is an Electric HobGeorge Foreman Grill and Microwave as cooking facilities. I also providepans and cooking utensils."

Title: Private, tranquil lakeside en-suite hut,

Title: Luxury Blackdown Shepherds Hut in Surrey Hills

Title: Luxurious Shepherds Hut + Private Garden & Views
Description: Our cosy and luxurious Hut is suitable for singles & couples that appreciate the finer things in life. The accommodation comprises an en-suite power shower-roomcompact kitchendining area and double bed. Facilities includes Freeview TV/RadioWIFI and log burning stove & fuel. We provide teacoffeemilkcrusty breadbutterolive oilvarious condiments and fresh eggs from our own happy chickens. The private garden with BBQ & furniture has fantastic viewsparking space & own entrance.The space"The space.The Pilgrims Hut and surrounding lower garden is a perfect romantic retreat and is all your private space. It includes garden chairs and tablegrass rug with BBQ and there are stunning views across the valley. There is also a dedicated parking space and your own private entrance.The main gardenwith high hedgerows and mature pond is the equivalent of a woodland glade and is a haven for bird life. CrowsJaysGreen and Greater Spotted Woodpeckers and of course Herons are all regular visitorsand buzzards can be seen circling high above. Bullfinch and Nuthatch are more exotic but frequent visitors and during summer nights there are hunting bats and sometimes owls to hoot you to sleep. You are welcome to wander these areas as they are enjoyed by us all.In spring and summer the pheasants return to the garden and mallard ducks to the pond to mate. In late February Toads wake up from hibernation and begin migrating to their breeding pond in Pilgrims Garden to spawn and their croaking sounds give the gardens an equatorial feel; unfortunately the temperature doesnt match!"

Title: Idyllic Shepherd's Hut near Chieveley
Description: "One of the top 30 quirky places to stay in the UK chosen by MuddyStilletos travel guide. Sleeping twothe hut is perfect for couplesfriends or solo travellers. It is close to beautiful walkslocal pubsfarm shops and historic towns .. or simply a place to unwindread a good book and get back to nature."The space"The space.Beautiful bespoke Shepherds hut built on the chassis of an original hut found in a nearby copse. Located in the hamlet of Beedon Commonan area of outstanding natural Beauty just a few miles away from Chieveley and j13 of the m4. Surrounded by fields there is access directly onto byways and footpaths so perfect for anyone keen on walking or cycling. The nearby villages of PeasemoreBeedon and Chieveley are within walking distance and have super pubs for a drink or bite to eat. There are plenty of activities within a short drive from national trust properties to canal boat rides to quirky tea shops or historic market towns- more information in the welcome pack once you have booked. The hut itself is in a paddock separate from our garden which also houses a large lilly pond and a few chickens so lovely fresh eggs for breakfast. Beautiful views face across the fields to the west and across the pond to the east. We do have dogs ourselves and welcome your furry friends provided they can be trusted with other dogs and chickens. The Shepherds hut bed can pull out to make a double or folded away to make a single. The hut is warm and cosy thanks to proper insulationa discreet heater and a traditional log burning stove -plenty of wood provided. There is a DAB radio for your use as well as a supply of traditional games and a book swap. There is currently no bathroom in the paddock but a modernshower room and toilet is set aside for guest use in the barn next to the main house (literally 10 seconds walk through the garden). For cooking there is a baby belling stove (hobgrill and oven) inside the hut with cutlerycooking utensils and tea making facilities. There is a small fridge in the shelter next to the hut. For breakfast fresh eggsbreadmilkjuiceteafresh coffee and condiments will be provided. There is electricity inside the hut and cold running water is available outside. There is a hammockpicnic bench and a beautiful oak framed shelter with outdoor wood burner for keeping warm and cosy when sun goes down over the best views in Berkshire."

Title: High Weald country side Log Cabin on Cattle farm
Description: Located on a working cattle farmthis cosy log cabin has enough space to comfortably be occupied by up to 7 people with plenty of garden space complete with picnic tablesBBQ and a fishing pond. The farm itself is found in the centre of the High Weald area of outstanding natural beauty and is surrounded by numerous castlesBedgebury forest and Bewl reservoir. In addition to the viewsonly a short drive away are plenty of shopping townsa cinema and bowling complex.Other things to note.Pets are welcome. We have 2 dogs and 2 cats who roam the garden freely.

Title: Swan Cabin on Taggs Island
Description: A purpose built Cabin in the garden of our river home Seahorsewhich overlooks the River Thameswith views of Ash Island. You will be welcomed into a tranquilcomfortableunique retreat with all the amenities you need for a perfect stay with us.The space"The space.Situated on Taggs Islandoff the Hampton Court Roadyou can drive over the islands bridgeleft along the road and park in our gravel driveway next to the Cabin. It has wonderful views of the River Thamesand the sun pours in through the windows all day. We have an enchanting garden and the wildlife of the river is all around us. As well as offering comfortablecontemporary living spaceyou will also have exclusive use of the adjacent patio area in the gardenwith outdoor seatingto sit and contemplate the river or just read and relax.We have a dog called Dilly and a cat called Milo. There are in the garden from time to time but we will make sure they dont bother you.Our guests have the entire cabinwhich includes a bedroombathroom and living room. There is also a kettletoastercoffee machinemicrowave and fridge (Please note there is no hob or oven) There is also a smart TV with internet connection.The Cabin is entirely electricthere is no gas boiler.(Please also note that the ¬£10 cleaning fee is for up to a 7 day stay and thereafter weekly)Make the most of your stay by visiting one of the many places of interest around Hampton Court. The Cabin is just a five-minute walk to Londons second largest royal parkBushy Parkand only a fifteen minute walk away from Hampton Court Palace. Central London can be reached by train from Hampton Court or Kingston stationsinto Waterloo. There are regular buses - the 111R68 and 216which stop just by the Taggs Island bridge. We also have many festivals and concerts locallyboth at Hampton Court ( including the annual Flower Show) and Hampton Court Pool open air concerts. More information on the local arearestaurantspubs and cafes can be provided . We are happy to help you with any information you need.Kingston is also a great shopping centre and with more riverside restaurants."

Title: The Grange (Annex Apartment)
Description: What better way to isolate yourself and your family with a completely self contained hideaway.Situated in the remote country village of Broughton. The village boasts popular and quaint pubrenowned for its food (The Crown). The Annex is detached from the main houseLounge/Kitchen areaBathroomTwo ground floor Bedroomswith a third double situated in what was a Hay Loft (not suitable for children under 14 years of age). Recently re-furbished.Ample parking on the drive for 2 to 3 cars.The spaceThe space.Three bedroomed (Isolated and separate) propertybut priced for either 1 person through to a maximum of 6.The property is situated right in the countryside and is very peacefulquiet and surrounded by lovely countrysidefieldsa few sheephorses and of course gorgeous walks to nearby villagesand yes with a welcoming pub or two at the end!!This is a newly renovated propertydone to a high standardwith brand new furnitureOven and Bathroom. The Kitchen is fully equipped and operationalwith platescultery etc provided. TeaCoffee and Sugar available after your journey and before you hit the local stores.Most cooking equipment is availableincluding kettletoaster etc.cleaning equipmenthand wash washing up liquidbowl all provided for. Fridge and freezer included within the property.Guest access.Guests will have sole access to the annex during their stay along with access to the driveway for off road and secure parking for up to three cars as required.In additiongiven the desire of many to socially distanceplease note there is a key safeallowing self check in. The property is disinfected between guests and is a real retreat for those looking for that ultimate getawayor stop over for the wedding or party you are attending!

Title: Willow Cottage - Sleeps 4, Benenden Kent
Description: We recently converted an outbuilding into a two bedroom house. The house is detached and purpose built. We aimed to create a space that was brightairy and incorporated the gorgeous woodland and farmland around us.When you stay with us you can expect to be in a peaceful rural setting with stunning views which can be admired from either the patio or through the large bifold doors leading from the main living area.The spaceThe space.The downstairs has a lovely open plan kitchen and sitting room with oak beams throughout. The upstairs has a large double and a twin roomwith window seatsand a stunning apex window offering fabulous views across the Kentish countryside. The shower room is also located upstairs.Each bedroom has cotton linenquality mattresses and Egyptian cotton towels. A travel cot and clip on highchair are available for smaller visitors. Downstairs the well equipped kitchen has everything you would need to cook up a feast. The cottage has Wi-Fi and Free View television and a washer dryer.Guest access.You have full run of the cottage with your own private patio and views across the fields. You have your own parking space outside the cottage.Other things to note.A Full refund will be made if guests are unable to travel due to the Covid-19 restrictions.A local catering companySeasons Wild & Free can deliver fresh ready made food to the cottage by prior arrangement. Please follow the link below for more details. www.seasonswildandfree.comhttps://www.seasonswildandfree.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/Decadently-Wild-Free-ze-Final-1308.pdf

Title: The little Annexe
Description: The Little Annexe is a self contained detached unit. Set within our farmland near rural Warninglidwe are located within the High Weald area of outstanding natural beauty. Access to public footpaths allow you entry into the beautiful woodlands and surrounds. Ideally situated: 6 miles from both Horsham and Haywards Heath. Only a 15 min drive to Gatwick Airport. We are also local to event venues including Slaugham PlaceCisswoodHyde EstateBrookfield BarnBolney Wine EstateSouth Lodge.The spaceThe space.Kitchen appliances include a microwaveovencoffee machinekettletoaster and fridge.Sugarcoffeetea is also provided.We really hope you enjoy your stay and hope we have made it as comfortable as possible.Guest access.There is separate entrance for guests. Off road parking for your car.Other things to note.We are making every effort to ensure that you and ourselves are at the least risk during these unprecedented times. Please let us know immediately if you are displaying any Covid-19 symptoms. We would rather refund your stay then put you/us at risk. Many thanks.

Title: Twmbarlwm Luxury Retreat - Dingle Cabin
Description: "*We also offer another brand new cabin @ ‚ÄòTwmbarlwm Luxury Retreat - Barnfields cabin‚Äô sleeps 6*Luxury holiday cabin in the Risca countryside of Twmbarlwm. Built discretely into the hillsthis cabin has been crafted for a relaxing vacation. The cabin has been built with great care and installed with the best insulation to ensure a peaceful nights sleep.- Free Welcome Pack.- Private Hot tub & firepit/grill - ¬£20 for your entire stay (pay when you‚Äôre here).- Extra logs - ¬£10/sack"The spaceThe space.Located near Twmbarlwm you are free to walk the entire common with a vast area to ridewe are just a 20min ride to some of the best mountain biking trails and downhill tracks in the UK.As for the farm itself we are happy to share the space and view our animals.Guest access.This cabin is hidden away from the farmhouse and is very private.Other things to note.Please respect other guests with noise and common decency must be used in and around the private hot tub area.

Title: Toad Hall Luxury Lodge with Private Hot Tub
Description: Toad Hall is our luxury lodge/ treehouse in the woods at Happy Valley Norfolk with incredible views across open unspoilt countryside with a Private Hot Tub. Suitable for 4 adults & 2 children. Under floor heatingovenhobtoasterkettlefridge. Wet room. King size accommodation. BBQ. Part disable/pram friendly. Ideally located close to SandringhamHoughton & the North Norfolk coast. 15 mins from Kings lynn station. Perfect retreat to immerse in nature. Wifi-4GBoxThe spaceThe space.Open plan gable living room kitchen. Wet room. King size bedroom downstairs with double doors opening onto morning terrace. Watch the sunset on the west facing terrace. Double bedroom and space for children to sleep. Wet room and fully functional kitchen. Private Hot tub. Suitable for up to 4 adults and 2 children. There are space saving stairs to the first floor. These are quite steep. There is a stair gate at the top but not at the bottom. Something to note if you have small children. Outdoor dining & BBQ. The ground floor is part disabled friendly. Anyone booking must be able to open doors independently for easy escape. Covid Measures in place.Guest access.A rural escape surrounded by woodland and open views. The lodge is hired as a whole and consists of king bedroom. Double. Fitted kitchen with oven. Sink. Hob. Fridge. Living space looking across open farmland. The ground floor is part disabled friendly. Anyone booking must be able to open doors independently for easy escape.Other things to note.Hot tub may not have reached temperature on arrival due to the measures we are putting in place for Covid. Bedding is provided but please strip covers and sheets and place in laundry bag provided when you leave. Toad Hall stands alone and is private. There are blinds in the gable end and bedroom. No other curtains etc so you can appreciate the rural views.You have to drive up a farm track to reach the lodge. All types of vehicles can drive up hereyou do not need a 4x4. Downstairs has king bedroomwetroomliving room and kitchen (ovenhobtoasterkettle etc). We are a rural destination nestled in the woods on a traditional Norfolk working farm situated on a Norfolk Wildlife Trust. Space saving stairs to first floor. These are steeper than house stairs. Stair gate at the top. Not at the bottom. The hot tub may not be hot on arrival due to covid deep cleaningplease leave lid on and do not press buttons as this will not speed up heating times. There is a play area for children on the main Glamping site. You will need towels and to bring woodland appropriate footwear. WiFi isn‚Äôt the best but that‚Äôs due to the rural setting. Not good enough for streaming. 4g in places. A holiday to connect in nature and reconnect with each other.The ground floor is part disabled friendly. Anyone booking must be able to open doors independently for easy escape.

Title: Alton forest lodge
Description: Alton forest lodge is a unique woodland hidaway set in beuatiful ancient forest on the edge of the peak district national park.The spaceThe space.A spacious woodland lodgesleeps up to 12 people. Located in the stunning dimmingsdale heritage woodland. This bueatiful one time youth hostel is clad in waney edge larch and nestles superbly into the sourounding forest. Gaze out from the traditional wood fired hottub into the woodland night or just lie backclose your eyes and listen to the woodpeckers.With a 100 square meter decking area the lodge is well equiped for outdoor living.Inside you will find further luxourya large living area equipped with modern open plan kitched with large state of the art range cookerlooks over the dining area with huge handbuilt pitch pine dining table following onto a generous lounge area with comfy sofas42" led tv and a log burning stove. The room also benefits from a bespoke library wall covered in hundreds of books.Three large bedrooms are all individualy designed and can sleep up to 4 people. Bed layout for each room can be tailored to every booking. Just let us know if you want single bedsdouble beds or a mix in each room and we ll arrange it all before you arrive.The lodge has 2 bathroomsEach is tiled from floor to ceiling. The larger of the 2 fitted with a triple sized shower cubicle and both boasting modern power showers.Gas central heating throughouta logburner in the lounge and our handbuilt double glazed windows ensure that you ll be toasty warm on the coldest of nights.Dimmingsdale is covered in a beautiful ancient woodland. The woods have dozens of footpaths which allow ramblers to discover its natural beauty year round. The area is also a very popular mountain biking area with trails from the family friendly xc routes all the way up to the gnarly and steep enduro and downhill tracks. Rock climbing is also on offer as dimmingsdale boasts some of Englands finest sandstone bouldering cragsall within walking distance of the lodgeeven with a heavy mat on your back.Set right on the edge of the beautiful and popular peak district national parkyou\ll find the lodge an ideal base from which to explore.Alton towers is just 2 miles from the lodge tooso if you fancy a few theme park thrills you\re in just the right place.Thank you for reading about our lodge. We look forward to welcoming you to dimmingsdale.

Title: Ash Cabin at Bramblewoods with stunning  views
Description: "Our handcrafted en-suite wooden cabin is located within a small wood on the grounds of working sheep farm with an uninterrupted view across the valley in picturesque Shropshire.It has everything you need to retreat from the real worldwhether its for a cosy night inin front of the log burner or a chance to sit and stargaze on the deck.There is an abundance of walks right from your doorstepyoure even lucky enough to have the Offas Dyke within a stones throw from the Cabin."The space"The space.Handmade timber cabin set on a working sheep farm within a small wooded area with uninterrupted views across the valley.The Cabin is finished to a very high standard with an en-suite shower roomcompact kitchendining area for twolounge area with log burner.Outside the Cabin is a secure deck area with 2 lounge seats and a double hammockits a perfect space to bring your well behaved 4-legged friend."Other things to note.Important to note that there is no regular TV due to how isolated the cabin is - there is a smart tv so guests can log into their netflix or prime accounts to watch tv online.There is limited phone signal depending on your provider. There is WiFi for WiFi calling.This site is adult only and not suitable for children.

Title: Shepherd‚Äôs Rest, camping pod with hot tub.
Description: "Nestled in the heart of the Forest of Bowland AONBthis glamping pod is ideal for hikers and bikers who want a base more substantial than a tent and less fuss than a hotel. Want privacy with absolutely nobody else around? We can almost guarantee you wont see a single person while youre at the podso you can sit back and enjoy the stunning panoramic views that stretch for miles over the Dunsop and Ribble Valleys from the hot tubchampagne in handwith nobody to disturb you."The spaceThe space.The Shepherd‚Äôs rest is set in its own valley with panoramic views. It‚Äôs location makes it the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Anyone who stays at the pod will have great access to walkscycling and adventure. Gisburn forest mountain bike trails is a 15 minute drivethere a plenty of walks to do in the area and some great places to eat out.The pod is made out of a solid wood frame and boasts three sides of glass to fully take in the panoramic views. The pod is split in halfwith one side providing a comfortable and relaxing living area. There is a log burnersofa bed and kitchen unit in this side of the pod. The other side of the pod is the bedroom and bathroomcomplete with double bedtoiletsink and shower.The hot tub is located on decking outside the podand backs onto an old barn in the field. The hot tub is filled with natural spring water. It is a beautiful experience to sit in the hot tub as sunset falls over the valley.

Title: Beautiful Tiny House with private hot tubs
Description: Le domaine des hauts de canchemagnificent Tiny house with brand new private spa.This atypical accommodation is quietly located on the edge of the foresta few minutes drive from downtown Touquet paris plage.Decorated with care and comfort you can enjoy a wide choice of servicessuch as ordering meals (on reservation 48 HOURS beforepossibility of having the menu card on requestbike rental or breakfast service)The spaceThe space.The kitchen is equipped with an electric hobrefrigeratormicrowaveelectric ovencoffee makerkettleand cooking essentials.In the living room the sofa is convertible and you have a dining area.Upstairs you will find a double bed (160x190 cm).The bathroom on the ground floor has a walk-in showera sinkand a toilet (hair dryer on site).Television with a wide choice of channels.Outside your tiny house you can enjoy a large roof terracemaking 2/3 of your homeas well as another terrace on the ground floor where you can have your mealsor enjoy the garden around youits private spa will allow you to relax in the song of birdsGuest access.Enjoy access to your home and private Jacuzzinot to mention the garden surrounding your Tiny houseOther things to note.Following a few disappointments: - music is accepted outdoors with a low volume of sound in order to respect the tranquility of the neighborhood; it is forbidden after 10 pm.-the fireworks rockets and firecrackers are prohibited.-the spa is no longer allowed after 11 pmsmoking in it is prohibited.-we do not accept more than one dog.-the decorations like banners are not allowed.IN CASE OF CONFLICT AND/OR COMPLAINTWE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO EXCLUDE THE PERSON RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DISORDER

Title: Woodland Winter Cabin with Hot tub & log burner
Description: The Woodlands cabin is situated in our peaceful woodland in the heart of Snowdonia. It has a shower (hot water included) and w.c and washbasin (no hot water in the washbasin.Lighting is provided from a 12v solar panel system.A log burner is provided with free wood and fire lighters.There is a double bed.The private wood fired hot tub is situated on a balcony overlooking the woodland area.Pet friendly.Outside heating is provided.The spaceThe space.This unique glamping experience has everything you need for a restful and idyllic break from everyday life. Wake up to bird song and the sound of the stream. Enjoy your own exclusive hot tub whilst sipping a glass of bubbly. Our Hut is fully insulated and has everything you need for that perfect "rustic" getaway without compromising on quality and convenience.ALL bedding and towels are included in your stay. You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.A small log burner inside to keep you nice and cosy.There is limited telephone signal.Other things to note.Things we do provide.In the kitchen - we provide a single gas camping stove and kettle. The kitchen area is full equipped including a cool box - you may like to bring ice with you. There is no hot water in the kitchen sink.In the bathroom - there is a showerw.c and washbasin. Hot water is provided in the shower cubicle only.There is a wood burner and wood and fire lighters are provided free.Please note that this is an ECO cabin. The lighting is. 12v system run off solar panels.Outside seating is provided.

Title: Odli Pod- Mountain views. Hot Tub. Farm Stay.
Description: Odli Glamping Pod is situated on a picturesque working sheep and beef family farm in the heart of the Mid Wales countryside. Both cosy and private it is a place to snuggle down and unwind.Positioned in its own private field the site is surrounded by rolling fields and far-reaching views to the Berwyn mountains. There is flora and fauna and plenty of wildlife to see with red kites and buzzards circling above and our livestock roaming in the fields.The spaceThe space.A perfect couples retreat or the ideal family fun-filled break away! The pod has all the modern comfortsa fully equipped kitchen with a Belfast sinkFridge/freezerelectric hobmicrowavekettle and toaster and a Nespresso coffee machine.The bathroom has a WCsinkelectric shower with plenty of hot water and a towel radiator.The double bed has a memory foam mattress dressed with a goose down duvet with crisp cotton bedlinen. There is a double sofa bed for 2 additional guests (aged 2 -16).All linen and towels are provided.There is an outside seating area with a Firepit with grill so you can relax with a glass of wine and listen to the sounds of nature in the evenings and enjoy the stargazing. The first basket of logs will be provided.You will also have exclusive use of your very own private 40 jet American hot tub positioned next to the pod.Although the pod is great for summer dayswith under-floor heating and excellent insulationWIFIand a 32‚Äù smart TV with Netflixit still makes the perfect winter getaway.There is a private entrance to the site with parkingand a 60m stroll down a gravel path to the pod.

Title: Alexa Lodge with private hot and sauna
Description: Situated in the beautiful village of Hurst Green in the heart of the Ribble valley,you will find our brand new lodge.A true romantic get away,Alexa lodge offers guests spacious 5 star quality accommodation.Set in a peaceful setting with far reaching views,yet within a 5 minute walk to 2 fantastic pubs and the village cafe.Hurst Green the winner of several best kept village awards oozes character,and a wealth of history with the iconic Stoneyhurst College,and the Tolkein Trail on your doorstep.The spaceThe space.Alexa lodge is a true home from home with all the mod cons,a fabulous fitted kitchen,sumptuous bedroom with superking size zip and link bed,which can create twin beds if necessary,a stunning bathroom with a walk in shower big enough for 2.Smart T.V with free Netflix package,Wifi,and Amazon Alexa for your convenience.Outside is a large flagged patio with your very own covered hot tub,and a private saunaGuest access.guest access via lock box code 1234

Title: Oak Lodge - Lakeside Retreat
Description: Oak Lodge is our largest Lakeside Lodge perfect for families of 4couples wanting that extra bit of space or mixed groups.The outside decking (child friendly!) is simply fantasticfloating high above our lakes with stunning views across the water and beyond.. you won‚Äôt want to go inside!With open plan kitchendiner & lounge and patio doors to the decking areait‚Äôs a fantastic communal space. The fire pit / bar-b-que and lawn area is also just out the front ready to go!The spaceThe space.Our lakeside Lodges are set on Headlands Farm Fishery18 acres of outstanding natural countryside with two lakes and away from noise and light pollution. Our guests are entitled to walk around the lakes and grounds (dogs must be on leads at all times).Oak Lodge is nestled into the trees with private parking (just outside)deckingaccess to our Lakes and totally private.Oak Lodge has a cosy double bedroom with plenty of space for luggage and hanginga separate bunk bed room with 2 full sized single bedslarge shower room with luxury organic toiletriesa fully equipped kitchen with everything you require and a spacious lounge and diner with tv.Help yourself to breakfastwhich includes: selection of cerealssliced bread loaffresh farm eggsmilkorange juicejambutterteacoffee & sugar.Alternativelyenjoy our on site coffee shop (Headlands Farm Coffee Shop) for a freshly cooked breakfastlunch and afternoon tea as well as fantastic cakes and even better coffee! Open 9am - 4.30pm every day.Enjoy a bar-b-que or fire pit on your private bar-b-que area just outside the lodge.Please visit our Instagram page: @headlandsfarmlakesidelodges.Here you will find more photos of our lodges / Headlands Farm as well as our favourite places to visit / walk / cycle / eat / explore and do!Oak Lodge Anglers are welcome to fish from any fishing swim around our two lakeswith a few swims within 20 metersopposite the decking. A maximum of 2 adult anglers per lodgewith a 50% discount off our normal fishing rates. Payable in the Fishery Club house.If Oak Lodge doesn‚Äôt have your ideal dates freeplease take a look at our other Lakeside Lodgesalso on Airbnb:Willow Lodge - Lakeside Retreat:.Sleeps 4 (double bedroom and twin room) absolutely perfect for couplesfamilies and mixed groups with shower roomkitchen/diner/lounge and decking on the lakeside.Pine Lodge - Lakeside Retreat:.Sleeps 4 (1 double bed on a mezzanine level with a separate bunk bed room below)shower roomfull kitchendinerlounge and a child friendly decking!*** For your reassurance and peace of mind we are spending extra time between guests‚Äô stays to make sure all surfacesdoor handlesobjectsetcare thoroughly cleaned and sanitised.Our lodges are beautifully isolated in the countryside. There‚Äôs no need for you to see or to come into contact with anyone during your stayincluding us! However we are always contactable by phone/text and on hand should you require us.Airbnb are continually posting up to date advice regarding COVID-19 in relation to their bookings. Please check this out if you have any reason to think you might pose a risk to others ***Guest access.You have full access to your private Lakeside Lodge with private deckingthe lakesgrounds and fishing swims at Headlands Farm as well as public playing fields within a 2 minutes walk.. and all the the New Forest National Park has to offer within a 5 minute drive!.Other attractions nearby include:Peppa Pig World - 4 miles.Paulton‚Äôs Park - 4 miles.New Forest National Park - 1 mile.Marwell Zoo - 17 miles.Stonehenge - 23 miles.Beaulieu National Motor Museum - 15 miles.Mottisfont Abbey National Trust - 8 miles.Dinton Park National Trust - 24 miles.Wellow golf club - 1.2 miles.Paulton‚Äôs golf club - 5 miles.Romsey golf club - 5 miles.Landford garden centre - 3 miles.Lepe country park (seaside) - 18 miles.Hillier‚Äôs Arboretum - 7 milesOther things to note.Please visit our Instagram page: @headlandsfarmlakesidelodges.Here you will find more photos of our lodges / Headlands Farm as well as our favourite places to visit / walk / cycle / eat / explore and do!

Title: Rectory Farm Hideaway
Description: Tucked away in the heart of the Cotswoldsthe Hideaway is situated within a secluded and idyllic south-facing meadow.Lounge on the deck by summer and cozy up by the log-burner come autumnthe Hideaway is a perfect escape for any season.Relax and soak your troubles away in the hot tub (available at extra cost)whilst gazing at the stars sipping champagne.Get back to nature but with a good dollop of comfort!Your dog is welcome too!The space"The space.Facilities include:.1 x double bed (bedding & towels provided).1 x Double sized futon (bedding & towels provided).Indoor Log burner (fire wood provided).Wood fired Hot Tub (this is an additional cost please enquire for more details).Basic cooking facilities within the cabin with hot running water.Crockeryglassesmugs & cutlery.Teacoffeesugar & milk.Small gas fridge.Fire pit/BBQ outside for your use (firewood providedcoal not provided).Outdoor seating.Bathroom comprisinghot water showerWC & sink.All bedding and towels provided together with additional blankets.Dining table & chairs.Lighting via 12v system.Limited Electricity supply (weather dependant) ‚Äì power provided by solar which is weather dependant.No Wi-Fi.Check-in after 3pm / Check-out before 11am.Your beloved dog is also very welcome at The Hideaway (we do have to take a small surchargepayable upon arrival)This beautiful purpose built log cabin boasts tons of character. It has been designed to offer you a wonderfully unique stayset in a private area all to yourselves.The comfortable log cabin sleeps 4 with a king sized bed and a double sofa beda cute kitchen and a perfectly formed bathroom. Everything you need for a relaxing break will be suppliedincluding kitchen basicsbed linen and towels. The bathroom will provide you with a hot shower after a glorious days sightseeing.The eco wood-fired hot tub(available at extra cost) will keep you relaxed as your supper is sizzling away on the BBQ. Treat yourself to a glass of bubblygaze at the stars and let the beautiful surroundings wash away your stress.The Hideaway is supplied with solar powerwhich of course is dependant on the sun shining. For those overcast days you can wander down to the local pubcozy up next to the log burnerwhile away your time in the hot tub or snuggle up around the fire pit toasting marshmallows.This is an idyllic place to unwind and leave your hectic life behind. There is no wi-fi to distract youso you can truly switch off.You are close to the beautiful cities of Oxford and Cheltenham and the gorgeous towns and villages of the Cotswolds. Shop till you drop in the many boutiques and antique shops that the surrounding towns have to offer. Or lose yourself in the wonderful stately homes and gardens nearby. To name a few; Blenheim PalaceBuscot ParkFriar‚Äôs CourtKelmscott Manor. Or visit one of our local villagesBamptonwhere many scenes of Downton Abbey were filmed.The Cotswolds is dripping in historyfrom ancient churches and barnsto Roman ruins and gothic monasteriesthere is a wealth of activity on your doorstep.If the great outdoors is your thingyou are spoilt for choice with wonderful walking and cycling opportunities. The Cotswolds Way is close by and boasts over 100 miles of trails through picturesque villages and ancient woodland. You also have the river Thames just a couple of miles away.If all that activity sounds like hard workjust kick off your shoes and spend the day lounging on your deck and enjoying the beautiful countryside.The Cotswolds is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and you will be staying in the heart of this wonderful area.If the ‚ÄòHideaway‚Äô is booked for the dates you are looking forplease look at our converted railway carriages - Rectory Farm Retreat and Rectory Farm Camp. All set in a similar setting as The Hideaway!""Other things to note.As we mentionedthe Hideaway is only powered by solar powerso you many experience a limited power supply. Dont fret too muchyou are close to many towns and villages if you need a WiFi hit.The eco hot tub is wood-fired and comes at an additional costplease enquire for further information. Its well worth it as you can enjoy a wonderfully warm outdoor soak. If you would like to make use of the hot tubplease let us know prior to your arrival so that we can make sure it is ready for you."

Title: Y Pod @ Bryntalch - Private glamping pod & hot tub
Description: "Set in beautiful surroundingsour stylishcompact two-person wooden pod is perfect for that relaxing break away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.Stay with us on our family farmand unwind to the tranquil sounds of the brook belowenjoy the picturesque sunsets from your own private wood fired hot tubor explore the rolling hills of Montgomeryshirewith footpaths right on your doorstepand Offas Dyke just a stones throw away.We look forward to welcoming you!"The spaceThe space.The pod has all your everyday essentials - fully equipped kitchenette (with fridge freezerelectric hobkettle and toaster)bathroom (showertoilet and sink)double bed as well as a spacious outdoor areawith you own wood-fired hot tub and seating area! There is also an electric heater insideto keep you warm on those cold nights.Bed linen and towels are provided.There is a private parking space nearby with a 50m stroll down a gravelled path to the pod.The pod is fenced off howeverbe mindful of livestock in adjoining fields.There is no Wi-fi in the podhowever there is good phone signal and 4G in the area.There will be a Welsh welcome hamper on your arrival containing teacoffeesugarmilk and chocolate.Other things to note.Even though we supply towelsmaybe bring a couple more to use with the hot tub. It might be an idea to bring suitable footwear (sandals/slippers)to walk from hot tub to pod.We will supply a bucket of logs for hot tub use.

Title: Pinetree Lodge, romantic getaway in the Cotswolds
Description: "Pinetree Lodge is a romantichigh end luxury Cotswold getawaynestled in its own smallenclosed wood on our active working farm. It‚Äôs outside living at its finestwith a well equipped outdoor kitchenfire pit with accessories to cook a beautiful BBQroast or chilli. A gas BBQ also provided for ease. An efficient wood burner provides ample warmth on colder evenings and during the winter months. The Kitchen is basica little gas stove gives for a nice cuppa and a breakfast fry up indoors."The space"The space.The Lodge has been a dream of mine for years and a wonderful Australian couple have made my dream a reality! Literally from a pencil drawing I gave them on a scrap of paperthey lovely created my beautiful bespokecosyluxury tiny home where guests can unwind and have a wonderful time away from the rest of the world!The small wood its has been built in is only a short distance from the hustle and bustle of the farm but this only adds to the feeling of being out in the true and very real countryside. There are sunsets most evenings and footpaths that run straight from your doorgorgeous Cotswold villages to visit and scrummy places to eat.Its definitely a place all to yourselfa space in the heart of the countryside to enjoyfor the majority its peaceful and tranquilbut maybe with an occasional visit from the young friendly farm sheep dogWoody! or the hum drum of the tractor beavering awaynature at its best!Its conveniently close to all local amenities without knowing it! We have 2 great pubsfabulous local butchers and shop with all you need. You are close to all the most beautiful Cotswold villagesChipping CampdenBroadway (my favourite)Bourton on the WaterMoreton in the MarshStow on the Wold. Your local town is Stratford upon AvonShakespeares birth place. National Trust GardensHidcote Gardens and privately owned gardens at Kiftsgate Court where the famous Kiftsgate Rose comes from.There is so much to do in the area and places to see."

Title: Stylish House By The River To Escape & Relax
Description: The property include a comfortable king size bedfully equipped kitchen and bathroomTV and internet and car parking facilities. All the architectural details have been created by our talented local designer to produce for you a relaxing interior style using natural and sustainable materials to inspire an earthy feeling without forgetting all the modern comforts you need. The space"The space.Otters RestYou will be immersed in beautiful nature and surrounded by the sound of the water. You can enjoy the tranquillity of our award nominated Eco -House with two lovely covered terraces for a nice weekend retreat where you can read a book or just relax with a cup of tea.Otters Rest is located in ClitheroeLancashire in the grounds of a listed building built in 1795 with a long history associated with the Lancashire cotton mills.We are at the edge of the town so whilst you are secludedall the amenities are within just 10 min walk. This area of the Ribble Valley is very beautiful and sits at the edge of the Forest of Bowland with Stonyhurst College only 15 minutes away. Downham and other picturesque villages are very close for you to visit and enjoy for walks and visiting the wonderful pubs.It is an ideal base for visiting friends in the areafor a walking holiday or for just the peace and quiet to have a break from chaotic cities. If you are a foodiethe Ribble Valley is peppered with gastronomic experiences to suit all pockets.  Clitheroe is a really charming old town with individual shopsa market and even a micro-brewery situated in the beautifully converted Holmes Mill just a short walk from the house.For a very different and very special experience try our little paradise!!!"

Title: Beautiful Handcrafted Cedar Lodge with Hot Tub
Description: This beyond the average bespoke 2020 build is ultimately pleasing to the eyewith it‚Äôs curvaceous smoothed oak rail staircasehandsome pillars and waxy satin cedar beams which embrace this appealing handcrafted lodge. An open plan living area leads onto 2 bedrooms with beautiful en-suites. Sitting in a field amongst the vivid greens of the Shropshire hills on an expanse of decking where you can open up the bifold doors and bring the outside in and enjoy the deliciously warm hot tub.The spaceThe space.Sunlight floods the stylish rooms showing off the gorgeous comfy furnishings. A log burner sits in the living area where you can hunker down on a winters day. An eclectic style kitchen of chunky wood and midnight blue cupboards with an accent of copper is well equipped. The honey hues of the king size oak four poster bed with its enticing plump beddingleading to wide opening bifold doors out onto a balcony with mesmerising views. The en-suite bathroom is luxuriant with its double rainfall shower headstwo sinks and heated floor. The second bedroom is welcoming with its deliciously comfy bed which cleverly can a king size double or two singles. The perfectly conceived en-suite has a heated floor and a shower to die for. In a field amongst an abundance of fruit blossom in the spring and broad leafy woods in the summer. This alluring place is tantalising in its serenity and you can‚Äôt help but fall into its bewitching peaceful rhythm.Guest access.A Private track lined by oak and sycamore trees will bring you up to a gravel parking areawhere you can unload and take the well lit footpath to the Lodge. We have 9 acres of private woodland with tracks for you to use right outside your front door and a field with the river Onny at the bottom which is easily accessible.Other things to note.There is no extra charges for fire wood and kindling or use of the hot tub. The Hot tub will be ready for use on your arrival with towels along with bathroom towelshand towels and bed linen. We provide a welcome packthis includes teacoffeesugarmilkbuttereggshomemade loaf of bread and Jam. Toilet rolls are provided. Soap powder and softener for washing machine along with washing up liquid.

Title: Canadian Log Cabin with Hot Tub
Description: "Our BRAND NEW traditional Canadian Log Cabin sits at the top of the mountain overlooking the Ceiriog Valley and Berwyn mountains. It is ideal for romantic breaks or just to relax and unwind making use of your own private hot tub after long walks in the hills. A mere four miles from Llangollen youll find a great base to make the most of all the fantastic outdoor activities and places to visit that we have to offer in the local area and further afield in North WalesCheshire and Shropshire."Guest access.Guests have access to a spacious garden and an undercover private hot tub spawhich is right next to the cabin and exclusively for use of guests of the cabin.Other things to note.WELCOME PACK:We provide a welcome pack for guests: Generally consisting of a few tea bags and some coffee so that you can have a brew on arrival without having to worry about unpacking all of your stuff. Along with other homemade produce dependant on what‚Äôs in season and what I‚Äôve been cooking / bakinga slice of cake or maybe some jam may be available.All said and done if there‚Äôs anything at all that you need during your stayplease don‚Äôt hesitate to come and ask us and we will always do our best to help.WI-FI:.We are currently without WiFi .PETS:With pets of our own we understand how much people like to bring them on holiday. Therefore we do accept one well behaved pet on request.For this we make a small charge of ¬£35 for three nights stay.For four nights plus we make a ¬£50 charge which is payable on arrival please.We also ask our guests PLEASE NOT to leave their pets unsupervised in the log cabin as they can become quiet stressed in a strange environment.Any questionsplease don‚Äôt hesitate to drop us a message.

Title: Cabin In The Heart Of The New Forest
Description: "Social distancing to a ‚ÄòT‚Äô !!.‚ÄòLittle Gate House is an idyllic country retreat for couples in the heart of the New Forest National Park. A cosy self-contained cabin with enclosed garden.South facing elevated position with gorgeous views.The New Forest is literally on the doorstep but yet there is easy access to visit the nearby townsvillagescities and beaches.Fab pub,2 cafes (1 with farm shop) all an easy walk.1 dog allowed - ¬£25 total payable in cash.10% off week stays.Min. 3 nights"The spaceThe space.* In light of the Covid 19 pandemicI‚Äôd like to reassure my guests that I have a very high standard of cleanliness and I clean and disinfect all surfacesthe bathroomthe kitchen and high touch surfaces such as handlestv remoteslight switchesetc. The bedding and towels are washed at 60 degrees and I will remove all scatter cushions and blankets if you‚Äôd like me to. HoweverI do spray them with a disinfectant spray. We are positioned in the middle of the countryside where you don‚Äôt have to come into contact with anybody else if you don‚Äôt wish to. You have more chance of meeting a wild pony! It‚Äôs self check in so you don‚Äôt even have to have any contact with me! I even disinfect the key!!.If you book and then we are put into a lockdown during your booked datesin the first instance I would hope that you would consider postponing your stay and changing your dates. Howeverif this is not an option for you and you need to cancel then I would instruct Airbnb to issue you a full refund.*Length of stay discounts automatically applied. Up to 10% off for week stays.*Late booking discounts automatically applied.*Please contact me if your required dates won‚Äôt fit in. Sometimes there is some flexibility.*Please let me know if you‚Äôre booking to celebrate a special occasion!*First load of kindling and logs included but thereafter charged at ¬£5 per load.*No extra cleaning fee or security deposit.charged.*Feel free to bring a bbq.*Extra charge of ¬£25 in total for a dog payable in cash during your stay. Please enquire if you‚Äôd like to bring more than one dog.*Contactless check in - just book and arrive!Little Gate House is located a short drive up a forest gravel track set on it‚Äôs own in the corner of our 3 ¬Ω acre grounds providing visitors with a high degree of privacy and peace. The site once formed part of Ibsley RAF base during World War II and Little Gate House was one of the original maycrete buildings. The block of stables that you look out onto is the old latrine block and a couple of Stanton air raid shelters are in the paddock. Literally to the rear of the cabin is the open New Forest providing a whopping 140,000 acres of stunning landscape to explore. Horse riders frequently go by as well as wildlife such as the New Forest poniescattledonkeysdeerfoxesbadgers and an abundance of birds such as owlswoodpeckers and buzzards which are often seen circling above the trees during the summer months.Well designedthe Little Gate House provides a compact yet light and airy space. Inside the heated and fully insulated bespoke cabinyou\ll find all the comforts you would expect from luxury self-catering accommodation. Living room open plan with fully equipped kitchen/dining area with full height ceilingsa wood-burning stove and double French doors opening onto a large area of south-facing decking. Cosy bijou double bedroom with full height built-in wardrobe and extra storage space above the bed useful for storing bags etc. En-suite bathroom with over-bath showerbasinelectric ladder radiator and toilet. Wooden floors throughout. Many guests have described Little Gate House as being "Smallbut perfectly formed and equipped with everything you need". Enclosed private garden to the side of the cabin ideal for your dog to stretch their legs!Although guests have the convenience of access straight onto the New Forestthere is also quick and easy access to all main roads for visitors to explore the many villagestownscities and beaches that HampshireDorset and Wiltshire have to offer.Riding stables 10 min drivewatersports/fishing 2 milesaward-winning \Hockey\s Farm\ shop and caf√© 10 min walkthe lovely \Royal Oak\ thatched pub and restaurant 20 min walk\The Potting Shed\ caf√© at Hyde 20 min walk (highly recommend - closed on Mondays). Ringwood (with a WaitroseLidl and Sainsbury\s) 5 miles and Fordingbridge (with a Co-op and Tesco Express) 2.5 miles.Please see \Getting Around\ section for walking directions to local farm shoppub and cafe.*** Please have a look through the ‚Äòhouse rules‚Äô and it‚Äôs important you follow my directions to find us easily.Guest access.The entire space. It is for the sole private use of our guests.Other things to note.We have dual band wifi. If your device gives you the choice then please select Gate House 5G (if notthen Gate House 2.4G). The password is TOUCHWOOD. Howeverus country folk don‚Äôt have as good a wifi as city folk so please be mindful of this. We have recently had a new router fitted and fibre optic brought all the way to the house so touchwood so far the wifi has been great!Our property is accessed from a gravel track which has two ends. One end has a ford which is passable 90% of the year. When we have had an extreme amount of rain the ford may be too deep to drive throughbut there is access by coming in and out the other end of the track. Our property is 0.2 mile from the ford end and 0.5 mile from the other end. General maintenance is carried out on the track a few times a year. Come in through the electric gates and the Little Gate House will be directly in front of you on the left hand side.

Title: Remote Retreat in private field, ideal for dogs
Description: Stay in our beautifully crafted wooden Shepherd‚Äôs Hutset in your own private south facing field next to the river. Surrounded by rolling green hillsthis is the perfect eco-getawaywith solar powered electricity and extensive outdoor space. Enjoy the elegant interior furnishings and cosy wood stoveand explore the many walks on offer directly from your doorstep.Ideal for dog ownershikerscyclists and nature loversor anyone looking to get away from the normal hustle and bustle of life.The space"The space.The Shepherds Hut has been lovingly crafted and furnished to provide a uniquely stylish and cosy retreat. Showcasing the natural wood and slate furniture that we make for a livingthe space contains cleverly designed table and benches that slide out from under the bed for spacious indoor diningand lots of hidden storage for your belongings.The Shepherds hut has been very well insulated and even on the coldest winter days you will be dry and toasty inside with the wood burner and the gas-powered shower. No need to bring woodwe have a healthy pile for you to use.There is a toilet and shower attached to the back of the cabin with spectacular views.Enjoy your breakfast at the table outside and maybe spot the grey heron flying in to catch his food from the river. In the evening you can sit outdoors around a bonfire to gaze at the stars and listen out for the owlsor watch the moon rise over the fields from your comfy bed.Keep your eyes pealed for badgers and ottersand enjoy guaranteed peace and quiet and connection to nature.There is no wi-fibut there is mobile phone reception.Parking is available close to the Huteither by our house or a short walk on the other side of the hedge.""Guest access.The Shepherds Hut is in your own private south facing field with fire pit and picnic table.We ask for a donation towards wood for bonfires.We have a second shepherds hut in its own field round the corner; the two huts are private from one another and there is no shared land between them.Depending on the time of year you might get fresh eggs from our hensveg from the polytunnelor a selection of pick-your-own berries."

Title: Luxury Glamping Pod with Hot Tub and amazing views
Description: "The Stretton Pod is nestled snugly in the South Shropshire HillsArea of Outstanding Natural Beauty.Situated alongside a working farmwith plenty of walks from the doorstepthis cosy Glamping Pod provides the perfect escape to relax and unwind.The accomodation has been individually designed and furnished in a bespoke style to provide you with a restful staywith a private hot tub included.Luxury 100% cotton bed linen and towels are providedalong with teacoffeesugar."The spaceThe space.Wet room with shower.Double Induction hob and combination microwave/oven/grill.Double bed with Hybrid Memory Foam Mattress.32" LED Freesat TV.FREE WI-FI.All year round heating.Outdoor decking area.Uninterrupted viewsOther things to note.Travel cot & high chair available for ¬£10 per stay.Iron & Ironing board available for ¬£5 per stay

Title: Beautiful Cosy Cabin (No.3) - Close to Yarmouth
Description: Thinking about a Spring/ Summer holiday in 2022? Why not booking one of our log cabins. Our cabins make a great base for exploring the beautiful Isle of Wight. Fully insulateddouble glazed and heated for all year round use. Suitable for couples or small families.The spaceThe space.This Cabin opened in July 2020 and is beautifully finished with high quality furnishings and fittingsmaking your stay as welcoming and comfortable as possible. Upon entering the grounds guests take the private track to an undercover parking area. Wander down the bark path and enter through French doors into the kitchen/ lounge. The Cabin has a fully fitted kitchen with microwave oven with grillfridge/freezertoaster and induction hob. All crockery and cutlery are supplied. The cabin also has a cafetiere for your morning coffee.Relax on the comfortable L-shaped sofa bed in front of the 32" TVwatch one of the many DVD\s provided or enjoy a glass of wine whilst playing a board game.The separate shower room has fantastic water pressureproviding an invigorating shower in a lovely corner unittogether with a basin and flushing WC - soap and towels provided.Through the door on the left hand side is a comfortable double bed with a quality mattress and topper all prepared with freshly washed bedding for your arrival . The comfy double sofa bed with topperhas all bedding supplied and is ideal for children or adults.You can dine at the table inside the cabin or enjoy the outdoors and eat at the picnic table next to your cabin. There is also a gravel area next to the picnic table for use with disposable bbqs these can be purchased on site if required.Please note: we do not allow smoking/ vaping or pets on site.Guest access.We have 3 cabins on siteall with their own grass and eating area.Guests have the whole cabin to themselves and are free to enjoy several acres of outside space around them. Guests have access to the whole site of approximately 3 acres."Other things to note.On site under cover parking is provided for cars and bicycles. Please note : only one car per cabin.Highly recommended and Award winning local Family Pub/ Restaurant the Horse & Groom is within walking distance approximately 1 mile away. Serving breakfastslunchdinner and Sunday Lunch.the Pub also has a childrens outside play area. Pre-booking definitely recommended."

Title: Log Cabin Snowdonia
Description: *LAST MIN CANCELLATION FOR XMAS TO COVID* Nights of 24 - 29 Dec now available *Lovelycosy little Log Cabin in the centre of Snowdonia. Perfect for 2can sleep 3‚Ä¶ (plus room for a travel cot if needed) with a fully equipped kitchen/ dining/ living area & shower room. Ideal for active getawaysromantic breaks or a family holiday the cabin is close to forests & mountains & just 20 mins drive to the seaside.2 night min booking. At Xmas/ New Year/ Bank Hols longer min stay applies.The space"The space.* COVID-19 Update: Airbnb have imposed a Covid Sanitisation Clean between each booking and this is mandatory. We are now having to apply a cleaning fee to all bookings to cover this. Due to the remote nature of the cabin this requires a 20 mile round trip for a cleaner. This is to cover the Sanitisation Clean only and guests are still required to clean up after themselves during their stay. Cleaning products are provided.* Please Note - For hygiene reasonswe dont provide any linens/ beddingincluding bed sheetspillowsduvets and towels (+ tea towels & cleaning cloths). Guests will need to bring their own.We are very fond of our little Cabin and have aimed to create somewhere that is well equippedwelcoming andas many of our guests saya Home from Home. We certainly love spending time there as an escape from everyday life and we hope you‚Äôll love it as much as we do!Our self catering cabin was fully refurbished in 2016 and has a fully equipped kitchen & living area with TV & Freesat2 bedrooms - 1 double & 1 single (note this is a fold out single bed) and a shower room.The kitchen should be fully equipped with all you need to make a 3 course dinner or just a nice bacon sarnie in the morning. We try to keep the cupboards stocked with a few basics ‚Äì coffeeteaTomato KetchupSalt & Pepper etc ‚Äì just in case! There is a small shop on site if you need any basic supplies too.At the start of 2017 the cabin had a newfully insulated external cladding added to it & in late 2019 we had the roof insulated also which is keeping everyone warmer in Winter and cooler in Summer. Howeverplease remember that cabin is a simple wood construction so it most likely wont be as warm in Winter as your home is so we do ask people to pack a few warmer clothes (& definitely some Slippers!) and maybe use it as an excuse to get cosy under a blanket with someone!Mobile signal has improved drastically in the past few years and we are able to easily stream films & shows to our devices using 4G - perfect for a lazy day in bed! Weve also been able to work remotely here as the connection is strong enough to support video calls.We also have a large supply of DVDs and books in the cabin for cold or wet days that you might not want to go out - so stay in and curl up on our big sofas!""Guest access.The place is all yours during your stay and in addition to this theres a small shoplaunderette (great after a day mountain biking or hill walking) & well equipped playground on site. Sadly the pub on site was devastated by a huge fire in Oct 2018 and will be closed for the foreseeable future whilst it is rebuilt. As its Grade II listed thoughthis is taking some time to get sorted.We can recommend alternative venues and taxis. Please ask us for more info or check the guidebook at the Cabin.Larger shops / supermarkets and all tourist attractions are accessible by car. Most things are about 20 mins drive away (a perfect opportunity to take in the scenery!). There is a dedicated space for car parking right outside the cabin so parking should never be an issue.""Other things to note.Check in is at 3 pm and Check out is at Midday.At the cabin itself theres no Wifi currently due to the location. There is a mobile mast on the site now though so Mobile signal has been greatly improved and is good enough to stream SkyNetflix etc or work remotely and do video calls.Due to restrictions from Snowdonia National Park we are obliged to close for the month of November.We require ALL guests to have a history of positive feedback from previous hosts so please note if you are new to Airbnb or have little/no reviews we are unlikely to accept your booking. As we are not on site we like to have extra confidence in the bookings - please dont take this personally!"

Title: The Delightful Tadpole Shepherds Hut, Somerset
Description: The Tadpole Hut offers the perfect cosy autumn escape.Relax under the stars (you can see them from your pillow!) as you enjoy a break from the routine in a truly beautiful part of South Somerset.This luxury bolthole is the perfect jumping off point for exploring the area‚Äôs natural beauty and quirky wondersthough you may prefer to snuggle up in front of the log burner!Brand new in 2021The Tadpole is well insulated with sheep wool and to ensure you are warm whatever the weather!The spaceThe space.The Tadpole was hand built in 2021 by local craftsmen at Blackdown Shepherd Huts in nearby Ilminster to the highest standards. It is fitted with an electric showersmall fridgetwin induction hobwater boiler tapwood burning stoveelectric radiatorand a drop-down double bed. The contents are of an equally high standardand include such thoughtful touches as a mobile phone charging padsmart speaker and a range of board games. WiFi is fast and reliable and the views across the valley are stunningespecially at sunrise when the mist sometimes gathers. The garden is fabulouswith outside seating and a wildlife pond complete with frogs and newts!Guest access.The Tadpole sits on the edge of the small pretty village of Kingston with its stone cottages and farmhousesgastro pub and community shop. Parking is available off road a few metres from the Hut.

Title: The Otterford Retreat -The Blackdown Hills -HotTub
Description: Welcome to the beautiful Blackdown Hillswe are conveniently located between TauntonWellington and Honiton in a quiet Area of Outstanding Natural beauty and set in 8 acres.Our aimto try and share our little piece of green countryside with our guests and create a place to relax in comfort away from your everyday cares and stress.This is the sister unit to the Oak Escape and both can be booked together to create space for parties of up to 8.The spaceThe space.Our small studio/House has been built to latest standards ensuring warmth and comfort during your stay. We have kept the pod as simple as possible making it ideal for couples and young families. The place has been fitted out with all the comforts of home with brands we all know and trust. The hot tub is here for you to enjoy as you wishbathrobes and luxury White Company towels will keep you warm afterwards.40 ins Tv with DVD and Roberts music system will help entertain on those cold dark winter nights when the views have been covered for the day.The shower room is stocked with everything you will need during your stay with a Mira shower to reinvigorate while your towel is warmed on the electric towel rail.The kitchen is compact but fully functioning with oven,fridge freezer and 2 ring hob top. The oven can also be used as a microwave. If coffee is your indulgence the Nespresso machine is there and fully stocked for you to sample the different flavours on offer.For the energetic guests we have 2 adult bikes located at the podplease bring your own helmets!With our changeable weather you can decide to eat inside or out with the tables and chairs we have provided. The Weber BBQ is also in situation on the deck when required ( we do put away during the winter but available on request.)Wireless charging is available along with a docking port for the iPhone with USB plugs available at the bedsides.Other things to note.We have tried to put everything we would want in a holiday stay into the househowever if something is not available please ask and we will do our best to provide.

Title: King's Cabin with covered private hot tub
Description: Located in an unspoiled corner of North Devon and nestled in undisturbed ancient woodland with outstanding valley views sits Wampford Woodland Retreat. Our luxury cabin comes beautifully crafted and styled inside-out with many features including a private hot tub. This is the perfect idyllic retreat!.Wampford Woodland Retreat offers a peaceful and quiet setting yet is only 30 minutes from the coastline. Our cozy cabin is the perfect getaway to enjoy a wood cabin holiday here in Devon.The spaceThe space.Wampford Woodland Retreat offers a uniqueluxury way to get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Amazing views await you at your wooden cabin and if you wish to wander and explorefeel free to do so with over 50 acres of ancient woodland along the river Mole to enjoy!.Your private hot tub awaits you on your large front balcony and behind the cabin you will find an impressive hammockperfect for stargazing in and sipping your favourite beverage with your favourite personbliss!Other things to note.Sensible shoes reccomended for the walk from the car park to the cabin.

Title: Idyllic countryside cabin with stream and lake.
Description: Relax in this beautiful quirky cabin which was completed in 2021.Exposed beamsarched doors and a wood burner. The master bedroom has an en-suite and behind a bookshelf is a hidden bunk room.Guests can enjoy 3 acres of private grounds with a stream bubbling through it and a lake with jetty and rowing boat.Hot tub available upon request and at extra cost.Dogs welcome.Bampton is a lovely "foodie" village just five minutes walk away.Attractions nearby.Checkin/out Monday or FridayThe space.Applejacks is a charming cosy gem which is accessed through private gates off a country lane and down a drive to the former stone sheep barn which is full of wood and rustic features. It is laid out as follows:Inside:.-Porch/boot room with hand made sheep mosaic on the floor and store cupboard with washing machine.-The main living area has high ceilingsexposed oak features and a wood burner/baking stovewith two comfy chairs and colourful bean bags at one end. There is a writing table that is perfect for anyone needing to work on a laptop. At the other end is a rustic dining tabledresser and brand new kitchen (microwavedishwasher). There is a Dulcimer should guests wish to learn a medieval string instrument.-The master bedroom is entered through an arched door. There is an en-suite bathroom with walk in shower. You can hear the trickle of the stream as you fall asleep.-Behind the bookshelf leading off the lounge is a small secret bunk bed room with colourful wallpaperperfect for kids or extra guests.-There is a cloakroom/toilet off the lounge.Outside:.-French doors lead out onto a large partially covered hardwood deck with comfortable sofas on one side and an oak dining table on the other. View of the stream and surrounding nature and complete privacy. The barn is surrounded in formal lawns and there are also three acres of private grounds for guests to exclusively explore and enjoy. Why not sit around a fire and cook marshmallows?Next to the stream is a two person oak swing seat and pondit is a perfect spot for enjoying the sight and sounds of the stream or to watch the kids play in the water.Across a stone bridge is a small orchard and grasslands. At the other end of the field guests can discover a lake with a path running around it. There is a jetty and rowing boat for guests to use at their own risk.Guests can enjoy outdoor fires and there is also a clay oven perfect for pizzasmeat and jacket potatoes.There is another picnic table in the field.Additionally:-Hot tub upon request and at extra charge-Dogs are welcome but not in bedrooms or on furniture.-Good wifi-Logs are provided-Outdoor shower-Short breaks (check in/out Fridays and Mondays)-No TV-Towels and bed linen provided-Parking for two cars-All ground floor apart from one step from porch into the barn-Washing machine-Highchair and cot bed-Hairdryer-Linen/towels provided-Payment by bank transfer please.Guest access.Private parking for two cars next to the property.Other things to note.The lake and stream are not fenced off so children must be accompanied at all times. There is a rowing boat for guest to use but it is done so completely at the guests risk and should not be used by anyone under 18.Please note that sometimes sheep are in the field so dogs should be kept under control at these times. Thank you.

Title: Cabin Morgan at Efyrnwy Escapes, Pontrobert, Powys
Description: Setup with everything you may needincluding bedding and towels. With a double bedroombathroom and sofa bed this is perfect for a romantic hide away bolt hole or a place for family adventure. Fully equipped kitchen including fridge/freezerslow cookermicrowavecosy log-burner and a stocked wood store. Dining inside or out on the decking; tables and chairs are provided and a private bbq and firepit on the seated patio area for those late summer nights stargazing with a nice glass of wine.The spaceThe space.Cabin Morgan is set back from a quiet lane on a smallholding between the peaceful villages of Pont Robert and Meifod. Tranquil and idyllic with stunning views of the rolling hills of Wales it has 10 acres of private farmland to stroll around. Locally designed with solar powerfiltered water from a bore hole and local welsh sheep providing wool insulation; this wooden cabin provides a more environmentally thoughtful way to stay.Dogs are welcome at a fee of ¬£5 on arrival and BYDB (bring your own dog bed). One well behaved dog is extremely welcomebut please contact us should you have more.We have tried to make the cabin feel like a home from home. A welcome pack with the basics (teacoffeemilkbread and bacon etc.) will be waiting for you on your arrival to start you on your holiday. Please let us know of any special requests e.g Soya Milk or gluten free bread.

Title: Beautiful Lake House near Shrewsbury, Shropshire
Description: "Set amidst beautiful Shropshire countryside and sat overlooking an amazing lake. The stunning Market Towns of Shrewsbury and Church Stretton are only a ten minute drive while Ludlow can be reached in around 20 minutes. Beautiful Surroundings set on a tranquil lakenear to the Shropshire Hills with plenty of walks including The Times number one walk for the 2018 New Year being from Picklescott which is just 2 miles up the lanesearch The Times 20 Great walks for the new year on the internet"The space"The space.With beautiful surroundings and set on a tranquil lake our log cabin has 1 large bedroom with a separate bathroom and an open plan Kitchen/Dining/Lounge area. Plenty of space outside with its private parking and wrap around veranda to enjoy the views of the lakes from! It has been beautifully decorated and furnished by a local interior designer to a high standard.There is caketeacoffeemilk and sugar waiting for you on your arrival ."Guest access.You can walk around the lakes but please do not use the owners private garden area.

Title: Arraslea (3) Two Person Cabin with private Hot Tub
Description: Our cabins are set in 12 acres of private land that we use for our heavy horses.We have three cabins and they all have their own hot tubs .Our site is a quiet site so no parties or loud noises.
