Description: Willow log cabin is a perfect escape in this tranquil setting in rural Suffolk here at KingfishersCretingham. This lodge offers open plan living with a hot tub in the secludedprivate garden where guests can enjoy the beautiful surroundings.This spacious one bedroom log cabin is perfectly situated within our stunning 120 acres of Country Park. It is ideal for up to two guests. The en-suite has a roll top bath with separate showerbasin and WC.The spaceThe space.Guests can enjoy the peace and tranquility offered here at Kingfishers yet have plenty to do both on their doorstep and within a short drive or cycle.From your doorstep you can enjoy a 9 hole parkland golf courserestaurantcafekayak and boat hire and nature trail. Kingfishers really does offer the very best of the Suffolk Countrysidenot a vehicle noise or street lamp in sightyet only 30 minutes from the amazing coastal towns of Aldeburgh and Southwold20 minutes from IpswichStowmarket and Woodbridgeand only 8 minutes to the popular town of Framlingham.

Title: Cosy Rural Log Cabin, Near Slapton Sands
Description: A peacefulsecludedlightbright and warm cabinsurrounded by fields with horsescountryside viewsa mile and a half outside of picturesque SlaptonSlapton Lea Nature reserve and the beach. The cabin has a sofatable and chairsTVsmall kitchen area and a cosy bedroom at the back with a double bed and bunks. It is on the edge of our playing field area and has its own fenced garden space. The bathroom; showertoilet and basin are in the building next door (@20 yards).The spaceThe space.The cabin is situated in our large garden and field on the side of the valley. You can be lulled to sleep with the sounds of the nature and bask in the afternoon sun that keeps the cabin naturally super cosy. The cabin is simple but beautifully peacefultranquil and the setting is idyllic. \u202c \u202aIn the cabinyou will find a comfy double size bedbunk bedsa sofaa small kitchen area with an area for making drinkssimple suppers and breakfastsand hooks to hang clothes. There is a kettletoastera small fridge freezermini hobmini sink with cold water tapcutlerycrockery and glassescoffeetea and breakfast jars of cereal. There is also a combination microwavewhich can be used like an oven. \u202c \u202aAll bedding is suppliedalong with towels and soap and there is an electric heaterto keep you warm and cosy. During the cooler monthsyou may wish to bring warm socks and/or slippers too. There is a small TV in the cabinbut perhaps you would rather immerse yourself in nature..\u202c

Title: Greenways Log Cabin a relaxing rural retreat
Description: Greenways Log Cabin is a beautifully furnished rural retreat with stunning countryside views. It is privateairy and comfortable. All furnishings and fittings are of a very high quality.The log cabin sits within the owner‚Äôs property in its own private garden. There is a key safe for contactless arrival; leaving you to enjoy your break respecting your privacy.The space"The space.In relation to Coronavirus (Covid-19) we are committed to Airbnbs Cleaning Protocol. Between guests the log cabin is thoroughly cleaned including the use of a Ultra Low Volume (ULV) fogging machine. This pushes out a disinfectant in a fine mist to cover all surfaces and soft furnishings using a Covid-19 compliant cleaner. Despite restrictions easing in Englandwith high infection rateswe will be continuing with theses strict Covid protocols.Located on the edge of the Royal Forest of Dean and the Wye Valley it is a perfect place to unwind and enjoy the surrounding countrysidelocal citiestowns and attractions.From the warm and cosy open plan living area you can enjoy far-reaching countryside viewsor just relax while watching TV.There is a well-equipped kitchen complete with all the essentials you need to prepare home-cooked meals. Fitted with an electric oven and hobmicrowavefridge (with ice box) and a dishwasher to make the log cabin a real home from home.There is a king-size bedroom with a comfortable brass bedstead bed and plenty of hanging and drawer space. You can enjoy waking up to views of the countryside every morning.A modern shower-room with walk-in showerbasin and WC completes the accommodation.Take a walk on one of the many local footpathsor perhaps visit the town of Newent with its traditional innsrestaurantstea rooms and individual shops.The historic City of Gloucester and Regency Cheltenham are also close by. Visits to the riverside town of Tewkesburythe ‚Äòhoney pot‚Äô towns and villages of The Cotswolds and the Severn Vale are also a must.Make the most of this delightfulromanticunique retreat."

Title: The Water Cabin by the Nor‚ÄìFolk (Norfolk Broads)
Description: The Water Cabin is a recently renovated 1930‚Äôs cedar-clad cabin located on the bank of the River Thurnein the heart of the Broads National Park. It is the ideal retreat for a romantic getaway or family holiday at any time of the year.The spaceThe space.The Water Cabin has two bedrooms (sleeps four) and open plan living roomkitchen and dining room. The bathroom has a large walk-in shower and bath. Outsidethere is a large decked areaa generous sized garden and an adjacent boat dyke with river frontage and moorings. The cabin has river views to the front and countryside views to the rear.Guest access.The Water Cabin is located in the heart of the Norfolk Broadswith boat hirecountry walkscycle routes and nature reserves on our doorstep. Close by is the beach (15 mins)the cathedral city of Norwich (30 mins) and North Norfolk (45 mins).Other things to note.We are located on the river so highly recommend hiring life jackets ‚Äì especially if you have children.Parking for one car is provided close-by but please note the Water Cabin is reached by footvia a concrete path for the last 200-300 meters. We will provide a trolley to easily transport your luggage from your car to the cabin.Unfortunatelybecause of the remote locationnarrow uneven paths and the fact the Water Cabin is a 1930s structurewe‚Äôre unable to offer full disabled access and facilities. If you have any specific questions about the accessibility of the Water Cabinplease contact us to ask ‚Äì we will do our utmost to help.

Title: Peaceful, Relaxing, Great views - Forest of Dean.
Description: The Lodge is newly built and located in the Royal Forest of Deanin our own grounds separate from the main house. It has a spacious lounge / kitchen area. There is a large bedroom with en-suite and super king bed or option of 2 singles. Benefits include a large patio for guests with views across the countryside. Ideal for those who want a relaxing break. There is access to the Forest from the garden gate. Social distancing comes naturally in the woods. Parking is within security gates.The spaceThe space.The Lodge is ideally suited to explore the Forest of Dean with miles of off-road walks and cycle tracks. There are plenty of local places to eat and tourist attractions nearby such as Taurus CraftsPuzzle WoodClear-well Caves and Steam Railways. Gloucester Quays and Chepstow are about 20 miles drive or by train from Lydney Station.Guest access.Guests have their own designated patio and garden area and parking space. The Host‚Äôs garden is out of sight within their acre of grounds and their dogs are kept separate from the guest‚Äôs area.Other things to note.The Lodge also offers respite breaks to carers. We value their commitment and dedication. The Hosts have not received any money from central government for this project. Instead they rely on the generosity of individuals such as yourself who are paying guests. When you staya percentage of money paid subsidises future carers staying at the Lodge experiencing a well deserved peaceful retreat.

Title: Luxury Cottage & Fairytale Garden near Hay-on-Wye
Description: **PRICE IS INCLUSIVE OF 15% AIRBNB FEE AND CLEANING FEES**Nestled between the thriving literary town of Hay-on-Wye and the stunning Black Mountains of Brecon Beacons National Parkthis property with its fairytale garden and babbling brook is the best of both worlds. Spend quality time with family and friends in both town and country. With beautiful walks and outdoor activities aplenty as well as bookshopsgalleries and restaurants just minutes awaythere really is something for everyone.The space"The space.Tucked away in a charming village and surrounded by woodlandWalnut Tree Cottage is a traditional Welsh stone cottage dating from 1881 with a modern extension housing a large master suite and a bright airy kitchen.French doors lead to a fairytale garden bursting with flowersherbs and fruit in the summer. Guests can listen to the babbling brook (which leads to an 8ft waterfall)explore the peaceful woodland and make a pizza in the outdoor oven all year around. Expect to see kingfisherstrout and even otters!The cosy living room - featuring a woodburner - flows into  the reception room and kitchenallowing guests to spend time together or apart. The charming downstairs bedroom sleeps three in single beds under the eaveswith space for a baby in a travel cot  provided upon request. A utility room contains a washer/dryeriron and ironing boarda family-sized fridge and toys for the little ones. Upstairsall three bedrooms feature king-size beds and the large master bedroom benefits from an en-suite bathroom. All beds are made up with 300 thread count hotel quality linen. The cottage has been lovingly decorated to a high specification in a calming palette. The propertywhilst not largeis big on style with furniture and fittings from all over the world.We have tried to think of everything a guest might need from shampoosoapconditioner and body lotion to laundry suppliesphone chargers and stationery so you can spend more time relaxing and less time worrying about the small stuff.A carefully curated selection of books are provided for the book lovers drawn to Hay as well as a range of board games for rainy days.We have amenities catering for families with childrenincluding travel cot with beddinghigh chairchildrens crockerymicrowave bottle steriliserstair gatesbed guardsbaby body wash and toys.There is Wifi throughout the property and a SmartTv including Netflix for rainy days. This property accommodates 7 people comfortably but may be booked to a maximum of 9 people (subject to additional cost)."Guest access.You will have access to the whole cottage. One wardrobe in the master suite and a number of cupboards in the utility room contain our personal belongings and supplies and are locked.There is space for two medium sized cars to park in the drive - howeverthere is a public right of way alongside the drive and must remain unobstructed.Other things to note.Whilst we provide a number of amenities for children this property has stairssharp corners and expensive furnishings - it is not baby or child-proofed and children must be supervised at all times. There is a brook that runs alongside the property and whilst there is not a sudden dropit is unfenced. The brook ends in an 8ft waterfall and though gateda determined child would likely be able to get around it. It is therefore a condition of booking that we ask all guests to accept full responsibility for supervising their children at all times.

Title: The Wendy House a 1960s chalet by the sea
Description: "The Wendy House: a traditional 1960s cedar wood chalet that was renovated in 2017. Beautifully furnished in a luxurious yet Wendy House style. Magical for children. Stuffed full of lovely vintage things. It is situated in a very sunny corner of a quiet family run site10 minutes stroll to the beach. Near great pubsperfect after a beach walk. Warm and cosy. No WiFi have a detox: talkwalkplay gamesre-chargerest..I really do try and make it special for youcome and stay :)"The space"The space.COVID UPDATE.To keep youyour family and myself as safe as possible during this unprecedented time The Wendy House will have to look a little different inside. Following government guidelinesanything that cannot be properly cleaned will be removed from the property. Sadly this will mean toys/games/leaflets etc. A different type of welcome pack will also be left. But please be reassured that when you enter The Wendy House it will be a safe environment for you.The Wendy House is a traditional 1960s chalet stuffed full of vintage and beautiful thingsalongside some wonderful vintage photography of Heacham as a seaside resort in the 50s/60s. The Wendy House is a very peaceful space that allows you to unplug from your busy world - we have no wifi.. allowing you to detox from technologyrecharge your batteries and be mindful of whats out there again..I personally look after The Wendy Housefrom the messages you receiveright down to the cleaning and the laundryI like it this way so I can ensure that when you arrive it is all looking its beautiful best. It is very suitable for familiesfriendscouples and a luxurious base for one..The Wendy House and The Summerhouse can be booked together for bigger group gatherings..I have taken my time renovating this little place which includes a beautiful natural slate floor to the kitchen and shower roomwood effect tiled showershutters to some of the windowsquality pocket sprung king size bed with beautiful bed linen - some pillowcases are gorgeous vintage ones. I have put black out blinds to both bedrooms to aid your sleepand for little ones to sleep..giving you some quiet time!The shower room has a wood effect showerslate floorshutters to the windowsa sink and toiletit also has a large heated towel rail to keep you cosy.The kitchen is equipped with everything you need to make some lovely dinners.with carefully chosen crockery and tableware. I supply a welcome pack of a continental style breakfast to last you a couple of days..Electric fully programmable radiators will keep you warm when it gets chilly. The chalet receives sunshine all dayso you can bask in it whilst reading that book you have always wanted to read! We have a super comfy corner sofa to stretch out on.The veranda has outdoor lighting and very comfortable natural wicker furniture.The chalet is located in the far corner of the siteto the side of the chalet there is a great place for children to make dens..I have included things for a mud kitchen to help them with their adventures. There are a selection of traditional games and family board games.My idea for this little place is to help create a traditional seaside family holidaya quiet sharing space for friendsa romantic retreat for two or a luxurious break for oneall where lovely memories are made..I think it ticks all the boxes.Come and play house at The Wendy House!The Wendy House turns into The Winter Wendy House in October. I dress it with velvet cushionsfur throwswintry bits and lots of candlelight (safe battery operated variety!) making it a very special place to get in the mood for this time of year. Norfolk is particularly beautiful in Autumn and Winter - the roadsbeaches and pubs are very much quieter. The cabin is super cosy with thermostatically controlled electric radiators and the electric stove. Come and get all snugged up!"Guest access.The chalet is all for you..Other things to note.The Wendy House is on a site with other chaletsto get to it there is approximately 100 steps from the parking area to the front door.No dogs are allowed on the site - not my rules :(A basic welcome pack will be providedNo smoking in the chalet please..If you wish to use my highchair please book this PRIOR to your arrival. Sadly due to Covid it is essential to bring your own travel cotI supply towels (not beach towels)tea towelscleaning productsclothshand wash.I will make up the beds that will be usedand a spare pack of linen on top of any beds that are not used.

Title: Beautiful Lakeside Lodge with Hot Tub
Description: Detached 3 bedroom Luxury Holiday Lodge with decking and Hot Tub. Situated on Misty Bay on the water ski lake. The Lodge is in fantastic condition. With double glazing and central heating you are assured a comfortable stay.Our Lodge has a modernopen plan interior with fully equipped kitchen with under counter fridge and under counter freezer. microwavewasherdishwasher. master bedroom has a king size bed and TVen suite. the second bedroom with twin beds and Third with bunk beds.The spaceThe space.This is an ideal location to explore the varied attractions of this part of Lincolnshire from leisure to heritage attractions. From water sports to shoppingthere is something for everyone.Tattershall Lakes Holiday Park you will find jet ski and water ski lakesfishing lakesa adventure playgroundgymswimming pool ,2 restaurants and bars. 2019 arrival of a splash pool and Beach with Sky Bar. All set within 360 acres of park and woodland. Guest entertainment passes can be obtained if you want them at Guest Services once you arriveGuest access.You have full use of club houseswimming pool. And you can book jet skis and water assault course which is great funOther things to note.All towels are not supplied.Club passes are available from office at a minimum cost

Title: Long Thatch Lodge, Old Newton, Suffolk
Description: Set in the peaceful hamlet of Ward Green in the heart of the Suffolk countrysideLong Thatch Lodge is a charming retreat for two people looking for the perfect place to enjoy a relaxing break.The Lodge is a great base to explore Suffolk‚Äôs historic townshousesgardensheritage coastnature reserves and countryside.It offers a cosy and tranquil stay with its own private garden with secluded outdoor seating areas to watch the abundant local wildlife.The space"The space.Guest Reassurance.The lodge is totally separate from our cottage with its own drivewayentrance and garden. Self check-in/out is available enabling you to be totally independent.We follow Airbnb‚Äôs enhanced cleaning protocolwhich was developed with expert guidance. Here are a few highlights:.- sanitise high-touch surfacesdown to the doorknobs.- use cleaners and disinfectants approved by global health agenciesand wear protective gear to help prevent cross-contamination.- clean each room using extensive cleaning checklists.- provide extra cleaning suppliesso you can clean as you stay.Should you need any assistance or further information there is a comprehensive Info Guide inside the lodge as well as contact numbers should you need us!.Downstairs.Front stable door opens onto hallway with pamment brick flooring and steep paddle staircase.Open plan living/dining area and a well equipped modern kitchen (including electric ovenhobfridgemicrowaveLavazza coffee machinetoaster and kettle).Stylish corner sofa with a large flat screen TVDVD playerbluetooth speaker & DAB radio. Dining table with two chairs.Bi-fold doors open onto a sunny decking area with outdoor lightseating along with picnic table/benches overlooking the small orchard and fields beyond. In the living/dining area there is also a wood burning stove making those chillier months much cosier.Upstairs.Comfortable oak-based double bed with deep Tempur mattress which aids independent sleeping. There is space to hang clothes and a chest of drawers as well as a wall-mounted flat screen TV. There is also a retro style desk electric fan for those warm nights.The recently redesigned bathroom has a full walk in showerhand basin with mixer tap and WC.All 100% Egyptian cotton bed linentowels are provided.Heating throughout the lodge is electric (manually adjustable) with constant hot water."Other things to note.Electric heating and hot water is included.Unlimited superfast WiFi available.Wood for log burner provided.Self check in/out using lockbox if required.A small welcome gift is provided as well as filtered waterfresh milkteacoffeesugar.Also provided for use during your visit are: booksdvdsgamespuzzles and jigsaws.

Title: The Home of Happiness Roulotte
Description: Trailer 2 persons.A room with kitchenette,fully equipped with sinkfridgemicrowave and hob..One bedroom 1 double bed 140x190 with linen.provided You will find a bathroom with toiletsink and showerhair dryer and towels.A little rest area with TV.A picnic table is reserved for you and awaits you in the shade of apple trees or on the south-facing terrace.Breakfast 7‚Ç¨/persThe space"The space.We have only one trailer.The outdoor Jacuzzi is entirely dedicated to it.It has running water no dry toilets we are committed to comfort.Theres everything you need to cook and eat indoors or outdoors.We are in the countryside the river nearby everything is gathered to relax.You can wake up and admire the animals around you"

Title: Ash Log Cabin -Sleeps 4 - Hot Tub - in Suffolk
Description: Ash log cabin is a spacious two bedroom lodge perfectly situated within our stunning 120 acres of Country Park at KingfishersCretingham. It is ideal for up to four guests and benefits from having a secluded garden with private hot tub.Guests can enjoy the peace and tranquility offered here at Kingfishers yet have plenty to do both on their doorstep and within a short drive or cycle.1 well behaved pet acceptedThe spaceThe space.Ash log cabin features and open plan living area for all guests to socialise togethera master bedroom with en-suite shower rooma twin bedroom and a family bathroom.From your doorstep you can enjoy a 9 hole parkland golf courserestaurantcafekayak and boat hire and nature trail. Kingfishers really does offer the very best of the Suffolk Countrysidenot a vehicle noise or street lamp in sightyet only 20 minutes from the amazing coastal towns of Aldeburgh and Southwold20 minutes from IpswichStowmarket and Woodbridgeand only 8 minutes to the popular town of FramlinghamGuest access.Parking is outside of the log cabin and there is a key safe next to the door.

Title: Misty's Place in a lovely peaceful setting
Description: "Mistys Place is a well maintained two bedroom lodge with enclosed decking complete with outdoor seating it is secure for dogs and children.Set on Bridlington Links golf course in peaceful surroundings. Just a short walk from Sewerby House gardens and zoo. Included in your package are four adult passes into Sewerby Hall and grounds. East Riding of Yorkshire approximately 28 miles north of Hull & 34 miles east of York."The spaceThe space.Our well presented two bedroom 1.5 bathroom cabin is set in the peaceful woodland setting of Bridlington Links golf and leisure estatenext door to the historic Sewerby Hall just outside the historic harbour town of Bridlington.Mistys Place is a single storey open plan lodge a real home from home.It has a well stocked kitchen even Jamie Oliver would be impressed prepare your food looking out towards the woods you may even see a deer wandering past! Double doors lead out onto the enclosed decking where you can sit on the outdoor furniture and enjoy the peace and quiet while enjoying the ample wildlife.A short stroll takes you to the Bridlington Links golf club / 18 hole golf and leisure Estate prices available in cabin.A side gate in Heritage park takes you into Sewerby hall gardens and zoo remember to use your passes to access all areas included in your package. There is a quaint dog and child friendly cafe.Then either walk along the cliff tops or along the beach into Bridlington or board the land train for a scenic trip into the town of Bridlington.Other places of interest Danes Dyke short drive to Cayton Bay Filey Scarborough and 32 miles from Whitby.The whole cabin is available to guests the lounge has a smart tv complete with Netflix /Amazon and free view/DVD player small selection of films books games available. The master bedroom also has smart tv with Netflix/Amazon. Wi fi available.

Title: Shepherd's Hut, Off-Grid, Hot Tub and Beacons View
Description: "A Tiny Houseoff-grid Shepherds Hut with panoramic views of the spectacular Brecon Beacons. Accessed by its own gated lane and set in a private paddockOliveduck Hut is the perfect retreat for couplesor singles who prefer their own company. An ideal ‚Äòbase camp‚Äô as you explore the National Park and surrounding area. Light a fire and get lazychill out in the hot-tubstar-gaze at the incredible night skiesor just take in the majestic Pen y Fan as you plan (or recover from) your ascent."The space"The space.Inside:.A uniquely designedcarefully crafted and wonderfully cosy Shepherd‚Äôs Hut / Tiny House clad in cedarwith oak-framed double-glazing. The Hut is set in its own paddock about 200 metres from your nearest neighbour (your hosts Tim and Sarah). The floor-to-ceiling picture window looks out to Pen y Fanwhile a side-door takes you to a decked terrace that opens onto rolling pastures and an equally stunning view. The Hut really feels like a miniature home-from-home and is finished to a very high specification: wood burning stoveoak floorvery comfortable double-bedgas oven and hobfridge (with small ice box)sinkTVBluetooth speakertable and chairsand WiFi. Dressing gownsslippersand eco-washing products are all included.Outside:.The paddock‚Äôs parking area and walkways are gravelled. The decking terrace has a table and chairs and a Weber gas BBQ (with grill and hot plate/plancha). The unheated WC/shower room is only 10 metres from the Hut and has a composting toilet and hot shower. Outsideon its rear wallis a large sink with hot and cold running water. There‚Äôs a picnic bench on the grassa bench beneath the tree near the streamand deck chairs. And not forgettinga two-personwood-fired hot-tubthat we‚Äôll fill with water ahead of your arrival.The paddock is located in a grazing field with a turning areaestablished trees and hedgerowsand a stream. Guests are welcome to use this field during their stay.Off-grid:.The Hut‚Äôs electrics are powered by solar energy and a 12v power supply. There are two USB charge points and a car-type 12v socket. Unfortunatelythere‚Äôs no capacity for 240v devices like hair dryers and straightenersbut we‚Äôre happy to charge your laptops for you. The 4G WiFi occasionally dips to 3G. The hobovenshower and BBQ all run on bottled gas.Heating for the Hut and hot tub comes from wood-fired stoves and you‚Äôll have more than enough kindling and seasoned wood to last. A fire pit is available to hire.There‚Äôs hot and cold running water in the shower and outside sink. Please use only the eco-friendly shampooconditionersoap and washing-up liquid provided. Running water is available in the Huts sink. This runs off an electric pump supplied from canisters kept under the sink. It‚Äôs not heatedbut you can fill canisters with hot water from the outside sink if you need to.Other:.You can lock bicycles or motorcycles to the base of the decking area. We can supply a strong chainlock and cover. Please contact us in advance if you need dry secure storage."

Title: Rustic Lodge, Stunning views & star gazing bath
Description: "The log cabin has been created to give our guests a privatepeacefulcosy stay with a rustic feeling of getting away from it all. There are stunning views of Dartmoor from your deckingwhere you can enjoy a glass of wine on the sofasurrounded by fur rugs & pillows.The combination of Beaches and Moorland are beautiful areas to explore with something for everyone!Alternativelylisten to the crackle of the log burner whilst peacefully watching your favourite movies."The spaceThe space.You are situated in a sheltered sunny valley where you can look down on the birds of prey flying around and the lambs chasing each other. It is so very peaceful and relaxing sat on the decking soaking up the view.It is great to get away from it all but in case of rainy daysthere is also a wall mounted TV which has no arealonly TV via the internet so you can enjoy net flicks/amazon prime etc. Occasionally we can have a poor signal due to being so ruralbut most of the time it works fine! There is WIFI in the Log Cabin.The log cabin is a 20minute walk outside the village and quite rural. Take care driving on the lanes as they are quite narrow and challenging at times. Late summer into Autumn is when the farmers cut the hedges which can be frustrating as this reduces the beautiful view. But this is not for long and the peace and tranquillity is still surrounding you.Dogs are very welcome; it is the perfect place for wonderful walks across Dartmoor National Park. The garden should be secure and private for them unless they are small enough to climb through the gate! Please let me know if you are bringing one on your booking. There is a small charge of ¬£10 per stay if you have one or two dogs (if you have more than two dogs I would be grateful if you would contact me first).There is an outdoor bath for twoin a private garden so you can look up at the stars.This is my favourite place but it is not for everyone! This is part of your log cabin and included in the price.There is a hot tub next door which is available occasionallyif my cottage is not booked.Please feel free to ask and if it is available it is ¬£25 for a two hour session. I will only be able to confirm its availability when you have arrived.My guest tell me they are loving the bath and would rather it to the hot tub!"Other things to note.Well behaved Dogs are very welcome. There is a hose and a dog gate to help you keep them clean and dry. If you could bring your own dog beds and keep them off your bed and the sofa I would be most grateful.The double sofa bed is small which is why I have allowed for only one guest but it can fit two. If you want a fourth person to stay it is an extra ¬£10 a night.If you do use the sofa bed I am afraid you cannot use the log burning stove as the bed gets too close - you do not need it for heating as there is a radiator anyway - but it looks and smells lovely if there is just two of you.There is an outside field kitchen under cover which consists of an small oventwo hot plates and a chicken rotisserie (which is amazing!). I am very grateful if you could leave this clean on departure to avoid a cleaning fee. There is a small combination microwave/cooker/grill inside the log cabin too.The bathroom is heated by the sun and has a wonderfully hot shower in an openrusticwet room - it is surprisingly pleasurable! The Eco Loo is a type of waterless toilet that separates urine from solid waste. Urine can is diverted through a flexible pipe to an external soak away area. This is cleaned and made fresh for all my guests and is environmentally friendly.You have your own two person external bath which is hidden away in your private garden with fairy lights and candles - a wonderful experience you simply must try!There is a fire pit that you can sit around in your gardenyou will need to bring your own logs for this. Great for roasting marshmallows and can be used to bbq food but you will need to bring your own charcoal and there is no temperature control so can be challenging..OccasionallyI rent out my cottage next door too."

Title: Chanctonbury View SHEPHERDS HUT with hot tub
Description: "Glamping is a new venture for us here at Gallops Farm Holiday Cottages. We guarantee youll experience the same high standard in our glamping accommodation as our guests staying in our cottages.Peace and tranquillity await you in Chanctonbury Viewour lovingly built Shepherds Hut. Sleeping two gueststhis cosy abode has beautiful far-reaching views across to Chanctonbury Ring.Youll love the luxury of your own hot tub tucked right beside the Shepherds Hut."The spaceThe space.There is an open plan living/kitchen area where you can sit and admire the view. The en-suite bathroom has a relaxing rain shower. The kitchen is well equipped with hobmicrowavefridgekettle and toaster. The living area has a 32inch smart TV.Guest access.Gallops Farm Holiday Cottages is based at Gallops Farm a family working farm. We are situated at the top of Findon Village (Stable Lane). You have the benefit of being able to walk directly off the farm onto the South Downs or down into the villagewithin 20 minutes you will reach a choice of pubs and restaurants in the village.Other things to note.We have been welcoming guests to Gallops Farm Holiday Cottages since 2013. Glamping is a new venture for us and I take pride in ensuring every guest has the best experience during their stay.

Title: The Retreat
Description: Hidden away privately behind electric gatesa truly delightful private parkland style setting of landscape mature gardens with views over open countryside. The Retreat is a perfect place to unwindthe one bedroom cabin boasts a Kitchenette with Cooking Facilities and utensilsa King Size Bed and Shower roomTerrace over looking natural pooland fieldsprivate parking for 2 carsor large vans,.Milk tea & coffee included along with Cereals & Crumpets.Toiletries providedThe spaceThe space.Completely private for adults only and well hidden in a beautiful mature garden with shaped lawns and pathways and a fine variety of superb specimen trees which include Silver BirchSpruceHorse Chestnut and an Oak tree over 400 years old. The village with local Pub within walking distance3 Local churches and beautiful walksideally situated close to Henley-in-Arden & Stratford upon Avon. Close to NEC and Birmingham International Train StationsGuest access.Guests will use a safe box to check inyou are able to Park privately and securely behind electric gatesyou then then have the use of the entire cabin to yourself and are completely isolated.Other things to note.Please note the Retreat is solely for adults only no children or pets.

Title: Cosy log cabin with log burner, bikes and hot tub
Description: The cosy cabin is situated on the edge of the New Forest. Perfect for bike ridingwalking and horse riding. There are many country pubs nearbyBournemouth beach is a 20 minute drive. Mudeford beach is a 15 minute drive where crabbing is popular! Nearby is the New Forest wildlife park and just down the road is Liberty‚Äôs Owl Raptor and reptile centre. Burley is only a 10 minute drive away too where there‚Äôs lots to see and do!The spaceThe space.This space is a handcrafted log cabin made by usit is rustic and authentic. Downstairs is the living areawith a loungewood burner and kitchen area. The bathroom is situated off the lounge. Upstairs is the cosy bedroom. Outside there is a lovely veranda where you can relax in the evening in one of the rocking chairs. In the back garden there are two decking areas. One has a wood fired hot tub on with slouch chairs and a little table. The other decking has outdoor gamesbeanbagsblankets and two bikes for guests to use as they please with helmets also provided. On the grass areathere is a bbq and a small fire pit.Other things to note.The log cabin is for people who enjoy natural environmentswith nature surrounding you. From owls landing on the roof at nightto the red deer running through the back field. This property is located in the National park and is for outdoor people. There will be spidersmothsbutterflies and bees. Anything to do with natureyou are sure to get a glimpse of what life is like living in the countryside.

Title: Romantic hillside hideaway with outstanding views
Description: "A unique and romantic hideawayQuarrymans Cottage is dinner on the roof terrace watching the sunset over Lyme Bay & Charmouthstargazing from the luxury freestanding bathepic views from the double showerreading under the old oak treeBBQs & firepitsleisurely walks to The Anchor at Seatown via Golden Cap or the coastal paththe sound of birdsongthe glimpse of a deercurling up in front of the wood burner in winter. It is a tranquil & heavenly escape from the bustle of daily life."The space"The space.Quarryman‚Äôs Cottage is a beautiful and newly renovated one bedroom cottage that was built in the mid 1800‚Äôs (it had never previously had mains electric or running water).Sitting over 600 feet above sea levelThe Quarrymans Cottage has the most stunning far reaching views of Lyme BayLyme Regis and Charmouth. As an upside down house it makes the most of those views. The open plan living and kitchen area on the top floor opens via French doors onto a large roof terrace in one direction and a paved terrace in the other. The bedroom and large luxury ensuite bathroom are downstairs.It has been thoughtfully designed to create a light and airy property with large window‚Äôs in all rooms and French doors also opening out from the bedroom. It is south west facing guaranteeing you sun all day and the most wonderful sunsets all year round.The cottage is furnished with an eclectic mix of old and new. Beautiful vintage wood furniture bought from local antique markets. Ercol straight back dining chairs sit beside an antique pine tablean old headmasters book cupboard has been loving restored to create a pantry cupboard and an old Teak ships doorfound on Sanna beach in the Scottish Highlands over 35 years ago adorns the wall. Reclaimed pine joists create the floor in the bedroom and upstairsthe original pine boards lovingly restored by the owners. An Oak and powder coated steel spiral staircase from Italy takes you between floors.The roof terrace is furnished with a heavy solid wood table and benches plus a BBQ. There are 2 bulkhead lights which at night illuminate the surrounding tree‚Äôs creating the feeling that you are sitting within them.The kitchen is fully kitted out to a high specification with a dishwasherwashing machinegas hobelectric oven and a gorgeous Belfast sink hidden behind an oak worktop allowing for extra worktop space. It has everything you need to create fabulous home cooked meals if you opt to eat in.The living area has a 2 seater sofaside tabledining table and chairsa beautiful Charnwood wood-burnera large window seata smart TV with built in DVD player and a bluetooth speaker for listening to music.The bedroom has a kingsize solid wood bedhotel quality Egyptian cotton sheets and towelstwo vintage Elm chairs for bedside tablesa large antique trunkchest of drawers and a window seat with cushions and blankets.The large ensuite bathroom has been fitted to a very high standard. A stunning ‚Äòdouble‚Äô shower with far reaching views of Lyme Bay and Charmoutha freestanding bath sits across the corner of the room under both windows allowing for a spot of stargazingthe freestanding sink sits upon a piece of reclaimed sycamore and the lighting hints at a nautical theme with stylish bulkheadsone of which which can also be dimmed allowing for ‚Äòmood lighting‚Äô whilst taking a bath.The garden comprises of various different area‚Äôs. The paved terrace is surrounded by a variety of tree‚Äôs and is a great sun trap. The woodland area under two large Oaks tree‚Äôs is perfect for lazy afternoons in the shade reading. The lawned area gets the sun for the whole of the day is a great spot for sun bathing and of course there is the afore mentioned roof terrace. There are two apple trees which provide a constant supply of fruit in the Autumn.There is currently parking for one car on the lower access level.Heating during the winter is via the woodburner as well as Haverland Wave electric radiators (with thermostat and timers). Winter bookings come with a basket of wood.Well behaved dogs are very welcome."Guest access.Parking for the cottage is on a tarmac area with space for 2 cars and a turning area (shared with guests from the studio). The parking bay for the cottage is in front of the Cedar fence.Other things to note.West Bullen is situated 600 feet above sea level and on a hillside. Access via Verriotts Lane is tight in places. Access via Gibbs Lane is fine. The track leading up to the property is a little rough in places and driving slowly is recommended. The driveway into West Bullen and to the parking area is short and steep.

Title: THE HIDE AWAY "White Rock Ranch
Description: My place is close to RHAYADER and THE ELAN VALLEY also adjoining THE GILFACH NATURE RESERVE. You‚Äôll love my place because of the cozinessthe peacefulness of been able to have the freedom to walk and explore our hills of mid walesstraight from your door.and only 45 mins to visit the seaside of Aberystwth. My place is good for couplessolo adventurersfamilies (with kids)big groupsand furry friends (pets).The spaceThe space.Please note due to covid 19.We have now put in place deep cleaning with a fogging machine in between guestsin all our holiday properties this takes extra time so our check out times are now at 10 am and check in is now at 4pm .Also due to covid 19 we will no longer be putting in bathing and hottub towels just hand and tea towels. ..PLEASE LET ME KNOW IF YOU REQUIRE THE HOT TUB in advance of booking your (URL HIDDEN) due to the high demand on the hot tubsi would need to make sure there is one available for you.. so i must know prior to you booking .and you can pay when you are with us ¬£50 for your entire stay with us The Hide Away Ranch is a unique and very fortunate placeit is situated in 400 acres of magnificent views overlooking the wye valleyit has been stated its like been on "top of the world" it rises up to 1400 ft on the topswith amazing viewswalks and ridesideal for star gazing in the evenings and watching the sun setting over the rolling hillswhile the wildlife is active all around you. You can ramble around the hills at your leisure finding all the sources of the lovely little steams which trickle down through our countryside.where many moons ago the pilgrims would walk to the source of these lovely crystal streamsto collect the so said" holy water" in the pilgrims ampullae. We have been very lucky in finding one .Then to take the water back to heel sick people from their ailments. We are also neighbouring our local nature reservewhich has got nature trials and all the information about our native wildlife in our areathey also do childrens activities if you log on to the Gilfach Nature Reserve. You are welcome to bring your own mountain bikesmotor bikesoff road vehicles where you can go and enjoy the stunning views at your own leisureor if you just want to chill,and sit out on the veranda with your glass of wine!! to watch the magnificent birds and wildlife go about their very busy lives. you are nowalso able to hire a hot tub if you so desired at an extra cost from a little company in our local market townthey come out the day before you arrive set it all up for you to jump in on your arrival .Please note.. the hideaway ranch is situated in the beautifulcountrysidethere is no wi fi and you may find your phone signals are limited in areasbut the best of it is that you only need to go 10 mins down the road and you are back into (URL HIDDEN) you have the best of both worlds..If you find that the dates you require for your breakhave already gone The Hideaway Ranch does have two further sister properties " Hide Away House" Rhayader which has installed . A Red Cedar Wood Far Infared Saunas well as its own log burner and hottub. it sleeps up to 8 people. and also The Hide Away Sunrise Sunset yurt which is also with Airbnb and is situated in the same 400 acre Estate.with its own log burner and hottub***. Sometimes in the winter monthsdue to some of our extreme weather conditions .the water sometimes cuts into our road through no fault of our ownits just surface water coming off our fields. we do maintain our roadbut when the heavens opening we have to wait for them to close .. xx

Title: Jed's Shed - Little Country Houses SS
Description: "A stunningluxury hand crafted cabin with your own private wood fired hot tub and wood burning oven located in the beautiful North Cotswold Countryside. A haven to escape to. During the Summer months Jeds Shed is situated in a secret site location on the edge of Mickleton or Broad Campden -on 21st September it will then move to its Winter location with our 4 other cabins on the main site in MickletonIF BOOKED CHECK OUR OTHER CABINS - Mirts MansionDJs DigsPoppys PadDaisys Den"The spaceThe space.The houses have a cosy double bedroom with bifold doors opening onto a small wooden floating deck- a great chill out area for those balmy Summer days. The micro kitchen houses a small fridge with ice boxdouble gas hob and hot and cold water to the sink. On the covered deck you will find your own double wood fired hot tub (emptied and cleaned between all guests) and a wood burner with oven and grill to cook up a scrumptious supper. A flush toilet is accessed from the deck and a uniqueoutsidehot water bucket style shower provides washing facilities for the Summer months. The cabins are designed to be off grid with solar powered 12v electric for the fridgelighting and charging your electric devices. In the Winter the cabins will be sited on our campsite where a double shower block is available together with an electric socket to run a heater."Other things to note.We only do change overs on a MondayWednesday and Friday - we have a minimum 2 night stay. Sunday night is charged at a nominal fee as we understand a number of people only wish to stay 2 nights howeverif you book Sunday nightthis does mean you dont need to be up and gone for a 10.00 am check out and can enjoy the facilities for as long as you like on the Sunday."

Title: Beautifully Eclectic Cotswold Cabin
Description: "The Old Tailorsbuilt in 1906was called Smith and Hobbsset right in the heart of the quintessential Cotswold village of Woodmancote. An area of outstanding nattural beauty."The spaceThe space.The original timber framed and corrugated iron building totalling 75 m2 has been recently sympathetically restored- th einterior reveals a beautifully designed living space contrasting vintage industrial with contemporary modern designproducing a truly boutique experience.The entire building is yours for your stay. You come in through a small porch where you can hang coatsinto the main space which is double height with large A framed ceiling. Thsi accommodates open plan living with fully equipped kitchen and dining area- everything you need to throw a dinner party- and a cosy nook at the far end with a large sofa and flat screen digital TV - a perfect place to drink coffee and read the papers.In the kitchen area there is a fridgeelectric oven and hobdishwasher and Nespresso coffee machine. Farrow and Ball dark blue colour contrasts with the original short blasted wooden tongue and groove cladding that is a feature throughout. As is the vintage and industrial design and fittings with accents of copper.The original wooden floor has been painted an off white.The bedroom has a king size bedEgyptian cotton beddingsthe softest duvet and electric blanket. Mustard yellow linen blinds and seagrass flooring. A cozy room yet with ample space and quirky lighting.The bathroom equipped with a fantastic copper shower. There is a heated towel rail loo and an original vintage basin.Wifi is fitted throughout the entire space.

Title: 'Juniper' The Cosy Pod
Description: "Choose Juniper our Cosy Pod and you will be greeted with a kingsize bedtable and chairsbespoke furniture and handmade furnishings. You also have an outside gas stove for cooking and a firepit on your private patio. Perfect for a couples romantic getaway all year round.Now including PAYG membership to The China Fleet Country Clubhere you have access to the poolgymsaunasteam room and hot tub. Further details are below."The space"The space.You have all you need for a relaxing breakaway. We provide you with beddingtowels and cooking utensils. Inside you have a kettleplug points and heater. The kingsize bed also features an electric blanket!You have a cooking space outside for use of the gas stovetop.The shared washroom is a short walk away (15 metres) which houses a shower and toilet.We have an onsite spa cabin called The Greenhouse Spa Retreat where you can receive treatments.Walk the stunning 1-acre garden and enjoy relaxing in many of its secluded sitting areas. Your firepit is particularly nice at night after a day of exploring.Visit the China Fleet Country Club with your included PAYG membership.Optional Extras:Aqua Spa and Pool @ China Fleet Country Club (Hot TubSaunaSteam Room25m swimming pool) - ¬£10 per personFitness Suite / Classes @ China Fleet Country Club - ¬£6 per personOnsite Outdoor Barrel Sauna - ¬£12 per couple (30-minute experienceavailable 5pm til 9pm)Fire Wood - ¬£5 (KindlingPaperLogs).**If you would like any optional extras or treatments we require at least 48hrs notice so we can organise it for you. The Onsite Barrel Sauna is shared between our three pods and you book private time slots.****China Fleet Country Club is approximately a 10minute drive from us. This doesnt require any pre-bookingjust take the membership cards and visit their reception. Opening times available online**.TREATMENTS IN OUR SPA WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE FROM 16/5 TO 5/6."Guest access.Located in a beautiful Cornish garden you are directly in nature."Other things to note.We have two other Glamping stays onsite. Wollemia The Peaceful Pod and Redwood The Relaxing Pod!Each glamping stay is located in a secluded and private area of the garden.Please check the availability of our other units if this one is not available!Thank you for booking your Glamping stay with us here.We are grateful that you have chosen our home and garden to relax and unwind in nature.Dan and I have created your Glamping experience to encompass our values living as minimalist vegans. We try to do our part to reduce consumptionwaste and cruelty and would love you to embrace this way of living during your stay.We have designed the retreat as environmentally friendly as possible. From upcycling old materials to installing solar panelsthermal collectors and rainwater harvesting. We recycle and compost and use a completely renewable electricity provider. As our guestswe welcome you to enjoy this lifestyle.The garden is flourishing with natures beauty; you will hear bird song through the treessee bees collecting pollensmell the incredible scented flowersforage to find herbscheck out the veg patch and why not take advantage of garden spa treatments. We also hope you catch a glimpse of the animal wildlife that lives alongside usfrom hedgehogs to frogs and voles.Your pod has no animal products used inside or out so you can relax in the knowledge that everything onsite from cleaning products to the food you eat and skincare range in the spa is cruelty-free and vegan.Everyone is welcome. We would ask politely that you bring only plant-based foods which you are able to cook outside in the garden on the stove provided.We hope you explore and enjoy our way of livingexperience new things whilst nurturing yourself in nature.If you have any questions please do get in touch. We would love to hear from you before your stay to help you have the bestunique experience here with us.Thank you again for booking in at The Greenhouse Spa Retreat.We look forward to welcoming you soon.All the best,Dan and Victoria"

Title: The Hide Out
Description: Set amongst green woods overlooking the south-eastern coast of England sits The Hide Outa self-built shepherds hut inspired haven. The Hide Out comprises a comfortable living spacefully equipped kitchenette with sink and gas hoba wet room come looand one upstairs bedroom to sleep 2. The Hide Out is surrounded by a level decking with outdoor furnitureas well as a BBQ and fire pit. Designed to be an extraordinary hut. The hide out does not have mains power as it runs off 12v battery‚Äôs.The spaceThe space.Designed to be an Extraordinary hut with an Extraordinary experience.Guest access.The Hideout is set on top of a steep hill in the edge of woodland with a full view down the valley below. Parking is above the Hideout further in the wood so their is a small walk down to the hideout from the car park.Other things to note.The Hideout is situated on a working farm so pets must be kept on leads around all livestock.

Title: Luxury romantic couples getaway with hot tub
Description: Family owned one bedroom lodge set in secluded private grounds with mature woodland and tree lined entrance. In a superb location accessed by private electric gatesour lovely cabin has a large deck with a brand new 4 person hot tub.Ideal for romantic couples it is nestled in an area renowned for walking and cycling and is on the edge of the Peak District.The space"The space.Our exceptionally well designed lodge provides everything you need for a cosy holiday in an area of outstanding natural beauty. The largedouble glazed windows offer wonderful viewsmaking it feel as if youre part of the great outdoors. Relax in centrally heated comfort indoorsin the wonderful hot tub outdoorsor mix and match in either summer of winter!The lodge is veryvery privatewith a cosy kitchencomprising a 2 burner induction hoba table top oven and a separate microwave. Theres a spacious living room with electric reclining armchairsa comfortable bedroom and well equipped shower room. The entire lodge is beautifully laid out and equipped and under previous ownership was listed in Hoseasons luxury range. The perfect place to chill throughout the year!"Other things to note.Please note that BBQs are NOT allowed on site.

Title: Stoke Leigh Barn
Description: The property is a self contained oak-framed barn. The Barn is situated just inside the entrance to Leigh Woods National Park and overlooks beautiful open countryside and the woods themselves. The woods boast excellent walking and mountain bike trails.The Barn is a five minute drive/twenty minute walk to Clifton village and a ten minute drive into Bristol city centre and harbour side. There is a bus stop a short walk away with direct links into Bristol city centre / bus / rail links.The spaceThe space.The Barn is open plan and there is a king size oak framed bed. There is a bathroom with a walk in wet room / shower. There is a fully fitted kitchen with fridge / freezer.The Barn has Sky tv including all sports and cinema channels accessible on a 120‚Äù cinema and surround sound. There is Netflix and an Amazon firestick and also a large collection of dvds.Outside there is a large decking area overlooking open fields with a hot tub for guests individual use.The Barn is safe and secure and resides behind Forestry Commission gates which are locked every evening. There is a gate key for guests.Guest access.There is a cinema screen with Sky TV / sports / cinema / surround soundfree WiFi and private use of a large hot tub.Other things to note.Fresh bedding and towels will be provided.Bristol airport is 20 minutes away and there is long stay parking and drop off / pick up on request for a small additional charge.

Title: Ceirw Treehouse high in the canopy & river below
Description: Towering above the River Ceirw is the enchantingromantic and magical Ceirw Treehouse. If you want an incredibly romantic cabin experiencelantern lit under the starry skies for a night or two then this is the place for you. Ideally located within easy reach of Snowdonia National Parkyou can enjoy beautiful waterfallslakes and the Berwyn mountains.The space"The space.Our unique treehouse cabin is sure to provide you with a halcyon escape from everyday busy life.Accommodation is accessed from ground level and from here the real attraction is the balcony where the stunning view boasts an impression of being set high amongst the canopy of trees overlooking the Afon Ceirw (Deer river). After a mornings hikeimagine spending a peaceful and relaxing afternoon here reading a book with a glass of something nice.Ceirw Treehouse is a cosy one room log cabin measuring 9ft x 9ft. It has a comfortable double bed with a 13.5 duvet to keep you cozyelectricityfridge and a two ring hob for a fry up in the morning. 5 star luxury were not as there is no showerhowever there is hot and cold water and a sink and a very clean compost loo.The balcony has chairs with cushions and blanketslanterns provide the atmosphere along with solar fairy lights. Sitting here listening to the sounds of the countryside in the evenings is what it‚Äôs all about.We have an abundance of wildlife including owlsheronspheasantsred kites and buzzards soaring overhead. Our wildlife camera has pictured foxesbadgersmink and otters. You will be surrounded by our own animals too - cheeky nosey Pygmy goatshens and Alan the cockerel.We are trying to do our bit to be as eco as we canour water is from a bore holesolar electricityrecycled rugssustainable cotton beddingeco products and compost loo.We have free ranging hens and our girls produce the best eggs you‚Äôve ever had. If you fancy some for your breakfast we usually have them available and cheaper than the supermarket."

Title: the pod@springwater
Description: "The Pod at Springwater is a uniquehandcrafted property set up amongst the trees. It has two bedrooms: one doublewith a large window and a view into the trees and the smallertwin roomwith offset bunk beds. The living room has a smart tv on a swing out bracket. Theres also a well equipped bathroom with a great shower.Downstairs is accessed through a trapdoor in the floor to the kitchen. Double doors open onto the backyardwhich has an outdoor fireplacepizza oven and bbq."The space"The space.As well as the accomodationguests have full access to the field in front of The Podwith a Willow grove and mowed pathways. Amongst the Willowtheres also a firepitden and rope swing.The Pod at Springwater is a great place to reconnect with nature and is in easy day-tripping distance for many of DevonSomerset and Dorsets highlights.You will also have three pygmy goats as neighbours!"

Title: Oak SPECIAL WINTER OFFERS - Hot tub & Log burner
Description: Situated in a private tranquil woodland in the Snowdonia National Park. The accommodation is approximately 4 miles from the seaside town of Barmouth.Sheep and lambs roam the fields around the pod.The spaceThe space.The pod has a double bed and bedding is provided. There is a small kitchen area which is equipped with a two ring gas hobcrockerycooking utensilscutlerypots and pans and table and chairs. There is no hot water in the kitchen area. We provide a cool box - you may like to bring ice with you.Towels are provided (one bath towel and one hand towel per person). You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.A wood burner and wood is provided.A private w.c./shower is located approximately 10 metres from the pod. Hot water is provided.The glamping site runs off solar power and because of its location there is a very limited phone signal. Please bring a battery pack to charge your mobile phones.The hot tub heats up using wood which is provided free of charge. It is important that you follow the instructions featured in your check in details. Failure to do this and the water will take longer to heat up.Please note that complimentary tea and coffee is provided for your arrival only and oil and salt and pepper are not provided.Two camping chairs are provided.

Title: Ash WINTER RETREAT- Hot tub & Log Bruner
Description: The Ash is located in a peaceful woodland overlooking the amazing snowdonia landscape. Sheep and lambs roam in the fields around the pod.A wood fired hot tub is provided and full instructions are given prior to arrival. Wood is provided.The spaceThe space.The pod has a double bed and bedding is provided.There is a small kitchen area which is equipped with two ring gas hobcrockerycooking utensilscutlerypots and pans and table and chairs. Hot water is provided in the kitchen area. We provide a cool box - you may like to bring ice with you.There is also a wood burner.Towels are provided (one bath towel and one hand towel per person). You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.The pod has its own shower and w.c. Hot water is provided.The pod runs off solar panels and because of its location there is a very limited phone signal. There is a USB point to charge your mobile phones.The hot tub heats up using wood which is provided free of charge. It is important that you follow the instructions featured in your check in details. Failure to do this and the water will take longer to heat up.Please note that complimentary tea and coffee is provided for arrival only and oil and salt and pepper are not provided.Outside seating is provided.

Title: Mountain View Glamping
Description: My Mountain View glamping pod is situated overlooking the Black Mountains at the Southern tip of the Brecon Beacons National Parkoffering the best glamping experience and a true opportunity to experience nature in luxury. Located on a working hill farm guests can find excellent way-marked walks that start right from the door.The outdoor heated hot tub overlooks the mountains and is perfect for either a romantic break or just a well needed escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life.The spaceThe space.Set between the trees inside the pod you will find a self contained kitchenshower roomdining area and a comfy double bed along with satellite TV & DVD player.The pod has underfloor heatinga microwavefridge and all basic requirements including a fire pit and gazebo covered BBQ. Traditional charm and a warm Welsh welcome guaranteed..this is truly glamping at its best!!PLEASE NOTE:The hot tub has recently been upgraded to a fully heated electric one with jets and lights! We feel this is much more relaxing for our guests as they don‚Äôt have to tend the fire..so jump straight in and enjoy!!COVID RULES:Please do not book if you live in an area effected by lockdown restrictions. We are based in Powysso currently have no restrictions.

Title: Crazy Mazy, Peace & Tranquillity in East Yorkshire
Description: Each of our four eco glamping cabins sleeps up to two adults and one child.They have their own cooking facilities and spacious en-suite shower room.A 4 person hot tub is located on the private decking area.We are very happy for you to bring up to two of your furry friends along too!.Freeview TV and free high speed wifi available. Each cabin has a BBQ area. With wonderful view over the Yorkshire Wolds countryside you are sure to ensure a peaceful stay in your own little bit of luxury.The spaceThe space.Crazy Mazy cabin is located on the edge of the plot with open views of the surrounding farmland. Enjoy the view from your personal hot tub or simply relax on the decking or lawn. A BBQ is provided for you to cook your own meals. A perfect stay in wonderful East Yorkshire (with amazing views of the sunrise from your bed!)Guest access.The cabin is for your sole use. There is plenty of parkingif arriving by taxi I would recommend booking this in advance as the area is fairly remote.Other things to note.Highfield Farm is also home to the award winning Yorkshire Wolds Cookery School and also has a 9 bedroom B&B.

Title: The Little Lodge is a cosy luxury hideaway..

Howeverthere are regular bus services from the main A4080 and from the village linking to other transport hubs in BangorLlangefni and Holyhead. Title: Secluded Eco Shepherds Hut with wood fired hot tub
Description: You‚Äôll love my place for its atmosphereuniqueness and secludedidilic location with stunning views over the Devon countryside.It has an air of creativity and lovewith a cosy natural feel.The views overlook forestvalleyand stream. With hot tub it‚Äôs the perfect place to unwind. Dartmoor is a glorious play ground with wild poniesbouldering for climbersrivers and beaches nearby for swimming. Many Neolithic stone circles around. Ashburtona town famous for antiques and fine foods.The space"The space.The hut is off gridso you will have a taste of what living simply and close to nature is likebut still enjoy having the luxury and comfort of my hut. Hopefully youll be inspired and go away with an experience of living off-gridand a greater appreciation for natureand what we take often for granted in this modern and busy world. .The woodwork is beautiful and the whole dwelling is uniquely crafted using only natural paints and materials so as to minimise anything harmful to both the environment and the people living in it.Similarly the washing and cleaning is done with non toxic environmentally friendly products.Do let us know in advance if you would like to use the hot tub so we can prepare it and treat the water with chlorine. We will need to know length of use as we charge ¬£85 for 3 days.The water is not mains but spring water (and can be unpredictable in terms of pressure and consistency)it‚Äôs the farms own naturally sourced water and it is drunk by the familyhowever is is not possible to test water constantly so for this reason I can not say that it is drinking water.Family‚Äôs wanting to stay with kids. Patients will need to take responsibility for their children. There are animals on the farm and areas with machinery and unusual terrine.Dogs should be kept on leads and any mess safely disposed of.But guests will have the benefit of having the entire feild to themselves with little if any interruption.The hut is solar powered and this relies on there being enough sunshine. As such there may be occasional blip in power availability.There are snacks and general food in the cupboard that your welcome to help yourself to during times that COVID guidelines do not stipulate that we are not allowed to. Along with fresh herbs from bay tree or herb pots.If you want any fresh local produceI can put you in contact with the farmer."There is an exclusive private driveleading to the Hut with parking in the bay right in front.Other things to note. The toilets are compost ones and need a small handful of sawdust after use.The shower is attached to the hut itself but positioned out sidewith some screening for extra privacy and to act as a wind barrier.

Title: Secluded rural cottage with hottub near the coast.
Description: The accommodation includes a fully equipped kitchenlog fired hottuben-suite bedroom with comfy kingsize bed. There is a sofa bed in the lounge areasuitable for two small children or one adult. A large secluded gardendecked patio areadriveway and BBQ. Small dogs are welcome at an extra cleaning charge of ¬£25 per stay. The beach is 5 minute drive awaythe local pub is a 2 minute walk. Dealwith its cool boutiques and cafesis a 15 minute drive or 10 minutes on the train.The spaceThe space.Wickets is a newly constructed luxury cottage. Situated at the end of a private country trackopposite the village cricket pitch. (Fixture dates are available if you like to spectate!) With a large secluded garden and log fired Scandi hot tub. The perfect location for local beaches and countryside walks. The accommodation has bi-fold doors out on to gardenWifi and Netflix. Children are welcomea travel cot and high chair are available on request. Dogs are also welcomebut please bring their own bed.Other things to note.Please note that the sofa bed is only suitable for two small children or one adult. The cottage is not really suitable for 4 adults as the bathroom is en-suite to the bedroom.The hot tub is chemical free so will get cloudy after a few uses. If you are staying more than a few days and would like it emptiedre filled and heatedthis will take around 4 hours. So please let us know the day before. You WILL need to know how to light and maintain a fire to use the hot tub.We will light it for you on the day of your arrival. But you will need to keep the fire going once you get here to get the tub hot.(It takes around 3 hours to get to temperature.)We have the village cricket pitch on the other side of the field. They have a licensed barso some social noise can be heard on match days in the summer.

Title: The Lodge at Beacon Fell - Hot tub rural escape
Description: The Lodge at Beacon Fell offers a peaceful and beautiful location set within The Forest of Bowland AONB (Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty).Ideally located to explore the nearby Ribble ValleyLancashire and even the Lake District.Open planlight and modern lodge with amazing views of Beacon Fell and Parlick Fellboth of which are just on our doorstep. A hidden gem. Last year (2021) we added a Wood-burning hot tub to the property which looks out over the views.The space"The space.NEW: Guests can enjoy the luxury of a private log-burning hot tub! Plenty big enough for everyone. Air jetsLED lighting and even drinks holders so you can enjoy the idyllic scenery of the Forest of Bowlandor lie back and watch the stars in this Dark Skies area. Water is changed between every booking. Toasty warm in just 1.5 hours. Fresh robes and provided for all guests.The Lodge is a larch clad2 bedroom accommodation with an open plan living area boasting a pitched ceiling and exposed beams. The main bedroom is king-size and the second bedroom can be configured as either king-size or twinwith space for an extra floor bed or travel cot for a child. An adult camp bed can be provided for use in the main living space.The bathroom is modern and has a shower over the bath. The large industrial style kitchen boasts a fully equipped kitchen with oven and induction hobdishwasher and microwave making cooking up a breakfast or evening meal easy. There‚Äôs also a washing machine for those longer stays.The open plan living area looks out onto the garden and Beacon Fell beyond through an almost fully glazed wall that leads out onto the decking. There‚Äôs also a large reclaimed wood dining table that seats 6 and a comfortable sofa to enjoy watching the smart TVwhich includes the Netflix app. This space is finished off with a cosy log burner for those cold winter nights.The Lodge also boasts a 1000Mbps (1Gbps) fibre internet connectiongiving you the fastest speeds in the country so you won‚Äôt miss out on anything. Of courseif you would prefer to be unreachable we can always turn it off!We wanted The Lodge to have a small carbon footprint so it is incredibly well insulated plus fitted with triple glazed windows and although each room has a programmable electric wall heater we‚Äôre not sure when you will need them! The solar panels on the roof help to heat the hot water and power the appliances so you can enjoy your holiday while helping the environment.The Lodge is set in the grounds of our house whilst still offering the privacy needed to enjoy your holiday as it has its own private enclosed garden. When staying at The Lodge you will have an area of outstanding natural beauty on your doorstep and a public footpath leading from our garden takes you to the summit of Beacon Fell where you can view the whole of the area on a clear day.There are many walks in the area and we are happy to share our favourites with you if required. The country lanes are also a favourite with cyclists so if cycling is your thing then you won‚Äôt be disappointed.Locally you will have the towns of Longridge and Garstang just 15 mins drive away. Both towns offer supermarketsrestaurants and a variety of pubs/bars plus exceptional high street boutique shops where you can experience locally produced foods and gifts. Slightly further afield there are the larger towns of Clitheroe and Lancaster offering even more selection.Being only 15 minutes from the motorway network the Lodge at Beacon Fell is also well placed for visiting the Flyde coastArnside & Silverdalethe Lake District and even the Yorkshire Dales. As hosts we enjoy visiting all of these places and have great local knowledge too so we‚Äôre happy to make recommendations if you want some ideas. There‚Äôs also plenty for the kids to do even on a rainy day!Situated within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and a designated Dark Skies areas. You will need a car to get around.<1 mile to Beacon Fell Country Park.<1 mile to Brock Bottoms picnic site.3 miles to Parlick Fell.11 miles to Longridge Fell5 min drive/20 min walk to nearest pub.15 min drive to local shops and restaurants.15 min drive to M6 junction 32.22 miles to the beach at Lytham.41 miles to Manchester City Centre.50 miles to Manchester Airport""Other things to note.We have a dedicated 1000Mbps fibre internet connection with very good wifi.We provide all logs and kindling for your log-burning Hot Tub. Heating takes just 1-2 hours.If youd like us to pre-warm your hot tub ready for your arrivaljust let us know at time of booking. A fee of ¬£20 is due upon arrival for this service.We provide a starter pack of logs for the log burner stove. More are availableto purchase.There is a 22kW fast EV vehicle charger available. Please let us know at time of booking if you‚Äôd like to use itextra charges apply.We have a BBQ available to use. Please provide your own charcoal and fire lighters and ensure it‚Äôs left clean after use"

Title: Bluebell Pod with wood fired hot tub
Description: Set on a rural glamping sitethe pod is a clever use of space with a side entrance light inside and great views to the outside. It has a kitchenette at one end with a breakfast bar and a bathroom with toiletshower and basin at the other end. The double bed is made up with luxurious bed linen with a dressing tablevanity mirror and wardrobe next to it. Outside there is a large decked area with its own wood-fired hot tub and bbq where you can enjoy views over the water and ancient woodland.The spaceThe space.The glamping site is in a beautiful Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty making it perfect for nature loverswalkers and cyclists.Guest access.Guests can walk or cycle straight from the site to large areas of forestry and past a beautiful lake. Parking is right outside the pod.Other things to note.We are in the process of having Wi Fi accessible in Bluebell butat the momentit is only available in and around the outside of the caf√© on site. We hope to rectify this as soon as possible.The hot tub is a wood burning hot tub which does not use electricity and so does not have a jacuzzi mode. We chose this option as it is more fitting to the area but the main reason was hygiene. The tub is emptieddeep cleaned and refilled between every stay rather than relying on chemicals which electric tubs use to keep the water clean between stays. We hope you enjoy it - it looks great!

Title: A Hidden Gem - Tranquil Barn in the New Forest
Description: The Barn is a delightful studio apartmentsituated next to our family home in the quaint village of BurleyNew Forest.Recently refurbishedthe barn features an open plan livingkitchen and sleeping area with its own private entrance and small outside space with eating area and space for a BBQ.It is a truly fantastic base for you to enjoy what the national park has to offer; including walkingbike ridinghorse ridingor exploring the beaches of the south coast.The spaceThe space.Insidethe barn features a full kitchen which includes an ovenhobmicrowave and tea/coffee making facilities. A choice of eating areas either at the breakfast bar or at the dining area table.There is a comfortable sitting area with Smart TVwireless internet and whole range of DVD‚Äôsbooksboard games - something for every one to enjoy. Our guests can enjoy a cosy reading corner with high back chair and a overhead lamp.There is also a self-contained shower room which features a sinktoilet and freestanding shower.Guest access.LocationThe Barn is located off the open forest around 1km along an unmade forest roadwe regularly grade the track but there are few potholes and we would advise that it is not suitable for low sports cars.There is a separate private gated parking area and entrance.Other things to note.Parents with babies / young children - we have a cot and loads of toys etc which you are welcome to use if you would like to bring your little person to The Barn.Pets.Dogs are welcome at The Barn providing they are small to medium breeds - please contact us to discuss prior to booking if you would like to bring your dog.Apologies but large dog breeds are not suitable due to the size of the indoor and outdoor spaces.Booking and AvailabilityFor ease of use please note that the AIRBNB booking calendar is up to date and accurate.Please use the AIRBNB help section via the booking confirmation to make any amendments or cancellations.Please contact us should you have any questions.

Title: Cosy shepherds hut, hot tub, log burner & Alpacas
Description: "A romantic shepherds hut in a beautiful rural setting with Alpacas for neighbours. Located in the village of Trematon on the outskirts of Saltash also known as the gateway to Cornwall. Plymouth centre is just 30 mins by car.Set in a field you will be able to enjoy the quiet seclusion of the hut and at no extra cost the hot tub will be exclusively for you throughout your stay.Its in close proximity to amazing coastlineDartmoor and Bodmin moorwith an abundance of local walks and footpaths."The space.The Shepherds hut has been built to accommodate your needs for an authentic experience with all mod-cons. The toilet and shower are standard size however the bathroom is small and compact. The kitchen workstation has a sinktwo ring electric hobfridge and a combination microwave and ovenjust enough to get by with the basics.The cabin double bed is snugly tucked away behind curtains with access from one side only. We provide 100% cotton bedding to make your sleeping experience as special as possible.Although there is electric heating provided if you want the more traditional warm and cosy feel there is a cast iron log burner.For your entertainment there is a wall hung TV with an integral DVD player and we have a digital radio for music lovers. There is wifi provided but it can be a bit sketchy sometimes inside the hut.As well as a decorative fence we have planted over 60 trees to provide natural privacy. We also have our own solar power panels to produce locally grown electricity.Along with the compact space there are steep wooden steps up into the hut. You will also need to walk across grassland so sensible shoes are a must. Please contact us if you have any mobility concerns.

Title: Treehouse living
Description: The treehouse at Derrington is a simple space where you can sit among the trees with the stream rippling below and enjoy the peace of the country -side.Other things to note.There‚Äôs a double bedtwin beds on a mezzanine floor for the kids and a log burner to keep you snug and warm. Gas hob/Oven for cooking and a rustic bathroom and nothing else in the way of modern distractions. It‚Äôs a chance to ditch the WiFi and unwind for a whilewondering the woods or sitting out on the decking gazing at the stars or listening to the creatures of the night.Fire pit provided for outdoor cooking with plenty of sticks. Amenities less than a mile away shoppubbutcherstea rooms and garage can be accessed via picturesque route through the woods. Local towns such as BridgnorthLudlowMuch wenlock and Iron bridge are between 15-30 minutes drive.The tree house has been created using recycled materials from the farm and locality.The farm is a traditional mixed farm of sheep and cattlebeen in our family for four generations. You are encouraged to explore the various foot paths in and around the farminformation will be provided at the accommodation of the time of your stay.
