Title: Snowdonia cabin in nature with hot tub
Description: Our secluded cabin is surrounded by ancient oak tree forest and all the wildlife that comes with it. It is so peaceful that you will only hear the river and the birds. Set in 10 acres of our own land for you to explore and easy access to Snowdonia public foothpathsit is perfect for those looking to spend some time in nature. The cabin itself features private hot tubwet roomunderfloor heatinglarge deck with bbqkingsize bedkitchenliving and dining area and a private cinema.The space"The space.*Our cabin is very popular and if it‚Äôs full for your dates we have another equally wonderful place to stay ‚ÄòThe Barn Owl‚Äô. Find it by clicking on our host profile photo*Our cabin is a nature lovers retreat for those looking for an adventure on foot or 2 wheelsor merely an escape from hustle and bustle of everyday life.Its located in the heart of Snowdoniasurrounded by native ancient forest and the wildlife it supportsnothing but the sound of the river and birdsong.After leaving your car at the garagemake the rest of your journey on foota short walk over a bridge by a waterfall and up a tree lined track up towards the cabin.The cabin is a long stones throw from the main house but enjoys complete privacy through its own gate and is hidden amongst trees and shrubs. It comprises large furnished deck complete with hot tubperfect for relaxing in nature and under the stars. Inside there is underfloor heatingkingsize bedfully equipped kitchen & dining areawet room and large comfy couch on which to enjoy a full cinema experience.The cabin is a perfect way to explore this part of Snowdoniathe surrounding area is crisscrossed with walkers paths and bike trailsthere are outdoor pursuits galore from surfing to zip wiring over the slate mines. Snowdon itself is close for more great walkingas is Coed y Brenin for mountain biking and Bala for watersports or simply amble through nearby forestsby beautiful rivers and lakes. On a sunny daythe beautiful white sandy beaches of HarlechBorth y Gest and the Llyn Peninsula are all within a short drive away.Now for the basicswe provide bedding and towelssmall welcome pack (for 3+ nights). Eco-sensitive toiletries are provided which we encourage you to use. The cabin comfortably accommodates 2 adults and a further 2 small children or babies and we can supply travel cotblow up bed and high chair. The cabin has full cinema experience and we have an extensive library for you to choose from. We are both keen walkers and can supply maps or advice on the many local hikes. You can even borrow Jake - our perfect dog - if you promise to take him for a walk!!"

Title: The Pool House
Description: Relax at the Pool House- enjoy the hot tub and swimming pool. Very close to Oxfordideal for sight seeing. Very close to the Cotswolds Cotswold Wild Life ParkBicester VillageBlenheim Palace. Suitable for couples or families with 2 young children. Also ideal for athletes who would like to keep up their fitness.The spaceThe space.Our lovely Pool House is tucked away but near the bustling city of Oxford.After a day of sightseeingshopping or long walks you can relax in the endless fast lane pool.(Heated at 30c 1st April - 31 st October but available for private use all year around ). For the ones with still some energy left you can swim against the pump. The pool has an electric safety coververy easy to use with a turn of a key- ideal for families with young children. Or you can simply relax and unwind in the hot tub. Inside the Pool House you can relax with tvstream your music on the Sonos or have a go at the arcade machine. We have a Nespresso coffee machine for you to enjoy. The Pool House also has a microwave and fridge.Guest access.We have off road parking on our drive wayuse of the pool with an outdoor heated shower and hot tub. The Pool House has a lovely outdoor seated area- ideal for relaxing.Other things to note.You will be staying at the bottom of our garden. There is a fence to ensure your privacy- you will not be over looked. We are a family of four with two friendly dogs. We welcome couples and families but please no hen or stag parties- or any groups who would like to party. Our Pool House is ideal for couples or small families. We will make sure we will greet you when you arrive to make you feel welcome and help you with settling in.Please note this is a non smoking accommodation.

Title: Waterfront apartment with pool.
Description: Beachfront apartment of 50m2 in Arromanches les Bains on the landing beaches. Large private terrace of 120m2 with direct access to the beach . A large living room with open plan kitchen . A master bedroom overlooking the sea with a 140 beda 2nd bedroom with 2 90 beds and a bathroom with a shower.Access to the heated swimming pool from mid-May to mid-October.During the school holidaysrentals are by the week from Saturday to Saturday. Title: Secluded Oak Barn Retreat with Hot Tub & Pool!
Description: Relaxation at The Oak Barn Danbury is inevitable. Surrounded by oak treesthe secluded fenced patio with comfy seatinghot tub and BBQ will allow quiet relaxation after a day exploring the Essex countryside on your doorstep. Insideenjoy a beautiful open plan oak beamed kitchen / living area with all the amenities you could need to enjoy your stay3 luxurious beds and a large bathroom. Being child friendlyfree parking and fast Wifi are a given. A seasonal pool is just an added luxury!The spaceThe space.Welcome to the beautiful Oak Barn in Danbury. 1000 sq ft of lightquietsecluded space for a relaxing get away.Bedroom 1 has a luxurious king size bed with memory foam mattressquality linen and is double aspect looking out over the tree lined garden and horses (when they arn\t on their holidays!).Bedroom 2 has an equally luxurious sprung double mattressquality linen and enjoys views of the horses and National Trust Forest behind.The large bathroom comprises of an overized bath for relaxing after a day exploring picturesque Essexa seperate showertoilet and basin. All amenities such as shampoosoap and toilet paper are provided as would be expected.The open planoak beamed Living/Dining/Kitchen area is light and spacious even for 6 people. The double sofa bed can be made up or left folded for your arrival.The 42" TV in the living area is linked up to a Firestick for App access and live TV.A seperate nook is available for reading or if you need to check the laptop and Wifi signal is strong so you can keep connected!The dining table can be set for 6 and the kitchen is equipped with ovenhobmicrowavefridge (with small freezer)dishwashertoastercoffee machinekettle and all equiptment you need for self catering. A selection of tea and coffee is also provided to get you started.Washing is available at a small fee.Outsidethe barn becomes even more delightful as you can choose to see in the evening on your private patio either from your 6 person hot tub or outside seating area whilst someone BBQ\s for dinner.During the summer months (weather dependent) a private heated outdoor pool is available daily between 9am and 12.30pm unless otherwise agreed.Parking for 2 cars on the shared drive is available.The Oak Barn Danbury is family friendly (2 little boys live on site!)so if there are any specific child requirements please just message me before you come and I will try and accomodate.We hope to see you soon x

Title: Delightful cottage in 15 acres of countryside
Description: The cottage is situated on a private estate with complete solitude in 15 acres of orchards and fields. Guests are able to use our indoor leisure complex of pool and hot tub at no charge. This is on the left of our family house 2 minutes walk from the cottageThe 2 floor cottage has recently been fully renovated and you will find it to be warmwelcoming and decorated and furnished beautifully with full SKY TVSKY Movies and Netflix availableOur family home is very close by if you need usThe space"The space.As you enter the cottage through the pretty front door you come into the integrated shaker kitchen. Turning left you have the lounge diner with a cloakroom adjacent. A neat white staircase in the corner takes you up with no door to the open plan family bedroom with double bed and 2 singles. Adjacent to the bedroom is a shower room and landing with large wardrobe. From the landing is a door which takes you onto a small balcony with staircase that leads to the grounds. The L shaped sofa can double up as a childs bed if you have more than 4 guests. In total the area in the cottage is 750 square feet."Guest access.Private parking space outside the cottageOther things to note.No pets

Title: THE OLD SUNDAY SCHOOL
Description: "The Old Sunday School is in the grounds of a Grade-II listed Georgian rectoryopposite a medieval church. It has been newly converted and refurbished in an open-plan contemporary styleand finished to a very high specification. It has a private entrance and garden and patio area. Guests have access to the hosts seven-acre landscaped garden in an area of outstanding natural beauty. In the summer months [MAY-mid SEPTEMBER] guests will have shared use of the outdoor pool with the owners."The spaceThe space.This is a separate and private propertyand includes a mezzanine-level bedroomfully fitted kitchenbath and shower roomspacious orangerie (with bi-fold windows overlooking the swimming pool)and a double-height open-plan living area (with sofa bed and TV). Private garden and patio. With own front and back doorsand ample parking.Guest access.Guests have full access to the beautiful rectory grounds and the swimming pool [MAY-SEPTEMBER].High-speed broadband and unlimited wi-fi on the property.Other things to note.THE POOL IS HEATED IN THE SUMMER (MAY-SEPTEMBER) and then CLOSED IN THE WINTER (OCTOBER-APRIL).We have 2 dogs (black Labradors)1 cat1 cockerel10 hens and 3 ducks!

Title: The Stables Cottage, hot tub & pool
Description: Charmingsingle-story barn-conversionjust three miles from the historic town of Stratford-upon-Avon with good access into Warwick and Leamington Spa. With shared hot tub and indoor swimming pool. Award winning artisan Farm Shop with caf√©butchers and bakery all on site.Keys are collected using a code for a keybox so this gives you flexibility on arrival and departure times.The spaceThe space.This cottage sleeps four guests and is all ground floor. Two bedrooms; one with king size bedthe other is twin room with two single beds - both have TV & Freeview. Family bathroom / full wet room roll top bathshowerbasinWC. Well equipped kitchen with separate dining area & sitting area. Vaulted ceilings with open timber beams.Outside you have a private decking area and private lawned garden with rattan garden furniture for alfresco dining. Enjoy a walk around our 4 acre grounds or take a pic-nic out and enjoy the stunning views."Guest access.The cottage and its garden are is exclusively for your use.You will share access to the indoor heated pool and the outdoor hot tub with guests in our two other smaller holiday cottages. This will be between 9:00 ‚Äì 18:00 daily. There is a diary planner in the pool house where you can reserve private hourly time slots simply write your nameor cottage namenext to the time you would like to use the facilities."Other things to note.We are really lucky as we have an award winning Farm shop next door. They also do takeaway pizzas and Sunday lunchespicnics etc. We have a great little village shop called Snitterfield Stores and they are open every day with a very good selection.The next closest places to eat are No.19 Restaurant which is 1 mile and The New Inn which is an award winning pub run/owed by the villagers in Norton Lindsey. StratfordWarwickLeamington Spa and Henley in Arden all have a fabulous range of restaurantsso something for everyone. If you dont want to eat out we can recommend other food deliveriesprivate chefs or takeaways.Snitterfield boasts two impressive USGA golf courses within 5 minutes of the village. The Ingon Manor golf club has a 18-hole par 72 championship course. The Stratford Oaks golf club is a welcoming and friendly club with our guests. With lots of other activities in the local area including horse ridingtennisbowlingfishinggliding and cycling. The Monarchs Way runs across the entrance drive giving walkers access to some stunning countryside.

Title: Idyllic, private & unique countryside holiday
Description: Our Granary is a stylishsustainable barn conversion set in idyllic countryside at the end of a quiet country lanesurrounded by a horseshoe of downs and near wonderful beaches. It truly is a picturesque spotand all just 3 hours from London.The Granary has just been renovated from two agricultural buildings. With two comfy bedroomsa large kitchen diner to inspire a great meala lounge with a wood burner and a huge window seat in which to gaze out at the gardencourtyard and the pool.The spaceThe space.Traditionally finished on the outsideour barn is unique on the inside. Stylespaceand light define The Granary - so relaxing and rejuvenating is it herethat many people who stay here with the intention of exploring the Island never leave Manor Bottom. With a private a courtyardyour own pool (unheated)a yoga studio on the groundsa picturesque woodand views from an elevated garden to calm your soulwhy would you need to go further?The two comfortable bedrooms (one with en-suite bathroom) are ideal for a family of four or two couples. The second bedroom can be set up with twin beds or a super king size bed. There is a second bathroom (with wet-room style shower) and we provide pure linen bathrobes for guests to lounge about in comfort.Guest access.An entire house (c80m sq)sole use of swimming pool (unheated)private courtyard and garden. Not overlooked. A small callisthenic gym space (located in the garden of the main house) can be accessed by guests who would like to use it for a yogaPilates or kickboxing workout."Other things to note.The Granary is a perfect choice if you are looking for a comfortablestylish and low carbon footprint holiday.The Granarys underfloor heating and hot water are provided by a heat source heat pump. The solar panels on the roof generate electricity. Additional energy purchased is from 100% renewable sources.The timber for the wood stove comes from own own woodland which is regularly replanted.The charred timber on the outside of the barn comes from reclaimed floorboards. The indoor joinery (wide window seats and some of the furniture) are made with worn and lovingly up-cycled scaffold boards.The remote location at the end of a country lanebordering fields and woodlandmeans that Manor Bottom is an excellent place to see undisturbed wildlife."

Title: The Potting Shed, 5* ‚ù§Ô∏é Luxury escape Cirencester
Description: The Potting Shed is the quintessential 5* Cotswold escape. Following an 18 month restoration completed in May 2019this stone barn conversion is the perfect retreat. Located within the grounds of an elegant Grade II listed Georgian town house on Cecily Hill - voted one of the prettiest streets in Englandthis romantic getaway is accessed by a private stone bridge which leads through through a formal kitchen garden to a stunning private terrace.The space"The space.COVID-19 POTTING SHED UPDATE - Your safety and protection is our top prioritywe are deep cleaning the Potting Shed between visits and have plenty of anti-bacterial wipes and hand wash throughout the property. In addition you are totally isolatedwith your own private entrancesplenty of private outside space and the largest park (Cirencester Park) in the county right on your doorstep to roam around in complete privacy. Further details are listed in our guidebook. Send us a messagewe are here to help!The Potting Shed is a self-contained converted stone barn which occupies 550 sq ft of living space and has a generous 200 sq ft private terrace. This gorgeous hideaway sits in our grounds butwith its own separate entranceit is a very private and quiet cottage.Following an extensive restoration from the ground up in 2018/19we have used local materials and Cotswold craftsmanship to create a retreat that‚Äôs been decorated to a very high standard throughout using beautiful fittingsFarrow and Ball paints and designer fabrics.Upstairs under the eaveswith their original lime-washed oak beams and exposed Cotswold stone wallsare 4 heritage double glazed conservation windowsfitted with black out blinds for the light early mornings. The queen sized (1400) pocket sprung bed with luxurious 400 thread Egyptian cotton pressed linen (Nb. Can also be set up as a twin room) occupies one end of the bedroom while a generous cupboard sits at the other end with a hanging rail and masses of hangers for your clothes and space for your bags. All the upstairs lighting controls are conveniently located next to both sides of the bed. In additionthere is a DAB Roberts radio on the bedside table.Downstairs features a great living space with excellent wifi and underfloor heating installed throughout. There‚Äôs a fully equipped kitchen containing a Nespresso coffee machinedishwasherfridge with ice compartmentgas cookermicrowavekettletoasterwashing machine and masses of kitchen utensilspots and pans‚Ä¶ so if you fancy dining inthere‚Äôs everything you need to create delicious meals while the drop-leaf dining table can be extended from 2 to 4 places.In the cosy living areathere‚Äôs a deep sofa and a 4k TV with access to both Catch-up and Netflix. Finallyfor those chilly eveningsa stylish Chesneys gas fire will keep you lovely and warm and as it‚Äôs operated by remote controlyou need only to lift a finger !The luxurious bathroom is also located downstairs and is equipped with underfloor heating and high end fittings such as a Hanns Grohe showerBurlington taps and natural Bramley bathroom productsall designed for complete indulgence.To ensure your stay is as comfortable as can bewe‚Äôve kitted out the cottage with a fully integrated heating system operated by Nestwhich also controls the underfloor heating. But your safety is vital so we‚Äôve also installed an intelligent AutoMist¬Æ fire suppression system.Outsidethe terrace is perfectly set-up for alfresco drinks and dining and it is there exclusively for your use. There is a shared formal kitchen garden / potagerbordered by a mature hedge which forms the boundary of the shared spacebeyond which the rest of the garden is private. The Gumstool Brook bridge was also rebuilt last year and the iron decorative railings and pillars which we added won the Cirencester 2019 Civic Design award.Checking-inDropping off & ParkingThe Potting Shed is set up for self check-inwith a keypad entry system on the bridge and a key safe by the front door. Unfortunatelywe do not provide parking on sitehowever there is a drop off point at the end of the Gumstool Brook pathwhere guests can unload. Cars can be parked at The Old StationThe BreweryWaterloo or The Beeches car parks; there is also free on-street parking on Barton Lane (subject to availability) just 3 minutes‚Äô walk away. Please be aware Cecily Hill is resident only parking. Alternativelyprivate parking can be arranged for a small charge 5 minutes walk awayincluding a Type 2 EV charge point. For those travelling without a carKemble train station is situated 10 minutes from Cirencester ‚Äì and trains from London take 1hr 20mins.From May until Septemberthe beautiful Cirencester open air swimming poolwith its warm spring-fed wateris open from 7am. It‚Äôs a couple of minutes walk along from the Gumstool Brook bridge so why not go for a refreshing early morning dip!"Guest access.Guests have access to their own private terrace and shared kitchen garden which lead on from the Gumstool Brook bridge. Howeverthe wider gardens of Cecily Hill House are private.Other things to note.We are an active family with children and young fox red labrador. We use the garden throughout the yearso we will be aroundenjoying lifegardening and socialising.

Title: Cosy Wooden Cabin by the Woods
Description: "Spend your days in a cosy timber-framed cabin enveloped by rhododendrons.With a wood-burning stovea garden and terraces youll be sure to have what you need for a relaxing stay. Head out of the garden gate and you‚Äôll enter Ringwood Forest with a cycle trailMoors Valley Country Parka golf course and a lake.A 5min drive will take you to the historic market town of Ringwood. Go east and you‚Äôll hit the beautiful New Forest National Park or head south to the sandy beaches of Bournemouth."The space"The space.The cabin has everything youll need to stay comfortably: a log-burnera fully equipped kitchena modern bathrooma pull-out sofa bedand a TV. Sleeps 4 comfortably (double bed in the attic bedroom and a pull-out sofa bed in the living area).It is particularly suitable for nature loverswith a fireplaceBBQ and garden access for guests to enjoy the open forest air.Note that due to the bedroom being located under an A-line rooftall people may not be able to stand upright upstairs. Howeverthe communal area downstairs is spaciousso movement is not restricted in day-to-day living.We can provide a travel cot and a high chair for infants. Should you want us to make up an extra bedthen you need to add an extra guest when booking so that we know to make up an extra bed.The cabin now has its own private Kirami wood fired hot tub. It is filled with fresh water for each new guest and then heated with firewood. Please contact us for prices.Parking availability for one car.We are dog-friendly!There is a sauna cabin on the property with a small pool which is heated with an air heat pump in the summer months. You can use the pool free of charge. Please speak to us if you would like to book the sauna (log fired)which we charge extra for."

Title: Beautiful converted barn with hot tub & pool
Description: Lovely barn with private hot tub (all year) and heated shared pool (May to Sept). Countryside walks from the barnincluding to one of three excellent pubs. Huge variety of places to visit within a short distance.. Abbeys,Market townsTorsHenges to SmokeriesCider FarmsMoors and Gardens.The spaceThe space.This lovely barn has been sympathetically converted to provide a fabulous holiday home on the edge of the Somerset Levelsless than 1 mile from the traditional town of Langport it provides the perfect retreat for a couple. Walk to one of the three dog friendly local pubs serving great food and local beer and ciderwatch the wildlife along one of the walks across the levels or cycle along the car-free tracks or flat roads. Alternatively travel a short distance to visit one of the many local attractions or market towns. At the end of the day relax in the hot tub or swim in the heated pool in season (up to 28 degrees in summer)snuggle in front of the wood burner or sit under the Cherry tree in the private garden.Set within a perfect spot for touring the beautiful countryside with a wealth of attractions to suit all tasteswithin a short driveincluding LongleatClarks Village at StreetRoman Bath and beaches on the north and south coastline. Enjoy delightful scenery and walks direct from the property and in the evenings visit one of many local excellent dog friendly pubsall serving good food.Leisure facilities: Private hot tub (Available all year)shared outdoorheated swimming pool (May to end of September). Table tennis on request. Outside: field available to exercise dogs with walks straight out. Amenities: ample parking. Bed linen and electric included. Wi-fi available in the barn. Towels provided. Regret no smoking in the property. Location: beach 30 minute driveshop and pubs under 1 mile.Accessed through a separate drivewaythe accommodation is spacious and furnished to a good standard and offers ONE bedroom: double with en-suite shower room and WCplease take care as the bedroom is accessed via a steep open-tread space saver staircasethere is also an external stone staircase which provides access to the bedroom. Lounge/kitchen/diner: downstairs open-plan with TVchromecast and bluetooth sound system woodburner (first basket of logs free)cookerfridge and microwave. Shared utility: with washing machine in outbuilding. Outside: enclosed private garden with hot tubseating and BBQ. Amenities: electric heating included. 2 dogs welcome by arrangement (¬£20 per dog).Other things to note.Please note there is WIFI but it comes from an extended outside so can be a little tricky sometimes.

Title: Three en-suite bedroom cottage with indoor pool
Description: This cottage is like a tardis! Very large en-suite bedroomshuge open plan living areaand large private outdoor courtyard by the fully-equipped kitchen with a barbecue and table for outside eating. Freeview TVApple TV & Wifi and access to private indoor heated swimming pool.Please note: we do not accept bookings with a Saturday check in or out. Please ensure your check out day is either a Friday or Sunday for week long bookings.The spaceThe space.In a quiet locationa very spacious cottage in a quiet courtyard with 3 largeupstairs double bedroomsall with ensuite bathrooms & an open plan kitchenliving room and dining area with fireplaceopening out to a private gravelled courtyard. Dogs welcome.Isolated at the end of a longbumpy drivewaythis very quiet cottage comes with three large bedroomsall three with en-suite bath or shower rooms. It has a spacious open plan kitchendining and living room.Wood burning stove in inglenook fireplace.Private outside space in gravelled courtyardperfect for outside dining in the summer.Very peaceful quiet setting.Ideal for familiesor small parties looking to get up to 8 people together for a (long!) weekend away.There are 2 further single camp beds or a sofa bed available which will allow the cottage to sleep 8.There is 4 hours per day of private access to the indoor heated pool. Times can be arranged in advance of the stay.Please note: if you are booking a bank holiday weekend we require a 3 night minimum booking.Please ensure that you add the correct number of guests to your booking to ensure that the correct price is quoted.In order to prevent food wastagewe only leave welcome food items for guests staying more than one night.

Title: Dotty's Hut at Old Rectory House
Description: Old Rectory House is a grade II listed property with 8 acres of gardens and meadows with stunning coastal and countryside views. We have two luxury shepherd hutsboth with spectacular sea viewswood burner and private hot tub. Alsowe have lovingly renovated our outbuildings to create The Coach Housea large 4 bedroom self-catering guest accommodation. Guests in The Coach House have their own private outdoor swimming poolpool house and hot tub.The space"The space.For the ultimate countryside experience treat yourself to a stay in one of our luxuryoak clad shepherd huts made by the master craftsmen at Blackdown Shepherd Huts. The huts are nestled within our fields with stunning coastal views with our Dexter cattle and Herdwick sheep for neighbours!Dottys Hut has been lovingly handmade in Somerset with amazing attention to detail and the highest quality of finish. Each hut has a log burner for cosy evenings. There is comfortable corner seating with a coffee table which expands into a full dining table. When its time for sleep there is a pull down double bed made up with luxury bed linens. Over the bed you will be greeted with a curved glass skylight for a magical stargazing experience. The bathroom has an electric showerheated towel railmarble sink and flushing toilet. We provide towelshair dryer and complimentary Bramley toiletries. The kitchen area has an lovely oak work topinduction hobfridge/freezer and Belfast sink.  There is a toasterkettle and coffee pot as well as all the utensils and crockery you will need. We provide teacoffeemilksugaroil and salt & pepper to get you started.Each hut is surrounded by its own private garden with a Kadai fire pitgrill and bowl for an immersive outdoor cooking experience. Let the stresses of everyday life fade away while soaking in your own Hikki Bohemen wood fired hot tub. Drink in the breathtaking countryside and sea views by day or luxuriate under the stars by night. All logs are included.BBQ and breakfast packs from our home reared produce are available to purchase as well as in hut meals delivered to your door loving prepared by us!For use during your stay every property has a selection of board gamescardslocal maps and booksas well as a bird watching kit and a fossil hunting kit.Guests are free to explore our stunning grounds which include a walled orchard and a willow tunnel taking you to our croquet lawn. There are peaceful seating areas nestled within the wild flower meadow where you can take in the sea views and enjoy a picnic. In the evening relax around the fire pittoasting marshmallows while star gazing.Access to the huts is by foot and a short walk from the parking area. We are happy to assist with any luggage."

Title: Apple Store with use of Pool, Jacuzzi & Sauna
Description: The Apple Store self catering lodge has been expertly decorated in a French Style. The open plan bedroomliving and dining area includes a Smart TV and WiFi. There is a very comfortable king size bed.The en-suite bathroom has a high specification shower.The seperate well equipped kitchen has an ovenhob and fridge.Situated in the patio areait has its own tables and chairs and is by the swimming pooljacuzzi and sauna.Set in seven acres of gardens and fields of grazing horsesThe spaceThe space.The Apple Store features private use of the indoor heated swimming pooljacuzzisauna and gym.Surrounded by the Cotswolds and Malvern Hillsyet conveniently located close to the historic towns of Cheltenham SpaGloucester and Tewkesbury,.the Apple Store self catering lodge has been expertly decorated in a French Style. The open plan comfortable bedroomliving and dining area includes a Smart TV and WiFi. There is a very comfortable king size bed.The en-suite bathroom has a high specification shower.The seperate well equipped kitchen has an ovenhob and fridge.Enjoy the pleasures of the Cotswolds airrolling countrysidepicturesque villagesour garden and paddocks of grazing horses. The accommodation opens on to the patio with seating and a purpose built barbecue to sit round at the end of the day and relax whilst making plans for the rest of your stay!.Manor Barn is close to ancient sites including Neolithic barrowshill forts and Roman remains. You are near to the Cotswolds Wayso if you like walking you can follow one of the walks from the National Trailwhich can be downloaded from their website. The Malvern Hills are also nearbywhich also provide pleasant walks and spectacular views. The River Severn is also a short walk away.The Cheltenham Festival and Races are world famous.The Cotswold towns and villages with their wild life parkscountry showsindependent shopsmarket stallspubsrestaurantsbarsart galleriestheatres and cinemas are a great attraction.We have maps and can suggest walkstours and places to visit.

Title: Countryside retreat, swimming pool, stunning views
Description: NEW BUILD FOR 2021! A brand-new jewel in the SummerHouse Luxury Holiday Lets crown! A beautiful countryside retreat with access to luxury heated swimming pool with a hot tubsteam room & changing roomsall bookable for fully exclusive use.The complex is a grand house in the middle of the Chew Valley overlooking the stunning Mendip foothills. East Wing has three luxuryen-suite bedroomscomfortably sleeping six people with a sofa bed for two more in our spacious reception room.The space.To the right of the front door is the Sitting Room with ceiling-to-floor windowslargeluxurious sofa with a comfortable bedand a magnificent fireplace. There is a large HDTV with a WiiAndroid TV box and a Blu-Ray player. Skylights stream natural light into the room making it nice and bright. Just off the Sitting Roomthere is a modern kitchenette with a brand new kitchen containing a gas cookerelectric ovenbuilt-in microwaveand a slimline dishwasher.Directly opposite the front door is Wisteriaa super king bedroom with a private shower room. This space also allows access to the shared Laundry Room with a washing machinetumble dryer and an additional dishwasher.Just off the Sitting Room are two luxurious en-suite bedroom. The nearest one is Willow with a super-king beda superb en-suite bathroom containing a freestanding slipper bath and a walk-in shower. The next bedroomMagnoliahas a double bed. Magnolia\s en-suite has a bath and shower.In our grounds you will find a 200-year old converted stablesa Georgian horse washa welland a purpose built swimming pool. The pool complex houses a ten-metre swimming pool with a "Fluvo jet" to exercise againsta hot tub which takes 5 people (at a squeeze) a shower and steam cubiclerobesslippersspa towelshair dryer. The temperature of the pool is 88 ¬∞F / 31 ¬∞ C and the temperature of the hot tub is 101 ¬∞ F / 38 ¬∞ C. Bring your own CDsuse ours or listen to the radio or Bluetooth; feel free to just sit in the pool room to readrelax or meditate. Groups are to book sessions for exclusive use of the pool complex - ask for details. We have personally approved people to offer you MassagesAromatherapy Treatments and Personal Trainer Assessment which can be arranged by yourselves at an extra charge if required.

Title: Garden Cottage, heated indoor  pool,  tennis court
Description: Self contained barn conversionVery spacious lightopen and airy.Totally secluded and peaceful except for the sound of local birds.Private decking area and courtyard with views over 4 acres of private park like gardenscontaining a small private lake and stream.Indoor pool and private tennis court.Huge wood burner and plentiful supply of logsThe space"The space.The Cottage is a fantastic self contained barn conversion.Please note that the driveway is somewhat cambered so may not be suitable for very unstable gueststhough there is parking very close to the Cottage so the amount of walking required to access the building is limited. The cottage is all on one level with no steps internallyThe space is large lightopen and airy but is cosy in colder weather with a huge wood burning stove and highly efficient underfloor heating through out.One bedroom has a king bed and the other a twin and single bed. We can put a temporary bed in the king room for a 6th guest.The hosts live in the main house on site some 30 metres away from the Cottage and are available when required.The Cottage benefits from a private decking area and courtyard and has.gorgeous views over 4 acres of private park like gardenscontaining a small private lake and stream.Please note the following.1. The cottage is directly above a riding menage and occasionally horses may be exercised there-in.2.Please also note that there are steep terraced flower beds immediately below the decking so small children must be supervised at all times.3. The Wifi is good but mobile phone reception in the building is limited. It is however available at the top of the driveway around 100 metres away.Make sure you login to the WiFi as soon as you arrive Mobile phone signal is not existent at the Propety but you can use your mobile plan through WiFi it you switch WiFi calling on on your mobiles.Guests have use of indoor pool and private tennis court which is near the main house but please note the following .1..The pool will be available for your exclusive use at times agreed with the host during your stay. ..times of use are flexible . Please also note that the pool is currently undergoing redecoration after a small leak to the roof so some marks remain visible. There is a plentiful supply of childrens floats and toys. All swimming is undertaken at your own risk!. There is a changing room available in the pool house but note that there may be family members elsewhere in that environment (although the pool will not be shared whilst you are in it).2 Please note that the use of the pool is STRICTLY FOR RECREATIONAL PURPOSES. Any COMMERCIAL USE including filming will only be permitted under separate negotiation3 Please also note that the tennis court is unavailable on Sunday mornings between 10.30 and noon but is otherwise fully accessible.4 Dogs may be accepted subject to prior agreement with the hosts on a case by case basis and subject to an additional charge depending on the size and breed of the dog. This will be payable on arrival Note..we have our own small terrier. All guests dogs will need to be kept indoors or on a lead at all times because fencing is not dog proof !5 Cycles may be available to hire at a rate of ¬£10 per day each subject to separate agreement.6 There is a plentiful supply of DVD s available to suit all agesplus a childrens keyboard and a supply of games. Please note that there is a TV screen with a Chrome cast facility and for playing DVDs only..there are currently no other TV screening services on site at present.7 Please message me about flexibility regarding check in time..I am always happy to help subject to the limitations of cleaning on change over days."Guest access.Guests have access to the barn and decking .The pool and the tennis court are also available ( see separate notes)

Title: The Pool House
Description: Welcome to our unique pool house (more of a spa retreat) set within 18 acres with far reaching views to the South Downs way situated with in a 5 minute car drive or 15 minute walk to the Village of Hurstpierpoint with its shops country pubs award winning restaurants and washbrooks family farm .There is a hot tub sauna and tennis courts for your use exclusively and pool is heated from 1st April - October.Brighton is 9 miles Gatwick is 20 miles ( by arrangement use can leave your car )The spaceThe space.We live next door but the pool house is completely private and we are only a text away if you need anything ,bikes ,tennis rackets available the sportsman‚Äôs pub walkable distance with new eating cabins or Nephur ( Indian takeaway) fish and chips and pizza takeaway and co op all in the village 20 mins walk and the South Downs for hiking on a short drive away

Title: Barn conversion, Henley-on-Thames
Description: A beautiful barn conversion in picturesque Stonor Valley10 mins from Henley-on-Thames. The barn is surrounded by a 5 acre garden shared with our farmhouse and enjoys spectacular views. Use of tennis court & indoor pool.The space"The space.As you enter the barn through tall glass doorsyou come into an open-plan sitting roomwith double height ceiling and a comfortable seating area.To the right and still part of this open plan roomis a dining table that seats up to 12 and a fully equipped kitchen with fridgefreezerovenhob and a dishwasher.Also on the ground floor are two double bedrooms and a bathroom.Upstairsthe barn is made up of two large mezzanine rooms accessed by two staircases flanking the fire place. To the right above the kitchen and dining area is a large family bedroom (described under Accommodation) and to the left on the mezzanine is a Games Roomwith a full sized billiard table.The fire place is a focal point of the open plan living room and is in good working orderlogs will be provided although the barn is centrally heated.There is no washing machine or tumble dryer but a laundry service can be provided at an additional cost by the owner.Accommodation:.This property is advertised for 12it is ideal for that number if shared between two families with children but for an adult group wanting their own space and privacy we would recommend it for a group of 6two in each of the three rooms.There are two single sofa beds (x2 singles) if guests are not couples and want their own bedplease advise if these are required. There is a single bed in Master with one truckle below) and doubles (x 5 across x 3 rooms). Please note there is only one bathroom!The bathroom is spaciouswith loosinkbath and separate wet-room shower and plenty of hot water.The accommodation comprises:x 1 double bedroom that sleeps 3 (1 double bed and a single bedthere is a truckle under this single bed so could work for two children)x 1 double bedroom that sleeps 2 (1 double bed)x 1 family bedroom / childrens room - this is located on the mezzanine level and sleeps 7 (x 3 double beds and one single sofa bed). Please note that this is on a mezzanine and open to the living area belowit is perhaps a consideration for those with young children who are light sleepers and likely to be disturbed by light or noise from the main sitting room below.A travel cot is also available for small infants.In the Games Room there is a further single sofa bed if required.Tennis Court:.This is right next door to the guest house and can be used by guests as they please.Swimming Pool:.The indoor pool is attached to the farmhouse and must be accessed via the housetherefore it will be offered to guests between the hours of 8am and 7pm. Pool towels are provided."Guest access.You will have exclusive access to the converted barn. This will be approached from a shared drive with the farmhouse. You will have full access to the 5 acre garden which is shared with the farmhouse.Parents of small children should be aware that there is a small shallow pond that is a good distance from the barn but is not covered.Plenty of parking is available.Other things to note.Bed linenbath and pool towels will provided by a hire company and charged at cost¬£55 to be left in cash in the provided envelope at depart regardless of group size.No stag partiesor all male group celebrationssorry guys! You are welcome on another occasions. We do not hire the grounds for weddings or larger scale eventsalthough we have accommodated many bridesgrooms and families before and after their big day.

Title: Cotswold stone cottage with use of private pool !
Description: Situated in glorious countryside on a smallholding is Stable cottagesurrounded by our own meadowsbeautiful local walks and rolling countryside. Constructed in local cotswold stone this traditional cottage dates from the 17th century and once was the stable for the cart horses for the farmhouse! We have a small heated outdoor swimming pool available for our guests (1 June-1 Sept) and we accept well behaved dogs.We have a conservatory (ideal for cooler months) and pretty garden.The spaceThe space.Stable cottage sits adjacent to a Jacobean farmhouse with banked wild flower meadows rising above the cottage and lovely views with mixed traditional woodland. It is a nature lovers paradise and the location is peaceful and tranquil.We are passionate about the environment and preserving the countryside.The cottage has two bedrooms (once the old hayloft) and is open plan to some extent to the living area. There is one a double room (en studio) and the other a small twin. It is important to note that access for the twin bedroom is through the double room (see our gallery page) The double room has lovely views of the banked cottage garden whilst the twin bedroom has a velux window. Downstairs we have a cosy living room with woodburning stove and include logs in your rental. We have a well equipped kitchen and downstairs bathroom with bath and overhead shower.The conservatory is ideal for the cooler months and doors open to a cotswold stone patio and steps to the pretty garden and views of the fields adjacent to the farmhouse and surrounding countryside. Guests are welcome to explore our fields but please observe the Countryside code!.Out of season we are very happy to consider short breaks or weekends (min 3 nights) Please send us a message and we will send over a special offer with the correct rates for shorter periods.

Title: Award Winning House, Heated Pool, Sauna, Hot Tub
Description: Architecturally stunning (designed by whiteBOX Architectural firm) and idyllically locatedCopse Road is inspired by the luxury hotels of Londonwith entertaining in mind. ideally situated halfway between the buzzing cities of Bath and Bristol. Sleeping 10 guests across 4.5 bedroomswith a wonderful open plan kitchen/living area and a luxurious heated poolIndoor Saunabeautiful gardens design by Karena Batstone compromising California coolCopse Road is perfect for groups and families.The space"The space.The space was painstakingly designed with hosting and entertaining in mind. Cantilevered glassexpensive finishes Copse road oozes sophistication but doesnt compromise on practicality. The house is clean and modernbut warm and welcomingset in a beautiful garden with its own heated poolsaunaprivate bbqsunken seating areapizza oven.Dogs: Up to 2 well-behaved dogs are welcome at Copse Road at an additional cost of ¬£30 per dog. Please let us know if you will be bringing a dog(s) and we will then revise your booking confirmation.This property can accommodate 12 guests if you also hire our garden studiothis is another room with a king size bed in the gardens of the property. This room is ¬£175 per evening. Please enquire.\uf0fc Sleeps 10 (or 12 if garden studio is also rented).\uf0fc 4 Bathrooms: 1 family bathroom1 ensuite1 downstairs statement toilet & 1 downstairs shower room.\uf0fc Private secure parking for 7 cars.\uf0fc Private walled garden and outdoor kitchen.\uf0fc Heated outdoor swimming pool (Heatedbut struggles in freezing temperatures).\uf0fc Outdoor sunk seating area.\uf0fc Indoor sauna.\uf0fc Pizza oven and outdoor cooking.\uf0fc All bed linenbath towels and tea towels provided.\uf0fc Robes and slippers.\uf0fc Hairdryers.\uf0fc Dining table + seating for 10.\uf0fc Welcome Pack: teacoffeesugar.\uf0fc Kitchen essentials: dishwasher tabletsclothwashing up liquidbin bagskitchen rollbaking foilcling filmsalt + pepper.\uf0fc Bathroom starter pack: hand soaptoilet paper.\uf0fc Heating and hot water via gas/oil central heating with individual thermostat controls.\uf0fc Free Virgin high-speed Wi-Fi.\uf0fc 65‚Äù Flat Screen TV in living areaTV in bedrooms.\uf0fc Dog friendly - maximum 2 dogs.\uf0fc Fully equipped kitchen with toasterkettleutensilscrockerycutleryglassware (champagne flutestumblers and wine and water glasses) cafeti√®rebakewarefood preparation (graterjugsievesaucepansetc).\uf0fc 4 x wall-mounted ovens.\uf0fc Food Steamer.\uf0fc Built in coffee machine.\uf0fc Microwave.\uf0fc Dishwasher.\uf0fc American style fridge.\uf0fc Washer/dryer.\uf0fc Ironing board + iron.\uf0fc Vacuum cleaner.\uf0fc Safety equipment: fire extinguisherfire blanketcarbon monoxide monitorsmoke alarmFirst Aid kit.Situated 20 minutes from Bristol City centre and just 10 minutes from Bath City centre you are able to enjoy barsrestaurants and night life from either city at arms reach. There are Uber and taxi services that run in and out of Bath for around ¬£15. I have created small guest book of some of my favourite bars and restaurants to explore during your stay. No"Guest access.While staying at Copse road you will have full exclusive access to the house and gardens. The property has a large secure driveway for parkingwith secure coded electronic gates.There is a large heated outdoor pool that is available for use. We enforce a strict policy of no use of the pool after 10pm for the safety of our guests. Please noteuse of the pool is to your own risk.Other things to note.We want our guests to enjoy the use of the property and have a memorable time while staying at Copse road. We have a few house rules to note and those are as follows;- No parties of any nature.- No private events.- Strictly no stag dos.- No use of the pool after 10pm.- Please specify the pet before booking.- No groups under 28.- No music after 10pm.- No Unauthorised additional guestsUnfortunately our swimming pool can only be heated to a maximum of 27 degreeswe cannot increase this temperature due to our pool being of domestic liner construction. This is a lovely temperature for swimming all year around.

Title: Deluxe Coach House with pool at Bretforton Manor.
Description: The Coach House forms part of Bretforton Manorwhich has features dating from Tudor times. We only have the one property which is luxurious and spacious for a one bedroomed apartment.Guests have access to our incredible facilities (5 acres of grounds- Walled Gardenan indoor swimming pool and a tennis court). Bretforton is an idyllic village which is a brilliant base to explore the CotswoldsStratford upon AvonOxford.The spaceThe space.There is a large sitting room with two sofas (1 is a double sofa bed). It has fully equipped kitchen/dining room. There is a utility room with a machine and tumble dryer. There is a king size bed in the main bedroom. There is a also a dressing area/place to do hair and make up. The bathroom has a bath/shower and there is a second downstairs WC and basin. WiFi (fast broadband)is and there is desk for working on the mezzanine levelas well as space for a travel cot.Guest access.Guests can access 5 acres of gardens includinga lakepondlots of exotic herbaceous bordersan orchardancient listed stocks and the beautiful Walled Garden where they can eat al fresco or enjoy a sundowner! There is also a private swimming pool (which is open April until end of October) and a tennis court. For an extra charge there are alpaca experienceshire of a Tudor barntours of the house and use of a gym.Other things to note.This is our sole Airbnb property. It sleeps up to 4 (although two would have to sleep on a sofa bed). We don‚Äôt allow children under 12 (accept for young infants).

Title: The Cow Pen Cottage, hot tub & pool
Description: Charactersingle-story barn-conversionjust three miles from the historic town of Stratford-upon-Avon with good access into Warwick and Leamington Spa. With shared hot tub and indoor swimming pool. Award winning artisan Farm Shop with caf√©butchers and bakery all on site.Keys are collected using a code for a keybox so this gives you flexibility on arrival and departure times.The spaceThe space.All ground floor. One double bedroom with king size bedTV & Freeview & en-suite bathroom (down two deep steps) with bathshower overbasinWC & small range of complimentary toiletries. Open plan living area with kitchen with Nespresso machinedining area & sitting area; all with vaultedbeamed ceilings."Guest access.The cottage and its garden are is exclusively for your use.You will share access to the indoor heated pool and the outdoor hot tub with guests in our two other holiday cottages. This will be between 9:00 ‚Äì 18:00 daily. There is a diary planner in the pool house where you can reserve private hourly time slots simply write your nameor cottage namenext to the time you would like to use the facilities."Other things to note.We are really lucky as we have an award winning Farm shop next door. They also do takeaway pizzas and Sunday lunchespicnics etc. We have a great little village shop called Snitterfield Stores and they are open every day with a very good selection.The next closest places to eat are No.19 Restaurant which is 1 mile and The New Inn which is an award winning pub run/owed by the villagers in Norton Lindsey. StratfordWarwickLeamington Spa and Henley in Arden all have a fabulous range of restaurantsso something for everyone. If you dont want to eat out we can recommend other food deliveriesprivate chefs or takeaways.Snitterfield boasts two impressive USGA golf courses within 5 minutes of the village. The Ingon Manor golf club has a 18-hole par 72 championship course. The Stratford Oaks golf club is a welcoming and friendly club with our guests. With lots of other activities in the local area including horse ridingtennisbowlingfishinggliding and cycling. The Monarchs Way runs across the entrance drive giving walkers access to some stunning countryside.

Title: Pool  House with use of the Pool, Jacuzzi & Sauna
Description: The Pool House has been expertly interior designed in a Mediterranean style. This fully equipped accommodation has a separate bedroom with a quality kingsize bedan en suite bathroom and showeropen plan living and dining area and kitchen with a range cooker.The Pool House opens on to the Patio with seating and a purpose built Barbecue. It is very close to the Swimming PoolJacuzzi and Sauna. The bedroom overlooks the large gardengazebo and fields of grazing horses.The spaceThe space.Surrounded by the Cotswold and Malvern Hillsyet conveniently located close to the historic towns of Cheltenham SpaTewkesbury and Gloucesterthis fully equipped accommodation has a separate bedroom with a quality kingsize bedan en suite bathroom and showeropen plan living and dining area and kitchen.The Pool House opens on to the Patio with seating and a purpose built Barbecue. There is a large front garden with a gazebofire pittables and chairs so you can relax whilst making plans for the rest of your stay!.The accommodation features use of an onsite heated Swimming PoolJacuzzi and Sauna.Manor Barn is close the historic towns of TewkesburyCheltenham and Gloucester. Ancient sites including Neolithic barrowshill forts and Roman remains are nearby. We are near to the Cotswold Wayso if you like walking you can follow one of the walks from the National Trailwhich can be downloaded from their website. The Malvern Hills are nearby and provide pleasant walks and spectacular views. The River Severnthe Coombe Nature Reserve and Canal is a short walk away.Guest access.Self-contained accommodation.Swimming poolJacuzzi and Sauna.Gym.Patio.Barbecue.Fire Pit.Gardens.Gated courtyard.Private parking.Bus routes close by.Good train services to and from Cheltenham and Gloucester.

Title: Luxurious barn conversion with stunning views
Description: Our rural retreat is a fabulousrecently renovated barn situated on an organic farm and with stunning views of the Somerset countryside. It is the perfect weekend get away and offers every amenity in a luxurious environment. The barn is Grade II listedand full of character with exposed beamsnatural brick floor and exposed natural stone walls. Imaginative interior design and great attention to detail make this the perfect place to relax in a stunning setting.The spaceThe space.The barn is adjacent to the farmhouse and shares a courtyard. The views are stunning and you might catch a glimpse of the deer and haresred kites and buzzards. There is a pretty garden and a terrace with outdoor table and seating. There is also a swimming pool that may be made available on request. Please note that the pool is only heated between June and September.

Title: The Parlour: Luxury modern barn with private spa
Description: Luxury modern two bedroom stone barn conversion with access to a private spa including heated indoor swimming poolsaunasteam roomgymtennis court and library.Situated on the exclusive gated Wellesley Park estate in DulcoteWellsThe Parlour is the perfect place to explore the charming City of WellsSomersetwith its historic cathedraltwice weekly marketboutique shopsrestaurants and bars as well as the nearby Mendip Hills Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.The space"The space.The Parlour is a newly refurbished luxury modern barn conversion with an open plan living spacesuper fast wifismart TVSonos Beam soundbar and DVD player.The kitchen is fully equipped and has a fridge freezergas hobelectric oven and grillmicrowavekettletoasterdishwasherbreakfast bar and everything you need to cook and serve a family meal. For little onesa highchair is provided as well as kids platescups and cutlery.Upstairsthere are two bedrooms and two bathrooms. The master bedroom is a double with ensuite shower room. The second bedroom can be configured as a double or twin based on preference and there is also a large family bathroom. A travel cot is provided for little ones and can be placed in either room as required. Both bedrooms have stunning countryside views and blackout blinds.The Parlour has underfloor heating throughout and both bathrooms have heated towel rails."Other things to note.All guests must read and respect the estate rules at all times. These are available in both the house and the spa building.There is no life guard at the swimming pool and the spa is not staffed so guests may use these facilities at their own risk. All visitors to the spa must sign in and sign out and a maximum of 4 guests may use the spa during your stay. Guests are not permitted to use the spa facilities after check out.Please only use eco-friendly cleaning products (provided) and no bleach as waste water is treated on site using a septic tank.No petssmokingparties or events.Commercial vehicles and camper vans are not allowed on the estate.The house and garden (including BBQ) must be left in a clean and tidy condition.Any damage to the property or its contents that occur during your stay must be disclosed and paid for.

Title: Ty Bach
Description: A cosycleanwarm and light annexe with its own walled garden. Situated on a beautiful private road a short walk from the historic cobbled streets of Guildford town centre with its numerous boutique shops and quality independent restaurants.Ty Bach is on the edge of the beautiful Surrey Hills (a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty) and the Rivey Wey. It is the perfect destination for walkersmountain bikers and lovers of the outdoors. Dog walking and country pub heaven!The spaceThe space.Ty Bach is a compact but well-designed property. Downstairsthere is an open plan kitchen and living area with french doors leading out to the private walled garden. The dining table seats four comfortably for a delicious meal prepared in the well equipped kitchen. There is also a small but smart shower room with W.C. UpstairsTy Bach has one bedroom with a double bed and plenty of storage. A sofa bed in the kitchen means it is possible to accommodate four people if needed.The property enjoys its own sunny private walled garden complete with bistro table and chairs to make the most of an al fresco lifestyle.Guest access.Whole property including private walled garden.

Title: Cotswolds Lakes, Spa, Pools, Water Sports, Nature
Description: ** Now with access to the onsite Spa facilities **A holiday cottage situated on the 500 acre private nature reservethe Lower Mill Estatehas much to offer during your stay. Perfect for family activity holidays for all generationsor a relaxing break in the countryside. Onsite there is a heated indoor pooltwo heated outdoor poolsplus eco poolfishingsports facilities and lakes on your doorstep plus a luxury onsite Spa.The space"The space.Oakleigh Cottage offers a cosy and contemporary feel featuring an open plan living/dining room with wood burner which opens up through double french doors to the enclosed outside decking area. There is a fully equipped kitchen with a dishwasherfridgefreezer and microwave plus a useful utility room with WC and a washing machine and tumble dryer for your use. Upstairs there are four bedrooms which sleeps up to eight people which includes two master rooms each with en-suite and balconya cosy double room and an adult bunk room and a family bathroom.Technology such as unlimited ultrafast fibre broadband (300 Mbps) is available to use for all your devicesplus there are Smart TVs with complimentary access to NetflixX-box (plus games and films)and Bluetooth speaker are provided.Travel cotstair gatehigh chairbed guardbaby bath seat and toddler feeding utensils are also available. (Please note the cot is a standard travel cot and does not include a full size mattress).Luxury hotel linen plus bath and hand towels are provided for eight people. Please bring your own pool/beach towels and linen for the travel cot if you require it.Essential starter items are provided eg teacoffeesugarmilkdishwasher tabletstea towelstoilet rollcomplimentary toiletries and hand soap. (Please note we do not re-stock these items for you when/if you run out during your stay and there is an onsite store or a local shop near bytheir details are found in our digital guide sent on booking).For the warmer months there is a BBQ with a starter kit on the back decking and during the autumn/winter months woodcoal and fire lighters will be included for the wood burner and if you require more supplies during your stay there is a general store on the estate that sells firewood.The ExperienceLower Mill Estate is situated on a 500 acre nature reserve which includes several lakesinterspersed with walking/cycle paths including the Thames Path which runs past the cottage.Included with the cottage rental there is the free use of an indoor heated pool at the onsite Spatwo further outdoor heated pools (30c) plus an eco pool (two of the outdoor pools are closed Christmas to Easter but the other two heated pools are open all year). There is also two saunassteam roomgymthree tennis courtsastro turftable tennistwo playgrounds and several fishing and sporting lakesall a couple of minutes walk away from the cottage.At the onsite award winning Spa there are also a variety of treatments available (charges apply) for everyone to enjoy including teens and expectant mums so you have the chance to really unwind and relax during your stay.For those who enjoy an active holiday there are varying activities available to enjoy on the water including fishingboatingpaddle boarding and kayaking. All equipment for these water sports (except fishing) and bike hire is available from the Activity Hub located on the estate (charges apply). The Activity Hub also offers lessonsevents and group activities during peak season to include paddle board lessonskayak safaris and yoga.From Mill Lakeopposite the cottageis the start of the children‚Äôs Miss Mouse nature trail and treasure hunt. You are also able to swim in Mill Lake which includes a beach area on the far side which has a gentle slope for paddling.For rainy days or lazy evenings in front of the fire there are a selection of board games and Netflix films available for all ages.The Ballihoo Restaurant and Clubhouse is a few minutes walk away from the cottage and is open for drinksmealstake away and general supplies.For the safety and comfort of our guests we only accept bookings with a maximum of 8 guests (adults or children) plus two infants who sleep in travel cots.We welcome well behaved dogs (no cats) over the age of 24 months - max 2 dogs. Please do let us know on booking if you wish to bring a dog with you adding the number of pets to your booking via the Airbnb guest numbers section. The are some lovely dog walks onsite and the Estate is dog friendly. Please note the Lower Mill Estate is a nature reserve so there is no fencing between each of the properties but there are grassed areas around the cottage. We have details in our digital guide of a dog sitter/walker who is known on the Estate who can help with looking after you dog during your stay should you require it.We do not accept Hen or Stag bookings.If you have any queries about your stay please do get in touchour guests are very important to us. I am currently working a couple of shifts per week volunteering in our local hospital so if I do not respond to your query straight away I will do so as soon as my shift ends. Thank you."Guest access.You will have the whole cottage to yourselves during your stay. You also have access to the private 500 acre nature reserve and Spafor paddle boardingfishingkayakingpicnicscyclingswimming etc. There is parking very near to the cottage for one car and overflow car parks within the gated estate for any other vehicles in your group.Other things to note.We provide a comprehensive digital guide at the time of booking for our guests for the facilities on the Lower Mill Estate and also the local area to help guests start planning their holiday to ensure they make the most of their time away.

Title: Cotswold Poolhouse
Description: "This is a 1960s housesympathetically decorated with original period furniture directly outside is a pool with deckingwhere you can swim and sunbathe."The spaceThe space.The PoolhouseSet in the Cotswold village of Rodboroughthis unique holiday retreat is a five minute walk from Rodborough Commonan area owned by the National Trust and consisting of nearly 300 acres of grassland.The Poolhouse was built in the late 1960‚Äôs in glasstimber and Cotswold stone (reputed to have originated from Prinknash Abbey)It is southwest facing to ensure maximum sun through out the day.The Poolhouse has recently been refurbished to a high standard. The interior has been sympathetically restored to reflect the period it was builtcomprising of mid-century fittingsfurniture and original posters.The house consists of one double bedroom and a shower room. The open plan living space comprises of a kitchen with a breakfast bara dining areaa large setteea TV and DVD playerand a wood-burning stove. There is also a utility room with a washer/dryer.Externally the house consists of a private unheated swimming pool surrounded by cedar deckingseveral seated tables including what was part of an old stone cider press and also a large table near the shade of two ancient apple trees; a perfect place to eat outside or just admire the view. The house is set in grounds shared by the ownerbut is discretely tucked away.The pool will be open from April 1st.Rodborough Commonset in open grassland on the Cotswold escarpmentcommands impressive views of Stroud and the Severn Vale. In the summer cattle roam freeoften wandering across roads. In the rambling 19th century golf course it is not uncommon to see cattle blocking golfers as they try to take shots. To admire the view visit The Lodge pub in the middle of the commonor have an ice cream at Winstones Cotswold Ice Cream factory.In the village of Rodborough is the pub The Prince Albert; a couple of minutes walk from the PoolhouseThe Albert is a busycharacterful pub that has regular music nights with musicians of repute as well as comedy nights.The house is a mile from the small bustling market town of Stroud with its independent shopspubs and caf√©s. Once the industrial centre of the Cotswold‚Äôs and the wool industryit is still very much a working town. There are regular arts and music festivals held here as well as a weekly award winning farmers market.Close by is Tetbury known for its antique shops and 12 miles away is the spa town of Cheltenhamfamous for its racecourse which hosts the annual Gold Cup as well as its many cultural festivals. Gloucesterwith its medieval Cathedral is 10 miles away and the ancient market town of Cirencester is also 10 miles awayNearby is the village of Sladimmortalized by the author Laurie Lee in his novel Cider with Rosieand its pub The Woolpack as well as the villages of BisleyMinchenhampton and Painswickwith its famous churchyard of 99 clipped yew trees. The surrounding Cotswolds‚Äô also has a wealth of houses and gardens open to the public.Walkers can access the famous Cotswold Way102 miles along the Cotswold escarpmentstretching from Chipping Campden to Bath with sweeping views and passing through picturesque villages in Cotswold stone.Further afield the city of Bath and the city of Bristol are both a 45-minute drive away.Transport links: Stroud train station is less than a mile away; there are hourly trains to LondonGloucester and Cheltenham. Paddington is 90 minutes away by train.The house would be ideally suited to a couple. Due to the proximity of the pool to the house it is unsafe for younger childrenand no pets.Guest access.The Poolhouse is set in its own private space within our garden. The main drive is sharedthen the Poolhouse drive branches off. This is where you can park your car.

Title: Hall Farmhouse
Description: "Set in an acre of garden with LARGE OUTDOOR POOLin a picture postcard setting overlooking the village pond. The Grand Design style 120sqm kitchen extension to the rearwith sliding glass wall and level access to the pool and patiomakes this a perfect family holiday venue."The space"The space.SWIMMING POOL: The swimming pool measures 20 x 40 ft. Its depth is between 4ft and 10ft.The pool is open and available from April 1st to October 31stweather permitting and can be heated on request at a charge of ¬£30.00 per day (charges apply for the entirety of the rental period).The pool is not fenced off but has an alarm.The enormous level back garden has a 15ft trampoline and a set of goal posts.The patio area has a mixture of loungers and sunbedsfirepitenormous charcoal BBQ12 seater oak table and chairsping pong table and football table.Please note:.Bedroom 6 is a small downstairs double. We added it in 2022 in response to frequent requests for a downstairs bedroom for guests with limited mobility who find stairs difficult.It is located directly adjacent to the kitchen and has one step down to access."Guest access.All areas of the property are completely private and accessible.

Title: Shepherd's Pye - Luxury Retreat In The New Forest
Description: "Shepherds Pye is a unique1920s Railway Carriage. Rescued from a local farm as a neglected frameit has been lovingly restored by ourselves into a cosymodern retreat on the edge of the New Forest.The hut is set in a secludedprivate spot on our farm overlooking a lake. It is self contained and finished to a high standard; including a comfy double bedheatingmains electrics and a fully equipped kitchen and en-suite bathroomsupplying all you need for rural yet comfortable stay.""The space.We are a family run cattle and sheep farmexplore the farm during your stayuse our well stocked course fishing lakes or make use of our indoor heated swimming poolwhich has just been newly renovated.Due to the huts excellent insulationelectric heater & heated towel railthe hut is cosy all year round and so is perfect for both summer and winter stays.Inside the hut there is:.- A comfy double bed.- Soft bed linen and towels.- A TV/DVD player.- Electric heating & heated towel rail in the bathroom.- Plenty of storage.- Fridge/freezer.- Oven with hob.- A clever pull-out table.- Roberts Revival DAB Digital radio.- Butler sink.- Shower.- Toilet.- Basin.- Fully insulated and triple glazed windows & doors.- Kettle and toaster.- Crockerycutlery and glasses.- Potspans and trays.- Salt & pepperOutside the hut there is:.- Decking area.- Rustic fire bowl: we can provide a bbq arm and a fire basket which includes firelightersmatches and fire logs at an extra cost of ¬£15 (please confirm if you would like the fire basket before you arrive).- Bistro table and chairs for 2.- Sun parasol.- A lake on the huts doorstep.- Beautiful surroundings with neighbours such as sheepcowsducksmoorhengeese and heron!Please notethere is no WIFI as the hut is in a remote location and we feel it is more peaceful without it.Howeverthere is a TV and a Roberts Radio to keep you entertained on rainy days."Guest access.Guests will have their own private lakewhich they are welcome to fish or to just sitrelax and enjoy the picturesque surroundings. You are also invited to explore the farmand use the indoor heated swimming pool which is just a short walk from the hut. The pool has recently been newly renovated.Privatehourly swimming sessions in the swimming pool are bookable when you arrive.The laundry room is shared with the guests in the self catering barns."Other things to note.Dogs are welcomebut please note there is an extra charge of ¬£15 if bringing dogs. Please also read my house rules before booking.Please note that the hut is located in a field away from the main farm buildings and swimming pool (a short walk of no more than 5 minutes). There is also a small step onto the the decking and another step into the hut. It is therefore probably not suitable for the elderly.We also have Cottage Pye & Bramble Pye; two luxury barn conversions suitable for larger groups (each sleeping 6-8 adults plus infants)as well as four other cottages available for staysplease see our website pyesmead farm for more info or visit us on insta; pyes_holiday_cottagesTakeaways unfortunately dont deliver to usbut you can have supermarket deliveries. There is a local shop close byas well as a farm shop selling grocerieslocally produced meatsbread and cakes.If you dont fancy cooking the local shop sells ‚Äòcook‚Äô high quality frozen meals which are designed to be just like homemade food.If you fancy eating out there is a great selection of pubs and restaurants nearbythe ones we recommend are listed in the welcome pack in the hut."

Title: Deauville Paradise
Description: This fully renovated two-storey apartment with Scandinavian decor is just a few minutes from Deauville Casino and from the promenade des Planches (1.5 km).A large equiped terrace with a unique view of the sea.The apartment is perfectly equipped: tvwashing machinedishwashertoastercoffee machineironing boardterrasse with see viewaccess to indoor swimming-pool.The spaceThe space.The apartement was recently renovated and has a beautiful view over Deauville and sea. The terrace is large and well equiped. Guest has access to private indoor swimming pool and jacuzzi.Guest access.The whole flat is at the disposal of guest.Other things to note.During the stay a very attentive caretaker will look after guests.Licence numberLicence number.1422000027008

Title: Countryside retreat, swimming pool, stunning views
Description: "Part of the SummerHouse Luxury Holiday Lets complexOld Stables is a grand house in the middle of the Chew Valley overlooking the stunning Mendip foothills. Old Stables boast use of a heated indoor swimming pool with a hot tubsteam room & changing rooms. There are four lux bedroomsthree are en-suitecomfortably sleeping eight people with additional small pull-out beds for threeplus a pair of sofa beds for four more in our spacious reception rooms. Pictures dont do Old Stables justice!"The space.To the left of the front door are two reception roomsthe breathtaking Garden Room with a Knowle sofabeda chaise longuea pair of sofasa pair of round tables and a highly polishedVictorian sideboard. The spacious Sitting Room has a pair of sofasof which one is a sofabed. There is a large 4K TV with a PlaystationAndroid TV box and a Blu-Ray player. Both rooms have French doors that leads to the garden.Opposite the front door is a flight of stairs taking you to 3 luxury en-suite bedrooms. The largest is Chestnut - a super-king bed with a bijou pull-out bedwith a superb bathroom containing a freestanding slipper bathwalk-in shower and his .\ hers basins. The next largestOakhas a super-king bed with a bijou pull-out bed. Oak\s en-suite is a shower room. The cosy Silver Birch has a double bed and the en-suite has a freestanding bath and a separate shower.Going to the right of the front door leads you to Damsona small bedroom with full size bunk-beds and a bijou pull-out bed. There is access to a downstairs washroom.The kitchen is extremely large with hand-made wooden unitsgranite worktopslate floora 7 burner Smeg rangea dishwasher and a wooden dining table that comfortably seats 8. There is additional seating around the central island that seats 8 more. There are French doors leading to the patio overlooking the landscaped garden. The kitchen also leads to the shared laundry room which has a pair of washing machinesa pair of dryers and an additional dishwasher for those large parties!In our grounds you will find a 200-year old converted stablesa Georgian horse washa welland a purpose built swimming pool. The pool complex houses a ten-metre swimming pool with a "Fluvo jet" to exercise againsta hot tub which takes 5 people (at a squeeze) a shower and steam cubiclerobesslippersspa towelshair dryer. The temperature of the pool is 88 ¬∞F / 31 ¬∞ C and the temperature of the hot tub is 101 ¬∞ F / 38 ¬∞ C. Bring your own CDsuse ours or listen to the radio or Bluetooth; feel free to just sit in the pool room to readrelax or meditate. Groups are to book sessions for exclusive use of the pool complex - ask for details. We have personally approved people to offer you MassagesAromatherapy Treatments and Personal Trainer Assessment which can be arranged by yourselves at an extra charge if required.Other things to note.Please note that we do 7 night stays from Fridays to Fridays all year roundbookable on Airbnbhowever between November to Marchinclusivewe offer stays of 3 nightsFridays to Mondaysand 4 nightsMondays to Fridays. Please contact us directly to book this.Alsoplease note that the Garden Room does not have curtainsand has ceiling-to-floor windows on 3 wallsso privacy would be at a minimum.

Title: Little House at Ashculme
Description: Very nice little self catering chalet house for holidays in the Blackdown Hills. On the picturesque grounds of a westcountry smallholding with a swimming pool.The spaceThe space.Real peace and quiet but easy to get to.Guest access.Enjoy the use of the grounds around and look at the stars at night.Other things to note.We are happy to try and accomodate people and are flexible in arrival times

Title: 3 Bedroom House, Decked Garden with Swimming Pool!
Description: This listing is JerseyUKnot New JerseyUSA.Set in a quiet private residential estatewith St.Helier town centre 10 mins by car or 20/25 minutes walk. A shoppharmacy is 2 minsand a large supermarket 3 mins by carwhich has an atm outside.Bus stop situated across the roadwith nearest beach is only 5 mins by car. 10 mins to the Eastis the scenic Castle harbour village of Gorey. There is 9 hole golf course just 2 mins away with a driving rangetennis courts and a restaurant/bar.The spaceThe space.The House has its own private entrancewith parking for 2 cars. There are 3 bedrooms all with free standing wardrobes2 have double beds and the other with 1 single bed.There is a separate lounge with 2 sofascoffee table and a smart digital TVincluding Netflix.The kitchen has a table for 5 peopletea and coffee making facilitiesfridgemicrowaveovenstove and toaster. Cutlery and crockery are also provided. There is a freezer in the garage.There are two bathroomsone downstairs with basinand other upstairs with power shower (optional rain shower head setting) and seat.Hidden awayand perfect for Kidsis a Snug room. This has a chairbean bags and tv (freeview).The non slip decked back garden has the swimming pool*which is 3 to 4 feet in depth throughoutand has a great swim against jet.*The swimming pool is "Air Heated" using an external electrical air conduction heater so only available for use April (weather dependent) but May to September is normally fine (please note: this is completely weather dependent).Free wifi provided throughout the living space.
