Title: Under the Walnut Tree Shepherds Hut with Hot Tub
Description: Under the Walnut Tree is a beautiful shepherd‚Äôs hut in a fabulously romantic setting with far-reaching views down the Painswick Valley. The bright and lighthut sleeps two in an elevated double bed and has a well-equipped kitchenettea dining tablelog burnerand ensuite shower room with a toilet. Guests have their own south-facing garden with a wood-fired hot tubfirepitarmchairsBBQpicnic tableand the seasonal use of a spring-fedheated swimming pool and garden room.The spaceThe space.Insideevery amenity has been thought of and cleverly designed to fit tidily awayproviding a stylish and welcoming space for guests to escape to. The sleeping area has a double bed (6‚Äô2‚Äù x 4‚Äô6‚Äù) on a raised platformwith LED candles lining the mantle above the curtains. There is a step to easily access the bed and storage underneath it.The dining area has a large pull-out table with a bench seat on either side and a view up the main garden and down the Painswick Valley. The kitchen area is equipped with everything guests need to cook simply but wellwith a double gas hoba sink (under a wooden work top) and an electric cooler box. Box. The cool box is situated under the bench opposite the door. The super-efficient cool box is provided with ice blocks that can be changed upon requestwhich usually last up to three days. On chilly days and eveningslight the little woodburner and enjoy the cosy ambiance. Next to the kitchen area is a compact shower room with a cubicle shower and toilet.Under the Walnut Tree is set in a private area of the owner‚Äôs delightful garden. Follow a steppingstone path past the swimming pool terrace‚Äôs stone pillars (entwined with roses in the summertime)to your own south-facing gardenwith magnificent views down the Painswick Valley. Guests have use of a spring-waterwood-fired hot tubcharcoal BBQfire pitpicnic tableand two armchairs. At the front door are two large planters full of fragrant flowers and herbs. Sit back and watch the local wildlifeincluding ravenskestrelsdeer and the occasional badger. Guests can also use the summer house at the bottom of the pergolaa delightful place in the cool on hot summer days. There is also a mini fridge/freezer in this summer house for guests exclusive use.Guests may use the owner‚Äôs swimming poolwhich is spring fed and heated and in the most idyllic of settings. The pool is adjacent to the shepherd hut‚Äôs garden and sun loungers are provided poolsidemaking it a fabulous place to relax. The use of the swimming pool is seasonalwith the season running from early summer to mid-autumn but varying from year-to-year - with the start entirely dependent on the date the last walnut tree fronds drops off and warm nights to maintain the day‚Äôs gain in temperature. If use of the pool is essential for your stayplease enquire if it‚Äôs open before booking.FACILITIES\uf0fc Sleeps 2 in a raisedstandard double bed (6‚Äô2‚Äù x 4‚Äô6‚Äù).\uf0fc 1 ensuite shower room with cabinet shower and toilet.\uf0fc Hot tub: wood fired and spring fed (first night‚Äôs fuel provided) - extrakiln-driedForest Stewardship Council (FSC)-certified wood can be purchased from the owner for ¬£6 per box.\uf0fc Parking for 2 cars (privatesecure driveway).\uf0fc Privatesouth-facing garden area with far-reaching views.\uf0fc Spring-fedheatedoutdoor swimming pool with terrace and sun loungers ‚Äì seasonal use only (shared with owners).\uf0fc Wood burner ‚Äì logs and kindling supplied.\uf0fc Solar powered garden lighting.\uf0fc Gas cooking and electric hot water; indoor power point.\uf0fc Free Wi-Fi ‚Äì available in garden area only.\uf0fc Kitchenette with twin gas hobkettleutensilscrockerycutleryglassware (champagne flutestumblers and wine and water glasses) cafetierebakewarefood preparation (graterjugsieve)saucepansbread binkitchen foilkitchen paper.\uf0fc Cool box: largeEsky cooler box with pre-frozen ice blocks provided.\uf0fc Fridge-freezer (in Garden Room).\uf0fc Bed linenbath towelsbath robes and tea towels.\uf0fc Kitchen starter consumables: teabagsfresh and instant coffeesugarfresh milkolive oiland balsamic vinegar.\uf0fc Complimentary breakfast hamper available (usually contains milk bread butter eggs and bacon but can be changed to suit dietary requirements) ‚Äì please request when booking.\uf0fc Cleaning starter pack: brushclothwashing up liquidbin bags.\uf0fc Shower room essentials: hand soaptoilet papershampooshower gel.\uf0fc Fire pit (first logs provided) - extrakiln-dried Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) certified wood available to purchase from owner (¬£6 per box).\uf0fc Garden furniture: picnic table and two armchairs.\uf0fc BBQ (charcoal) and utensils ‚Äì initial supply of instant lighting charcoal provided.\uf0fc Garden Room: open-sidedstone-built room near the hut with fridge-freezer and seating (available during the late spring/summer months).\uf0fc Games: Board gamecardsScrabble.\uf0fc Safety equipment: fire extinguisherfire blanketcarbon monoxide monitorsmoke alarmFirst Aid kit."Guest access.Guests have full access to the shepherds hutgarden and hot tuband seasonal access to the outdoor swimming pool and garden room with fridge-freezer. The use of the swimming pool is seasonalwith the season running from early summer to early autumn but varying from year-to-year and with the start entirely dependent on the date the last walnut tree fronds drops off and ambient night-time temperatures. If use of the pool is essential for your stayplease enquire if it‚Äôs open before booking."Other things to note.The use of the swimming pool is seasonalwith the season running from early summer to early autumn but varying from year-to-year and with the start entirely dependent on the date the last walnut tree fronds drops off and ambient night-time temperatures. If use of the pool is essential for your stayplease enquire if it‚Äôs open before booking.The owners have threefriendly dogs who may come out to greet you when you park.Wood: Guests are provided with sufficient wood for the wood burner for the duration of their stay. (The wood burner‚Äôs logs are specifically for the burnerplease do not use them in the firepit). A one-night supply of logs for the firepit is also provided. Extrakiln-driedForest Stewardship Council (FSC)-certified wood for the firepit can be purchased from the owner for ¬£6 per box. The wood is provided in a recyclable cardboard box (rather than the plastic netting used by supermarkets/garden centres).Hot tub: wood fired and spring fed (first night‚Äôs fuel provided) - extrakiln-driedForest Stewardship Council (FSC)-certified wood can be purchased from the owner for ¬£6 per box. No use of the hot tub after dark or after 10pmwhichever is firstor before 10am.Please note that additional guests above the maximum capacity are not permitted to stay overnight.

Title: Romantic Secluded Cottage
Description: A stunning cottage standing in its own grounds in the heart of the Wiltshire countryside with access to amazing walks right outside your front door. Wonderful countrysidegreat local pubs all within easy reach. Enormous comfy bed with ensuite makes this cottage a truly romantic get away. Small private garden with garden chairs where you sit out and enjoy the stunning views.The spaceThe space.You can enjoy the features of this truly splendid cottagewith separate dining roomsitting room with large TV and kitchen which is small but well equipped with quality cooking equipment but please note no dishwasher. The bedroom is large and has 6ft comfy bed with cotton sheets. The ensuite bathroom has a very large bath with a shower above it. You will be provided with bath robesbath towelshand towels and flannels. The cottage has a contemporary feel yet retaining the original features.Sorry no petsGuest access.The entire cottage is yours. There is no over looking and it is completely secluded.Other things to note.Swimming pool is closed from October till May.

Title: Rural Getaway ‚ÄúStaycation‚Äù Bliss
Description: The "Party Barn" is a recently converted addition next door to our rural home. It is immaculately furnished and is self contained with the use of a swimming pool and beautiful terraced area from June to September. It has one twin room and a double mezzanine space sleeping up to 4 adults or 2 adults and 2 children. The kitchen is open plan to a living /dining area. The market towns of Marlborough and Hungerford are nearby with Winchester and Salisbury withing easy reach.The spaceThe space.The barn is light and airy and stands within a pretty cottage garden overlooking our fields. The swimming pool area and terrace outside is secluded.

Title: Hamlet of converted barns with shared indoor pool.
Description: COVID-19 UPDATE: Indoor facilities (snooker room and games room) open. Swimming pool open and on a rota system with all properties on the Estate. Sorry - no pets. Stancombe is a small hamlet of several converted stone barns that now consist of about 15 properties set within 20 acres of idyllic Devon valley in the heart of the beautiful South Hams. Snowdrop is positioned on the 1st floor of the Tythe Barn.The spaceThe space.This area is best known for its peaceful rolling countrysideoutstanding coastal walks and beautiful beaches. The original stone buildings of the Stancombe Estate have been converted into holiday accommodation. There are eight stone-built properties that make up the converted Tythe Barn as well as several other properties on the Estate. Snowdrop is on the first floor of the Tythe Barn has one double bedroom and one twin bedroom. There is also room for a fold-up bed or cot in the twin room.Guest access.All shared outside areas.Other things to note.10% discount for 7 night stays. Sorry no pets.

Title: Footmans  - Outdoor Recovery Spa Available to Book
Description: Originally part of the servants quarters to West Housethis part of the North Wing has been made into a comfortable studio flat with kitchen and beautiful en-suite bathroom including roll top bath and walk in shower. There is a further Air BnB flat opposite and another beneath. Access is up a stairs. With an on-site quirky cafe; gym; beauty parlour and animals this is an unusual place to stay with plenty going on and choices of places to visit and things to do.The spaceThe space.West House is set on the edge of Chilton Polden on the Polden Hills between Street and Bridgwater and overlooking the Somerset Levels towards the Mendip Hills. The main house is of Gothic Victorian style with a beautiful old Coach House set behind the house and plenty of other quirky buildings around. We have lots of animals on site here - sheep and lambs; Barry (our Saddleback pig); cats and dogs; chickens; alpacastwo naughty pygmy goats called Murph and Cindyour two Red Deer called Saffron and OG; two larger goats called Bruno and Clover; horses and currently a donkey called Patch. You may well see some of these during your visit!We also have a gym on site - The Goat Shed (home of CrossFit Wyvern); we are primarily a weight lifting and conditioning gym but offer open gym sessions and CrossFit classes; PT is also available. Our Outdoor Recovery Spa is linked to our gym and is available to book (at additional cost) (hot tub; sauna and pool for cold water swimming in the winter; heated in the summer; closed Christmas Day and Boxing Day). We do offer an exclusive option or hourly slots (limited availability) with limited numbers. You are very welcome to make use of the facilities - just go to CrossFitwyvern.com to book the gym or westhouse21.com for booking the spa or for more information on the site here.A chiropractor works part of the week from our gym plus sports therapists (please ask for details).Have you ever wanted to try Alpaca Trekking? Somerset Alpacas is based here at West House so if you want to learn more about these fascinating animals plus other rare breeds and try your hand at trekking with them go to fb Somerset Alpaca Trekking and send Sue a message!You will find a pint of milk in your room when you arrive; this is from our Milk From the Moor milk station in the old Donkey Barn just across from Js Bistro; you can also buy some real local farm milk from here to take home or sample one of the many delicious milk shakes. Yummy milk from a local herd of cows grazed on Somerset grass with minimal food miles.In addition there is a beauty parlour offering a range of treatments "The Parlour" and also Salon V hair salon. Somerset Silver designs and makes silver jewellery on site here which is also on sale.Visit Js Bistroour on site cafe (open 10am - 6pm Tues - Weds; 10am - 8pm Thurs - Sat and 10am - 3pm Sun; closed Monday) to have a delicious breakfast cooked for you. Coffeeslunches and other drinks are on offer as well and wonderful freshly made pizza (please book in advance for pizza to ensure your order). Alternatively you may wish to prepare your own food and use the kitchen with oven and hobmicrowavetoaster and fridge. The bathroom has a walk in rainfall shower and roll top bath. Access is through a door shared with The Old Dairy and a further Air BnB flat (The Coachman\s Flat) up a stairs. There is a private locked door to the Footman\s Flat.Guest access.Although Chilton Polden is served by a bus route most people do have alternative means of transport. The 75 bus is the one which will take you to places locally and there is a stop in Chilton Polden within easy walking distance at the old post office or Leather and Lace. The road that the house driveway joins is part of the National Cycle Network so we often see cyclists in the village. If you do drive through the village be aware of tractorscyclistshorses and people walking on the road with dogs - the roads really are used by a multitude of different people! If you want to get away from most traffic then head down Goose Lane just a short distance from the house and out onto the moor where you can walk or cycle for miles and see very little traffic.Other things to note.We do have a number of animals here - dogs and cats sometimes like to visit our guests; please do just say if any are a nuisance and I will come and remove them; most of the rest of our animals should be behind fences although the odd one escapes ocasionally!

Title: Bwythyn Cerrig (W41454)
Description: Relax in the shared indoor heated swimming poolhot tub or saunaor keep fit in the on-site gym during your stay here. Beams and wooden floors throughout.Ground Floor:.Living room: With wood burnersatellite TVDVD player with a selection of DVDsCD player and patio doors leading to patio.Kitchen/dining room: With Agamicrowavefridgefreezer and dishwasher.Utility room: With washer/dryer.Wet room: With shower and toilet.First Floor:.Bedroom 1: With double bed and en-suite with shower cubicle and toilet.Bedroom 2: With twin beds.Bedroom 3: With twin beds.Bathroom: With bath and toilet. . Underfloor central heating. Lawned garden with patiogarden furniture and portable barbecue. Private parking for 4 cars. Please note: Family bookings only. Both properties: Electricitybed linentowels and superfast broadband included. Logs for wood burner included. Travel cot and highchair. Indoor heated swimming pool (shared with other properties on-site9.1m x 4.2mdepth 0.9m to 1.8m)with saunahot tub and children‚Äôs play area. No smoking. Visit Wales 5 Star. . Shared indoor heated pool / Hot tub / Sauna & gym. Situated within the heart of the Dulais Valley at the edge of the village of Crynantthese barns have been converted to a good standardwith splendid views of March Hywel Mountain and numerous walks directly onto the mountain behind. Bwthyn Cerrig (ref W41454) is semi-detachedwhilst The Old Stables (ref W42528) stands detached. Situated on a working farm with the owner‚Äôs friendly dogseach property has shared use of the on-site facilities including an indoor heated swimming poolsauna and hot tub. Cefn Coed Coal MuseumAberdulais Waterfalls and activities such as golfingdriving rangesarcherypaint balling and quad bikingare all available within a three mile radius. The famous Dan Yr Ogof Cavesand Craig y Nos Country Park are just 10 miles. The magnificent Gower Coast is approximately 18 miles and the Brecon Beacons are within 35 miles. Swansea town centre and Cardiffboth with excellent shoppingbars and clubsare within driving distance. An ideal holiday base. Shoppub and restaurant 1¬Ω miles.Bwthyn Cerrig (W41454) can be booked together with The Old Stables (W42528) to accommodate up to 11 guests.

Title: Nutkins Retreat, Whippingham, East Cowes
Description: Tucked away in a secluded spot and surrounded by woodlands and rural areasNutkins retreat is a delightfully peaceful place to get away from it alland enjoy a daily dip in the outdoor heated pool.Located just on the outskirts of the historical village of Whippinghamand a short stroll from the popular English Heritage site of Osborne Housethe accommodation is an ideal spot for exploring.The accommodation has two bedrooms and overlooks a very scenic natural stream and pondwithin the grounds of the propertywhich back onto a wooded area. The accommodation benefits from the use of a 30ft heated pool open between April and September and shared with an additional smaller lodge within the grounds.There are two bedroomsa shower room with pod showeropen plan living room and kitchen/diner. The master bedroom is very spacious and recently refurbished with views over the garden. The 2nd bedroom has a single bed with pull out trundle bedmaking it into a twin.In the living areathere is ample soft and dining seatingTVDvd player and wifi. Outside the living area is a large deckingseating area with views over the garden and stream. There are plenty of wild visitors to the gardenincluding red squirrels to watch for.Nutkins retreat really is a hidden gemin an excellent spot for exploringand there‚Äôs even a great pub within walking distanceon the bank of the river medina a leisurely stroll away.NB: As the property has a pond and poolwe must restrict bookings with children to 8 years and above.

Title: Paignton pet friendly holiday lodge c/w hot tub
Description: Luxury 2345 or 6 berth timber cladpet friendlydouble width holiday lodge c/w private 5/6 seat hot tub3 bedrooms2 bathrooms (1 en suite)large vaulted lounge/dining areafully fitted kitchenlarge private outside decking area with outdoor seating and panoramic devon countryside views situated on a five star country park. On park facilities include indoor swimming poolsaunagymtennis courtarcherykids play areadog walking areaspet friendly on site pub/restaurant.The spaceThe space.Welcome to our beautiful fully furnished pet friendly timber clad lodge c/w 5/6 seater hot tub on the 5* Devon Hills Holiday Village/Country Park situated between Paignton & the historic market town of Totnes. A perfect place from which to visit the holiday attractions of TorbayTorquayBrixhamDartmouthTeignmouthDawlish & the many blue flag & pet friendly beaches of the areathe cities of Exeter & Plymouth are nearbylovely little market towns like TotnesNewton Abott & the dramatic scenery of Dartmoor. Paignton Zoo is less than a five minute drive & is also well worth a visit. The lodge is beautifully furnished with everything you need to make your stay in this lovely part of Devon a pleasure. The lodge features..large vaulted lounge /dining area,.3 Bedrooms (1 x king size with ensuite)1 x twin1 x double.1 main bathroom,.beautiful landscaped park,.dog friendly lodge & park,.large decking area with outside seating,.private 5/6 seat hot tubmaintained daily.free wifi,.free use of on site indoor swimming poolsaunasteam room & gym(gym tuition is chargable if required) plus other on site facilities,.15th century thatched roof coaching inn on site serving foodwines & fine alesjust a 5 minute quiet stroll away. This is also dog friendly inside or out.The lodge is situated on the newest part of the park with sweeping views into the valley & the rolling hills beyond. It has its own car parking space adjacent to the lodgeand an extended decking areato while away the hours..The 5* park itself is very quiet & relaxing with beautifully landscaped grounds & boasts among its attractions a lovely indoor pool with separate kiddies poola sauna & steam room. The Gym at Devon Hills is modern & well equipped with personal trainers on hand if required. There is also a beauty salon & hairdressers situated in the main building.Free passes for use of the pool & gym are included in your stay at the lodge for up to six people (seperate charges may apply for gym tuition etc). Also on the park you can try TennisTable TennisArchery & there is a small play park for the younger members of your family.Dogs are welcome on the park & in the lodge (see below) & there is a lovely large dog walking field/area just 100mtrs from the lodge which leads to a small pond & picnic area. A further field is available at the other end of the park.Also on site is the Blagdon Inn a 15th century coaching house serving good food & fine wines & ales..The Blagdon also has sky tv & a pool tableall this just a five minute quiet walk from your lodge (dogs are welcome there tooinside & out). The Inn now does a takeaway/collection/delivery menu service & also features an onsite shop selling basic essentials & local produce.Onto the lodge itself...which is a 3 bedroom 2 bathroom fully fitted lodge finished to a luxurious standard..of course with D/G & central heating if you are visiting out of season..Complimentary Wi-Fi is also included in your stay & mobile signals are excellent.Enter into a superb open plan living/kitchen area with vaulted ceilings.. the large kitchen is fully fitted including a hobovenmicrowavedishwasherfridgefreezerwashing machine & the all important wine cooleras well as kettletoaster & all the other small kitchen essential items that you may need to make your stay a pleasure.. oh & nearly forgot we supply a small welcome pack for your arrival.The spacious & bright lounge area has 2 x 3 seater sofasa modern electric firea 42‚Äù flat screen TV with built in freeview ..then onto the dining area which has a large modern dining table & 6 chairs..Views from both the lounge & the dining area are onto the decking area & beyond to the rolling hills. The outside area itself has a rattan dining patio set for up to 8 people .it also features the 5/6 seater hot tuboutside lighting & a wet storage box..Through the hallway where you will find hanging space & shoe cupboard are doors leading of to the 3 bedrooms & the main bathroom.Bedroom 1 (master). King size divanlarge wall mirrorample wardrobe & drawer space32‚Äù samsung wall hung tv & door leading to En Suite with a beautiful tiled quadrant showerwashbasinw/c,.Bedroom 2..2x single bedsample wardrobe & drawer space.Bedroom 3..1x double bedample wardrobe & drawer space.Main Bathroom.. featuring full size bath with shower overwashbasinw/c. welcome toiletries are supplied in each bathroom area...All bed linentowels etc are provided & we even leave a few childrens games in the wardrobe.The whole property is tastefully decorated & furnished & is protected by smoke & CO alarms & all necessary testing to appliances is to standard. Gas & electricity is of course included. If you have any further questions about the property or area please just ask.Please note .2 small/med dogs allowed only...strictly no smoking within the lodge or on the decking area.. Due to insurance purposes please only a max of 6 occupants per stay.. from 16/07 to 02/09 only 7 or 14 day bookings accepted with checkin/out day being saturdaysGuest access.full use of 3 bedroom luxury lodge including large private decking area with panoramic views & private 5/6 person hot tubOther things to note.please note covid19. please also be aware that on park facilities as described may be closed or restricted during your stay dependant on the current situation.

Title: Escape to Country Living at its Finest!
Description: Escape to the country and unwind at this charmingelegant cottage in 2 acres of lovely gardens with swimming pooltennis and badmintonand county walks starting from your door. Located on the edge of the award winning village of Cuddingtonwalk to the thatched roof pub for drinks and dinner or village store for supplies and news papers. Only 10 minutes drive to the bustling market town of Thame35 minutes to Oxford40 minutes to London by train and 45 minutes to London Heathrow Airport.The spaceThe space.Tyringham Smallas it is affectionately calledis on the grounds of Tyringham Halla 16th century Elizabethan manor house. At nearly 1800 sq. ft. and freshly remodelledthe cottage is brightclean and open. Furnished with country antiquesmodern amenities central heating and log fire with private garage parking.A comfortable and relaxing retreat with the master bedroom en-suite on the ground flooralong with the fully updated kitchen with new appliances. The dining area leads to the ample living room with wood burning fire and flat screen TV. Two additional bedrooms and a bathroom are upstairs. Every room has an internet connectionGuest access.Private entrance to the Tibbys Lane with another private entrance to garden. The expansive 2 acre garden with pool (opened and heated May 1 - Sept 30) Tennis and Badminton is available for your exclusive use..Other things to note.For special events or weddingsthere are 5 additional en-suite bedrooms in the main house with a separate garden entrance to Tyringham Small that can be made available on request. During your stay we offerMassage,Manicures and PedicuresBrows and Lashes,waxingand skin cleansing plus sustainable flower arranging classesmaking wreathsand table decorationsclay shootingtennis lessons prices on application.

Title: Natural pool, Luxury hot tub with Glamping & Barn
Description: Two luxury glamping tents both with king size bedsset in the quiet Cambridgeshire countryside. Additional bedroom with double bed in the barn. Use of natural swimming pool and luxury scandavian wood fired hot tub. Guests also have access to an inside toilethot outdoor shower,small indoor kitchenette area and outdoor Webber BBQ. Check out our socials @StonesGlampingThe spaceThe space.Two luxury glamping tents both with king size bedsset in the quiet Cambridgeshire countryside. Additional bedroom in the barn. Use of natural swimming pool and luxury scandavian wood fired hot tub. Guests also have access to an inside toilethot outdoor showersmall indoor kitchenette area and outdoor Webber BBQ.GARDEN / POOLThe mature grounds are a very special feature indeed and enjoy total privacy and seclusion and are bordered on three sides by farmland and enjoy breathtaking and far-reaching views particularly from the end of the garden over surrounding unspoilt countryside. The gardens are principally laid to lawn with a great variety of mature shrubsbushes and trees around and extend in all to approximately 1.4 acres.Within the central part of the groundsthere is a wonderful natural swimming pond which provides pureclean water for bathing and a complete haven for relaxing. There is a large timber deck and adjacent to this there is a delightful thatched changing room/summerhouse. The aim of a natural swimming pool is to avoid chemicals such as chlorine and insteadencouraging an organic environment. A natural swimming pool offers the feeling of swimming in a freshwater mountain lake.The woodfired hot tub is perfect for relaxing with a glass of bubbly! All logs are providedlight the stove and have a hot bubbly tub within two hours!BARNThe barn is for private use and is accessible 24 hours a day. Providing guests with a king-sized bedroom. Kitchennette and dining room that includes two ring hobmicrowave ovenfull sized fridge with small freezer compartment. The room also has a six-person dining table perfect for breakfast. The living room/ sung area includes comfy seating & a TV connected with an xboxperfect for rainy days.GREENHOUSEWhat to try your hand at gardening? The property includes a large vegetable garden. Help your self to fresh produce or grab a shovel and give gardening a go!ACCESSParking is private landyou will need a car to access the local area. The host will meet you at the property show you around and then leave you to enjoy your holiday.EXTRASWant to make your trip extra special? From putting away your shopping before you arrive to organising private chefsyoga lessons or days out. No question or activity is to big to ask for! Send us a message for more details.Guest access.Parking is private landyou will need a car to access the local area.

Title: The Country Retreat - fabulous holiday lodge
Description: Comfortable and spacious lodge in 5 Star Edgeley Park in the Surrey Hillsan Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The Country Retreat offers self-catering accommodationuse of saunaswimming pooland gym. Free WiFi.Ideal for relaxing holidays with the whole familyquick getaways with friendsor the perfect romantic break.Well behaved pets welcome - extra ¬£35.No commercial vehicles/vans allowedif in doubt please ask first.The spaceThe space.This lodge is completely detached and isolated from all others on the park. The only shared spaces here are the poolgym and reception areanone of which need to be entered during your stay.The property is deep cleaned after each guestsurfaces sanitised and all fabrics washed - with the exception of carpetscurtains and sofas.The accommodation sleeps 6 adults in 3 bedrooms: includes a master bedroom with ensuitetwin bedroomand one bedroom with bunk beds for twofamily bathroomstylish open plan living area and modern kitchenwith separate utility room. The kitchen is equipped with an ovendishwasher and washing machineand towels and bed linen are included.There is a dining area and seating area with a flat-screen Smart TV and DVD playera sun terracecomplete with furniture for al-fresco dining.You can play swimhave a sauna and use the gym on sitethere are also tennis courts at the parkand the area is popular for golfing and cycling. The swimming pool and gym close at 5pm.Dorking is 9.1 miles awaywhile University of Surrey is 5.6 miles from Country Retreat. London Gatwick Airport is 14.3 miles away.

Title: Lilly Pad
Description: Our lakeside lodge offers comfortablemodern accommodation with stunning views across the lakeperfect for a memorable get away.It is perfectly positioneda stones throw from the waters edgea perfect place to relax after a busy day.The space"The space.Situated in the Cotswoldsan area of outstanding natural beautyour lodge is perfectly placed. Were just a 15 minute drive from Bibury Burton on the Water and all the Cotswold villages.If you wish to use the Hoburne facilities then please ask about passes.The lodge has a great lakeside view.There are 2 bedrooms:.Master Bedroom has a king size bed with en suite shower/toilet and a walk in Dressing room/Wardrobe.The twin room has 2 single beds with additional storage.The kitchen is fully equipped withOvenFridge/FreezerDishwasher and Washing machine as well as other small appliances such as KettleToaster and Microwave."Guest access.You will have access to the whole lodgeOther things to note.We do have other lodges on site so if you are staying in a group please contact us.

Title: Apple Cottage - Barn with Log Burner, Private pool/spa sessions & Alpacas, Nr Beach
Description: "Berehayes has 8 self-catering holiday cottages set around a delightful courtyard in a tranquil rural village just 2 miles from the beaches of the World Heritage Jurassic Coast in West Dorset near Lyme Regis. Some parts of the cottages are over 500 years old and they have been rated 4 star by the AA. The Berehayes Spa includes a heated indoor swimming poolsauna and jacuzzi (open all year). Its all about the pool!  - You can now have the indoor pool complex all to yourselves (covid-safe). 1 free session is bookable in the pool complex each (full) day. To be fair to other guests bookings can only be made once you arrive on site* Converted from 16th century listed stone barns * Outside table in the courtyard for Al fresco dining * Village pub with good food * Games Room * Free 30 Mbps in-cottage WiFi * Smart TV * Alpaca feeding in large paddock *Designated car park space *2 miles from Britain‚Äôs premier fossil beaches (sand & pebbles) * A peacefulrelaxingsanctuary in an Area of Outstanding National Beauty just 2.5 hours from the M25. We are adhering to all Government Guidelines for extra cleaning and have been approved by the AA Covid Confident scheme. If there is a Government lockdown that effects your stay full refunds will be given."The space

Title: Stunning Coastal Apartment with Parking & Pool
Description: Situated in a secluded cove this 2 bed apartment in a gated development offers breathtaking panoramic sea views across Torbay from the large balcony.Avocet 2 at The Cove makes a peacefulcoastal retreat for a familycouples or single travellers keen to enjoy Devon life in style. Avocet 2 is set in a prime location and boasts spectacular sea views from its position on the first level of the building.The spaceThe space.The full width balcony is accessible via sliding doors from both the living room and the master bedroom and provides plenty of space to relaxBBQ and dine and to take in the breathtaking panoramic views across Torbay and on clear days as far as the dramatic coastline of the East Devon Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The communal grounds offer a boules courtbarbeque area and an outdoor swimming pool with seasonal opening from June until mid September*. There is direct access to the secluded Fishcombe Cove where you can enjoy freshly prepared food and drinks and even catch a glimpse of the local seals if you are lucky. Follow the South West Coast Path 5 minutes down through the adjacent National Trust woodland and you will find yourself at the very picturesque and sheltered Churston Cove.  As well as the contemporary decorthe property benefits from stunning coastal views and is close to Battery Gardens and Churston Woods for those who enjoy a nice stroll. For those who like to wander further afieldyou‚Äôre only metres from the famous South West Coast Path.The apartment also includes access to an outdoor heated swimming pool on the grounds of this breathtakingly beautiful development.Living Room/Dining Area;.-Full width sliding doors with access to the balcony.-Open and bright with fantastic views.-Open plan living room and dining area .-4 seater dining table.-Two 2-seater sofas and footstool.-32‚Äù Flatscreen TV with Freeview.-Bluetooth wireless speaker.Master Bedroom;.-Access to the balcony via sliding patio doors.-Double bed and built in wardrobe.-19" flatscreen TV with Freeview.Bedroom 2;.-Twin single beds and built in wardrobe with hanging space.Kitchen;.-Open plan kitchen off living and dining area .-Single electric oven with grill and hobs.-Under counter fridge with freezer drawerdishwasherwasher/dryer.Family Bathroom;.-Bath with over head shower.Outdoors;.-Large balcony spanning whole width of apartment with stunning panoramic sea views.-Private and enclosed with four piece rattan set with table and foot stools.-Gas barbeque.-Communal outdoor heated swimming poolseasonal opening from June until September.** FOR SUMMER 2021 THE SWIMMING POOL IS ANTICIPATED TO OPEN AFTER 21ST JUNE SUBJECT TO GOVERNMENT CONFIRMATION THAT ALL SOCIAL RESTRICTIONS CAN BE EASED**.-Allocated parking for one car in the secure gated car park on site. All Saltwater Escapes properties have acquired the Industry Standard and has followed Government and industry COVID-19 guidelines. All properties have Risk Assessments in place and a process to maintain cleanliness and aid social distancing.Guest access.Avocet 2 is a first floor apartment and is accessed either via the boardwalk which runs along the front of the site and then up a set of stairs to access the front dooror along the level paved path which runs from the car park between the first and second rows of apartments. From this path it is only a couple of steps down to the front door of the property. Please note it is not permissible to park directly outside the apartment. Roller cases and soft luggage which can be easier stored are recommended. Once inside the propertyit is single level and there are no stairs.Other things to note.- Early check in: 3pm. Check out: 10am.- *Outdoor pool is open from June - September annually however the dates are at the discretion of the site management. Please contact us with any questions.** FOR SUMMER 2021 THE SWIMMING POOL IS ANTICIPATED TO OPEN AFTER 21ST JUNE SUBJECT TO GOVERNMENT CONFIRMATION THAT ALL SOCIAL RESTRICTIONS CAN BE EASED**.- No pets permitted on the development.All Saltwater Escapes properties have acquired the Industry Standard and has followed Government and industry COVID-19 guidelines. All properties have Risk Assessments in place and a process to maintain cleanliness and aid social distancing.

Title: The Shed
Description: The Property:The Shed is named somewhat tongue in cheek by the owners\ family as it is about as far from a shed as you can get. Whether sitting out on the decking with its clear view glass balustrade or in the comfort of the lounge you have stunning views across Avon Beach and the Solent to the Isle of Wight and The Needles; there is always something to watch at any time of year. When you talk about a property one of the most important factors is location. New for 2015the chalet has it all from its prime sea front position to its proximity to such places as the beautiful New ForestBournemouthLymington and Christchurch. There is so much to do right on your doorstep or within a very short drive.The Shed is fully equipped to a high standard with all you need to make your stay one of comfort and luxury. There is a dishwasher "so no arguments over the washing up!"separate fridge and freezermicrowave and extra touches like a built in coffee makerBose Sounddock and TVs in both bedrooms. You have private parking adjacent to the chalet so you do not have to haul your luggage and shopping far.The Shed is based within the boutique Sandhills Holiday Park. With its historic main house and leafy grounds the whole ambiance is one of relaxing in the country but with the sights and sounds of the sea. The park facilities are available to all guests and include an adventure playgroundfamily bar with Sky TVheated outdoor poolsmall gymnasiumpool tablelaunderette and mini mart store. Additionally there is free WiFi in the lounge and bar areas.About the Local area:.Christchurch was a renowned smuggling town and \The Shed\ is just a short walk from the historic Mudeford Quay where in 1784 smugglers skirmished with Customs and Excise officers. So kids bring those cutlasseseye patches and skull and crossbonesoh and a parrot if you have one!It is still a working quay today with fishing boats venturing out most days so why not say hello to Pete on boat Deja Vu (SU21) and see how his day has beenor wave to him from your decking as he heads back from another successful day out. If you fancy testing your skills out and bringing the catch home yourself pleasure fishing trips are available directly from the quayor we can help you organise in advance. There are many pleasure trips to be had or if you fancy a thrill then why not hang on to your seats on the Bay Blast rib ride.The Quay is also famous for its crabbing from the quayside (crabbers quay!) and has a children\s play parkfish stallcafeThe Haven House Inn and a large green area which is perfect for picnicsball games and kite flying. You can catch the ferry to Hengistbury Head directly from the Quay and visit its fantastic beaches and beach huts.Christchurch harbour is a great place for watersports from windsurfing to sailing and the Highcliffe sailing club is based on the Quay. There is also an active RNLI lifeboat station which practices launching weekly so you are almost bound to see their rather unusual lifeboat launch and recovery system in action!If walking or bird watching is your thing then you can do both without even getting in the car. Within an easy stroll you will find a nature reserve on the cliff top adjacent to Highcliffe Castle. If you fancy a little longer out then why not try the circular walk through Stanpit Marshes and on to Christchurch for a spot of lunch. Then take the Tuckton ferry from outside the Captains Club to cross the riveror walk over Tuckton bridge a little further on if the ferry is not runningand head across more picturesque marshes to the back of Hengistbury Head. From there you can skirt the inside shorelinehead up and over the top or use the beach as your route back to the beach huts and ferry home at the tip of the Head. Who knowsthe Haven House Inn may tempt you with a thirst quencher before heading back to the luxuries of the chalet.Down at Avon beachthere is a caf√©/restaurantthe Noisy Lobsterand kiosks serving fish and chipscoffee and ice cream. There is a shop selling anything from local/national papers to clothes and holiday souvenirs and even a bakery on site.If you head out in the car then the walks available to you are endless with The New Forest on your doorstep and The Purbecks within easy reach. Easily missed and of particular note is the area around Keyhaven and Lymington andin particularthe sea wall walk past the now disused salt works and the spit and Hurst Castlewhich in itself is worth entry but make sure you have a few hours to spare.Historically sailing and fishing are all part of the local heritage with such famous local sailing clubs as Christchurch and Lymington to hand. More recently wind and kite surfing have become extremely popular along with kayaking and paddle boarding. Don\t worry if you have never tried any of these or do not have any equipment as Shore Sports base themselves in the harbour and are more than happy to help out.About the area in general:Christchurch - the sign says \Where Time is Pleasant\ and it\s right. From the lively Monday market to the great shops and restaurants along the high street it is a great coastal town. It is a short trip in the car or by the Ferry that leaves from Mudeford Quay. Christchurch Priory is the longest parish church in the country and is surrounded by beautiful groundsriverside walks and Christchurch Quay. The Priory is a must see and is steeped in history. The Priory contains the \miraculous beam\ said to be placed there by a carpenter locals believed was Christ himself.The New Forest - a National Park situated on the south coast of England. The landscape is a mix of heathlandgrasslandbogs and woods. Domestic animals are permitted to roam freely throughout the Forest. Visit Beaulieu Motor Museumcatch a ferry from the pretty town of Lymington to the Isle of Wight or just enjoy the many cycle trailswalks and forest villages.Bournemouth - the famous seaside resort with miles of beachesloads of restaurantsbarsclubs and great shopping. Just 9 miles awayit has so much to see and do.Other Attractions - Alice in Wonderland maze Theme ParkSerendipity SamsGo Ape at Moors ValleyTowerPark with its Multiplex Bowling and Splashdown Indoor Water ParkPaulton\s theme park on the edge of the New Forestthe Bournemouth OceanariumCompton AcresPoole Old Town & HarbourSandbanks and Brownsea Island to name but a few.Guest access.Guests have full access to the full property along with access to the Sandhills Holiday Park site facilities

Title: 17thC  thatched cottage in farming hamlet
Description: "This pretty self-contained 17thC thatched cottage is situated in a farming hamlet near historic Abbotsbury village and World Heritage Coast. The cottage is annexed to the owners farmhouse and cottage guests are welcome to use our heated swimming pool (June - end August) hot tub and to relax and unwind in our extensive garden. The hamlet is a walkers paradise surrounded by footpathsincluding the Dorset Coast Path. The cottage is available to hire on a weekly basis with a Friday changeover"The spaceThe space.This pretty thatched 17thC Grade 2 listed cottage has oak beams & inglenook fireplace with log effect electric stove. The garden is in excess of 2 acres with tableschairs and benches where guests can relax and unwind. There are no other holiday cottages on site and outdoor facilities are only shared with myself and very occasionally when my family may visit.Guest access.Guests are welcome to use our hot tubswimming poolBBQall outside garden furniture and to relax in our extensive garden.Other things to note.Both Abbotsbury and Portesham have farm shops and pubs. Abbotsbury also has a general grocery storepost office and various craft shops.

Title: The Hunting Lodge (NQ4)
Description: A uniquetranquil hideaway a mile from pretty Bourton-on-the-Waterwith fishingswimming and tennis by arrangement. All on the ground floor.Living/dining room: With TV and DVD player.Kitchen: With electric cookermicrowavefridge/freezer and dishwasher.Bedroom: With twin beds and dressing area.Bathroom: With bath and toilet. Oil central heatingelectricitybed linen and towels included. Garden with garden furniture. Outdoor swimming pool (shared with owneravailable on request). Tennis court (shared with owner). Private parking for 1 car. Please note: No children under 12 years old. There is a stream that runs at the back of the property. This enchanting detached holiday cottage is set in the grounds of a Grade II listed mill housewhere guests can enjoy trout fishing in the groundsand use of the owners‚Äô tennis court and outdoor swimming pool (by arrangement)while outside is a prettyenclosed garden. It lies close to Riverside Lodge (NVG)with the picturesque Cotswold village of Bourton-on-the-Water only a mile awaywith its beautiful old houses and many attractionsincluding the elegant bridges spanning the River Windrush. Also nearby is 18-hole golf at LynhamCotswold Farm ParkBurford Wildlife Parkand the attractive spa town of Cheltenhamwith its art galleriespump room and museumsall within 12 miles. Ideally situated for exploring the Cotswolds‚Äô picturesque villagesNational Trust houses and old market towns. Stratford 35 miles. Shop and pub 1 mile.

Title: Bramble Pye - New Converted Barn In The New Forest
Description: Rob & Claire welcome you to Bramble Pye; a newly renovated barn on the edge of the New Forestwhich is renowned for its wild ponies & scenery.Located on our family farm within an idyllic courtyard of converted barnsbeautifully decorated & furnished to a high standard. Accommodating between 6 to 8 guests + infants.Situated within the charming Hampshire countryside close to historic RomseySalisbury & Winchesterthere are plenty of places to visit. 10 MINUTE DRIVE TO PEPPER PIG WORLD."The space.SHORTER STAYS (2 nights minimum) ACCEPTED DURING THE WINTER MONTHS (from November until March)PLEASE CONTACT US FORE MORE INFO :-)We are a family run cattle and sheep farmexplore the farm during your stay - guests can get involved in lambing and feed lambs at lambing time (April/May only) - make use of our indoor heated SWIMMING POOL & sauna (use of the pool is shared with the other cottagesbut you can book privatehourly swimming sessions in the pool when you arrive.).We also have a well stocked course fishing lake on the farm (own equipment and license needed).The ground floor of Bramble Pye comprises of a spacious open plan living areawhich includes a bespoke kitchen with washing machine & dishwashera large farmhouse dining table that seats 6-8 and a comfortable sofa area.The first bedroom with a king-size bed is also found on the ground floor and is equipped with an en-suite bathroom with a generous walk in rainfall shower.The master bedroom is located upstairs and has an impressive king-size bed and a substantial velux window looking out onto the courtyard and farm beyond.The third bedroom is upstairs and has two single beds (sleeping two) as well as daybed/sofa that sleeps another 1 to 2 guests (please note that if you are a booking of 6 or less gueststhen there will be an extra charge for making up the daybed if required). This room also has a large velux window with views across the courtyard and farm.Outside there is a large patio area (which is shared with the cottage next door) with a rattan table and chairs that seats 6. There is also a communal courtyardgrass gardens and plenty of fields to play in nearby.There is a communal laundry room (which is shared with the five other barns) which is stocked with DVDs and games as well as leaflets and ideas of things to do and places to see in the area. The laundry room has a washing machine and dryer that is coin operated.You have exclusive use of the entire barn which includes a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher and washing machine.Privatehourly swimming sessions in the swimming pool are bookable when you arrive.The laundry room is shared with the guests in the other barns."Guest access.Being on the edge of the New Forest there are lots of walks and places to be explored! The nearest train stations are RomseySouthampton Central or Salisbury. Bringing a car is recommended to explore the best places.There is a dedicated parking area adjacent to the courtyard.Please let us know if you are bringing more than two carswe only have a finite number of parking spaces per cottage."Other things to note.We also have a Shepherds Pyea shepherds hut located on one of our lakes for smaller groups (2 adults plus infant)as well as Cottage Pye another luxury barn conversion (sleeping 6-8 adults plus infants)and also four other cottages available for staysplease see our website pyesmead farm for more info or visit us on insta; pyes_holiday_cottages.Takeaways unfortunately dont deliver to usbut you can have supermarket deliveries. There is a local shop close byas well as a farm shop selling grocerieslocally produced meatsbread and cakes.If you dont fancy cooking the local shop sells ‚Äòcook‚Äô high quality frozen meals which are designed to be just like homemade food.If you fancy eating out there is a great selection of pubs and restaurants nearbythe ones we recommend are listed in the welcome pack in the barn."

Title: One bed Lodge in AONB Dorset with shared pool area
Description: Fully refurbished to a high specBrook Lodge sits in the grounds of the main house in the village of Iwerne Minster.One bedroom with king sized bed. Bathroom with free standing bath and separate walk in shower. Open plan living area downstairs with sofa dining area for 4new fitted kitchenseparate cloakroom and entrance hall. Small outdoor semi private seating area.Free WiFi .TV. Welcome pack. Outdoor heated pool OPEN MAY/SEPTEMBER ONLY .NB Pool use is shared with property ownersThe spaceThe space.The Lodge sits to the side of the main house. It is a private space with a small outdoor seating area to the side of the doors and further seating around the shared pool area.Pool is open air so it is only open from end May to end September .Pool is CLOSED from October to mid May.Pool area is a shared space.Guest access.Parking is adjacent to the garage/workshop.The house is situated in a small village with a well stocked village shop and pubboth of which are walkable from the LodgeOther things to note.Pool is only open in the Summer months.During the remainder of the year it is covered but there is still access to the pool area for additional seating if requiredor to catch some Winter sun!

Title: Spacious house and garden in Itchenor
Description: "Located in Shipton GreenItchenorThe Willows is surrounded by large gardens with tennis court and heated swimming pool. Close to W. Wittering Beach and Itchenor Harbourand with easy access to local walksbike rides and waterside pubs. Near Chichester and Goodwood.WOW. The house is absolutely fantasticwe couldnt have asked for a better setting to celebrate Christmas. If you are looking for a spaciousbeautiful property then this is a must book house. We will 100% be back. Dec 2021"The spaceThe space.Spacious ground floor with large kitchen/dinerliving room and games room with pool table. The garden includes a trampolinetennis court and bbq facilities. The new outdoor pool will be open from April - October and heated throughout this time. The pool will include a full safety cover and is visible from the house and patio area.Guest access.Guests can use any space within the house and back garden.

Title: Silverlake, Dorset - Eco House - 2 bedroom
Description: Located in Silverlakea Habitat Escapes development set in 500 acres of parkland & lakesand situated in the centre of the crescent in Beaumont Village this Bijou cottage offers bright and airy accommodation & enjoys a sunny southerly aspect. With the lounge/kitchen/diner situated on the first floor adjacent to the master bedroomthese rooms have access to the south facing balcony that runs the full width of the property. There is a second bunk room situated on the ground floor.The spaceThe space.Set in a private 500 acres lakeside reserve within a 10 minute drive of the Jurassic Dorset coastthis eco village boasts its own entertainment with its own private luxury spatennis courtfootball pitchlakespathstrails and adventure you will be at home both inside and out of the house. There is now a new poolside bar.Guest access.Access all areas on the 500 acres estate. Free entry to swimming pool and sauna. Spa and massages available on request (for extra ¬£).This property also benefits from full access to the Activity Hub‚Äôs facilities (subject to prior booking and availability) providing you with access to bikescanoeskayaks and stand up paddle boards during your stay.PLEASE NOTE Latest COVID procedures and contact owner for further details.Other things to note.This cottage sleeps a family of 4 (2 adults + 2 children max). The master bedroom is located upstairs and has its own en suite. The bunk room downstairs is suitable for children only and access to the toilet / en suite upstairs is via the master bedroom.Toilet rolebath towels and fresh linen is all provided. Please bring your own towels for the swimming poollakebeach etc. Pleas also bring condimentsshower geland other toiletries.

Title: The Pool House
Description: A secluded pool house with private pool in its own private garden set in the Chiltern Hills of Hertfordshirean area of outstanding natural beauty.The spaceThe space.The property sits in an unshared private gardenwith its own swimming pool. It is private from the main house which is approximately 50 metres away. Title: Birch Cottage located on a country working farm
Description: A peaceful and family run fully working farma country paradise for youngsters and adults alikesituated close to all major attractions.Come and meet all our animalsfree roaming chickensfeed our saddleback pigssay hello to our ponies or pet goat. We also have petting lambs during the Spring.We offer fully self-containedcomfortable and cosy cottages with access to our outdoor heated swimming poolskittle alleygames roomplay areaonsite bar or bistro.Have fun down on the farmThe spaceThe space.Withy Grove Farm offers 10 fully self-containedcharmingcomfortable and cosy cottages with their own individual access set around a courtyard and patio area with our family also living on site. We can accommodate for parties up to 4-5 in each cottage. All cottages have access to our outdoor heated swimming poolas wells as a skittle alley and well-equipped games room including table tennisa pool table and table football.We are a family run business who are committed to providing the best experience for all of our guests. We put our guests at the heart of everything we do and pride ourselves on excellent customer service and will go out of our way to ensure you have an enjoyable and memorable stay with us on the farm!Guest access.The Cottage has its own access via its own door with a key provided. We always try to greet our guests and provide a quick tour of the facilities.

Title: The Stables - easy access and a swimming pool
Description: "The Stables is the ground floor apartment in the Old Rectory Coach House in the middle of Sampford Brett - a quintessential English village between Exmoor National ParkQuantock Hills & Somersets coast. It provides bright spacious accommodationhas easy access from the parking area & is fitted to a high standard. Central heating keeps the property snug and warm even in the depths of winter. There are spacious grounds with a swimming pooltrampoline & climbing frame. Free Type 2 EV charging."The space"The space.The Stables has two bedrooms - one with a double bed and the other with two singles that can be configured as a double. Each has a generous wardrobe with drawers and bedside tables.The largebright lounge has a sofa bedsetteeand 2 armchairs. Theres a dining table with 6 chairs and a wall mounted smart TV. WiFi Internet access is available throughout the property.There is a separate kitchen which is fully equipped with ceramic hobovenfridgefreezerdishwashermicrowave oventoaster etc.The modern bathroom has a good sized showertoiletwashbasinshelving and heated towel rail.The Stables has a fast broadband connection but mobile phone signal varies between providers. Vodafone and O2 are goodbut you have to go up the field to get an EE signal."

Title: Shillings Cottage,  Hemyock, Devon
Description: Shillings has exclusive use by arrangement of a large outdoor pool. This has just had a new liner fitted. The surrounding terracewith a table and reclining chairs is a sun trap. The cottage lies inside gardensorchards and meadowswith footpaths close by. Upstairsfrench windows open onto a balcony with a table and chairs for al fresco dining under a walnut tree. Steps from the balcony lead to lawns with teak loungers and comfy cushions. At nightyou can gaze at the stars from your pillow.The spaceThe space.The cottage is in the Blackdown Hillswhich lie between the North and South coastsin an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It is the only rentable property on the premises and is a field away from a quiet Devon lane. The kitchen is fully equipped and the bathroomalthough tinyis enough for a holiday stay and has a power shower. The bed is a continental king size. There is a cafeti√®re and microwave. Wi Fi is available everywhereeven next to the pool!Guest access.Surrounding the cottage there are several areas of gardena fruit orchardgrazing fields and a big pond where swallows dip and dragonflies fly..The village lies within half a mile and has a Post Office and general storea pub and Doctors surgery.Other things to note.The parking is secure and off the road.We allow one small dogdepending on age and breedfor which payment can be made on arrival. Please note that your dog must be closely supervisedon a leadparticularly around the poolas they can cause damage if they fall in. There is a 4 acre stock proof field next the cottage where they can run freely. We have found that dogs left on their own in the cottage can be noisy and destructive. So we ask guests to please take your dog with you. The pubs in the area are happy to have dogs.

Title: Secluded luxury in New Forest with heated pool.
Description: A secludedluxurious retreat located on a smallholding where you can interact with the animals. Once the loft of a Victorian stable set in the ground of a country house in a beautiful rural settingwith an outdoor heated pool to use in summer. Located in the northern tip of the New Forest National Parkclose to Paultons Park and Salisbury. The added bonus of a country pub 2 min walk up the road!The spaceThe space.The Retreat is a lovely sunnyself contained and very spacious (1100 sq ft) first floor converted stable loft which has been newly refurbished to a very high standard and everything within is there to provide you with the standard of quality you deserve. For 2022 we have added some additional touches including a replacement top quality mattress for an even more comfortable nights sleep!.The modern kitchen is new with all the facilities you need to cook and dine-in should you wish to. Teacoffeesugarmilk will be provide on arrival and we often offer a selection of fresh produce for sale from our smallholding.You are welcome to visit the smallholding and share in the daily feeding of chickens and sheep or see where all the fresh produce is grown.Alternatively you may wish to cook alfresco over the fire pit or on the barbecue whilst watching the sunset over the fields in your private gardenbefore retiring inside to the oak beamed living area. Relax watching TV (Talk TV included) or a DVDchallenge each other to a game of Scrabble or just spend quiet time snuggled into a luxury throw whilst reading a book ‚Äì all are provided for your enjoyment. There are two single sofa z beds in this space for younger children (hidden behind curtains to make their own special den) as well as a double sofa bed for older children - so plenty of options for guests.The bedroom has a king size bed with top quality Angora wood 30,000 spring mattress and high quality bed linen and anti allergy duvet. Fitted wardrobes provide ample hanging and shelving space and a ceiling fan helps to ensure you are comfortable when the weather gets warmer.The spacious shower room has a beautiful stripped wooden floor and views across the fields. There is a large walk- in shower and plenty of room for all your personal toiletries. A small selection of miniature toiletries are providedalong with good quality fluffy towels and of course loo rolls!.Downstairsas you enter your front doorthere is a boot room/utility room with plenty of coat hanging spacecupboards and sink with running hot and cold water and a washing machine. Outsidethere is parking inside the gates and storage can also be provided for bicyclesif you bring these with you.The private garden to The Retreat is well stocked with mature shrubs and beautiful flowering perennials with a lawn leading to a seating area overlooks the fields. Early in the morning you are likely to see deer roamingrabbitsfoxessquirrels and a plethora of wild birds. In the evenings the sky is the domain of bats and owls or you may be lucky enough to see swallows swooping around.From your garden you can take a stroll up The Avenue - a sweeping grass walkway edged with an enormous planted mixed border and ancient brick and stone wall - along the path and out through the private gate to a footpath leading to the road and further footpaths beyond. In Spring these paths provide a magnificent spectaclecovered in a carpet of Bluebells.The heated outdoor swimming pool is available for your exclusive use.from 9am - 2pm and again 6pm-8pm during the summer months (usually May to end Sept). Swimming towels are provided and there are sun loungers by the pool as well as in your own garden. Guests use the pool at their own risk and any children should be supervised at all times.Pets.Although we have a dog in our main houseit is with regret that we have decided not to accept dogs at The Retreat due to the close proximity of grazing sheep.Arrival.The Retreat is available for a minimum of 2 nights (4 or 7 nights min in high season). Usual check in is after 3pm and is contact free. We hope to be there to meet you from a distance on arrivalbut if this is not possible a key will be left for you. My husband and I will be around if you have any queriesor you need a good recommendation for eating out in one of the many pubs and restaurants near by!Pricing.Prices provided here are for low seasonat different times of the year price may vary. Summer is typically ¬£165/night for 2 and includes the use of the heated pool. Additional guests from ¬£30/night.Departure.We ask all guests to strip their bedclean the bbq (if used) and pop rubbish/recycling outside into the main bins. This helps reduce the contact our cleaners have with personal items whilst we are still battling the Covid pandemic.Departure is by 10am to enable us the maximum time between guests to ensure the property is as clean and safe as possible.Other things to note.The accommodation is primarily on the first floor with stairs.

Title: Granary Cottage (6255)
Description: Complete with a shared swimming poolthis property is ideal for that escape to the countryside. All on the ground floor.Living/dining room: With wood burner.Kitchen: With electric cookerfridge and dishwasher.Bedroom 1: With double bed and TV.Bedroom 2: With twin beds.Bedroom 3: With twin beds.Bathroom: With bath and toilet.Shower room: With shower cubicle and toilet. Central heatingelectricitybed linen and Wi-Fi included. Cot and highchair. Laundry room (shared with other properties on-site). Sitting-out area with picnic bench and barbecue. Indoor swimming pool (sharedopen from Easterclosed winterplease enquire when booking). Games room (shared). 2 dogs welcometo be kept on a lead at all times (livestock). Private parking. No smoking. Please note: There is an unfencedshallow stream in the grounds. WTB 3 Dragons. . Indoor heated swimming pool/hot tub. The ancient farmhouse at Werngochlyn dates back to the 12th century. It nestles in open farmland underneath the Skirrid Mountain and the four comfortable holiday cottages are sympathetically converted from stone farm buildings set around the farmyard. The setting is perfect for children of all ages (adults too!). There is plenty of room to run around and explore ‚Äì and plenty of animals to befriend‚Ä¶. a pair of Kune-kune miniature pigsa donkeygoatssheepchickens (you can collect your own eggs for breakfast if you want to)ducksdogscats and loads of horses and ponies ‚Äì including a tiny rescue pony named Tinkerbell.You could stay around the farm all day ‚Äì with a heatedindoor swimming poolhot tubgames room and then a BBQ in the evening. There are footpaths running directly from the farm and dogs are welcome. You are ideally place to explore the Brecon BeaconsBlack MountainsUsk and Wye Valleys and the fantastic countryside that surrounds the nearest market town of Abergavenny which is only 3 miles away ‚Äì home of the Food Festival. It boasts good shops and a marketa cinematheatrecastle and museum as well as good choice of pubscaf√©s and restaurants including Michelin starred ‚ÄòWalnut Tree‚Äô which is within walking distance of the farm. An 18-hole golf course and driving range is only ¬Ω mile away. An enjoyable stay that will have you wanting to return. Shop 3 miles.Free WiFi

Title: Traditional Sussex Barn with Pool
Description: Traditional black boarded barn in secluded grounds with beautiful views of Sussex countryside. Plenty of space to relax by the swimming poolon the terrace or wander round the garden.The spaceThe space.The converted hay barn is situated within private grounds offering extensive views over fields to the South Downs. The building features exposed oak beams and a galleried roof space so there is plenty of room for guests to spread outsocialise or relax. The cow shed is a separate building across the barn yard and contains 2 additional bathrooms (ideal to change for the pool)kitchen and lounge area.Guest access.Guests have access to the barncow shed and gardens. The heated swimming pool is open summer months onlynormally mid May to mid September. Please confirm dates in advance as weather dependant. There is a barbecue and fire pit on the terrace. Feel free to bonfire in the garden.Other things to note.Please supervise children at all times as there is a swimming poolpond and river in the garden. Don‚Äôt swim alone or at night.

Title: Hoarstone - Cosy country cottage
Description: Peaceful and with stunning viewsyou will find Hoarstone Cottage the perfect place from which to enjoy everything that the Cotswolds countryside has to offer with a wealth of walkscycle routesbridleways and wildlife right outside your window. You will also find yourself within easy reach of plenty of renowned townssuch as BurfordWoodstockBourton-on-the-Water and Stow-on-the-Woldall of which will enable you to enjoy a fantastic Cotswold holiday. An ideal staycation post lockdown!The spaceThe space.Cottage is a self-catering holiday cottage for upto 4 people. Located on the edge of the Cotswolds with stunning views across the Glyme Valleyyet only 5 minutes from the bustling market town of Chipping Nortonthis cottage is the perfect setting for a luxury break. Soho FarmhouseDaylesford Farm ShopBlenheim Palacemany award winning pubs plus CornburyFeastival and Wilderness Festivals are all within 10 minutes of this beautiful hideaway.Open planwith high vaulted ceilings to let in plenty of lightthe cottage is situated next to a synthetic surface tennis court and a shared swimming pooland with footpaths crossing the farmthis is a great get-away to unwind and relax. Due to the ongoing situation with Coronavirusthe swimming pool is open but will be operated on a rota basisand at our discretion.There is ample parking and a private garden with outdoor garden furniture and BBQ (during summer months).In the cooler winter monthsa wood burning stove adds to a cosy feel within the cottage which is itself heated through underfloor heating from ground source heat pumps.For those with young childrenwe can provide a travel cothigh chair and the cottage is fitted with a stair gate to prevent the more adventurous toddler exploring too far.Dogs are welcome provided you let us know in advanceso that we can provide towels to help dry and keep your pet clean. We do have our own dogs and a cat so well behaved dogs only please!

Title: Coach House with private indoor Swimming Pool
Description: The Coach House has been beautifully converted into the most uniqueluxury detached self-catering holiday accommodation sleeps 4(+1) with exclusive use of its own private en suite heated indoor swimming pool and outdoor tennis court. Just 6 miles South of the County town of Shrewsburysurrounded by unspoilt Shropshire countryside in an area of outstanding natural beautyit provides a perfect base to explore the Countywalk in the Shropshire Hills or just relax and get away from it all.Guest access.Exclusive use of private heated indoor Swimming Pool situated within the Coach House itself. Free use of outdoor Tennis Court and adjacent Orchard in season.

Title: Culver Reach 33 - cosy and warm caravan by the sea
Description: A light and airy caravan with a lovely sized lounge area (refurbished 2022) which has a TV with DVD player. Separate seating is set around a dining table which then leads into a galleyfully equipped kitchen. Down the hallway there is a bathroom with power showerWC and basinseparate toilettwo twin bedrooms and the master double bedroom. The caravan is double glazed and benefits from gas central heating. There is parking for two cars. Beds are made up on arrivalplease bring towels.The spaceThe space.Culver Reach 33 is conveniently situated in the centre of the park - all park amenities are in easy reach and the secluded beach is a short 10 minute walk.Guest access.The caravan will be yours to use exclusively during your stay. On site there is a barshopday and evening entertainment and indoor and outdoor pools. Access to the barentertainment & swimming pools requires passes available at reception at an extra cost.Other things to note.The park do not assist owners in monitoring the gas bottlesplease keep an eye on this during your stay and contact me should you find the window to be red and I will ensure the gas bottle is changed for you.

Title: Dellfield holiday cottage
Description: Self contained holiday flat. 2 bedrooms (1 double1 twin). Double room has en-suite shower room. Spacious sitting room looks out onto secluded shared garden. Off road parking for 2 vehicles next to the flat.We are inside the South Downs National Park with lovely walks close by. We are also close to Goodwood for the Festival of SpeedRevival and Horse Racing - as well as the cathedral city of Chichester and sandy beaches at West Wittering.The spaceThe space.The flat is self contained with its own access door. Fully equipped kitchen with a dish washer and a sitting room with TV. There is access to a laundry room with a coin operated washer and drier.Guest access.We have a swimming pool (outdoor and only in the summer)tennis courtsauna and gym which guests can use by arrangement (extra charge for use of sauna due to electricity costs). We just ask for consideration as sometimes we would like to enjoy them either on our own or with friends. We do not expect guests to spend all day everyday by the pool.The garden has a slide and trampoline and there is a shed with a few toys and bikes suitable for children.Other things to note.Although the flat is all on the ground floor there is a small step down into the sitting room and there are 3 steps outside down from the car park area to the main access door.The flat is not suitable for wheelchair users due to the steps noted above and also a narrow door between the kitchen and sitting room.The sitting room and kitchen/dining room are spacious but the bedrooms are compact.

Title: Vale Hornbeam - Farm with stunning mountain views
Description: One-Bedroom House This house with a balcony and mountain views of The Brecon Beaconsan open plan kitchen/living roomone bedroom with king size and single bedalso a double sofa bed in living room. There is a shared indoor heated swimming pool and indoor hot tub with changing rooms.Due to Covid rules of no more than 6 adults staying in one house we offer our shepherds hut free of charge to keep within the Welsh government rules (child under 12 yr are not counted). Also parties and gatherings are not allowed within the cottages. Our hot tub and pool are open on a booking slot system for a private 1.5hr slot (only one cottage can use the facilities at only one time). Face masks and social distancing applies. Our cottages are cleaned to covid standards and hand sanitiser is in the cottage for your use.The spaceThe space.The cottage features original oak beams in all the rooms and has a spacious living room with French doors opening onto a balcony with views of the Brecon Beaconssituated in a farm court yard settingideal for al fresco dining or a barbeque.A great location to meet up with family and friends.Situated on the Edge of the Brecon Beacons amongst beautiful countryside close to BreconBuilth WellsHay on WyeCrickhowell and Abergavenny. Located on a traditional working farm with cowssheephensgoatspigs and our donkey called Star. Our farm tours are very popular with the all the family and our play area with swingsslidessand pit and football goals are situated by the cottages

Title: The Beach Huts: Unique home with indoor pool
Description: A stunning & unique home in the pretty village of Oving! This Eco-build Beach Hut style property has 2 bedroomsa bathroom and a stunning large open living space. A private back garden terrace with beautiful unspoilt views across fields and separate BBQ sun deck. A tennis court is literally on your doorstep and a great local pub only 200 yards away! A quiet and truly unique place to stay and enjoy. We are only 4 miles from the Goodwood Estate and in easy reach of West Wittering Beach.The space"The space.This Eco build property has a lovely light open plan living area containing a modern fully equipped kitchendining areaseating and TV area with a cosy wood burning stove. The Master Bedroom offers a comfortable King Size bed with fully fitted wardrobes and space for a travel cot. The Second bedroom has 2 single beds (which can be pushed together if preferred) and equipped with blackout curtains AND blind to ensure a good nights sleep. All bed linen is The White Company for added luxury. The house is beautifully finished in Scandinavian style with picturesque views across the farm.This is a truly stunning place to stay and relax - if you want peace and quiet then this is a perfect retreat (unless you bring your own little noise makers!). We are very child friendly and can provide everything from toys to high chair (NB: arent providing Travel Cots due to Covid:19). We also have our Pear Store property situated nearby. Combinedthey offer a great place to stay with friends and familybut have the added bonus of everyone having their own space.""We are so lucky to have so many wonderful places to visit on out door step. From the spectacular beaches of the Witterings to The South Downs and its stunning walks to The Goodwood Estate and its renowned events. The Beach Huts is ideally located to ensure easy drives to so many days out. A list of suggested places to visit (including family friendly and rainy days) is in our visitors book. This can also be emailed to you on request.This is an Eco Build and our preferred method of heating the space is using our wood burning stove. There is plenty of wood available for your stay in our wood shed so please help yourself at no extra cost. We have a smart electric heating system if wood burners arent your thingto ensure your stay is a cosy one - we only use Green energy suppliers.We are lucky to have a separate internet signal for The Beach Huts which offers fantastic WiFi for all your needs.The Washing Machine & Dryer is located in a utility building adjacent to the property."

Title: Chalet at  Selsey Golf and Country Club
Description: "57 Granada is a traditional holiday chalet situated at Selsey Golf and Country Club a popularfamily-oriented holiday park. The facilities on site include an outdoor heated swimming pool and bar with a family seating area. There are two ball play areasa tennis court and a childrens playground. The chalet is suitable for both families and couples. The site is located just a few minutes drive or 15/20 minutes walk to Selsey village and the local beaches. The site is next to Selsey Golf Course."The spaceThe space.The chalet has two bedrooms with a separate shower/toilet with a heated towel rail. A new kitchen was installed in January 2018 and this has a hob/oven and microwave. The chalet was also completely rewired in January 2018. The first bedroom has a double bed and second has a single bed with second pull out bed underneath. Unfortunately there is no cot availableguests are welcome to bring their own. The sofa also pulls out to a double bed. All bedding and towels are provided along with bathroom essentials and cleaning products. There is a TV/DVD player. An outside seating area on a paved patio is ideal for alfresco dining.Guest access.A car parking space is available close to the chalet. All areas in the chalet are accessible.Other things to note.To use the two bars a temporary membership is required which can be arranged in advance.

Title: Cosy cottage with stunning views and hot tub
Description: Pennard Hill Farm is a family farm offering fantastic views over the Mendips.The Lamb is the perfect place for a luxurious romantic getaway with its roaring log fire and stunning views from bedroom.There is plenty to do just a stones throw from Pennard Hill and some lovely towns to explore such as BrutonFromeWells and Glastonbury. There are a huge array of pubs and restaurants on the door step and plenty of places for long or short walks in the countryside.Breakfast is not provided.The spaceThe space.There is a gorgeous private wood-fired hot tub!Guest access.The pool is shared with our two other cottages and is available to use between the hours of 10am and 6pm.Other things to note.Please note smallwell behaved dogs are welcome (a maximum of oneunless otherwise arranged) but there is an extra charge of ¬£25 per dog. This needs to be requested and agreed with the owner upon booking.
